comment: Schmidt felt like a really easy professor, yet I always left his classes and tests feeling like I knew the material. He makes mid-level undergrad math about as approachable as it can be, fun lectures and well made tests, that are easy if you get how the concept works. There's also room for bonus points on tests. One of the best RPI math professors.

All I did was show up and pay attention. He conveys the material in a way that is clear and easy to understand. Only downside was Covid cutting us off, to which he posted his lecture notes online. While instruction was still clear, losing the lectures was disappointing, to say the least.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Solid lectures, easy tests that are like the same as the backtests. One of the few professors I felt was really fair with students.

If you're taking Multivar, Schmidt is the way to go. His lectures are pretty interesting, but the only thing that matters is if you can get back tests -- exams are almost identical to previous semesters.

Lectures are very good and clear, both in content and in terms of speaking. The exams are very similar to old exams and the quizzes are generally pretty easy while teaching you how to do the math. Can be a little theory heavy and does not post notes or homework solutions online.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Lectures are like youtube tutorials on multivar, tests are easy, just like the homeworks (and similar to what is discussed in class). The final is just test questions from previous exams. No required homework. Easy quiz in recitation. Learned a lot and very easy class.
Schmidt has very clear notes and lectures. Homework is not mandatory. Quizzes and Tests are very straight forward.
Learn how to do all the back test questions and you will get an A easily
Straight out amazing. One of the best professor you get in RPI.

Extremely clear lectures. Gives lots of examples and will always ask if people have questions to make sure nobody is confused. For tests, go over one or two back exams and you're set since he keeps the same problems and equations but just changes the numbers

Probably the best/easiest RPI prof. for any MATH course. Tests are easy and simple but he doesn't give back exams, so study. HW is optional, but if you do that and show up for recitation you should be good. Do go to class and take notes, his notes are on the overhead projector so not posted online. Gives a review before exams too.

He is such a nice guy that I thought he might be the best among the math department. A really good lecturer and really kind to his students. The tests are not very tough and I don't think you will get a bad grade after reviewing all the questions he gives to you!

Overall, great professor. The initial lectures before a test are more conceptual and intangible in nature but as the test gets closer becomes more concrete with problems appearing straight on the exam. DEFINITELY check out the backwork before taking the tests. Blue matrix algebra book helpful for the final.
Prof. Schmidt was the best professor I ever had at RPI. His lectures were easy to follow, his course was well designed, and he genuinely seemed to care about his students. I highly recommend him.

He focuses on the "why" a little bit more than the "how." He wants to make sure you have a full understanding of the class, and why everything operates in the way that it does. Excellent teacher who makes sure everyone understands the content before continuing to more complex concepts.

Stupidly good, plain and simple. Lectures are insanely clear, extremely well organized, and well-suited for any lvl of student. Very willing to answer questions, and always gives a thorough answer. Focuses more on intuition than formulas, great for those looking for a deep understanding, even for applications beyond the course material.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Schmidt's lectures are insanely clear, he asks questions to ensure no one is confused, and holds a class prior to exams to just work through problems. If you do more than 2 backtests before an exam, you're guranteed to pass. Wish I had him for every math course.

Schmidt is a real gem. I would have taken his Multivar class this semester but his class was filled before I could register for it. Also he's very friendly and super chill. One of the best professors I've ever had. Explains all content very clearly, and always sticks around after class to answer questions
Bless this amazing gentleman. The real mvp.
He is a caring professor and explains the topics lucidly. Taking notes in that class is essential if you want the A

Professor Schmidt is by far the most articulate professor I've had so far. He's the only math teacher/professor I've ever had that explains topics clearly, but more importantly he wants to make sure everyone understands WHY a particular theorem is the way it is. I would DEFINITELY take another class with him and I highly recommend him.

Schmidt is a good guy, but beware because he doesn't use LMS, so it might be difficult to balance focusing and note taking. I've heard this class is easier with another prof if you haven't taken Calc AB. Quizzes are no partial credit which sucks, but the exams are pretty straightforward. His handwriting might be one of his most redeeming qualities

Dave Schmidt is one of my favorite professors I've had so far. I've taken classes with him twice now (Calculus 2 MATH1020 and Multivariable Calculus) and I find his lecturing style very easy to follow. Plus, he's very accessible outside of class, and it's obvious that he cares deeply about his students.

It's probably okay if you don't want to show up to lectures--the only things you're graded on are your tests and quizzes. But going to the lectures makes things simple. Course material is clearly presented and explained, homework questions are provided for practice and questions are always answered.

In my 3 years at RPI, no other professor came close to Schmidt's clarity. He answers any potential questions you may have before you can even ask them! His exams are fair. He doesn't try to trick you. He cracks jokes in lecture from time to time and does not acknowledge them. His swag knows no bounds. I wish I could take this class again.
Excellent instructor! Very clear during lecture!
Great professor. Lectures are clear and understandable.

Professor Schmidt was a good professor for Multivariable CalcMatrix Algebra. Found the matrix algebra portion of the class to be somewhat more difficult but will vary for each student. Lectures are fast paced but he is very helpful in office hours and very approachable after class. Tests and quizzes are the only graded work.
Great teacher! Very clear and uses straight forward examples!

It might be surprising but you cannot float on prior knowledge of the material. Homework is optional but don't skip over it. Class is kind of dull but overall he really is not bad. Don't take him for all calc i, ii, multivar though unless you want to. Mix it up and see how the other professors work too. He is a good professor

Lectures are boring.  He's the most monotone teacher I've had and it's hard to stay awake if you go to class.  Tests are 80% the back test which is good but I still wish I took the class with khiel because i learned nothing.  I've heard he's much better for mutivar.

Great professor.  Possibly the best lecturer I've encountered, giving crystal clear proofs and explanations.  Also very good at answering questions asked by students in class (I find many professors don't answer the question asked.  Homework is optional, but also is very helpful for test preparation.  Highest of recommendations for this professor.

Schmidt is the bomb.  Like a nuclear bomb.  Or like a hydrogen-cobalt bomb.  Either way, he is a great teacher.  To succeed in his classes, at least in multivar, do the optional homework, do the quizzes, and go to his study sessions before each test.  He has got his stuff together and annihilates any weak points math students may have.  Praise Dave
Schmidt is great. Easy to understand and breaks things down into very simple ideas. His tests are fair and representative of what you do in class and for homework.
Schmidt is amazing and the best professor I've ever had. alsew hot
Great explanations of topics. Sometimes too in depth but always teaches thoroughly. Tests are slightly difficult but if you do homework well you will do fine on tests.

I've had Prof. Schmidt for two consecutive semesters and to tell you the truth, his lectures are boring. (he doesn't let you play on phone/electronic devices too), but his tests are really easy once you do few hw problems from the textbook. He also know what he's talking about, but might seem confusing or boring to some. He's awesome!
No submission of homework

Excellent lecturer, homeworks are extremely useful for studying. Tests are somewhat easy depending on how well you know the material (no absurd amounts of work for a question), but he's a harsh grader.
It's the best math teacher I've ever met! His lecture is clear and the homework is really helpful to gain an A!

To teach a class such as calculus,such a crystal clear professor is essential.He explains things so well in class,with a great number of examples,that I didn't exactly have to study outside of class.I really liked how instead of just giving the students formulas to use,he explained how to derive them.This way,I was able to remember them better!
Great guy.  After sleeping through a test, I went to office hours and he let me take it no problem.
Crystal clear lecturer. Runs a great class. Personable. What else are you looking for? Actually that brings me to another point, girls think he's hot.

I had Schmidt for Calc II, and he was pretty much the best thing that could have happened for me.  He has a gift for explaining things in a way that most people can understand.  His level of clarity is far beyond any other professors I've had here.  I would recommend him for any math class you're taking.
Very helpful in class, answers are very detailed. However, when he is sick, he tends to be very loud about it; be warned! Seriously though, he is a great professor.
Awesome Discrete prof
Professor is probably one of the most knowledgable math people I know. Is very smart and enjoys teaching. Tests aren't too bad either.
Great teacher, easy to understand, approachable. No curving though.
This is by far the best professor I had in RPI. Had him for Calculus and DFQs back in the day and when I am in town I go to one of his lectures just for fun... Kudos for Schmidt...
Great for Calc II, boring for Discreet. That might not be his fault though, that's just a terrible class.
Great teacher. Very clear on how to solve problems, tons of in-class examples, and having frequent quizzes with no required homework was better than the opposite.
I like his class ;)
he is amazing
A freakin math yoda. Very clear, step-by-step, and good handwriting too. The best.
This man is a living math GOD. He is perfect to learn from and other professors wish they could be him. :) Schmidt is the man!

very awesome teacher. he knows his math, AND he knows how to teach to students, two qualities that often do not come together. He actually answers your questions in class, rather than just re-stating what he has just said in lecture. very, very, very, good, especially if you are not doing so hot with your math grades.

Took calc 1 and IDS with him...  I have a general dislike for math, but Schmidt clearly explained everything and where it came from. I passed the class no problem by attending and paying attention. tho doing the optional homework would most likely have improved my grade  Best teacher I've had at RPI. would take his classes anytime

Calculus II was an interesting course. Schmidt is an awesome teacher, and his TAs were awesome too (Joanie and Kai at the time). I learned a lot in his class, though at times I felt like things were coming out of left field (like when we were expected to know L'Hospitals). I think doing the optional homework would have helped a bit though, lol.
Best prof ever,even though I hate math.
I felt that he was very clear when explaining new topics in a way that I understood them. It was not an easy class, but if you want to learn then this is the class that you can excel in.

His lectures are easy to follow and he explains the material very clearly. The homework is optional, but does a good job of preparing you for the exams, which are pretty straightforward. As long as you attend lectures or work the homework problems, it's a very easy class. I took two courses with him and would be happy to take another.
Although classes are very boring, he knows his stuff. The tests were fair but the final was much harder than the class ever was.
Fantastic teacher. Clear, helpful, and a little bit funny. his videos are the best study tool ever. When you're in class you don't realize that you're learning, but you really are.
Awesome professor, really easy to understand and his tests aren't that bad.
Best professor by far. Easy to understand. Tests are easy.
I dont think he liked me much, but I still have to admit he was a fantastic math teacher, probably the best one at rpi.

Is the second best professor I've ever had... even through my master's degree. I have never seen such a man in academia with that dedication and knowledge of the material and the way he is able to project himself to the class and deliver the material in a clear, understandable way. I wish I could go back and sit in one of his lectures.

I had Prof Schmidt during my undergraduate degree at RPI for Calculus I,II, and Discrete Structures.  He is an excellent teacher and seems to enjoy it.  I highly recommend his courses.  Top 5 RPI professor.

Schmidt is popular because he gives straightforward tests and explains everything clearly and concisely, even though he takes the time to prove some equations which can be a bit tedious.  He is excellent at math and has an above average vocabulary.  For me, Schmidt is the epitome of a great teacher.  He knows where many student's difficulties lie.
Discreet structures; I wouldn't buy the textbook, you wont need it.  Prof. Schmidt explains everything quite clearly.
WOW... best math teacher i've ever had. I thought i knew calc before taking his class but I was wrong.  His videos for diff eq. are also extremely helpful.

Definitely the best teacher at RPI. My weak background in Calculus strengthened exponentially (pun intended) after taking his course. His test problems are very fair. No monkey wrenches or tricks thrown in. I don't advocate skipping recitation and skills classes, but his lectures are all you need. Very systematic and clear. Thumbs up all the way!

I came into Schmidt's class without ever haven taken Calc and a weak base in Precalc. In class, I feel he skips steps a lot. I learned more easily from tutors, but overall, his tests are A LOT easier than the other Calc teacher's. Problems on his tests are pretty much similar if not exactly the same as the backtests.
i'm using his DiffEQ videos because my DiffEQ prof is aweful at life
We wish, One day every professor will bacame a SCHMIDT !!.

I took his classes in the Fall 00 & Spring 01. I can still remember the HOT prof! He provides clear notes. His exams are super easy. Once I didn't go to his class, and he was okay with it. He explained things over again to during office hours. But the question is, are easy exams good for students? Will students learn much?
Goes slow, clarifies even the simplest points. Tests are decent as long as you understood what was going on in the class.
Professor Schmidt is amazing. I'm taking my fourth class with him now. The man's a god.
Professor Schmidt is a whiz at providing exceedingly useful, informative, and clear lectures and fair exams.  He is a model for RPI math professors.
SCHMIDT = GOD.  Enough said.
WOW..best math teacher on campus. Hands down.
WOW! Best math teacher here...perhaps the best teacher here in general.
With all the hype, I think you can see hes a good professor. He's very clear and thoughtful in his presentations.

He is hands down the best calculus teacher in the world. He teaches super basic and easy stuff; he's really REALLY good at explaining it. AND he posts videos of him doing common problems online. So you NEVER have to go to class and you can still get an A. All I did was watch the videos before each test and I averaged a 100. Praise be to Schmidt. :)
Prof Schmidt is the best teacher i have ever had...ever!  He explains everything clearly, and has really nice handwritting too. I recommend him to anyone who has an opportunity to have him! : )
The way he teaches makes you understand.  Even if you don't think you get it, you really are learning.  He's amazing like that.

Excellent teacher! Very clear lectures and fair tests. Homework sheets list problems on the book that are generally doable without a calculator. EXTREMELY helpful during office hours--he caught me up on three weeks of material in half an hour. Highly recommended overall.

Schmidt is the man! He is very clear, and explains things very well. Also great to listen to him talk... if you watch his lectures, he talks JUST like that in class. It's rather soothing. He has perfect handwriting, and writes out everything so you have time to take good notes. Exams are tough and tricky though.

He is the best teacher that I've ever had. He clearly explains everything and does great examples. His videos are great too. If you have the option to take a class with him, do it. He not only makes it easy to learn and really understand the material but he also makes it interesting.
great prof! knew what he was talking about and he KNOWS HOW to teach it too!

I didnt have him but Schmidt videos saved my life.  I thought my friends were on something when they were excited about watching a prof. work out porblems online but there is reason for excitment.  They somehow are interesting and very very very helpful
Schmidt is the man.  Seriously, he teaches well, exams aren't hard, and he doesn't put people to sleep in my experience (unlike other professors here) and knows what he's doing.
SCHMIDT IS SIMPLY THE MAN
Seriously, this man is the best teacher I've ever had. Very clear and organized. His classes may seem easy, but he explains the material so well that you just have to know what you're doing.
Schmidt = God

Quite possibly the easiest class I've taken at RPI, yet I still feel I learned a great deal of information.  He organizes his lectures well, is fair with his tests, and gives optional homework.  Recitation complemented lecture perfectly.  I recommend this class for all engineers to take to enhance their math knowledge.
BEST MATH TEACHER EVER. Clear.
a wonderful teacher, makes everything easy to understand. If you can manage it in your schedual take theis prof for as many math classes as you can!!
Awesome prep before exams, makes sure you know how to do every type of problem, no suprises on tests. Explains as much as necessary to make sure you understand, best math prof around
He's really hot and good. AND 110/100.
No Comments
awesome teacher
The tests are pretty easy, he does lots of examples, and everything you need to know is in the notes.  Just go to class and do the homework!  Some of the TAs are a little difficult though.
schmitty is the man!  he's the best math teacher ever.  his lectures are super clear and easy to follow... take his classes!  i wish he taught diff eq

Schmidt is the best math professor at RPI, it's as simple as that.  I got an A in diffEQ with a totally horrible professor after taking Calc I and II with Schmidt because he prepares you well.  Very very fair.  Also, if you need DiffEQ help he has long distance learning videos online that are a total godsend.

Prof Schmidt has a voice that put me to sleep,but his class isn't bad. Be respectful in class. Turn off your cell phone, don't come in late and DON'T TALK. Having a good or bad TA can make a difference. Stick with the hw and you are golden. Most people blow off the lectures and get behind. Don't do that! You'll have a HUGE advantage.
Great at explaining things in a way that makes sense, and not at all boring to listen to.  The classes (Calc 1 & 2, and MultiVar) are pretty easy, too.
explains everything in a simple way , easy to follow and understand, tests are reasonable, mostly on what's done in class. nothing dramatic

take schmidt for any math class that you need to take that he offers.  best professor for math at the school, hands down.  some call him boring, but its just cause he does his job and you learn the information.  clear as that.
had him three semesters in a row- calc 1,2, and Diff Eq-- and he was the most amazing professor.. very awesome
Simply amazing.  Fair tests for all.  Fair grading.  Very easy to understand.  Great professor.  The best math professor at RPI for Calc II
Didn't realize how much I liked his class till I took Diff Eq with another professor (Kovacic). I would give anything for shmidt! The best applied math professor at RPI!
great explanations
Schmidt is as good as they get. He was excellent back when I took Calc 2... and his online videos saved me from certain doom in Diff Eq. Thanks Dave!!
Simply the best. Fair test and grading system.
He did alright. He really is a walking textbook - he knows his stuff. Probably the best prof if you are looking to learn the material.
He will blow your mind with made-up math words.  Excellent.
Awesome professor.  Highly reccomended.  Very soothing voice, if he wasnt a math teacher, he would def. be reading audio books professionally.  Peace!
d-schmidt is the man...he is a walking textbook!
I didn't like how he speaked at first, but you start to appreciate how he orders things as time goes. Plus he saves lives in Diff EQ
He's not that good!
No question, he is the best!

There's just something about him. He is the clearest, most even-toned individual you will ever hear speak.  It's almost to the point of being creepy.  You will never miss a word he says.  He does do a wierd flick think with his pens though.  I found that distracting.
He is a great professor, as clear as they get and is more than fair on his exams. Taking him will be a good investment in the money you put into RPI
One word AWSOME
Best Prof at RPI (a school filled with horrible professors)
dave is the man.  had him for both calc one and two and if it wasnt for the goddamn gateway wouldve easily had A's in both.  he is very intelligent and is a great teacher.  grades fairly as well
Hard to find a better calc I teacher.  Good notes, easy to understand.
Great professor, easy to understand.
The nicest and most organized professor at the institute.

schmidt is the man.  best math teacher at rpi.  simple, kinda funny, smart, and crystal clear in every single lecture.  if you get a chance to have him as a teacher, dont pass it up.  schmidt you the man.
Best math teacher at rpi.

Compared with other professors at RPI, Professor Schmidt is amongst the very best at teaching. His lectures are crystal clear, the format of the course is very straight forward, no tricks. Tests are fair and follow the lectures very closely.
Great guy. Explains stuff clearly and taught very useful material. Get him as a prof. if you can.
Prof. Schmidt is great, his tests are fair and he covers the material in multiple ways so you are sure to understand it.
"He has one of the most soothing math voices you'll ever hear." >>>>>> He's helpful, clear, and he sounds like he should be on the radio.
Is extremely clear in his lectures. If you go to class and study your notes his tests will not drop many surprises on you. Great teacher.

Best professor there is at RPI, exams are more than fair, and he covers material very clearly.  If you need help he can teach help you learn anything during his office hours.  Very good at teaching!  and a very nice guy on top of that
very clear, the best teacher i've had at rpi
Good teacher, lectures are interesting.  Fair tests.
good teacher, no bullsh*t, very fair tests and grading
Great professor, teaches very clearly, good dry sense of humor, very reasonable tests that are easy if you pay attention in class, highly recommended.
Very easy for calc 2, very nice guy too.  Explains things very well.  Best math teacher I've ever had.
Very good teacher. Explains everything very clearly in lecture; altough sometimes seems so clear can lead to false sense of security. Highly recommended!
Great teacher, explains well without rushing, little bit of a boring voice but does many examples and is very helpful. one of the better teachers at RPI.
Monotomic voice at times but he makes sure you understand what your learning.  Very good teacher, you learn alot but it doesn't seem like he's rushing through it.
spends a lot of time on un-important topics

Very good lecturer. Explains the material clearly and concisely. I thought multivar would be hard, but he has made it seem easy because he's so good at teaching it. Also very friendly and grades leniently.
dave schmidt is the coolest guy in the world. and also the only one who has ever been able to teach me calculus. he is nice, understanding, and very helpful and will go out of his way for you.
Professor was helpful.
AWESOME prof! So clear
very clear, does proofs for everything
I recommend Schmidt for any Math course. Believe me, if you can't get a good grade in his class, you wouldn't in the other ones either. Speaks so clearly and softly in lecture I'd often fall asleep.
i studied a lot and still didnt do as well as i wanted to... it sux that most ppl who do well r taking calc after taking ap... ppl like me get screwed occasionally
Had him for calc I and II and I can honestly say that I hated it.  Bad Prof, no matter what anyone else says.
He is awesome....i took 2 classes with im...Calc 1 and Diff Eq....he is very personable...very approachable...if u are good to him hes good to u ...
Yes im one of the few schmidt grads. Two semesters with this guy, and it was well worth it, teaches what u need to know and a great guy. Stop by his office hours good guy to talk to.
TAKE MATH CLASSES WITH SCHMIDT!!! If you put any effort into the class and do homework, you WILL get an A. Its not that the material is easy; he is a really good teacher.
The best teacher in the entire department.
best prof ever. made freshman year way easier. if you do really bad in its class its your own fault
He was very clear in explaining the material, and the tests were never a surprise (and fairly easy).

This class was simply TOO EASY. All his tests are out of 105 so you have 5 points to mess up with and still get a 100. Not hard material at all. He explains things very well and is just an easy prof in general. Best math prof I've had by far.
never showed up to class and still got an A just from reading my buddy's notes
No Comments
Great Prof.
Nice Guy. Excellent Teacher. Great Attitude.
Hands down the best all around professor at RPI.

got in A in calc 1 with him, now i'm in his calc 2 class. hopefully i'll get an A or B. gives good notes and helpful review problems before exams. an A or B is possible in this class, unlike with most classes here.
by far the easiest class I've ever taken, mostly because it was schmidt.  actually, he was a little TOO easy - my test avg was above 100 which is about 30 pts higher than most classes
SCHMIDT-Y BABY!!!! Dude is awesome. The bomb math prof...man I got As because he conveyed the material oh so well. I say we nominate him for Math Dept Chair!!! Gooood guy. Has a heart. FINALLY!
No Comments
he writes everything down
Most soothing math voice, ever.
No Comments
I don't know what everyone's raving about, he's OK, but I've had better teachers.
Probably one of the best math teachers i've ever had... he actually cares whether or not you understand the material
Schmidt is awesome. A really good teacher and he says weird funny things all the time.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

Dr. Kiehl is a great lecturer, but her office hours are what really made me like her as a professor. She is extremely helpful one-on-one. In class she can seem intimidating but during office hours she is very respectful. The work can be a lot since there's homework and a quiz every week but overall it's not super difficult. Her exams are very fair.

The exams were fair, with partial credit questions. The course was organized and predictable. The lectures were content-heavy and not very helpful. Students can be passive-aggressive when answering questions. Homework (15% of the grade) was an easy A with multiple attempts and dropped scores. Your lowest exam score is dropped.

A great professor, Dr Kiehl makes her lectures thick with content. A little too thick for me, but she does a great job at teaching the material as the semester goes on. 4 Exams is a little much, giving you about three weeks between each at best. Definitely one of the easier classes.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Lectures optional, but you should go. She teaches very efficiently and explains things well. Homework 2x a week. There's graded online work and then unchecked textbook work that she says is mandatory, but don't do it. Instead, use it to study for the test because there aren't any back exams. Tests are easier than the HW; there aren't any tricks

Professor Kiehl's lectures can be fast-paced, but engaging if you stay focused. While she can seem unapproachable at times, unstuck AI proved helpful for supplementary practice and reinforcing concepts outside of class.
Very rough professor. She is very passive agressive with student. Not clear of what she wants on the test. Examples are terrible

Amazing teacher and one of the few teachers at RPI that I admire. Her lectures give a lot of examples that really help you out during the exams. She was very caring and considerate to me when I was having family issues; she seemed like she actually cared about her students. I would love to take other classes with her.

Dr. Kiehl is very knowledgable, offers great notes during classes. Great lecturer, goes really slow on concepts and break down everything in details. She does not have regular OHs but you can always book appointments with her, she offers great help on HW probs and exam prep. Most back exams at APO are from her class so use those to study!
I like Kiehl. Grading can be quite pedantic but for the most part exams and homeworks were fair. Never had much of an issue with her for this course.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Dr. Kiehl is the only reason I passed Calc I&II. I came from a school with a severely lacking curriculum and students and teachers who didn't care--I was far behind from the start. If you reach out to her for help, you'll immediately see her clear care for her students. I don't think there is any RPI math professor more understanding than she is.

Good notes and clear grading criteria. Fair exams, homework's and presentations. Feedback on assignments is good, and provides hints/steps for proofs. Grading tends to be nitpicky, but that's just the nature of the course. Solid professor.

Professor Kiehl easily had the best lectures out of my freshman classes. Tests offered a lot of partial credit on open-ended problems, and homework was given via Achieve, allowing you ten attempts to correctly answer each question.

It really feels like Dr. Kiehl wants you to do well in her class. If you put in the effort to do the homework and go to office hours you will do well. The material can be difficult but her grading system gives room for mistakes. She is great at explaining concepts if you ask for help and ask questions. Highly recommend!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr.Kiehl is a very good professor, she is not harsh on grading, and if you ask her questions she answers them to the best of her abilities and if she can't then she will find the answer for you.

Her notes are very easy to read and look back on. Some lectures are heavier than other and the only downside is that she will just power through the heavy lectures and cram it all into the 2 hours of class. She tries her best to answer your question during/after class. Fairly easy class and also easy to find her back exams.

Dr. Kiehl is a wonderful professor. She knows exactly what she expects from her students and makes that very clear in lecture. She may seem impersonal during the class but she is extremely kind and helpful during her office hours. Would definitely take a course with her again if I could!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Mathematics has always been my favorite subject and my strongest suit, until I had class with this professor. I hated each single class. She scolds people very harshly and is very strict, and she makes you feel stupid by answering your question and staring at you. I did not have a fun experience, and her exams are the hardest of them all.

Professor Kiehl lessons are quite good, she can move very fast throughout the lectures. Kiehl is one of those professors who tends to want to make there lessons  perfect. In my opinion, I don't know if it was just me, but she seemed really unapproachable and unfriendly, to the point where you couldn't ask her anything without feeling stupid.

Does a lot of example problems during lectures and typically does a good job explaining the content. Her tests do tend to be a bit more difficult than other professors but if you find a good way to study or have taken calc before they are fine. Is very kind and great to go to with questions during office hours and review sessions.

Dr. Kiehl made Calculus I a very enjoyable experience. I am absolutely horrible at math, but her exams were very fair and she was always willing to stay after lecture to explain topics to confused students. She hosts exam reviews one week in advance of exams, and exam questions are usually similar to the ones shown in the review.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: She was pretty good, I liked her teaching style. My main problem was that notes and homework were not posted in a timely fashion and sometimes I was surprised with homework. Overall, I liked her and her class.

All I can say is that in my opinion Dr. Kiehl was a really hard Calculus professor. I swear some of the exam versions are harder than the others and the TAs are told not to give brownie points for showing work. Calc 2 is hard enough as it is, so if you're looking for extra credit take another prof.

Professor Kiehl did an amazing job teaching Calculus.

It certainly helped to have a little background but calculus can be confusing for many.

Not accessible outside of class and will ignore emails. Rude and condescending in class. In the first class I attended with her she publicly humiliated someone for asking a clarifying question. As someone with anxiety, it sucks that she yells when she proctors tests making it harder to focus. The actual class material is not difficult.

The lectures could get boring at times, but overall I think she is a great professor. She covered everything in depth, I thought the tests were fair, and she gave good feedback on work. She does have a low tolerance for disrupting class though, so if you're going to talk or sit on your phone, she might give you a hard time.

Her class is structured such that you watch the lecture before the in-person session and then do a worksheet. It's more work, but you're guaranteed to learn the material. I found learning under her to be an extremely pleasant and inspiring experience. I highly recommend taking a class with her if you get the chance.
She is a good professor overall. I found some of the lectures long and boring especially towards the end but, I learned the material well and her notes were very useful.

If you're the type of person to go above and beyond you will love her. She provides a lot of example questions and lectures are detailed/well organized. I didn't go to lectures because I already took calc I. You should go to lecture to know how she wants you to write your exam answers otherwise you could lose points. Personality is strict.

Her lectures are fine, except she chooses the most bright, hard-to-read colors to write notes with. If her color choices were more normal, I think I would've actually gone to class more often. Can sometimes be snappy if she's having a bad day, but otherwise a kind person and is concise in lecture.

The flipped classroom is actually the most vile invention known to mankind. Having to watch lectures + do the HW outside of class created an immense amount of work given that the work done in class consisted of struggling through a worksheet whose answers were never posted and were therefore no help at all. Class was mandatory but a waste of time.
Detailed and to-the-point lectures! Not the best at technology.
Good Prof

Gives relevant examples of material, along w/ examples found in the textbook. 50% of each test being multiple choice questions and definitions makes it easy to do well as long as you study and do the HW. HWs are pretty easy if you do the worksheets. Worksheets are pretty easy if you watch lectures and ask questions when confused.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: If you ask a question in class and don't understand it by the 2nd time she explains it she will condescendingly tell you that you're not doing it right & that you should get it. Takes points off of quizzes and homework but won't tell you the correct way to do it. 72 theorems & definitions must be memorized word for word..... that's just for Exam 1.
Amazing clarity and depth in lectures; assigns a generous amount of homework, but specifies what parts to study for exams.

Kiehl is okay, though she's not particularly accessible outside class and isn't the best at explaining the material. She does care about how well you learn the material, but she's nothing special. The TA on the other hand... If Dan is still the TA when you want to take the class, avoid that section at all costs. He's awful and an awful grader.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Tough grader

comment: A lot of work from webassign but shes a really good lecturer and a sweetheart. She gives lots of examples for each topic. Only negative thing I have to say is that her handwriting is sometimes hard to read. Extra credit for getting iClicker questions correct in class
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Absolutely get her  if you have the option
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Kiehl is the best technical lecturer I've had RPI. She takes amazing notes and posts them online. That came in clutch if I missed a lecture. I probably should have gone to class more as she gave iClicker questions, but even when I missed, I was alright because of her notes. She's amazing. I took Calc 1 & 2 with her and I highly recommend her!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: One of the best professors you will have. She has the best notes ever. Much better than the book.
Easiest class I've taken, A+ without bonus quizzes. Great help if you have issue, which isn't likely
She's super nice and easy to talk to and has very clear expectations for every test. All you need to know is on her website, including all of the hand written lectures.

Took Kiehl for Calc 2 last semester. She was very clear in all her lectures and I understood all the material. Never opened my textbook the whole semester. She gives extra credit too. 1% on final grade for participate with I-Clicker. Great professor.
Easy Calc I and II teacher

I have her for Calc 2, and while my test average right now is an 88, my average in the class is just under a B, because the full-or-no credit skills quizzes are weighted so heavily. They're worth 20% and after our first test most people had a skills average under  a 50% (myself included), and a 50% means a straight 10% loss from the final average.

Professor Kiehl is probably the best instructor for mathematics that I have ever had to this point in my life. She organizes her class lectures very well, and has a clear understanding of the course content. Professor Kiehl's class notes are also easy to follow along with, so if you study them for the tests, you will do well in the class.

There extra credit quizzes that help boost your grade. She writes clearly all steps like a high school teacher. There are suggested homework problems and  test problems to study. This is not mandatory to complete and it is not graded. Overall, one of the best math teacher I had in RPI.
Great Calc I professor. Easy Tests. Great notes, posted online

The material can be challenging, but Kiehl structures the class in such a way that it is very difficult to do poorly. It's also refreshing to have a professor who happens to be a human being and not an academic robot.
Very kind professor who actually explains the material well in class.  Course is very manageable if you stay on track and study at all.
A well taught and well organized class. An enjoyable experience overall. A good teacher that I recommend.

She does a great job of explaining things and her test are really straight forward. She bases her test from hw problems in the textbook, so if you do your homework you'll have no problem acing the tests.
Amazing woman. Great teacher. Lessons are very clear and to the point. Come ready to take notes she doesn't pause. If you miss something notes are immediately posted online. Highly recommend.

Professor Kiehl did a solid job teaching Calc II.  Granted, the stuff can get terribly dry, but she teaches it, and won't leave you in the dark on anything. She also clearly explains how you will be tested, which is a +.
She is a good teacher, and she is a nice teacher, but as a person she isn't so nice.

Kiehl is definitely my favorite professor here. Concepts are explained extremely well, there's no homework, and tests are pretty easy (and there's a lot of extra credit). Kiehl often gives very big hints about what is going to be on the test and I always felt very prepared going into them. Kiehl is also very nice and helpful as a person.

Calc 2 has changed its structure. There is in-class material and quizzes, as well as "skills" quizzes that cover material at a different pace (a little confusing). She teaches integration well and the quizzes were easy. Lines and planes were hard to understand. Does a lot of in class examples and is helpful during at office hours. Go to class!
She's an amazing professor and gives a ton of extra credit.  Super easy if you go to lecture and do the homework. Tests are a lot easier than the homework

She's probably the best professor I have this semester. She covers the material thoroughly in class but still finds time to explain things further if you have questions during lecture. There's never any HW but there are always optional practice problems online. We've had two tests so far and I felt very prepared for both.

She is really nice. The way she teaches her class is great. It is a very simple class and only requires out of class studying. Honestly, she does her part when it comes to teaching. I highly suggest going to office hours. This course is mostly memorization, but also about seeing proof processes. The best thing to do, is practice. Go to class!

Great teacher!  This course was easier than AP calc.  Set up problems but do not solve.  She went through everything very thoroughly even when kids asked dumb questions.  You'll have to use maple for labs.  Optional final.  Easy A if you could handle AP calc.
Very friendly, I attended most classes and she made an effort to learn my name. I would recommend her.
incompatible, goes too fast, does NOT explain herself ... leaves you in the dark; very difficult to wrap your arms around this teaching method

Had her for both Calc I and II. Get her if you can. Ignore those who say she goes too fast, she doesn't at all. She tells you the exact kinds of problems that will be on the exams, gives study hints and problems, and explains things crystal-clear. I got an A in Calc II. Easy class, and she is easier to listen to and understand than most professors.
Had for calc 1 and 2.  She covers more material than some of the other professors but she goes in to less detail and tells you exactly what is on the exams.  Awesome teacher
Posts practice problems on website that are identical (except #s used) to exam problems and tells you in lecture before exam exactly whats going to be on it
She's an amazing prof. She goes fast and it's very easy to understand. Do the homework and do all the problems that she gives right before the exams. Easy A.

Goes pretty fast and doesn't do much to explain the material. Pretty much pulls all of her lecture notes from the book. Will occasionally give helpful tips, but usually goes too fast for you to get all of them and the notes at the same time. I wouldn't recommend taking this course if you don't have a head for math.
Awesome. Maya Kiehl is the best teacher. Have her if you can!
awesome

About as straightforward of a teaching style as you can get. Almost as good as Schmidt in terms of clarity and easy tests. She drastically narrows down for you what you need to study for the final. You won't learn how to do extremely difficult calculus problems, but you'll still leave with a good basic understanding.

This course is very easy, and everyone knows it. Don't tell your Calc 2-taking friends that you're in "Contemporary Math". But make sure you still give the assignments your best shot, or you *will* receive a bad grade. As for the professor, she's nice in and out of class, and in general cares more about the course than you probably will.

Kiehl is fairly clear with teaching, but is on the easy side as far as exams go.  There are quizzes every week, but it comes in handy with the basic skills stuff.  One may or may not learn much, depends on how much effort is put into it.
Very good prof, clear, helpful, fun

Kiehl is totally uninspired and too bureaucratic. She acts like a highschool teacher and an overprotective, annoying mom. Has a quiz every week and FOUR midterms, one of which is a week before the final. She basically tells you the exam questions the day before and grades very leniently. Easy A, but you won't learn anything from her. Good luck!!!!!
Easy class gives u all the problems on the test beforehand, if u know calc u should get an A pretty easy

She's such a boring teacher. I guess she's perfect for those who miss being in highschool. She's far too bureaucratic and uninspired. It's teachers like her that make learning seem like a painful process.

Great teacher.  Easy to understand and learn, and her tests are very easy.  She's a nice person and cares about you understanding the material.  If she isn't available she tries to have her TA be available so you always can get help.

Kiehl was a great prof. Her lectures were very clear and organized. She posts practice questions before each exam so you know exactly what you need to study. I would deffinitely recommend Kiehl as a prof.
She's great, easy, and nice!
Excellent Calculus professor. Spells everything out for you and walks you through each type of problem. Extremely helpful and understanding.

Excellent professor; lectures are clear, organized, and to the point.  She teaches you what you need to know, and doesn't waste your time with anything else.  Despite the fact that calc2 sucks, she did a great job teaching it, and it's fairly easy to get an A.
This class wasn't exactly easy...but Kiehl gave great notes and gave very fair tests.  From what i hear about some other Calc II professors she is extremely good in comparison.  I'd recomend her!

Had her for both Calc 1 and 2 and she tells you exactly what you need to know and how to do it.  When you don't understand something in the class, she personally goes out of her way to make sure you understand it.  Highly recommended, provided you get a good TA.
easy to get an A, just sort of pay attention and study what she tells you to. the only reason you should ever get less than an A is because of gateway

Good lecturer who can give you a lot of information very clearly.  Lots of opportunities to do well in the class.  Her only drawback is that she runs the Gateway, which is Satan's **** child risen on Earth.  But besides that, highly recommended.
Very nice... big class kind of hard to pay attention... but easy to get an A if you took calc before in high school
Class was very organized, always knew what would be on our exams and quizzes, lectures very informative and useful.
Had her both semesters, slept through class. Shes teaches very well, no HW, maple labs done in resus. and is very nice

She goes way too fast.  I asked her questions about what I didn't understand, and she tried to help, but I didn't understand what she was saying.  Maybe I'm too dumb.  I have a D in there right now.  I haven't gotten less than an A in math since probably sixth grade, if even then.  I don't like it.
Teaches well!
she cuts straight to the point with her notes
The class is very informative.
good teacher, yea, go to class day before a test, she tells you what to study, not hard to get an A at all!

Excellent teacher.  Gave clear examples.  Tests are no surprise.  Moves at a good pace so you don't get bored and zone out. My advice don't skip class the day before an exam because she basicly goes over exactly what to study especially for the final.
she is the best teacher I have had at RPI (not daying much b/c i am a freashmen) but she is really clear
not a bad teacher, though if you miss one class you get screwed because she goes so fast. worth taking from her, her exams are awful though.
She's a good teacher- explains things clearly and gives good notes.
Totally incompatible teaching style for me...I didn't understand a single thing she taught.
She makes everything seem easy when it isn't
I repeated calc 2 and I understand this subject much better than the professor i had last year, heavily recommanded.

Good teacher. Very clear. Easy as long as you study. I got A's all through the class then slacked off before the final and ended up with a B in the class (after spending 8 hours in the gateway to get a 10).
Excellent.
I had an A going into the final but she wouldn't give me one afterwards even though I was like .000001% from it. She's pretty easy to understand though, and does explain the topics pretty well.
Decent lectures, fair exams and pretty fair homeworks.  Doesn't tend focus on any particular thing for long.  That helps sometimes but makes the class move really fast.
went so fast i had no clue what was going on the entire time. managed to get a D in her class after getting a B in calc I. couldn't understand a thing. go figure.
Very easy exams and no homeworks. Extremely clear in her teaching and very helpful in all aspects.  Quite simply, TAKE CALC I AND II WITH HER!!! You won't regret it, trust me.
Very clear and organizes material very well.  Also very reasonable about grading and preparing you for exams.

Her final was interesting. She tends to rip through difficult material and have no bearing on what the class sees as hard, even after using the placement exam. Willing to throw out points to make anyone pass; makes it harder to get the A though...
Good professor, very friendly and easy to understand.  Do the suggested problems and use office hours...they can save you.
Took the time to make it easier and clearer for someone who's strong point is not Math...
She was terrible at explaining stuff a few years ago.  Heard she's gotten better, but dont know for sure.  Asks if people understand and if they dont, she still moved on
Sometimes she goes really fast especially with difficult material.  Not really bad, not really good either.
she is simply awesome...must say she one of the best math teachers ive had EVER...shes awesome...loved calc 2 with her...
Good teacher.  Makes sure everyone understands things before going on.  Always willing to answer questions and wants students to succeed.
Very helpful teacher.  Very clear.  Highly suggest to take Calc 2 with her.
always willing to answer questions, very nice.
She makes sure that everyone understands before going on and is always open to answering questions
Good explanations, makes sure she doesn't lose too many people before she continues
Really takes the time to ensure that students get the material. Putting forth the effort will result in an A.
No Comments
No Comments
great teacher
good teacher... easy class, very helpful
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
easy course!
No Comments
Terrific teacher
excellent teacher!
One of the best math teachers I've had, very consise and informative
Great Teacher!  Very clear!  Very good!
Tough but fair
Excellent professor, very kind, ask for research projects

Probably one of the most disorganized classes I've taken. I never knew what was going on. There seemed to be little communication between the professor and the TA, and the students were consistently out of the loop. I didn't get most of my grades back. He is very quiet and hard to understand, but tests were easy and quizzes were graded leaniently.
Very intelligent with regards to mathematics, but cannot teach to save his life.
WONDERFUL PROFESSOR
Complex Variables was a freaking nightmare. He made it super difficult in 6 weeks and there was way too much homework. DO NOT TAKE IT WITH THIS DR.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Multivariable Calculus is rough, but Boudjelka makes it less horrible. His lectures are rough and super theory heavy, but you will learn the material. The tests are GREAT super super fair and straight forward. HW can be 'fun'. Of all the multi teachers at RPI, I'd definitly reccomend Boudjelka.

Very interesting man. Unbelievably intelligent. Pretty hard to get down all he is saying in lecture, he moves quick. If you go to recitation and do your best to pay attention in class you will get an A with ease. He's super accessible and very willing to help if you ask. Just study what he tells you for the tests and you will get an A

Excellent professor- very intelligent and truly does care about students. The class is an easy grade (tests are easy if you are prepared) and you will learn a lot if you pay attention in lectures and do the suggested homework problems. Boudjelkha is always willing to help those struggling as well. Definitely take this class.

Not the best teacher, however he does give many examples. Homework is where I've learned most of the material. He is, fortunately, an easy grader and his tests have are predictable. Although he is not the best teacher, he is certainly brilliant and is to be respected. He is also pretty funny, but his humor is often hidden behind his thick accent.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Figure out all the homework and go to the class before tests and you can get an A. You do not even need to take the final

He clearly has the subject mastered, but teaches in a manner that skips basic definitions and basic concepts. The end result is page after page of notes that are ultimately meaningless to students. I recommend skipping the lectures and reading the textbook instead. Go to recitation and ALAC to learn the subject material.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I'm not going to talk about the tests because I've not taken one yet. But one thing I know for sure is that I don't learn anything from this class. The lecture is boring, and all he does is giving theorems and proofs to those theorems. There is no concrete example of how to use those theorems in lectures.

Bojangles is one of the most intelligent and enthusiastic professors Ive had at RPI. But he sucks at teaching. Going to class is not usually helpful and may make you feel very overwhelmed and confused. Not to worry!! Make sure you do the homework and study solely from the back tests and you will do just fine.
Has a heavy accent, which wasn't too bad to understand. His handwriting, however, is very small and hard to read.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: Bojangles is a genius but he's a really bad professor. He doesn't take a breath for you to actually understand what he's saying or for you to write down his messy notes. You will good grade if you study the back tests but you won't actually learn anything. Show up early to tests. Lecture attendance is unnecessary and may confuse you more.
If you do your homework and use back tests you will be good. He was very good in office hours.
His  heavy accent and lack of a current course website don't stop him from being the REAL MVP  You can also call him Bojangles
very good professor, really nice to student, and easy to get A

Class is easy. Professor is hard to understand sometimes in class because he moves very quickly but is very helpful in office hours. Don't really need to go to lectures but I recommend it because he will try to get to know students who go to class.  Homework can be long if you want to actually put effort in. Tests are the same as back tests.
Lectures are pretty useless.  Just be hopeful that your TA is good.
Go to class. Do the homework. Succeed.
Is good teacher like It
An overall good professor his lectures are a bit hard to understand due to his accent but he teaches all concepts clearly.

He seems nice enough but isn't a very good teacher. He speaks quietly and constantly and writes constantly, rarely pausing to explain unless asked to, and then his explanations aren't very good. DiffEq was extremely easy anyway, though, as he basically gives you the exam questions. I think he tries to be a good prof but comes up short. Hard accent.

Teaches you to do PDEs hella fast, also Fourier transforms and wall heat. Says very profound a lot, would recommend. Course is approachable for illiterate students, I can't read and I did fine. Happy to talk to you at office hours, very thick accent, being fluent in Arabic before attending class is recommended.

Don't need to go to lecture, but make sure you go to his lecture before every exam, those review sessions are golden in terms of studying for an exam because you encounter every scenario you can see on an exam. Other than that, don't bother copying proofs that he writes in class, you'll never see them on a test

Ignore all of these lazy cynics complaining about how horrible Boudjelkha is. Pay attention in lecture, go to recitation if the TA is worth it, and do the homework. He practically gives you the test questions the class before. It's a shame that a good guy and a better teacher gets slammed here by the ones still whining about his accent.

All of the negative comments are very un just. This is one of the most caring professors I have encountered in my college career. He basically tells you exactly what is going to be on the test, and will go through any problem step by step in his office hours. His biggest down fall is his lectures are fairly boring, usually non stop note taking.
Easy A, but you might not actually learn anything.  Lectures are terrible and completely optional.

I managed to get an A in his DiffEQ class without ever going to lecture, but ACalc was different. Not that going to lecture helps much either, since he's incomprehensible. The homeworks alone don't fully prepare you for the exams and he uses weird notation. Lectures are like a game, you try to sort through the mumbling and extract what's important.
If you are failing his Diffeq class, you shouldn't be at RPI.

Boudjelkha is one of the smartest people I've ever met.  He knows a ton about math, and if you go to lectures, he'll give you some good shortcuts for solving problems.  He's a bit tough to understand, but he posts his lecture notes online and tells you exactly what's going to be on the tests, so it's pretty easy to do well in his classes.

I have to say that the poor ratings he gets mostly are due to his accent. If you go find him during his office hours, he is extremely helpful and friendly. I mean you cant do anything about the accent. But a nice professor overall.
Bad teacher. Class was boring and useless. Homeworks were unrelated to class. Tests were poorly done.
Class consisted of him mumbling while he wrote constantly. He never paused. A brutally boring class.

This class is as easy as you make it. Boudjelkha is hard to understand but he has a grad TA reteach the 3 weekly lectures in an hour. Skip class and just go to those. The format of the tests is the same year to year. Buy a cramster account and learn the hw as you copy it. Easy A.
If you copy down what he puts on the projectors, you'll do fine.  However, he misinterprets most questions you'll ask him, and does a very poor job of explaining/elaborating on what he did.

Awesome guy. A little hard to follow in lecture but if you take notes and look at them later you can see what he did. Super willing to help you if you go in a talk to him during office hours. Tests and quizzes are a breeze as long as you do some amount of studying. Overall an easy A.

One of the easiest A's I got at RPI.  Pro tips for success: 1.  Take good notes in lecture, but exclude the proofs, you don't need those. 2. Go to the Wednesday night review sessions and/or ALAC tutoring if you need help. 3. Do ALL of the homework and don't start the night before it's due. 4. Back tests are your friend.  5. The final is optional!

Math itself is a language, so english shouldn't be a problem. In his original country, he was really recognised as a genius due to his research theories. However, his exams were extremely difficults to solve when he used to teach in his original country. If he's not well recognised in USA, it means that there's a problem in math students level.
He isn't as bad as everyone says, just pay attention in class and his accent won't seem that bad. Very willing to help students and does plenty of examples to make sure students get the concepts.

Really easy class. Do all the homeworks from cramster or rpistudygroup because pretty much none of the problems you do will show up on the tests. The tests are a piece of cake. 4 problems and the back tests are almost identical. I'd recommend going to class because his methods for solving problems are more understandable than the book.
He is my favorite professor at RPI thus far.
easy grader, interested in students achievments, office hours are helpful (esp for maple projects) ive never gotten such a high math grade before

Great class and completely straight forward.  He gives you the equations you need to know right away and then gives you more than enough examples.  One of the easiest graders around and a nice guy overall.  One downside is his accent can be hard to cut through but the material is not too complicated.

His class was an easy A, though I did learn quite a bit.  He lectures are a bit on the theory side, though when possible he explains the physical meaning or gives an example where it is useful; alot of what doesn't make sense is clarified by the homework.  He prepares students for exams very well.  Simply, he wants students to do well.
Excellent Professor. He is a little dry, but he explains things well with lots of examples.

His lectures were hard to understand, partly because of his accent and low speaking volume. I ended up skipping most of them, but by doing the homework and going to recitation I managed to learn the material. Diff EQ is a pretty dull subject, so I don't really blame him for not being very interesting.
Keeps it simple and shows you exactly what you need to know for tests.  It may seem unclear at first, but the homeworks help to clear anything up and usually end up being harder than the test itself.

He is a very smart person. He tries his best to communicate, but that is usually not enough. His exams are very straightforward and with just a little preparation an A is easy to achieve, BUT I highly suggest back exams and pray for a good TA. Try Drop In Tutoring or his online notes. I did not go to class after 2nd exam and still got an A.
very easy tests
Do not go to lecture.  Pray that you get a good TA.  Go to recitation.

Soft spoken and has a thick accent, either sit close or hope he wears a microphone.  Other than that, very knowledgeable, focuses more on pure math than application (doesn't give any word problems).  Very easy grader: if you do the Diff Eq right but screw up arithmetic or calculus you won't lose much, just show you know the process.
Decent teacher. Writes out proofs for everything and gives plenty of examples. Not big on the conceptual side or giving you that nice feeling of understanding. Pretty fair grader.

He isn't that hard to understand , nor is it terribly difficult to read his handwriting. He more or less tells you what will be on tests. He is a really nice guy and if you talk to him about your grade and let him know you care, you will do better. Go talk to him at least once study, go to class, and do the homework, and you should get an A
Very easy test if you know the form of the solution. He is very passionate about teaching and thinks that some forms of solving differential equations are "like magic"

This guy is quite possibly the funniest professor I have ever had-- honestly just listen to the stuff he says, its hilarious.  He's also incredibly smart-- one time a kid challenged an "assumption" he wrote down and Prof. B responded with a 3 page proof off the top of his head, impressive. Watch schmidts videos and do the homework,you will befine

I agree with the some of the previous comments on this forum. This guy is not fair guy. Some people say he is an easy grader and nice. But he is NOT. He is nice to only certain type of people and if he doesnt like you, he will make sure he take it off your exams.
Tells you exactly what is going to be on each exam- makes the class relatively easy.

His approach to teaching mathematics is geared toward mathematics majors. His tests can be hard due to the limited number of points. (20 point tests translate to 5% for each point...) Good professor overall.

Trust me, take Diff EQ with this guy. He is by far the easiest grader I have ever seen. He goes through proofs in lecture, but you dont need to learn them. Instead, follow the tons of examples he puts up, cause the homework and tests are exactly like these.
easy stuff but lectures make it seem more complicated than it really is

DO NOT GO TO LECTURE. YOU WILL KICK YOURSELF FOR WASTING 50 MINUTES OF YOUR LIFE EVERYTIME YOU GO. Easy grader though, the final is optional. Id take him compared to the other professors but just know its pointless for you to go to lecture. Read the book and watch David Schmidts online videos, it got me through well.
Great Professor, a little hard to understand but i learned a lot in his class, easy grader, buy you still have to learn everething

His accent and complex explanation of subject matter make the subject much more difficult than it actually is.  He uses complex proofs during class that use notation and ideas out of students' understanding. Very boring. Homework is fairly understandable, some complexities. Tests are extremely straightforward, and final is optional. Not recommended

He is a kind and friendly person. When you have questions, he is always glad to help. When teaching, usually he not only tell the practical part, but the proof and principle as well. But...it is sometimes really hard to get a clear understanding of what he is talking about...
No Comments

He is not a nice profesosor, not an understanding professor. iHe treats you depending who you are, if you appear to be quiet and hide, he dont care about you. He's very hard to understand, and he writes very small, so lectures aren't that useful, unless these things aren't a problem for you.  If you're good at reading the text for most of your info and then asking some questions to clarify, then you'll be fine.  The material isn't that hard.  It's similar to Multivariable Calc.

Boudjelkha teaches math how it should be taught, with examples. In his lectures he'll show hundreds of different situations for each type of problem. Understanding him is tough at times, but if you just follow his math everything becomes clear. Exams are easy and homeworks are easy if you don't suck. Check out Schmidt videos for anything else.

This professor will go much out of his way to help students learn. He is very reasonable and he will always tell you exactly what is going to be on the test. He is not the greatest at giving lectures, but this isn't the only part of a teacher's job. If you go to his office hours and try to do well, you will.

Lectures are bad, just does a bunch of proofs.  Do the HW and listen during both recitations to do well.  He grades easily and teaches different stuff than the other professors.  Not a hard class, just a chore to get through.
you cant understand a thing he's saying, skips steps when he does proofs/examples.  watch schmidt videos if you wish to survive this class

Cant understand anything he says but if you watch Schmidt videos you will do good on his tests except the last one which you have to read the book. I got a B by never going to class, copying all the homeworks, and studying the night before the test.

This guy is not nearly as bad as everyone makes him out to be and neither is his accent. His tests are not hard, and he is very willing to help you if you ask him. He wants to see all of his students suceed

What made me go to class all semester is the guilt I would have if I didn't go. He sounds he's on Nyquill, and his accent is terrible. Does all proofs, and like one example, and skips steps there. bojangles is the man! he might not make much sense in class, but he's a very easy grader, and if you go talk to him, he'll help you out ;-)

This guy is the worst professor I have ever had.  He does not speak clearly and should be fired from his job at the first possible moment! what can we say about this man...he has his own group on facebook, he's a freedom fighter (look it up on google) he has the thickest accent known to made and understanding him is a chore. One of the easiest graders ever. Shout out to Sharath for getting me an A in the class.
only does the proofs on the board and the material he does in class is VERY HARD.  The test are easier though, but if you don't know how to do any of the problems your screwed.
cant understand a damned thing he sais, bores you to death and does not do anywhere near a good job of teaching material

Dear lord, don't take diffEQ from him.  Too many proofs, impossible to follow, doesn't answer questions.  I went to every class and was still lost most of the time.  Easy grader. I got an A but that's because my TA Pablo was totally the man, and he's not TAing anymore so you have no hope.

Mohamed's notes were pretty hard to follow and the lectures were boring. However, he tells you what are on the tests and it's pretty straight forward stuff that just takes some memorization. He's also willing to explain stuff to you, which can be a big help. I got an A in the class w/o taking the final, since I got a B and C in Calc I and II.

Pay attention in his class.  Write down everything he writes on the overheads durring lecture.  If you do this and put in some effort you will do fine in his class.   He is one of my favorite professors here...but i don't think i could get to know him because his english is not that great.
Look at this. Just follow the formula; don't worry about the rest. We've proved it; just use the formula. We have example number...um....3. It's so simple. Just follow the formula.

Difficult material. He tends to skip steps, leaves students wondering. Starts class right when he walks in (come early if you're going to classes) goes a little late. Thick accent. Fair tests. Tests are on Mondays. I recommend getting a Friday TA section, if possible.
we call him Mr. Bojangles, but he doesnt dance. somehow i got an A.

oh my god.... worst teacher ever.  assumes that people care about the proofs only and not actually how to do anything.  doesn't help that you can hardly understand him.  grr.  super easy exams though.

hard to understand. real easy grader just do the homework. onoy tests the basics
This man gave me a gift that noone else on earth could -- The Wronskian. and i love him for it. He just really needs to shower

hard accent but once you get used to it you'll love him.... you'll feel utterly lost at times but dont worry he'll answer everything eventually... grades very nicely become friends with him and you'll ace the class
Very thick accent, very confusing lectures. He has good notes you can download and is lenient with grading, as long as you talk to him.

The most confusing professor I've ever had. Most of the lectures are spent doing mind numbing derevations of every concept covered. The differing test forms he gives out significantly vary in difficulty. The last test was extremely difficult. Get a good TA or be a math major or you're doomed.

A terrible teacher who can't communicate with students.  A very smart man, but he is not good at teaching.  His thick accent makes him difficult to understand.  He is also bad at answering questions, (he just stares back at you), or interacting with other humans in general.
just use his notes and u will do fine the book sucks

he's spastic, u can't follow him

Mohammed isn't that great.  Very unclear about his steps to solve problems, almost has a belittling response to some students questions.
