Make sure you pay attention and follow along in python, he goes kinda fast and sometimes doesn't post the code you want in his notes. ps CS1 is taught in python, so indian guys on youtube are your friend and can reinforce what he said in lecture.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: So I previously submitted a bad rating, but since then I've had Professor Kuzmin for 2 additional classes, and I actually really like him. I think the first class was poorly organized, but it was his first time teaching it. In the other two classes I've had with him since, I think they were taught very well :) He is a caring teacher.
Lectures aren't great, homeworks can be annoying and the quizes people averaged 50%s on. That being said, he is trying harder than a lot of profs and he will help you if you give him the chance.

Many of the complaints are valid. That being said, Kuzmin is clearly trying his best as a lecturer even if he falls short. If you spend time to talk to him in office hours, he's actually very kind and will spend a lot of time explaining concepts. Clearly very knowledgeable, just not great at lecturing. Class was heavily curved at the end.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: The worst professor in my life. Try to excape him Take his course if you want hard quizzes and homework. :)
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Given hard quizzes every two weeks; won't give any practice test. If there is another professor available, RUN! Otherwise, GOOD LUCK!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Just an absolute nightmare. Gives incredibly tough quizzes every 2-3 weeks. They're absurdly long, and he refuses to shorten them because he can complete them in 12 mins. Won't give practice exams and won't accept any criticism about his teaching methods. He gives absolutely no indication in class when something he is lecturing on will be on tests.

Tests every 2 weeks, laughably hard. The last exam had to be curved so sharply that the minimum d was a 22! He gave us an 8 page test in 50 minutes. He then told all of us that we didn't study hard enough and said he could finish it in 12 minutes. He explains how to do the labs and the homework in the lecture AFTER we had to do it ourselves. RUN.
The worst professor. Lots of difficult homework. He think he teaches very well and give us hard quizzes. However, I think he is wrong!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: This is by far the worst professor I have ever had. I have attended almost every lecture so far and it doesnt prepare you at all for the quizzes or homework. He spends lots of time on stuff you dont need to know and rushes through things that are on the test and doesnt teach the programming you need to know. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!

TERRIBLE teacher. Quizzes are super hard and irrelavant to the homework or labs. Does not teach and only reads the powerpoint. Blows through the material quickly and expects you to have it mastered the next day. If you take him expect most of your education to come from youtube or google. Kuzmin is definetly on here rating himself the 5 stars.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Quizzes are insanely difficult. Material is not relevant to homework, labs, or even lecture notes. For example, last semester (spring 2019) quiz 3 was 1.5 pages. Fall 2019 Quiz 3, 11 pages.
Terrible. I don't understand anything he talks about in lecture. Quizzes are ridiculous difficult. nothing similar to the past quizzes and homework.
Great professor and is teaching the class very well.

Professor Kuzmin is one of my all time favorite professors. While the lecture was dull (comp org just sucks.. not his fault), he was always willing to help and I learned a lot by going to his office hours and receiving help. I have also had the pleasure of working alongside him as a mentor and he truly loves his job and it shows.

Kuzmin was okay for Comp Org. He really seemed to enjoy the course, unlike the rest of the class. He was very enthusiastic and excited to answer peoples' questions, and he did a good job answering them. He had to pick up the class half way through, so for a late start, he did a pretty good job. Comp Org itself is not a great course though.

He's a great guy who is just trying his hardest. The lecture exercises are easy, the labs are not too tough, and the homework are doable. Exams suck but they get curved like crazy so its okay!!!!! Great dude!!!
Do not take this professor's course!!! Trust me! Too much homework, and too difficult for an introduction course.

You don't have to go to lecture at all to pass CS1. Just read the note packet, do the lecture exercises, and use stack overflow to help you with the homework. Be careful because weird things can pop up on tests.

I register for Rate my Professor just to let others know do not take course with this prof. His lecture note is not helpful AT ALL. You'd better youtube and look for online courses instead of reading through his notes and slides. Lots of homework. His exams are hard. The average for our Final Exam was terrible.
The worst professor ever

Yue Laoshi is a very caring professor. Everything that you need to do is made very clear from day one of class, where a comprehensive syllabus is provided. Your grade is very much about how much effort you put in, not your fluency. It is clear that she wants students to succeed. There is a lot of content, but it is presented gradually.

As a senior, I can definitely say she is the best teacher I had in RPI. Really cares about her students and very supportive. She fostered an incredible sense of community among students, it truly felt like a collaborative environment where everyone kept growing together. You have to put in effort, but in the end, you will have a solid foundation.

Yue Laoshi is a very kind, understanding professor and her classroom environments are very fun. In her class, everyone knows each other and it's a nice little community where no one feels awkward or out of place. You definitely need to put in some effort, but the assignments are very doable and you leave the class feeling accomplished.

Yue Laoshi is a great professor to have. One of the few professors at RPI that actually cares about student learning and the material that they teach! She is so compassionate and understanding, always trying to bring a positive and uplifting attitude to class. The workload may be high, but she's always willing to work with you and you have makeups.

Yue laoshi is an amazing professor! I've had her for three classes now and each time, I look forward to going to class. She's very knowledgeable, her lectures are fascinating, and she genuinely cares about her students. Would recommend taking any of her classes!
Great teacher, just a lot of homework
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Amazing professor. The requirements for the class are very clear. Cares more about effort than your knowledge of Chinese. If you put in the work she WILL see it and it will not matter if you know less than other people, she will greatly appreciate it and you will get a good grade.

Prof.Yue is an amazing professor. There is nothing about Chinese culture she does not know about. The content itself is not difficult, but there will be a lot of work. She gives you the syllabus and it tells you the work you will have to turn in for the entire semester and the deadlines. If you miss them, there is an opportunity to make up for it.
I love Yue Laoshi. She was excellent. The class is work-heavy, but if you put the effort in, you will see that learning Mandarin Chinese is easier than you think!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: I had a hard time in her class. She sometimes was very rude and didn't allow students to explain themselves if there was miscommunication. I tried my best, but she made it impossible for me to receive an A. She likes to brag during class that kids like her, but that is subjective, and I don't know how that is relevant to the class material.

The best Chinese professor I could have ever asked for. Very passionate and understanding. Will always go the extra step if she sees that you are also passionate about the language. Gives a lot of opportunities to learn and grow. You get as much out of this class as you put into it, but attendance is mandatory.
Yue Laoshi is an amazing teacher that really cares about her students and their progress! There is a good amount of homework for the class, but it is very doable.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Yue laoshi was a great professor who guided me through the beginning stages of learning Chinese. I took this class during the accelerated summer semester, which added to the rigor of the already fast-paced schedule of memorizing words and grammar structures, but I always felt that I had the educational support required to succeed.

Professor Yue is a very caring and thoughtful professor. This class has a lot of assignments, but if you manage your time well you will get a good grade. I would recommend her to anyone looking to learn Chinese!

I love Yue Laoshi! She is very involved with students and is one of the clearest teachers at RPI. The work outside of class is fairly easy to do good on (70-85), but if you want to really master it (85-100), you need to put in work.

Our class loves Yue Laoshi; she brightens our day and always comes to class with great enthusiasm. She teaches us in a fun way, and she goes above and beyond to help us learn the material. She is a fantastic professor who cares about not only our grades but also our happiness. She is very intelligent and knowledgeable. Definitely take her class!
I've had professor Yue for Chinese 1 through 3. She's by far the best professor at RPI and one of the few that care about their students

You can tell Professor Yue truly cares for her students. She expects a very reasonable amount of effort from her students but with the way she encourages and helps the students, its usually no problem. I never thought I could have so much fun taking a foreign language class so if you are interested at all, I highly recommend taking her class.

Professor Yue is the only professor that I've come across at RPI that really does care about her students. She listens to feedback from students to make the course as fair, effective and enjoyable as possible

Anyone who's taken her class can see how much she wants you to succeed in not just learning but internalizing the Chinese language. She is always prepared for the day's lesson, and always ready to happily answer your questions. There is a lot of work for this class, but it is definitely manageable and ultimately worthwhile.

Yue Laoshi stresses learning in her class, and while she may often correct your grammar or tone, she does it because she wishes for you to be better at the language. Her grading metrics are clearly defined, and while she stresses focus in the class, she is willing to tell stories in both Chinese and English, as well as learn English from us.

Very good at giving feedback, after every word she will make you practice it so that you can pronounce it correctly. Professor Yue is also very supportive and only wants to see you succeed and be able to speak Mandarin well.

Yue laoshi is an amazing professor who I admire very much. She is incredibly caring and hardworking. She prepares for many hours outside of class to make sure we have the best learning experience. I appreciate her dedication to her students; she wants us to become native speakers, and she is willing to support us throughout!

Professor Yùe is an outstanding educator. Her knowledge of Chinese etymology, history and culture is extensive and accurate, and she is so meticulous and thorough in her explanations. She carefully reiterates important concerts in various ways, such that certainly that no student has ever left the classroom with any misunderstanding or confusion.

A rare professor. If you want to learn Chinese, don't miss Professor Yue. She cares about her students and sets you up to succeed in the language. I was surprised by how much I learned in a couple of months. Challenging but rewarding. Take a class with Professor Yue.

Laoshi Yue is easily the best teacher I've ever had the pleasure of having. I took Chinese I with her my freshman year and from the very beginning, she is clear with her expectations. Chinese is a difficult class that will require lots of time outside of class studying, but she is willing to listen to students input and work one on one with any.
Shes very nice and very supportive.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: I really loved the class! Fair warning: THIS IS NOT AN EASY A. While Yue is very clear on what you can do to get an A, I wouldn't say it was easy. You really do have to go to class and do all of the work. Make sure to start early on projects and sign up for mentoring hours early in the semester. The class is taught primarily in Chinese.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: I took Chinese 2, 3, 4, 5, and an independent study with Prof. Yue. She is accomodating (within reason.) If you do the work (which there is a lot of,) you will probably get an A. You'll get out of the class what you put into it. I found the projects helpful, but the workbook HW seemed like busywork, I don't feel like I learned anything from them.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Yue is probably the best professor I've had at RPI. She clearly puts effort into her classes and even makes online classes engaging and fun.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Yue laoshi is very knowledgeable and always willing to help and provide feedback. At first, you might feel embarassed every time she corrects your pronunciation or grammar, but it's always with the intention of helping you improve. As long as you keep up with the work and frequently participate in class, you'll have no problem getting an A.

A great professor that really cares about her students. She'll do everything to make sure all students are following along and puts a lot of effort into her class. Since it's a language class, there's a lot of work. However, the pacing is good and if you start work early, you won't struggle. In this class, you'll actually learn Chinese well.
Good lecturer but tended to repeat the same thing over and over in class. And her english is sometimes difficult to understand.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Yue is awesome! She pays attention to all her students and takes the time to understand us not only as students, but as individuals. My favorite part of learning in her class is how interesting she makes it (i.e. if we have trouble recognizing a character, she'll tell us a story to help us remember the character itself and its meaning).

As a professor, she is one of the best I have ever had. Not only does she truly care for the students and what they are able to take away from her class, but she does see the effort that the students put into her class. She tries to help clean up students' pronunciation whenever possible, so that the students speak as authentic Chinese as they can.

Best. Language Class. Ever. If you've heard that Chinese is super hard to learn and are worried about taking this class, don't be. Yue Laoshi is an amazing professor and you can really tell that she cares about teaching. If you're looking for an easy A, this isn't the class for you but if you want to learn Chinese, there isn't a better class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Yue Laoshi is a great instructor. Fully recommend. If you put in the work, she respects you. Even if you don't, she will still push you but it is only because she cares about her students. A wonderful instructor.

Amazing professor. Yue Lao shi cares about all of her students. You can tell just by being around her that she wants every student to succeed. The workload is what you make of it. If you don't understand something she will gladly go back and review. She takes a lot of time to go beyond the textbook but the quizzes/tests are based on the textbook.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: I absolutely loved her teaching style and class time. Most people wanted to be in class all the time because we enjoyed learning without feeling too much pain from homework or stress from the material. I honestly wish that all classes were run the same way because Chinese I has sparked my love for love for learning all over again.

Professor Yue is the most dedicated professors to a course that I have ever been taught by in my four years at RPI. She provides excellent feedback and teaches the material excellently. Class time is very productive and stimulating. She also provides opportunities for students to practice the language outside of the classroom with native speakers.

Yue laoshi was excellent, showing a great wealth of knowledge way beyond what was expected. She know the entire history and origin of every single character and had great background and cultural information for many of the topics covered. She was also very aware of the difficulties in learning a new language and was very patient and understanding.

This course is quite time intensive but that is expected of a language course. The course was very enjoyable and the students really got to interact with each other. Professor Yue was always ready to enthusiastically help any student and answer any questions about the course or other subjects related to the course.

Professor Yue did a fantastic job ensuring that all students were familiar with a given topic and set of words before moving on. She doesn't just teach content but the reasoning and understanding behind the content. She is always trying to find ways to improve the classroom experience.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Yue Laoshi singlehandedly helped me discover what I'm passionate about, and she's made my time at RPI invaluable. She is incredibly caring and will do everything she can to help you succeed. I've never met another professor who cares about her students as much as Yue Laoshi, and I don't think I ever will. I highly recommend her classes.

Yue Lao shi cares so much about her students. She truly loves teaching. She always does her best to make herself available for students, and when she helps you she does so in the kindest way possible. She understands that her students top priority is not her class but their major work, and she's always considerate of that.

Yue Laoshi is hands down one of the best professors at RPI. I have taken Chinese 2-5 with Yue Laoshi and can say the class is always fun, interesting, and interactive--you get to learn so much culture beyond just the language. Additionally, the class size is small so you get to know your class and amazing prof. I would highly recommend this class!

I've never met another professor who has put in as much effort at Prof. Yue. She is a very caring prof who gives it her all so that her students can get the most out of class and do well. She is always there to help you with anything you need. Lots of work (presentations, dialogue performances, quizzes and workbook HW) but you'll learn for sure.

I learned a lot in this class. I do have prior experience with Mandarin because I speak it at home. Even so, however, I came into the class without the ability to read or write any Chinese characters. After finishing this class, I can now say that I can confidently recognize and write nearly all of the characters I learned in class.

Yue Laoshi has an amazing ability to instill in her students a high regard for and robust understanding of the Chinese language and culture. She takes care to address the learning needs of each and every student and is always accessible. Class is fun, so going to class does not feel mandatory despite the attendance policy. The work is manageable.
Meh

Yue laoshi's class is clear and although attendance is mandatory class is fun to attend. There is a fair amount of work, but if properly paced the workload actually seems rather light and learning is not difficult as Yue laoshi does her best to answer any and all questions. She's also very accessible through office hours and email. Would recommend.

Yue Laoshi is one of the best professors that I have had at RPI. She genuinely cares about her students and you can tell that she absolutely loves teaching. The class is not hard, per se, but very homework intensive. You have to study a lot and put a bit of time in to the course. If you think this will be an easy A, don't take a class with her.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Caring

comment: There are only a few professors who really care about their students in RPI, and Yue Laoshi is definitely one of them. To me, she's like a family member because cares about everyone in her class. She makes sure that all students are at the same pace. I got a B in her class because her class is relatively challenging. Overall she is a great teacher.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Yue Laoshi is the singular best teacher I have had here at RPI. While her course can be challenging and intense, she is committed to going above and beyond for her students, and will go any lengths to inspire and encourage those in her class. She approaches each student as an individual, addressing their specific needs and deficiencies, and pushing

Excellent professor. As a senior, with six years of college semesters behind me, I have never had a college professor that cared so much about their students. She constantly puts effort into trying to accommodate for students, gives constructive and helpful feedback, and makes everyone feel included.

There are few language teachers like Yue Laoshi. She is very caring and accessible to students if they need help in class. Gives plenty of extra credit to encourage learning. Class structure is ideal and the syllabus is concise and clear.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: God-tier language teacher. If you're trying to learn, you'll get a lot our of this class.

Yue laoshi is a professor who really cares about her students. She is an exceptional teacher and always keeps her class interesting and engaging. I always look forward to class because of the enthusiasm she brings on a daily basis. It seems like all of her students are always hard workers because of the environment she sets.

Professor Yue is by far one of the best professors I have taken a class with here. She makes class interesting and makes you want to learn more from her. She often tells jokes and stories about a certain character to help students understand it more. Although the homework and projects may seem like a lot, it won't be if you properly space it out.

Yue is the best professor I've ever had. When it comes to teaching Chinese, she is enthusiastic and overqualified. The environment of the class during lectures is lively and joyous, unlike other language classes. Active participation is expected and advised, and errors made during class are not mistakes but enjoyable learning experiences.
rating_tags: Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: One of the best professors hands down. Very experienced teacher. Extremely nice. Especially great for first-time learners. Some ppl say a lot of homework, but only true if you let it pile up (only 2 hrs/wk avg). Most important thing is GENUINE effort/motivation. You'll learn a TON of Chinese stress-free, and love doing it, & should be a natural A.
Amazing professor who cares a lot about her students and their success. Definitely among the top professors I've ever had.

Professor Yue is a very supportive and caring teacher. Chinese is a very tough language to learn and Yue makes a point patient and enthusiastic every single day. She offers individual feedback to each student and shows them specific mistakes and how to solve them. Overall I genuinely enjoyed her class, she made learning Chinese fun.

She really takes the time to make sure every student has what they need to succeed. The class is by no means an easy one and requires a lot of work, but as a student, you have everything you need to do well in the class if you are willing to put in the work. The most important thing in any of her classes is being involved and showing that you care
If you do the all the work, you'll do well. She's a great teacher who really cares about her students.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Professor Yue is personal and cares about each of her students. She focuses on providing opportunities for her students to improve their Mandarin outside of the classroom such as in Conversation Corner. She is interesting during class and does a great job going above and beyond, teaching not only what, but also why.

Yue is one of the best profs at RPI. She genuinely tries to make learning a fun experience for everyone, which is a pleasant change from most RPI profs. She's super sweet, however, you will get out of her class what you decide to put into it. It can be an easy A if you do the work or it can be an incredibly easy D if you miss more than 2 classes.

Prof. Yue is the type that expects a lot out of you and at the same time gives you've everything you need to meet those expectations. If you are planning on taking Chinese at RPI, don't expect an easy A, but expect to be able to get an A with the right effort. Definitely one of my fav professors so far.

What separates her from the rest of the professors at this school is her passion and ability to inspire her students. Her class had a steady stream of hw and quizzes every week, which was an appropriate work load and kept me engaged in learning. If you are considering taking any Chinese class with her, i highly recommend it!

Seems strict at first, but if you put in the effort, it's very easy to do well in her class.  Going to class is mandatory, and you will fail class if you don't, however, participation is a huge part of your grade and as long as you at try to contribute you'll get 90-100% easy. Has dialogue and culture presentations so you aren't just taking tests .
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Prof Yue is an excellent professor. You can tell she is very dedicated to her work and she genuinely wants her students to learn and excel in the Chinese language. B/c of that, expect to work a bit to get a good grade, but learning the material isn't too hard since she's is great at teaching and she's always eager to help students if they need it

Prof Yue is enthusiastic about teaching language and she does a good job incorporating Chinese culture into the class. She's often available to help students when they need it and is very approachable.

Professor Yue does an outstanding job at breaking down the foreign language learning process into a way that is easy for students to learn. By easy to learn, I mean that I was never without direction in the course. Learning a new language can be overwhelming and discouraging, and Professor Yue was always available to explain material in a new way.

Excellent professor overall. Very passionate about you actually learning Chinese. A lot of focus on speaking with proper tones. Expects a lot from her students, but not too much. Is very reasonable and knows that for most students this is not their major or even their minor.

Yue Laoshi is a really great professor. She cares a lot about her students and tries her best to meet everyone's needs while still moving through the material at a good pace. Expect to have to work hard, but you'll be rewarded for your effort. I hope to take more courses with her in the future.
Great professor, great course. There's a decent bit of work in the course, but it's fair for the content. Just wish I wasn't swamped with other courses this semester.

This was a great course. It was a much needed break from the technical work at RPI.  This class is by no means an easy A you do have to work for it, but it's not back breaking work. Lecture is very interactive and fun you learn a lot about the culture and plenty of Chinese jokes. Professor Yue is so dedicated to helping her students.

She keeps the course very interesting. We learn something new nearly everyday. There hasn't been a boring moment in her class. She's very knowledgeable in her field of expertise and provides clear easy to understand feedback to students.
It's a jam packed class in with a great teacher who wants to see her students succeed. Stay on schedule and do well on the quizzes and you will be fine.
Very considerate to every students. She makes a language class, which is supposed to be hard, easy and fun.

Great and fun professor, goes out of her way to be available to help. She wants to give you an A, just study for the quizzes and you're golden. I don't think I got below a 90 on anything I handed in on time.
Professor Yue is phenomenal.

Chinese is definitely a tough language to learn, but Professor Yue puts a ton of work into making it possible for you, and clearly tries to support each student.  Plus she's super nice, though you are expected to do work.

Yue Laoshi is a wonderful Professor that truly loves teaching, and her love for teaching is what really makes her so great. She cares so much about her students and wants to see everyone succeed. She is a very understanding woman too and is very easy to talk with. If you are struggling at all, talk to her and she will help any possible way she can.
Yue Laoshi is a great teacher. She is very clear about what she expects out of you, and very helpful. She can be a little harsh at times, but overall, her courses are relatively straight-forward.
She's just everything you need to learn chinese
Took his intro to MGMT class as a freshmen. By far the best MGMT professor I've had. You have to put in the work, but he will make you improve.
Best professor at RPI. If you get the chance to take this class do so. You will not regret it.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Overall, an excellent professor. No tests or quizzes, just constant assignments where you apply everything you learn. Assignments are a lot of reading and will take outside research as well. Beginning of this class will be super confusing on what is expected of you. Asking Wright questions to clarify and working with classmates are major keys.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: I'm writing this review as a senior and I can say that this course is easily in my top 3 favorite courses across engineering and management.   Don't skip class and be ready to improve.  If you just want an easy A, don't take this course. Mr. Wright will make you work for your grade and if you take the time to improve you will be rewarded.

My favorite professor I've had at RPI. It has been one of the most useful courses I have taken because he provides insightful life lessons. The course is a lot of work and will challenge you to put thought into the assignments. However, it is very rewarding. If you have the chance to take a class with him, do it!

You need to talk. If you do not participate your grade will suffer harshly. Intimidating teacher who is very knowledgable. A wrong answer is better than no answer. You will spend many hours on the homework. You will need to apply yourself, but you will learn much. He has a lot of experience and makes you work like you are an adult.

Greatest, wisest and most helpful as well as difficult a professor you can have. One of the few that will CHALLENGE a student with material that requires thought. Chegg will get you absolutely nowhere in this class, you must actually engage and come up with your own (correct) answer that is perfect in its own right.

Wright is one of the best professors I've had at RPI so far. He goes beyond teaching management by providing insightful life lessons. If you're not interested in a business degree, then another teacher is better. It's a hard class but if you put in the effort and communicate with him, you'll get an A. If you get an A+ he gives you a letter of rec.

Professor Wright helps facilitate learning in different methods that any professor I have ever had. His class has a lot of work that takes a lot of effort. The most work that i have ever done for a class, and I'm a senior! I would recommend anyone to take his course, it inspires learning unlike any other class I have taken at RPI.

Frank Wright is awesome! Best professor I had that semester. The class was very engaging and felt very relevant. His teaching style is phenomenal. The cases are pretty simple and is an interesting way to teach the topic.
Asked for help, got none; was told I had to find out on my own. I'm fully expecting to fail, due to complete lack of communication as to what he expects from each case study.
Class has a lot of work, but it's all worth it in the end. You learn so much and get to know a great guy.
Mr. Wright is fantastic. Although he is kind tough, his course will definitely be a part of helpful experiences.

Everyone says he's hard, and the reality is, he is. But if you put the effort in, go to class, take everything seriously, do your work, and don't slack, the rewards are well worth the effort. He doesn't help individually much and he mostly leaves you to figure out stuff yourself, but that's just his way of getting  you to do stuff yourself. Great.

Mr. Wright was my first experience with a professor at RPI, and he was fantastic. He challenges his students, and makes his classroom an awesome interactive learning experience. I gained a great deal of applicable real world knowledge from him, making the lack sleep completely worth while.

If you ever have an opportunity to take Frank's class, DO IT! Especially if you're not a Management major! He's one of the most helpful, insightful people at RPI, and you owe it to yourself to interact with him. He's served as a mentor and friend to me ever since I took his class...four years ago. A real asset to RPI.

What a class! This class is a lot of work, no one will deny that.  The class is very rewording. He does not return work which is very frustrating. If you go to his office, he will  give you your grade.  He will say, "If you exceed your expectations, you will exceed mine." He gives you life tips and hints. He loves his job and it shows through.
Strongly recommend his class

Wright is one of the most outstanding professors I have ever had. Do not take this class with him unless can put the work in. You would do both everyone a favor. That being said, the quality of your work MUST rise with every assignment, or else you will do badly. Also, the standard for an A changes each term depending on the brightness of students.
Wright is a great professor. Although you think he is insane sometimes, it is all for a purpose in the end. I would recommend this class to anyone, but you will have to put in the work to do well
Intro to mgmt: Easy peasy class as long as you participate and are confident. Wright himself is no help and doesn't return your work back.... No way to know how well you're doing.

I did not find lectures incredibly helpful in learning anything about business.  However, this class teaches you how to learn for yourself, work in a group, deal with a lot of stress in a small amount of time, think (or ****) on your toes, and be prepared for anything. You won't realize how much you learned until later, during, it's hell.
Phenomenal professor.  I will always be grateful for Mr. Wright's help and advice.
Best all around course @ RPI; everyone there should have this course.  highly relevant, no matter what you're there for. contagious enthusiasm for material. inspired & inspiring.
Great

This is a class that you will only realize it's helpfulness down the line. He is a great teacher who intentionally makes assignments vague and tough to prepare you. He cares to much about his students to hurt them(GPA wise). Overall nice guy, great person to ask for advice from. Live by: "prior preparation prevents poor performance".

Lots say he's the 'best professor ever.' I find that he rambles on a lot about pointless topics. I only found the final presentation to be relevant; other than that I did not think I learned much in his class at all. However, it's  not hard to get at least at A-; he's an easy grader.

Prof Wright is a cool guy. He's eccentric, but he also knows what he's talking about. If you have to take Intro to Management, take it with him. He'll make class interesting, and he'll connect what you learn to real life.
Everyone says he's wonderful, but class isn't that interesting, I don't think.  Just rambles on about non-important things in the front of the class sitting in his little chair.
quite possibly the coolest prof ever.  he is basically the man and you need to take this course with him, you will have alot of work, but it is worth it.
He is one of those teachers that you will never forget. Best teacher I've ever had!
No Comments

A great teacher. Notihng prepares you for the ambiguity that may arise in the work world, as well as the work load. You can learn alot about business from his course. No teacher has ever motivated me to do the work as much as him.

Had him for both Intro to Mgmt & International Business over the course of my rpi career and he is extremely intelligent and well versed.  Learned a LOT from both classes and was very interested throughout both.  He's one of the best teachers I had at RPI.
Best teacher i've ever had. Learn as much as you can from this class.
good god there was a lot of work. also, he is definitely crazy. now that i'm not taking the class i like it a lot more.
Easy A, guaranteed B.  He gave 18 A's in a class of about 30.  Great guy

sooo over-rated. Wasn't what I expected. he tries to be your "shrink" or something. maybe appealing to other rpi people but not to me. found him boring and he constantly repeats himself.his class only teaches you how to dress well in the "business" world and how to "present" well. but after 5 wks, there is no need for him anymore.

The best professor I've had thus far.  Amazing at getting student involvement and still allows the student to decide how much he/she will put into the course.  Awesome, awesome, awesome.  FXW fo life!
Best Teacher first semester... got me really into it... and im not a geek... you learn a lot and the presentations are fun!

GREATEST TEACHER I'VE EVER HAD!!! FXW 4 LIFE! Taught everything with great detail and the class was amazing. BEST PROFESSOR AT RPI! You'll never regret taking the class with him. Amazing man and great professor who cares about students and material and life in general. Amazing in and out of class.

The best professor i ever had. He's fun.. understanding.. fully engaged with students.. he has that stern look but dont let it fool you. class is a lot of work, but you get used to it pretty fast. i wished prof wright teached every class in rpi cause i simply adore him!!!

Going into my senior year here at RPI and still no teacher like him....He has the ability to entertain and educate you all at the same time.  What you learn in this class goes far beyond the four years of college......Thanks Prof. Wright!
lot of work, but u learn a lot. Easy A-B
awesome class, very usefull!

Best professor there is!  He is beyond intelligent, and truly cares about the students. He is teaching for all the right reasons, unlike many of the Engineering professors. Find the time to take introduction to management.  Wright is the best!!

Took this class 5 years ago as a freshman and he shaped my work ethic at RPI from there on out. Allows you to push the class as far as you want, and i learned the most out of such a basic class! Awesome awesome guy!!!!
No Comments
awesome awesome dude.  i learned more in his class than probably any other class here.  hard but worth it.
stop whining.  This guy is the man, definitely my favorite teacher ever.  Those who complain should just grow a pair.
Great Prof...Should be at a much better school
Best MGMT class i've had at RPI, Yes u work, and half the assignment is figuring it out but u will learn more in this class then accounting, eeb, and a handful of other classes combined
awesome class!  great view point on business
took his class twice dropped it mid way once and once in 2 weeks .and i am going to take it again ...can u guess who i am?
excellent teacher. likes to confuse the students, but in the end he helps everyone out to the best of his ability.
Definitely one of the best teachers I've ever had.  He has such a unique way of teaching.
Very passionate towards teaching.  Very iteresting methods.
awesome professor
No Comments
He is very arrogant and has a big ego. People make the class seem very hard when it is not. He picks his favorites also. He comes up with stories that are just ridiculous.

franks incredible. i almost went to RPI because of him.  i took his course when i was in high school and he taught me so much more than i expected.  how good is good enough? frank sets his standard high and it pays off to work hard.

Good class to take. You learn a lot even if it is a lot of work. Lots of team projects, so make sure you have a good group. He acts like he is grading everything very very critically, but then he gives half the class A's.
Frank Wright is the man. He does have an ego and he speaks cryptically at times, but overall he's one of the best professors I've had so far. Taking Intro to Management with anyone else is unwise.
Third highest workload in the MGMT school, but soooo worth it.  You will learn a hell of a lot.
No Comments
Frank wright is very pompous and makes himself out to be gods gift. interesting class but bad personality
Best teacher at this school.  Lot of work in the class, but he is the best teacher.
more homework than their should be but a phenomenal course
No Comments
Frank Wright is the man, and don't you forget it.

Intro to management with this guy was the best class ever.  I am an EMAC major and I plan on getting a minor in management just so I can take all of the classes he teaches.  He is the best proffessor I have ever had.  If you can take this course, do it!
No Comments
One of the best Mgmt professors  at RPI
I felt he was one of the brightest and most fair professors in all of RPI
Best professor I've ever had.  Looked forward to class.
Only talks about himself. I had a long grade dispute with this fellow..
Frank Wright's class is the only one I look forward to.
Take Intro to Management with Frank Write

Cares about the subject matter and students, but isn't the best lecturer.
Tried to make class engaging by encouraging participation with prizes, but spent most of the lectures just reading the slides.
I learned the material best by studying it on my own time. To his credit he is very accessible online to answer questions, particularly before exams.

There are lots of mixed thoughts on Dr. T, personally I had no problem with his style of teaching and I found the textbook reading and labs to be particularly helpful in learning content. He's always on WebEx and is willing to help anyone that asks.

Doctor Tysoe is a great guy, however could improve upon his time management and general teaching skills. His lectures were often unpredictable, which usually provided some form of entertainment happening at some point or another, but also took time away from actual learning and lecture. Always willing to help and has a positive outlook on life.

Tysoe constantly wastes time in class talking about unrelated topics. Most students in my class would sit in the hall and watch Ma's lecture during class (just so they could get the attendance points by being in the building). I taught myself all of Chem 1. If you have to take him- still go to Ma's office hours!

He goes on tangents and rambles for most of the class and before labs. This means he's always behind in lecture and labs start late. He also gets way too close to incoming freshman that it's just weird. Always asking us to DM him something at any possible opportunity. He tries to seem like a nice guy but he just makes me uncomfortable. Stay away.

I really enjoyed Dr. Tysoe, very approachable and will show you around his 3D printer lab if you go to his office hours. But he does tend to go off on tangents which are funny and interesting but for a class that requires attendance via IClicker, it sometimes made class fall behind. Very knowledgable and nice though so all a round a great professor

Dr. Tysoe's a good professor &helps out his students a lot. It's very easy to reach out for help. He often cuts into lab/lecture time with off-topic rants & music. If you read the slides & textbooks before lectures, you should be fine. Overall, a great person but I wish he spent more time in lectures explaining topics rather than telling stories.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Tysoe is a very empathetic person. He gets distracted in lecture easily, assigns mandatory homework with old questions, and usually makes attendance graded as well. He is very easy to reach, be it by email or webex, he'll respond very fast. Despite the harsh opinions of him held by students, he genuinely wants you to succeed.
He was a great person. He really cared if we passed and wanted us all to pass. However he wasn't a good teacher. His lectures weren't exciting and usually consists of a waste of 20ish minutes.

Don't take his class!!! He doesn't know what he's teaching, and he wastes time going of tangents in his lecture. He does only 3 practice exam questions in an hour, which is extremely inefficient, and he did those 3 questions using unnecessary complicated methods.

He makes his lectures mandatory but teaches for barely half the class. He goes on random tangents that make taking notes nearly impossible, as to where it's more time-productive to read the entire textbook before trying to participate in his class. He wants to be the fun, "cool" professor but is just annoying.
DO NOT TAKE TYSOE!!!! He wasted the first 10ish minutes of class playing random rock songs from the 80's and does not teach well at all.

Dr.Tysoe is a good person who wants the class to do well, but the way lectures are structured and presented are not enough to fully understand the material. The pacing and content of lectures are inconsistent sometimes we spend a whole class on 15-20 slides or we go through a full slideshow in another. He really cares but outside study is necessary

Super caring guy who really wants you to succeed. Chem in general isn't a super interesting topic and has a lot of memorization involved. He makes it engaging and will go out of his way to host quality review sessions and long office hours. He does tend to speed up throughout class and go a little too fast to wright the example problem down however

After spending almost 90 days with him, I can say for sure that he is a professor that you don't come by easily. He is very approachable, has a great sense of humor and humility, and very much so wants students to succeed. He did read some of the comments on here, but did a poll in a lecture to feel out where he could improve. He cares 4 & about u.

Holy this guy is actually insanse, what pissed me off is the fact that he tries to manipulate us into thinking that he is trying his best and that he constantly says he only wants best for us, but doesn't give us the resources we need during lecture to be doing well in the class, absolutely dissapointed.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: Dr. Tysoe is a great professor. In other lectures, professors just read from slides, and it gets extremely boring. However, Dr. T provides real life examples, questions, and overall, just keeps the class engaged whether it be by experiments, music (before lecture), 3D objects, candy, etc. He is also very caring and wants success for everyone.

Spent the first 1/4 of class time less than a week before our exam making us take a survey on how much we liked him. It was true/false, and included questions like "Dr. T should retire. He's not an effective educator." We are also so far behind that the entire biochem unit was dropped from the curriculum. Need I say more?
Terrible, awful, useless. Avoid at all costs
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: This guy pisses me off so much, he has no prioritization at all, instead of teaching during lectures, this guy plays games and plays loud music for 10 minutes while throwing 3D-printed toys at students, the worst part is that attendance is required where you don't learn anything until the last 10 minute when he realized he wasted to much time.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Online Savvy

comment: learned absolutely nothing in class, going to lecture was a waste of time, does not explain the topics and just talks about them, does not walk through example questions clearly

Dr. Tysoe is one of the best educators i've ever had the privilege to have. He can be polarizing to some but in all honesty i don't really get it. He brings a lot of life and character to what would otherwise be dull material. If your an incoming freshman, no one on campus will make you feel more welcome and help you while your struggling.
Professor Tysoe is literally the only professor I have had that WANTS every student to pass his class. Most aca

Wholesome dude. Tries to make his lectures not boring and for the most part it works. Not the greatest chemistry professor at RPI but overall he's funny and does a good job teaching the material. Pay attention in lecture and go to other professor's test prep and you'll be alright.

In a brief statement, Professor Tysoe lacks the professional maturity to distinguish between being a lecturer and another person in the room. His lectures are almost incomprehensible between the countless tangents he goes on in the middle of class. He's a very nice individual, but your learning will suffer if you rely solely on his lectures.

Tysoe is literally insane. He got reprimanded for inviting students to his house and although nothing happened, he remains weird. Also if you're looking to take general chemistry with him, I highly recommend a different professor. He's most commonly the professor with the lowest test grades and he'll go on random tangents about his personal life.

Only had for Chem Lab, not lecture. Took over an hour every week to actually begin the lab, and frequently had to rush/ran out of time to submit lab data by end of class. Lab grades were not returned for weeks if not months.

Some people like him, most people don't. He mumbles thru every lecture then goes off and plays a random video. His exam review sessions are useless and all he does is joke with students. Do not take spring sem chem he basically tried to change around everything bc everyone was failing (everyone is still failing). Be prepared to teach yourself.

Steven Tysoe is a dedicated RPI teacher known for saying, "Once a Tysoe student, always a Tysoe student." He goes above and beyond to ease the transition for first-year students. like movie and video game nights and remains a lifelong advocate. It's surprising he isn't tenured yet, given his commitment to the parents, and students alike.

Dr. Tysoe is an amazing professor. He cares more about his students than the school does. He gives everybody the opportunity to have fun and cares about his teaching. In lecture, he tries to make it fun and upbeat so that people pay attention. He is also very funny and personable. Chem 1100 isn't that hard if you try outside of lecture.

This review is strictly on the teaching/lecturing efforts by Dr. T. He is a very nice person and this is not a personal negative review. I have problems with the total and complete lack of any lecturing going on during class time. No teaching is going on during lectures and I do not feel I am learning anything from class. I want to learn Chem :(
He's a great person, super easy to get a hold of outside of class but his lecturing is somewhat lacking. If you keep up with the reading, you'll do fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--Accessible outside class

comment: He's a bit of a rambler but incredibly kind and accommodating. He tries his best to ease the stress that comes along with such a difficult course. Definitely choose Dr. Ma for lecture if possible, but Dr. Tysoe is not a bad professor by any means.

Dr. Tysoe is a fantastic person who clearly cares a lot about his students, but has a tendency to waste lecture/discussion time on tangents or playing music, having to compensate by going extremely quickly during the last few minutes of lecture. Altogether a good professor for a very difficult course, but could do with staying more on-topic.

I had Dr Tysoe for both Chem 1 lecture and lab. I liked his lectures a lot, I found his jokes and tangents nice and kept my attention for the whole block. He also plays music at the beginning and end of class and hosts events around RPI for students. For lab, his tangents can sometimes cut into time actually in the lab or post-lab time.

The course is challenging but organized well, and Dr. T does a decent enough job at giving us the information Dr. Ma wants us to know. Dr. T messes around and goes off on tangents a lot, which make his lectures not the best if you want to get something out of it. Cool guy and very reachable outside of class, not the most effective lecturer, though.

Dr. T is a person that everyone needs to meet at least once. He really does know his stuff, and he does a great job explaining things in rudimentary ways when you don't understand. Sometimes his lectures are a little unserious, but that breaks up the monotony. Take his section of lecture to learn and have fun in chem 1.

Dr. Tysoe is wonderful!! He's always available to answer questions or just to talk. He hosts many events outside of class which are fun to go to and he really cares about his students. I also took his History of Chemistry class and really enjoyed that as well.

Dr. Tysoe loves to help students in many ways for them to succeed and explains things in a way that is clear to everyone. Despite what some have said, he won't go off topic for more than a minute and will not waste time on playing music. He reads the reviews about him on this site too and will improve his performance from the feedback if possible.
I feel like I learned nothing you really have to teach your self to get through the class he is a nice person but not so great at teaching he is off topic all the time
W mans

Dr. Tyso is an awesome professor. He cares a lot about students learning and goes out of his way to answer questions on Webex especially before a test/exam. He's brought candy to lectures and printed hundreds of custom stickers for students.
RIP his old car "The Beast"
(he also holds a retro game thing once a year that's awesome)

Awesome professor, you can tell how much he loves to talk about chemistry in his lectures. Goes on many tangents which some stupids complain about, but I never saw them as an issue. He is very willing to help students and take the time to meet with them if they need extra help.

Dr Tysoe is literally one of the sweetest people I've ever met. He really cares about his students. I had him for my Chem 2 lab, and his explanations during the discussions are really helpful and in-depth. I haven't had him for lecture, and I hear he can go off on tangents sometimes, but it's definitely worth it to take him.

Prof Tysoe is a great guy, cares a lot about his students. Goes on many tangents about the most random things instead of teaching, but very passionate! Brings in snacks sometimes. Relatable guy, cares about ethics. Lastly, one of the tangents he went on was telling us to never hesitate to call him if we're in a hard place. (In terms of depression)

Professor Tysoe is a great lecturer and a kind man. The chemistry one curriculum can be difficult at times, and he is expected to go through the lecture slides fast, but regardless, Professor Tysoe is understanding of his student's abilities. He also cares for the success of the students. He plays music and hands out stickers too!

He's the kind of professor that will answer your last-minute questions about tests the next day at 3AM. I found his lectures not as useful as the textbook, but it was more of my problem because COVID kept me from finishing HS Chem.
Overall, he's the bubbliest professor I've ever met who really enjoys spreading his knowledge and love of chem. 
10/10
Overall fun and engaging teacher. He doesn't make the exams though.

Although he tends to go on tangents, Tysoe is a really funny professor and cares a lot about how you progress and learn. Chemistry is one of the toughest subjects I've ever taken and he's definitely the reason I passed. Thank you Dr. T

Professor Tysoe does his best to keep class entertaining and interesting. Sometimes he can go off on a bit of a tangent, but he absolutely cares about his students. I've seen him open his office doors for people with questions 3 hours early to do whatever he can to help his students succeed. While the class can be difficult, Dr. Tysoe is great.

He liked to get off topic at the beginning of the semester and it was BAD, like 30-45 minutes of the lecture sometimes were random crap. But he did get better later in the semester. Great person just not the best professor

He's a fun guy but if you show up to a lecture looking to learn, you might have a hard time.  I ended up scrolling through the slides outside of lecture to learn the material instead of paying attention in lecture.  It's fun but I wish he concentrated more.

Chem1110 is more work than my other classes in terms of homework and studying

Even though he is a very kind and smart person, his lectures tend to be very unproductive. Learned most of the material myself, and only attended lecture for the iClicker points. If your major is chem-based, then I definitely  wouldn't recommend his lecture, but he can be helpful outside of lecture in his office hours or during lab.

Dr T cares for the Gen Chem students so much! He always will spend extra time out of class to help you, whether it be during his very flexible office hours or on Webex. He brings his jokes and songs to every class with him, but uses them well. He is very knowledgable about chemistry and loves to spread his knowledge and see kids learn! Love ya Dr T

Very caring and funny guy. Gives you lots of mnemonics to help memorize what you need to. Gets behind in lecture, though, so sometimes homework assignments will be on material not covered yet. He used to play music for the first part of lecture but I don't know if he's still allowed to do that.

Dr. Tysoe showed his love for chemistry every lecture and would go out of his way to make the class environment relaxed and fun. He would buy us stickers and make jokes to try and help us stay positive and it made all the difference. This and his clear understanding of chemistry made the generally difficult course not as bad.
spends 20 minutes blasting music at the beginning of lecture and blasts through 200 pages of slides through the rest of the hour and 30 minutes remaining, good guy but not the best teacher

Dr T's lectures are as useless as watching TV. Always talks about unrelated things MID-SENTENCE while teaching. I hardly learned anything useful
If you are in RPI for learning and paid a lot of money for it. Do not waste your 10k on his class

Good guy but often rambles in lectures and gets off-topic. Does hold review sessions the weekend before an exam which helps. This year one exam was scheduled the day after the Superbowl, and another was scheduled the day after Easter. Does give chances for extra credit; understanding when it comes to your grade, sometimes helps to increase it.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Although Tysoe is super sweet, funny, and caring, he almost always goes off on tangents and never ends up covering material needed for lab quizzes or otherwise. Sucks that you have to be there for iClicker because I would skip and attend Ma's lectures instead.
Difficult to pay attention in lectures. He gets distracted very easily.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: I had Tysoe for chem lab. He's terribly nice and wants his students to do well, but he literally does not stop talking ever. I would trust him as a wacky uncle, but the constant chatter just bugged me.
Very knowledgeable but Tysoe's lectures were not very helpful, and I had to use a lot of outside sources to learn the material. Often times we would be behind the other chem classes

I did not find his lectures super helpful, and had to learn the material on my own outside of class. HW and pre labs took quite some time. He checked attendance by having in class questions that we would have to answer (but not have to get correct), for credit. If taking Chem 1, Id recommend Dr. Ma, as he writes the tests.
Dr. T is a great guy. He does go off on many tangents but usually relates them to the lecture. Tests are not hard if you go over notes and labs are easy.

While the online learning format has been a challenge (in my personal experience), Dr. Tysoe always went above and beyond to make sure his students had ample opportunity to get help with chemistry. He spent a good portion of his weekends holding live review sessions which not a lot of professors are willing to do. Very caring and kind person.

Dr. Tysoe loves chemistry. He really wants you to understand the material and offered extra tutoring sessions before exams. He may go on tangents sometimes, and plays music before and after class (he mainly listens to songs from the 70's-80's). Talking to him would only help you, as he loves knowing his students.

Dr. Tysoe is a good professor, although he's like a valve that doesn't close. He frequently goes off on tangents but usually makes them relevant to the material... His aim is to get everyone to love chemistry as much as he does. He's fine at lecturing, but is especially helpful when you have specific questions. He likes to know his students.

Tysoe is funny and knows a lot about chemistry, but O Chem lab is generally a very difficult course. It's easy to lose many points of pre-lab and post-lab reports, but he gives feedback so hopefully you can avoid mistakes in the future.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I love Tysoe. He is amazing. I am excited to have him for Chemistry 1200.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Honestly, he's an all around amazing professor.  He cares not only about his students' success in the classroom, but also in their everyday lives.  His lab is filled with great jokes, good music, and an easy to understand breakdown of the material.  He's a fantastic professor who goes above and beyond for his students.

I had him for a chem II lab.  He likes to tell a lot of stories during the "question" portion, and he objectively wastes a lot of time in this regard.  There has been labs where we could have finished the post lab that day, but started the lab late because of tangents he went on.
Very well involved in lecturing. Is really sweet and will help you with anything you need in chemistry.

Dr. Tysoe is one of my favorite professors at RPI! He clearly cares for each of his students and genuinely wants you to learn something in his class. He's very funny and a great lecturer! His careful explanation of the discussion questions really helps to clear up difficult topics.
His jokes can be funny, and he's a good teacher and explains everything well

Dr. Tysoe is one of the funniest people I have encountered. He is a lab professor so his job is basically to do discussion questions which he explains thoroughly albeit a little slowly. His jokes are hysterical in the cringe-worthy pun way. So glad I got him as a lab professor though!

Truly cares for all of his students, and while his lab lectures may take awhile, he does it to ensure that his students have all of the information that they need in order to do well on exams. He keeps things light and engaging with goofy jokes, that are somehow always chemistry related. I had him for CHEM 1&2.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: A great professor! He is always doing his best to engage the class in different ways and is super helpful in office hours!

Lab instructor for CHEM 1100-07; he is a bit goofy but you can really tell he genuinely cares about his students. This is a rare quality to have in modern college education setting. If you like bad puns and dad jokes, he is the guy for you. He takes his time on problems, so if you need it to go slowly then his lectures are perfect. Really nice guy.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Lab instructor for my CHEM 1100-07 and he makes boring chem lectures worse. Everything gets dragged out and he goes on a irrelevant tangent every problem. It took us 1 hour to make it through 4 example problems. He makes the boring material unbearable with his awful puns and jokes. The work load is equivalent to all of the other lab blocks. Um, No.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Always very helpful to me and answered my questions. Assignments have very clear grading criteria and I would recommend watching the recorded lectures, as most of the content came straight out of them in my experience. Was very understanding when I transferred in at the beginning of the semester and gave me enough time to catch up to the class.

I'm switching majors so it's kind of sad to say I won't be taking this class anymore, however the professor and TAs are very helpful during the hours you go in, they won't scold you for the stuff you don't know so please just ask for help. The grading rubrics are pretty clear aswell.

this guy is definitely a strange bird out of RPIs faculty but he genuinely does care about the success of his students, but it can be difficult to notice since he oversees like 50 sections. even still, he surprised me when he actually remembered the names of me and many others in my class. the class is decent to understand if you watch the videos

It's a reversed classroom so all of the lectures are online and you just follow along with the assignments given. There are in class "labs" every three weeks where you only have about an hour to do an assignment but you get the entire library of videos to use while doing them. If you ever have trouble with an assignment he knows how to fix it

Morris teaches through video lectures that can sometimes take an hour or two to watch fully, however you can submit everything online so you don't have to go to class except for ILAs. The actual 3D models do take a lot of work, however if you work together with other people they can be completed in a reasonable amount of time.

Be prepared to spend hours building models and watching lecture videos. I took both 1200 and 1400. I loved both and learned a lot. If you don't know how to ask for help you will have a hard time, but I found him accessible and friendly. Just show that you've given an effort before asking. I used my knowledge in a future internship! Very satisfied.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: I had Dr. Morris for both CAD and Comms. Lecture videos are useful and give you the info you need to do the whole course. Despite his reputation, he showed up to every session, and is extremely helpful if you ask him a question. CAD is a work-intensive class, but Dr. Morris is a great resource to help you get through it.

This class was essentially self taught through lecture videos, which granted were helpful, the only time you would ever see Jeff Morris was when he would take the first 5 minutes of class to speed run the entire assignment that took you a week to finish just to vanish like a fart in the wind.

You follow videos online each week, then the class is for the TAs to grade/help with anything. The videos have the answer to literally any question. Sit by the door so the TAs grade you first and you can leave within 10 minutes. Prof. knowns the answer to EVERY question. There aren't any tricks. If you watch the videos, you can do the HW/quizzes
Hes a nice guy just know that all the learning will be through his youtube videos

If you're a woman, he's a little bit of a misogynist but not actually. He's really nice and if you have a problem, he'll often just fix it for you. The cad part of the class is the only truly difficult part but if you get in the groove of things, it's not bad at all. It's really the TA's running the class but Dr. Morris is always around somewhere.

Its a 1 credit course with a 4 credit workload. The professor only teaches through videos, but everything in the videos is taught well. He is very helpful in class in checking work before submission, so recommend doing that. Most assignment are difficult, and usually get harder as the course goes on. Its a different style of teaching for me.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: I got lucky, he was in every class. He'll help you if you ask and tbh it was very helpful. The class itself is interesting but don't take 1200 unless you have to. NX sucks but it gets better (kinda). The TAs pretty much ran the class even though Dr Morris was literally there. At least TRY to watch the lectures and START THE FINAL PROJECT ASAP

I understand why many people don't love him, but I think he's great. As someone who took 1400 and 1200, the content wasn't too bad. If you have him when 1400 isn't going on at the same time, chances that he's there is high. He does run FEA office hours during class sometimes, so he might be occupied on occasion.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: All the lectures are online and you might never actually see Jeff. The ILAs are tough and stressful. He takes a while to grade. If he does show up to class, you can ask him any cad question and he will know how to help. Start the final project early and if you have questions, ask them. Everything builds so make sure you understand the basics.

What a joke of a professor. Was in class once, maybe for 5 minutes and never saw him again. We were only assigned videos to watch and work to do. Was rude in emails asking for assistance and the TA's ran the class. The way this class was structured was to make it the easiest for this man never to care about his students or to teach the material.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment: It seemed like he didn't really want to teach, he prerecorded all his lectures and had you go through them for the homework. I will say he knows his stuff (because he wrote the software) and will help you if you ask. He can be condescending at times. As long as you get the homework done, you can be out of the class within 10 mins.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Saying that I had Dr. Morris for my CAD class might be an overstatement because he almost never actually showed up to our class. There are a lot of sections of CAD, so I understand that he might have to miss sometimes for some of his higher level classes, but his presence was rare. The grading in this class is also very harsh.

Morris gets a lot of crap but if you go to the classes (literally any of them doesn't have to be yours) you can easily get 100 on all the assignments. Siemens NX is extremely aggravating but by the end of the course its pretty easy to get the hang of.

Look if you asked him to help you with whatever CAD project you had, he'd straight up do it for you. The TAs were hit or miss so sometimes Jeff is all you have. Only thing is when he doesn't show up to class you're kinda done for. Just don't procrastinate and you'll be fine in CAD.

A few pieces of for when taking this class is 1) to join his office hours he will help you fix any of your problems 2) Look for the undergraduate TA because they are the ones that will actually know what they are doing. 3) if you do not need to take this class do not take it will save you a headache.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: This class is definitely a lot of out of class work but if you watch and follow along with the lecture videos every week, you can easily grasp the content. Plus the TAs will always check your homework for you and help if you go to class so there's really no way to get bad grades on them.

I love this man. He always shows up to class, helping everyone (mostly white guys). If you become his TA, expect to do absolutely no work, as Morris completely does all of it. If you want an easy one-credit class, this is the way to go. (He gives plenty of extra credit opportunities if you meet him during his office hours). Woohoo Dr. Morris!!

I love this man. He always shows up to class, helping everyone (mostly white guys). If you become his TA, expect to do absolutely no work, as Morris completely does all of it. If you want an easy one-credit class, this is the way to go. (He gives plenty of extra credit opportunities if you meet him during his office hours). Woohoo Dr. Morris!!!

Morris was present for only the first class, just to read the syllabus. The TA's will be actually teaching and administrating the class. All lecture content is youtube vids by Morris. Grading is harsh. It's a good course, teaches you to teach yourself which is good, but I can't give much kudos to Morris. Work is much more than 1 credit class.

He only came to the first day of class and I've only seen him a handful of times around campus since then. I didn't mind the format of the course, you just have to hold yourself accountable and actually watch the lecture videos because that's where he explains everything. Hopefully you get good TA's or have helpful friends.

Dr. Morris teaches CAD using a flipped classroom model with prerecorded lecture videos. While some in-lab assignments can be challenging and NX is not ideal, ENGR-1200 is a great course that also teaches you time management and independence.  If you watch the videos and ask the TAs for help, you will find that Dr. Morris's presence is not critical.
He just DO NOT teach. I did not see him once in the whole semester. The officer hours are now turn to online. Tough grader and never knows where you loss the point.

Good ol' Jeff here teaches through a lecture series he recorded years ago and has not once shown up to class. He also schedules office hours at the same time as class and is rude if you try to use them. Assignments are also barely relevant to "lecture" material. All in all the only thing I learned from CAD is dealing with frustration.

Can't tell you what his face looks like. Even the final was graded by the TA. He knows his stuff, but does not teach it. He never showed up to class after the first day and left everything to his TAs. 1 credit class but 2-3 credits of work. Everyone was upset, disappointed, or both when showing up to class. Could be great, but sadly does not teach.

Can count on one hand the number of times I've seen Dr. Morris all semester. Class run by TAs, grading criteria not always clear. Lectures to be watched before class, highly recommended to watch for CAD and skip for everything else. Attendance not required but helpful to get work checked over. Have heard mixed results from attending office hours.

Morris will show up on the first day and then never again (unless you find him at hockey games).TAs grade everything; the class can be hard, and even they don't know what they're doing. Now everyone's confused. The class is entirely taught with outdated videos. It was a waste of time for me, so beware of this class if it's required for your major.
He never once showed up to class, and the entire course is run by the TAs. I went to his office hours once and he was extremely rude.
Almost hated as much as Shirley Ann jackson

He didn't teach Engineering Communications, the TAs did. Showed up to the first class for half an hour, never saw him in person again. Content was taught through old youtube videos using an outdated version of NX. CAD part of the course was way too much work, but it was a breeze once we got to word/excel/labview. Take this course instead of 1200.

https
://www.tiktok.
com/t/ZTRm4ogeq/
Refused to round up a grade that was extremely close to the next letter grade. Threatened to decrease my grade when I asked him to regrade an assignment.

Man literally does not show up to class. There are video lectures that were made in like 2008 that use outdated software. Office hours are during class for some reason. Do not let Box grade your assignments. Have the TAs grade it instead.

Has the absolute worse grading metric, volume, since he contributed to the software that he teaches he expects everyone to use the features the exact same way he would when even the TA's don't even know the right answer. I've had four separate assignments where the TA's had no idea what the problem was. He hasn't even taught in years, just videos
the class is almost entirely taught by TAs and requires much more work than one would expect for a 1 credit course
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Professor Morris does not teach. He just shows up the first day and then leaves you in the hands of the TAs. I was lucky to have a few very helpful TAs, so I did fine in the class. Just whatever you do, avoid Morris's office hours if at all possible. He will do everything possible to make you feel like an idiot.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Morris never showed up to class. During office hours, he was very condescending and offered little help. Grades harshly (even though guidelines aren't clear) and requires every assignment to be done in a very specific way (which he does not tell you; you're expected to just figure it out) even if a different way would also be right. TA's ran class.

Doesnt show up to his own class. The entire class is taught by his poor TA's who are doing their best and will try to help you but some things they just don't know. In which case you can either take the L and lose the points or go to his office hours where he will be outright aggressive, mean and rude towards you for simply trying to pass his class

This guy is an absolute scummy person. He belittles you with every chance he gets. If you ever want to feel bad about yourself, go to his office hours.
