His lectures were clear and easy to follow. Has a great sense of humor and often uses current events in the news as examples to explain economic concepts. The class was pretty easy and straightforward, but definitely interesting. Definitely a great professor.

Quite possibly the best professor at RPI.  Starts lectures off with a section on current events where he applies course material to the real world.  I learned a lot of exciting stuff from this course, particularly during a time when the economy was in a slump.  If you're taking an ECON course, definitely look for Jones!  You won't regret it.

He is a great teacher for intro to econ although he just follows the slides he explains them well. If you read the book and then go to class it helps tremendously. He is also a really funny guy and the class flies by.

He's probably one of the most conservative teachers you'll meet, but that's right down my alley. If you read the book, show up for lecture, and do the pretests, you don't have any excuse for not getting a B. However, it seems like most people taking the class tend to skip one of those things; I ended up with a 97% pre-curve.

I never liked economics in high school. Taking this class changed my perspective. This is especially owing to the way Prof. Jones thought the class as well as the excellent textbook used. Definately take this class from him. If you understand the material, tests aren't hard.

Actually didn't feel that he was quite as easy at people said, but I think that's because I don't like WebCT tests.  Explains material well but you have to pay attention to him or read the book if you want to do well in the class.
Amazing teacher.  He taught me so much about economics that I started reading the WSJ just to get my daily capitalism in me.  I would highly recommend him.  Bob Jones is the man...
Take this prof for intro -- he's the best. Very clear. Makes class fun. Connects the material to the real world.
Explains the material well, and the course is organized very well.  Jones rocks!

Excellent professor, explained the material clearly and consicely while making real world connections.  Not afraid to joke around with the class a little which made it far more welcoming.  Quizzes and tests are multiple choice on WebCT and pretty easy if you read the reviews online and take the practice quizzes.  Wish he was teaching managerial!

He's the only Econ Prof that can teach managerial econ, the other professors just throw up equations and don't explain them. He explains the equations and makes you laugh while doing it. I wish he taught more econ courses.
awesome professor. if you ever have to take the class take it with him you'll actually learn.
A great class! Really taught the material well and showed an interest in helping us learn. Awesome guy, really funny.
A vey lazy guy....the grades are only based on tests.  If you study you'll get a good grade.
great teacher, enjoyable, and a isnt a communist.
kind of a boring class... read of of powerpoint slides online
Easiest class ever
great professor, very energetic and funny. explains the subject very well.
awesome prof. second time i am in his class and i am enjoying it... very clear, very energetic, helpful and funny...
awesome prof. great guy.

Had Jones for Intro and Money and Banking.  Great professor!  Isn't a firm believer in final exams during finals week.  Tests aren't the easiest things but they're more than fair.  Funny and applicable stories in lecture.  You'll learn the stuff too.
best prof ever
Easy, funny guy, has a story on every topic. Lectures were pretty much out of the book.
Awesome prof, he's cool and funny. Always has great stories.
No Comments
One of the best professors I have had at college.
No Comments
Bob Jones is a super prof. His classes are well taught.

She was my advisor several years ago and was nice when talking on the phone. However, she doesn't read your emails or responded to just half of it. I swear she is a drunk. 

All her feedback and comments as well as email replies are lazy, soulless, ambiguous and the list can go on. She also has zero empathy for any problem you might have
STAY AWAY

Avoid if you can, I noticed most of the good reviews about this professor came about 15 years ago. This professor needs to realize that students are paying thousands of dollars to learn, not to have to pay thousands more for tutoring. Do not expect a kind response if you email her that you are running late on an assignment.

Ask a question why you get marked down and she only reiterates the directions(mind you, they were followed exactly). She doesn't like when in a project you solve for a value asked for and the process you used is different than what she thought, even though it's still right and didn't say what so ever how to solve. Beware, this should be criminal

Has unclear of unstated expectations, refuses to help students when asked. Her feedback is unkind and unnecessarily harsh when providing feedback. Won't actually explain the problems or instructions, instead cutting and pasting the original directions while implying students are too lazy and stupid to understand.

I just started her class. We have to use MML and have to complete 65 questions (with 5 parts each on a lot of them) that are ungraded before we can even access the actual graded homework. Stupidest thing ever. Fortunately I work full time and have a group project for the entirety of my other class. Absolutely ridiculous.

She is at Excelsior now and she is the worst. She is horrible with communicating her expectations and when you ask for more guidance she blows you off. She is a really strict grader even on the smallest assignments. Her expectations for her students is 40 hrs a week dedicated to her class.. So goodluck having a job. I would not recommend this class
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: She is knowledgeable, but she does not like to teach.  Often will not answer questions and simply tells  you to look in the textbook. Does not respond to emails or phone calls in a timely manner. Avoid if possible.

Empire State College has a tendency of hiring professors who are either fired from other institutions or are really cheap.  She is one of those professors who cant find job anywhere else.  She is very disrespectful, never replies to student emails and when asked to talk over the phone she always declines.  She DOES NOT offer any assistance at all.

I found her course very frustrating.  She would not get back to me in a timely manner at all, over a week would go by without getting a response email after sending multiple emails.  I did not find her helpful at all when trying to learn and she did not try and help me succeed at all even after asking for help.
Very difficult class and the professor did not provide assistance when asked prior to grading assignments.  Professor graded all assignments harshly with vague feedback.

Says another review: "good teacher for students who have already had a Calc BC background and just need a review of that material before starting higher level math classes." Umm, classes aren't for review, they're for LEARNING. You can't teach a class expecting students ALREADY know everything there is to learn! It's sad she hasn't been fired yet.

Definitely the worst class I've ever taken.  She is not very helpful, and her quizzes do not prepare her students for upcoming exams.  She always confuses herself when solving examples in class, and leaves the students even more confused.  Study at least a week prior to her exams.  With that being said, I do not recommend this professor at all.
Excellent Professor.She put all her notes online and her classes are easy to follow. Exams are not hard, and you do not need too much extra reading for her class.

Irritating and frustrating professor. She was NOT a good lecturer, and she seemed to decide that showing up to class wasn't important until the department told her to! Her graduate TA taught a ton of the lectures. Tests are unnecessarily difficult. She tries to trick you and grades harshly. She doesn't even have office hours in person. Avoid her.

Taking 5 classes as a freshmen with any other teacher I would have recieved a 4.0 her class dragged my gpa down the entire semester until the point where I rallied 10 or 15 pissed of student to complain to the department head. If these other rating were true, they no longer are. It is not a challenge, it is a waste of time. You will not learn.

When she did show up to class, which she decided not to about 6 times over the semester, her notes were colorful and appear as though they would be helpful but in reality she jumps back and forth writing unintelligible notes on top of her other ones. Her tests are unreasonable and do not reflect notes or homework, and she is generally unkind.

Lecture notes are very much unclear to the point of unreadability. Does one example usually for each new concept in class, then expects you to use the book pretty much as your professor. Says things like "e of stuff is the same as the derivative of e of stuff." Just tell me some actual math.

She makes a lot of mistakes while teaching. She is very unorganized and a lot of times the class has to correct her. Her level of helpfulness extends to telling her class that they should get help from their math mentors and go to tutoring. Tests are unneccesairly difficult compared to the homework. Unless youre bright you will not get an A.
Excellent professor. If you try, you will succeed.
good teacher

Prof. Blue is very nice, yet somewhat disorganized. Lectures are sometimes boring, especially if you have seen the material. Exams are not too challenging. She is a good teacher for students who have already had a Calc BC background and just need a review of that material before starting higher level math classes.

Professor Blue is fantastic. She is amusing and gives extremely detailed notes. There are a lot of quizzes, but she gives you resources that will make you well prepared. She is by far my favorite professor.
not bad pretty easy and straightforward diffy q
Excellent Professor. She explains things extremely clearly and puts all of her notes online. Her exams are very straight forward too.
Very helpful and very clear examples. The class was quite useful as far as being applicable in the real world.

Great professor for calculus 2. Her online notes are color coated and she relaly makes sure that you understand the material. I went to her for extra help and I pulled up my test grade 3 letter grades. I recommend her for anyone that likes detailed notes and doesn't mind attending lecture. STUDY FOR NPC QUIZZES!
Yall.....lol her favorite word
I took her calculus and differential equations classes. She is an incredible instructor.
Outstanding professor.  Cared about her students like her own kids.  Fun, interesting, outstanding at explaining material.  Get her if you can!!

Considering that she is teaching calculus one (possibly the most uninteresting classes) she does a wonderful job of keeping things fresh and fun. Clicker questions are something to look forward to with her, rather than something inconvenient and to be dreaded.
Kind and enthusiastic, and strong mannered. Very outgoing.

Great professor.  Direct in what she wanted, but very clear and concise in the way she taught Calculus 1.  If you cared, you did well.  Easily approachable and very helpful lectures.  Non-mandatory homework which was never collected.  Nice jokes and wisecracks too! Awesome overall.
Awesome class. Got an A...as long as you go to class, then you're set. REally.
really great prof..has office hours from 9-11pm the night before the test in McNeil.. right when you figure out you need help...laid back biker chick...cant get better than that

she skims down the material to get rid of the unecessary details which is fine for a bit but then Cal II arrives and you dont know anything. Nice teacher, easy to work with and you end up with a better grade then you think
Shes pretty cool.... She tries really hard to put calc into understandable terms and is pretty fair with her grading.... Tests are SO EASY!!! Good Luck!
Jennifer Blue is the best. She's very cool, and her method of teaching is very effective.
No Comments

All teachers should be like Jen Blue. She's very down to Earth and approachable. She also likes to "cut the crap". She is very practical and her tests are fair. She doesn't play the demoralizing "I gotcha game". She's easy IF you've taken Calc I before, but not so much if you haven't.
She is really awesome. I did really bad on all the tests and did really well on the final and i got a b overall. but she is also very helpful in and out of class
Very good teacher.  Went into calc 1 with no previous clac classes from HS.  Clear to understand.
She is the coolest teacher at RPI.....she actually has a personality!! wow, what a concept. Definitely try to get her; she kicks ass!!

GREAT PROF!...LOVED her class.  VERY HELPFUL...begs for you to come to office hours.  I have one word for her: STUFF!  (ull understand if u take her class)  GET THIS PROF IF YOU CAN.  Final took 30 mins!...
Professor Blue is very helpful and will work with you on anything and everything you ask her for.
Great teacher

A very fair teacher who explains the subject well. She doesnt try to trick you on tests, but instead just wants to make sure you know the material. Easy and a great refresher course if you have already taken calculus before.

Jen Blue is awesome.  She cancels class all the time and her exams take 20 minutes, if that.  She is very straightforward and teaches you exactly what you need to know- nothing more, nothing less.  And she's young and crazy, so her lectures are definitely an experience.

SHES AWESOME! SHE KICKS ASS SOOO BAD!!!! hard professor but always comprehensible....unlike the rest of the professors at rpi. finally a professor who makes sense and teaches the topic in a straightforward manner.

Great professor from Texas!! Finally someone who says "y'all!" I miss southerners, so it's nice to have a redneck somewhere. She knows her math, and understands we don't care about trivial terms and whatnot. Engineers don't need the mathemeticia

Very easy professor, teaches the essentials and no more, often cancels class and recitation, tests are easy as well. Doesn't prepare you as well for further classes as I'd like, the downside to the easy class.
very good teacher, explains material well, makes up easy tests, overall a good teacher
Made things  very easy to understand and very straight forward
Very nice teacher, makes lecture interesting, tests take you 1/2 the time to finish (while getting an A), nuff said.
very easy!!! and clear, cancels class often which is great! she also isnt strict w/ her stuff
Very easy teacher, the final took me about 35 minutes to finish.
If you don't get an A in her Calc class there is something wrong with you.  Best calc teacher!
Best Calc Professor

Scott is an awesome teacher i had him for ma 060 and i would recommend him to anyone that is struggling in math or wants a good teacher that actually cares about you passing. The homework is normal as any math class. Don't skip class in order to understand yet if you do he will post notes or homework online.  Great teacher.
Great lecturer

Professor Dwyer's lectures are very fast paced and can be hard to follow. Make sure you go to office hours though because he is very helpful there. Tests are tough. Labs are difficult because the material is only taught that same day so there is not time to learn it. Dwyer knows his stuff and is concerned with helping students learn the material.

First, I admit he is a great professor. But there are many downsides his course, due to the limited space I'll just be brief: fast pace in lecture; offer quizzes at lecture which Persans don't this semester; if you need to take this course, make sure you place the lecture and lab at least 2 hours apart so you can work on lab before, lab is a lot

Dwyer is a great teacher. He lectures very well and explains things really well. Each lecture he goes over material learned in the previous lecture which is super helpful. You definitely want him for Physics 2.

Prof. Dwyer is one of the best I've had so far at RPI.  He's a great lecturer and uses lots of real-world examples and applications to explain concepts.  In Physics II, you can't find anyone better, and I'd recommend him wholeheartedly.
Very good prof, he also writes labs that making fun of MIT and liberal arts colleges

Prof. Dwyer is great in that he is actually a TEACHER, not just a guy who talks at you about his subject. His explanations are thorough, his lecture experiments are practical applications to course material, and he is extremely personable. Plus he has an awesome mustache.

Dwyer is a no BS prof;however if you're willing to learn he will go out of his way to help you.Physics II is a hard course and if you're not willing to put the work in, you won't do well(unless if you're a genius).I got a 63 on the first test and a 97 on the last test-Dwyer helped me quite a lot;he helps you if you take the initiative.Great teacher

Awesome professor. Even if you're not a big fan of physics, Prof. Dwyer's lectures are entertaining, highly informative, and interesting. His use of written notes will help you learn much more than Powerpoints will teach you. He is very approachable and friendly, and will gladly answer any questions you may have.

Worst physics teacher I've ever had. You have to copy projector notes otherwise you only have the textbook to review, so you don't have any time to understand physics! Activities were also meaningless. Even I got them all right I don't know what's the point of it. He didn't reply emailed questions, and usually just disappeared during the activity.

Professor Dwyer keeps attention during lecture by taking commercial breaks to give awesome demonstrations.  He tells stories that make the material memorable.  And he explains difficult course material concisely.  Although Physics II is still a difficult course, Professor Dwyer keeps it straightforward.  He is an amazing teacher.

Dwyer is a great teacher. He knows his stuff and loves to answer your questions. Magnetics and electricity aren't my strongest suites but he still made it good going through and learning them. He's great to talk to out of class as well. He'll help clear up anything you need as well as be a great person to talk to in general.

Dr. Dwyer is a wonderful professor. I can't stand Physics yet I enjoy class with him. He's very helpful, very smart, and very open to questions. He also likes to have "commercials" where he gives real-life examples of how things work. Great guy!

Dwyer's really cool, really knows his stuff, and really enjoys teaching students. He chews you out pretty hard if youre ever late and he's got some pretty high standards but he makes sure his students reach them.

He was a great professor. He really tries to make everybody understand the subject. If you ask him questions he will answer them. He loves the subject matter and enjoys teaching. He does a great job at describing the topics and their relevance.
horrible person, bases every student on any one single person who might have done something wrong. Dont even try to talk to him because he is a rude snob
Dwyer is tied with schmidt for the best professor at rpi.  He's extremely clear and his notes are excellent.  Goes out of his way to help you.

Amazing professor, no other way to put it. Unlike other professors too caught up in their research hes JUST here to teach. He writes all the notes out for you every class period, and gives great review packets before each exam. His teaching skill is reflected in his tests averages being almost 20 points higher than other sections.
Great Professor. He will help you get the grade you want. His class is slightly more demanding but you will do well in the tests if you listen to him
Scott Dwyer was one of my least favorite professors at RPI.  If you are a nerd and love physics that you'll probly love him.  but for the average student... try to avoid him.
It's more important to Dwyer that you get a good grade than your actually learning the material.  This could be a good thing depending on your preference.
Simply put, he is the Man.

Very good teacher, presents the material well. The rest of the sections use prepared powerpoint, while Dwyer writes all the notes out for you in class. His classes have the highest average of all the sections.

He makes the class fun and is a overall great guy, and most importantly, he really knows how to teach.  The only drawback to his class is that the homeworks are graded very hard.  I probably would have gotten an A in his class if the homework rubric was the same as the other classes.

Dwyer absolutely blew me away with how amazing of a professor he was. After an absolutely horrid physics 1 experience, Dwyer completely redeemed the physics department as a whole. Never has a professor gotten my interest in a class, conveyed the material so well, and been such a good guy. RPI needs to use him as a model!!!
The best Physics II prof. Had the highest exam scores out of all the other sections.

I don't have enough words to convey my satisfaction and impression of Dwyer. He does an awesome job with the lectures and exam prep- it makes learning pretty easy. One caveat: he is pretty tough on grading homework but this is a tiny price for what you get for signing up for his physic sections.

Excellent professor. I actually learned the material IN CLASS for once. He explains things perfectly.  Top 3 profs I've had. There is one downside tho. His class grades the homework like crazy. I've gotten a 100 once on a HW assignment, and I try very hard on them. In Physics I, I used to get 100s on all my HW w/out trying much. Still amazing tho.
If you want to do well in physics 2 definatly take it from this professor!  He cares about his students and their gtrades...and he does everything possible to help you do well!
Awesome teacher

Dwyer is great.  Get him, seriously.  A little more work that the other professors, but totally worth it.  He's a really nice guy and an EXCELLENT professor, one of the best at RPI for sure.  I wish he taught physics 1 too.  Prepares you for the exams really well, gives out study packets.  A little bitter about IBM, but it's ok.  Totally rules!

far and away the best teacher I have had at RPI.  He cares so much about students understanding material, and shows it with the best tests scores of all sections consistently. He makes a serious effort to  get to know his students,and he is an extremely out going nice guy and an excellent teacher.

Dywer is a great teacher.  He steers away from the powerpoint and that helps students immensely.  He also knows students names and knows their difficulties.  Execellent in class demonstrations.  Made me like physics again after a terrible physics 1 class.
Seek this guy out for your pysics classes. He is the most helpful prof i've ever had. He'll care more about your grades than your parents
This guy is freakin amazing.  Extremly helpful, easy to understand, clear notes, makes the class somewhat interesting.  Plus he give a well detailed packet before the exam to study from.  Excellent.
Dwyer is Amazing
this guy is the man. hes had the highest test avgs in his classes for a couple years in a row.  hes english and speaks it well.
He is extremely friendly and willing to help you out.  His notes are excellent, and he knows his stuff and is very clear when teaching.
what i can say is that his sections had the highest test average overall
An awesome physics professor.  He learned my name, that's a big thing to me.  He really cares about you as an individual and wants to help.
Cool guy.  Tough to get an A but his review packets are amazing.  He'll know your name if you go to class.
Nice guy, great teaching and goes out of his way to help you.
Possibly the best professor at rpi!

Scott is the best professor I've had so far at RPI (2 yrs). He explains all concepts and presents material in an understandable fashion. Gives out great review packets, and MAKES HIS OWN notes, in addition to the powerpoints. Gt his section for an A!!

Dwyer was by far the best teacher I've had so far at this school. He explained things thoroughly, but clearly. Plus he's a funny guy and has some great stories about the people at IBM. Definitely sign up for his section if you can!!!!
Great Teacher...best one to have.
awesome teacher. easily the best i've ever had. went out of his way to help the students.
he's easily the best physics professor here. very helpful, knowledgeable and genuinely cares about his students. thanks prof. dwyer.
Great guy----has a passion for teaching.

PROF. DWYER IS THE BOMB DIGGITY.  If you get the opportunity to take Physics II with him, DO IT FOR YOUR OWN GOOD.  He gives out awesome review packets before the test and also just generally is very good at explaining difficult concepts with examples. A+
He's genuinely concerned about the welfare of the students.
Dwyer DOMINATES Physics II.  'Nuff said.
If you're going to take Physics 2, Dwyer is the guy for you.  All that time he spent in the real world (with real physics) really shows.
Great proffesor. Speaks perfect english, and actually makes the stuff interesting.
Excellent lectures and demonstrations, very easy to ask him questions

Extremely knowledgeable of every single tool inside of the lab. Amazing and sarcastic personality, is extremely funny, and you come out of the class with true knowledge of various tools. Don't be afraid to ask him questions, and there's more than ample amount of open hours provided.
John is a really funny guy who's always around to lend you a hand if you're stuck or need help fixing a problem. The class is really easy if you show up, and a lot of fun!

John is very knowledgeable on all things Processes, but sometimes his sarcasm and dry humor can rub you the wrong way. The course was restructured this semester, but the course material wasn't fully updated, leading to confusion on what was expected of us. Very time consuming class for a 1 credit pass/fail, but you will learn a lot.
John is my favorite prof at RPI so far. He has a strong personality --- expect him to be quippy --- but his class is an easy A and absolutely rules.

Great Course with a great professor. It is a major change of pace from the typical lectures in most courses, and instead, learning how to use the heavy machines in base engineering. The professor is very funny, and also informative of what your supposed to do.
The class is easy and the lab manual tells you everything you need to know. Just read it a bit beforehand and ask questions when you need help. The TA's are very nice.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Hilarious--Graded by few things

comment: easy class

You have to be a real muppet to fail this class. Also, nothing the negative comments say is true coming from someone who asked him a crap ton of questions. If you are also in IED, you can go ask him for advice on how to do things and he will give you fantastic ideas and let you use his machines to complete it. Overall very knowledgeable guy.

He is such an awesome guy -- pretty much an overgrown child who likes making things and I mean that in the nicest way possible. He'll let you use anything in the shop and just finish your project and you'll get an A. If the TAs don't know what to do, he always does.

I personally didn't care for this class, but as long as you actually read the manual and try things before you ask him for help, he's super helpful. He can be a little intimidating, but just remember you aren't the first or last person to ask him for help. Do your labs and finish your project on time and you will be fine.
He was extremely knowledgeable and respected by his students

John's class was my favorite class last semester. He sends out a manual at the beginning of the semester to help with the machines, schedules of the other labs, and more. You only have to attend class until your project is completed and when you are scheduled for the welding and plastics labs.  TAs and John are very fun and helpful.

John has some hilarious stories and does everything he can to help you learn on your own, especially letting you make mistakes and making you find answers in the lab manual. Passing his class is easy, just show up and participate every week and put effort into your lab report. You also learn a lot from helping your partner.

This was a Pass/No Credit class and was extremely easy. John grades the projects lightly. He comes off rude when you ask for help but just ask the TAs. Read the manual though because all the answers are there.

John is friendly, full of stories and cracks witty jokes to lighten up the class. He is always ready to help if you get stumped, however the year's project instructions are pretty easy and detailed in the manual. Make sure to complete the training video/test in the beginning of the year, he becomes a stickler about it later on.
John is a jerk.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: I really enjoyed professor John's classes. He always had good stories to tell and plenty of knowledge to share with others. He was always willing to help students whenever they got stuck with the projects, but keep an eye on the safety course at the beginning; I forgot and he made me go back to the dorm and do it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Hilarious

comment: This is THE machine shopman. He can be callous and rough, however, he has got your best interests at heart. He can seem intimidating but will help you in a moments notice (e.g lathe difficulties). However, GET YO LABS DONE. For engr processes, if you don't finish the Cannon Barrel Project, the two labs, the report AND the final - he will fail you.
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Perfectly fits the trope of experienced machinist. He is funny, and very intelligent in the sphere of machining. Highly reccomend if you can get him. He grades by if your final project looks vaguely like what its supposed tofrom 10ft away.

Just read the manual and you will be fine. He wont answer some questions because he wants you to learn and figure it out on your own. If you are really struggling though he will help you. Really hard to fail.

John was really funny for Engineering Processes. He is very helpful but loves to mock you if you ask a question the lab manual answers. His manual is very long but very easy to follow. Class is easy if you get everything done on time. Very hard to fail. Don't even need to go to your assigned lab meeting unless your have a specific lab that day.

Was not helpful at all. Anytime you ask a question, he refuses to answer it directly and will refer you to the class manual. Become friends with your TA's, because they will provide any help that you need.

Interested in safety first, but challenges you to learn on your own; does not feed you answers.  It can be tough to ask questions because he expects you to know what you're asking (not just.. help what do I do next).
Good guy and always helpful when you need, though a bit sarcastic if you are asking a stupid question.

John isn't a bad guy, but he's quite a bit nicer to girls than to guys.  If you're a guy, he'll probably make you feel dumb at least once during the class.  He expects people to at least have common sense and be safe, so do that.  Processes is pretty easy though, as long as you remember your safety glasses and your instructions every class.

Had him for processes. I only talked to him a few times because I soon realized that he was not very helpful and a bit of a stuck up brat. He expects you to know the answer to every question, even if you are the one asking, otherwise he'll try to make you look stupid.

Worst professor I have ever had. He constantly made fun of my accent and questions. I was the first one in my section to finish the project but still was made fun of. The TA's are amazing. Anything you need they can help you

Great hands on guy. Yeah he yells a bit, and **** a lot, but you can't deny that he's good at what he does-machining. Suck it up. The final is just from the lab manual, and you surely can get a lab report somewhere. And yeah, it's pass/fail.

He's a suck up for girls. If you are a girl, he'll know your name within the first week, if you are a guy you're lucky if he knows it in 2 years. Watched a female TA of his ram a .500" endmill at 3200rpm into a piece of aluminum stock and sheared the mill clean off. John smiled at her and yelled at me. I was just watching...

Very unhelpful. Questions will be answered with a question or an unclear "sure, you *can* do that" which just means you're doing it wrong. Obviously knows everything there is to know and decides not to actually help the students in Processes. Good luck if you don't walk in already knowing how to use all the equipment.

I had John for processes and now I'm a TA for him. When he isn't around, it's because he's fixing things, or helping people in the other labs. If you can't figure it out from the manual, the TA's have the answers, or else John does. Don't be stupid and you won't get yelled at. John knows practically everything about machining.
Very easy going.  Don't see him often.  You get most of your questions answered by TAs.
John is incredibly helpful.

This guy is useless and a complete ****.  He doesn't teach.  He simply gets paid to do nothing.  Very unhelpful if you have a question.  With the amount of time he spends chillin behind the plastic glass wall or chatting with Ta's, I am surprised not one of the untrained students he is to look after hasn't killed them self on a machine yet.

Extremely flexible.  if you didnt like your class time, you could come into the shop during open hours and do your project then.  extremely nice guy too... only he is a little protective of his machines (understandable, they're really expensive).
No Comments

Didn't have him for processes, but he was VERY helpful in IED.  He had a lot of helpful ideas and he was willing to take the time to help us work on our project or fix problems.  He is very knowledgable and even though he is often quite busy, it's worth the wait for the help and advice he gives you.

so mean. if u do something wrong, he comes up to u and gives u a disgusted stare and says what are u doing? it feels like kindergarten, when the teacher disapproves of u. makes u feel so bad! the manual is so long and ur expected to find it urself. he doesnt tell u anything and expects u to know everything.

Don't down John, He's a great guy if u get to know him a little bit and a lasting relationship has gotten me a TA job and a URP.  The class itself is a cake walk if u put in the time and itll priceless for IED.  Nothings worse than and IED kid coming in not having seen a lathe before.  Anyway Johns the man.

This guy just sucks, that's all there is to it. If you haven't had shop before, good luck. He doesn't teach at all in class (you're expected to know what to do from the lab manual) and don't expect any help from him. As said, if you need help, go to the TAs, although most of them aren't much better.

I don't know what this guy does all day. He certainly doesn't bother to help anyone in his class, just leaves it to the TA's, who aren't much better. Good luck if you don't have much experience in a shop.

Yea, he's a jerk.  Don't bother asking him any questions, he won't answer them.  Just go to the TA's, they'll help you out if you have a problem.  Remember it's a pass/fail course so your project doesn't have to be "perfect."  Just do it and don't worry about the minor details and you'll be fine.
The guy is an ass.  He is so full of himself and acts very unprofessional.  Not very helpful at all.  Needs to start hanging with people his age.
Awesome.  Don't break his machines.  He will beat the crap out of you.
Very helpful during both processes and IED.  He knows what he is doing and ensures a factor of safety in the shop.  Highly recommmended
Very competent and definitely knows his stuff.
This guy was just full of himself.  I needed no helo in the shop, I have used the machines before, but he seemed to laugh at people who did need help, not a nice thing to do.

While everyone else is correct that he is cool, note that I missed the one plastic lab which his underlings told me not to worry about and yet he ruthlessly flunked me.  Perhaps because the course is considered a joke.

John is awesome.  One of smartest and friendliest people on campus.  I wish he could teach all of my classes.  (he probably knows enough about engineering to acutally teach most any class here)  Seriously, if you need help with anything at all, go to him.  John you ROCK!
Great guy, if you put in the effort he's great to learn from. Highly recommended class, and a lot of fun.

Dealt with John in Processes and IED.  He enjoys making fun of you if you don't know what you're doing in processes but if you need help making something for IED later on he's going to be your best friend, seriously.  Extremely helpful for IED, period.

This class rocks and John is awesome.  Always very helpful, especially if you show that you're making an effort to follow the instructions and get it right.  Be stupid and get treated as such.  Be intelligent and you'll love the whole class.
Cool guy, the class is lots of fun! Make a cannon, it rules!
Take this class even if you dont have to.  You learn a lot and have fun.  My cannon actually fired a .036 musket ball.
awesome prof!  lots of fun! :)  and cannon rules!
No Comments
John is da man. Period. And Catapults ROCK!
Does he actually live in the machine shop? And if not, does he teach anything else? It's all about the canon!!!

Mr. Machine shop, knows every single thing there is to know about anything that has to do with metal.  Read the lab manual, because he will enjoy belittling you if you don't know something thats in it. Easy class. (CATAPULT!)

Imagine only ever being taught quantum physics, but all of the exams are on physics 1 and you have never been taught that. Our grade being 90% exams makes for a tough class. 3 exams total worth 30% each with 4-5 T/F and 2-4 open-ended. Some open-ended were worth 12% of our ENTIRE grade. If you get it wrong you no longer can get an A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: im not a formal student in the class and im just attending one lec to testify the rating. the notes are messy and lacking of information. the professor couldn't explain things clearly so that it would be a miracle for someone who never learned LA to understand for even a bit, even for me who got A for LA in high school.

I found that taking a class with him wasn't as bad as a lot of people say, but I definitely do agree with most of their complaints. A lot of proofs are required in this course, and grading can be harsh on both exams and assignments. The material in this class is pretty interesting, but its a shame he's not very good at conveying it in lecture.
Do not take this professor's Linear Algebra Course!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: I took Linear Algebra with Professor Lim. I had a wonderful experience.
I took linear algebra with this professor. I had an amazing experience.

Lim is absolutely baffling. In lecture, he's incomprehensible if you stop paying attention for even a little bit. But one-on-one, he's the best math professor I've ever had. I had a problem with one of the homeworks so I asked him in office hours and he walked me through the proof without spoiling it in such an intuitive way I was shocked. Go to OH
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Take it from someone who read the most recent reviews on Lim and took a chance, DON'T TAKE LINEAR ALGEBRA WITH LIM! He has tests worth 90%, and most of the exams are NO PARTIAL CREDIT meaning you either get a A or a D. Homework is also extremely hard for how little its worth. As a bonus he's also impossible to understand, meaning lecture is useless
His lecture is pretty interesting. He actually changed his teaching style in the middle of the semester so the whole thing just became so much easier. I definitely recommend him.

I don't know why so many students hate him. He's actually a very inspirational lecturer, trying to build up our understanding and interest in Math. His lectures are pretty intuitive and he's pretty considerate of the design of the curriculum.

Lim is the best professor I had at RPI! He is super caring, gives easy tests, and is the reason why I am now a CS/Math dual major (i was inspired by him)
The negative reviews in the past do not tell the full story. Lim changed his style of teaching and now gives very concrete examples in class to tackle proofs, gives easier exams, and is more lax.

Prof Lim gets a lot of flame here which is 100% because people don't put in the necessary work. He is literally the best professor I've taken. The lectures are very in-depth and you will learn a LOT if you pay attention. He makes the material easy to grasp intuitively rather than just memorizing mechanics. The work is easy if you pay attention.
Handwriting sucks, lecture notes are impossible to distinguish, lectures are somehow informative but still hard to understand, no partial credit. Just! Don't! Take! His! Class!
The lectures are muddled and the notes written are not legible. There is no proper format to write the homework and the grading is strict.
Very bad handwriting!! Can't understand anything from his teaching. Totally waste of time. Awful experience.
Just don't take classes with him. Awful handwriting, can't teach a thing, and he doesn't give partial credit on a math exams.
awful handwriting
Awful handwriting

Professor changed the ENTIRE grading scheme AFTER the final, after being told the A- was 80% in class. The syllabus was half-baked, didn't go to the lecture, read instead. Additionally, the tests are T/F no partial credit, with proofs that are copied from the textbook. Did well but I don't feel like I learned anything. I was one typo from an A-.

He would just use his fingers to write down notes on the iPad and then project his iPad on the screen. I can not even clearly see his notes due to his terrible hand writing. Avoid him at all the cost. Even though the bar for A- is fair, which is 80%, just do not expect to really learn any materials from his lectures and badly designed exams.
He needs to improve his teachings. I also take another class Linear Algebra and sometimes the HW is massive. But his tests are fairly easy.

The lectures where completely unusable and incomprehensible. He usually just scribbled on an iPad notes page projected to the main screen with unreadable handwriting and no prepared slides. The tests were 50% T/F with each T/F worth 2.5% of your class grade. The rest of the problems were literally just write the book definition of a theorem.

His class is absolutely a waste of time and money. Never teach things explicitly. Always wasting time. Always teach irrelevant things. Exams and homeworks are completely unrelated. I mean, if you want to get a C, probably you may consider him.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Worst teacher ever. Makes the test worth so much of the grade, and then doesn't even prepare you for the test. If you get a true/false question wrong on the test, that is 2% off your final grade. If you show work but accidently write the wrong answer, you will not get partial credit because, as he said, "It is too much work to do it for everyone."
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: This is the worst professor I have ever had at RPI. He is incredibly unclear about exams, which are the biggest portion of the overall grade. His lecture notes are impossible to read and this class would not be difficult if anyone else were teaching it. You will basically have to teach yourself everything. If you can, avoid taking classes with Lim.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Due to COVID this class was totally remote. The notes that the professor wrote were totally illegible and it was incredibly difficult to follow what he was saying in class. The lecture had almost nothing to do with the homework (which was challenging and had a lot a proof questions). Further, the actual financial math has no online resources.

Incomprehensible lectures. Never answers the questions actually being asked, always condescending. Crazy-hard grader. No crib sheets. Doesn't explain anything. Given a choice, I'd advise against taking a course with him, ever. Literally not even a teacher.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Awful.

His lectures are incomprehensible because he doesn't give examples. He only gives one test all semester. My TA taught me everything. He is very dismissive of questions. Paulsnotes helped me a lot but it's hard to study something when you don't even know what you need to study. He takes pictures to confirm attendance for a possible grade boost.

I have never had a bad professor until I had Lim. DO NOT TAKE MULTIVARIABLE CALCULUS WITH LIM. He is literally such an awful teacher who clearly knows his material but does not (in any way, shape or form) know how to teach it. Bless the TA for helping me through his class
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: PROS: not much homework easy quizzes and test you could probably skip lecture and learn independently CONS: homework questions are not like the test questions bad at giving examples uses technical terms and methods you will most likely have to read to get a proper understanding the TA had to rush through information at recitation
Terrible professor

Absolutely terrible professor. Can't teach lecture notes, which are already confusing. Cannot explain concepts. Exam and quizzes do not relate to homework questions. If you're unlucky enough to have him pray for a good TA.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: If you have other choices, DON'T take his class. Confusing lectures, notes are all over the place, not many useful examples... quizzes and the exam are not like the hw problems at all... Good luck if you still decide to take his class :)

Test and quiz are all inconsistent with what he teaches in class. There's no pattern in his lecture and he talks about wherever his words lead to. Examples made in lectures are confusing as well. If not necessary, do not take his class.

Doesn't try to teach at all. Quizzes/tests are not remotely similar to what's asked of on hw problems. Teaching style is also all over the place. I felt like I couldn't pass his class no matter how hard I tried.
good luck

From my experience in Prof. Lim's class, he's really knowledgeable in a lot of fields, and because of the expanse of a certain subject, he's willing to spend time to accommodate students covering prerequisite topics in class/office hours. Very easy-going too; nice to talk with. I learnt a lot from his class and office hours.

I don't know where to start with this clown. Not the toughest teacher, but very inconsistent and lazy. Puts very little effort in .You have to teach yourself everything and he gives you very inconsistent feedback on tests and homework. he also basically punishes you for volunteering and actually trying to learn instead of using the answer manual.

I don't understand why he has such a bad rate! It's true that some times he cannot demonstrate all the things clearly, but that just because you don't have the background of what he required. I go to his office several times, and it helps a lot. Those who complain about this course should work harder! And I really learned a lot from this course!
I can't understand his oral english

Chjan Lim ranks as the worst math professor I have any had the displeasure of meeting.  He has a rare ability of making nearly trivial material prickly as a cactus to swallow.  Despite enrolling in this class nearly ten years ago, I am still plagued by horrible memories.  Avoid at all costs.

He provides recommendation to my project in front of the whole class as "Rubbish" and "Nonsense" and thought all my data are faked without even looking at my project paper. I could not believe there are teachers worse than than this guy in this world. Never take his course.

Professor Lim really is not that bad.  He thoroughly explains all theories and will show one proof per class.  Homeworks are relevant to the class.  Exams are very easy and cover the basic concepts.  If you take his class, read the sections in the book ahead of time, you will understand lectures much better.  He will help you outside of class.

I have never understood anything when I go to his class. He only shows theories rather than actually solving problems. Also, the way that the material is presented is incoherent. It is very hard to understand what he says. Also, for every point you get on tests and quizzes is considered to be every % of your grade. Do bad on a test, u will fail.BAD
Go to google and type in Paul's Online Math Notes. This is how you will learn MultiVariable Calc. Lim is useless.
Avoid at all costs.

His lecture notes are illegible and his explanations are incoherent.  Homework is graded with check marks (wtf do check marks really mean?). Asks you to present problems in class which, again, earn you those wonderful check marks. It's a stupid grading system and a terribly run course. Avoid this professor if you can. Otherwise, start praying.

Overall, he's just a terrible professor.  One year, I think everyone in his class should agree to drop the course about two weeks into it.  If everyone just dropped his course, maybe that would finally make a statement to the department that this guy just CAN NOT TEACH.

This professor is absolutely terrible at teaching and running a course.  His lecture notes are poorly organized and his exams are irrelevant to the homework and notes.  The grading system is based almost entirely on 2 exams (40% each) and the exams had 5 questions each.  5 questions that you absolutely have to know or else!  Don't take his courses.
Evil stuff!Avoid it!
He is totally an idiot!
Suck man!evil enough!don't take course from this guy unless you wanna to be shamed!worst teacher i have met!

Worst course I ever took.  Over half the class failed his first test the majority of us dropped the class and a handful of us filed a complaint with the head of the department.  Would not take a course from this man, seems to be in his own little world.

around 75% of the class dropped out. he said he would go out of his way to make tests very hard. he has tenure so he can do what he wants and doesnt have to worry about the consequences. evil man. evil!!
Pretty easy class, definitely don't underestimate the quizzes, they were much more difficult than expected. Professor Traver is nice, but often brings up a lot of her own stories when lecturing.

Dr. Traver is a terrific professor. Lecture material is useful, homework is interesting and not difficult, occasional quizzes are more than fair, and you get to choose the books you read for the book club. A nice break from a hectic RPI schedule, and teaches you how to truly appreciate the world around you. Take this class!

I loved the course content and I especially loved having Professor Traver. She's incredibly understanding and empathetic. The quizzes are pretty easy because she'll tell you what exactly will be on the quizzes during her lectures. I found the assignments enjoyable and not overwhelming. This class is a nice break from all the other hectic courses!

Dr. Traver is the most outgoing professor you're going to have. She has plenty to say no matter what time of day, some relevant and a lot of personal anecdotes, but all interesting regardless. Positive Psych pretty easy just study for the quizzes and show up to class! Random attendance will kill your grade if you miss it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: I took this class in the summer and taking it over the summer enhanced the class experience. She tries to lecture in a way that is not overwhelming, makes it engaging, and makes the material easy to understand by making it personal to each individual. Take this class with professor Traver as it is a must take at RPI.

She teaches lots of communication intensive courses and most are easy A's. If you show up and listen, then there's no problem. She keeps class as enjoyable as possible. Other people don't normally like her too much because of her stories, but I enjoy that she shares and listens unlike other classes and professors. Like I said, easy A.

Her positive psychology is very useless. She always like to tell boring story with her daughter which has no help to class. What's more, she has no sympathy for the students' suffering. Instead, she takes the students' miserable manager as a verbal example. Even her neighbors she likes to gossip in class.
She is a very nice person and cares about her students.

I can't say enough about Professor Traver. She is one of the most passionate and driven professors I've ever had. Professor Traver truly wants to teach and influence her students in a positive way. She is a fantastic resource to have in the school and she is incredibly wise.

I had Dr. Traver for positive psych and she has been the light at the end of the tunnel for a lot of us in the class. She genuinely cares for everyone, whether you care or not. She understands us and works with us. Her assignments and tests are very easy and actually beneficial if you put the effort in. I am looking forward to having her again!

More like an English class than a psychology class. I found myself having to search up a word on every slide. Will say the content of the class is good, the way it's taught is more complicated than it should be, hindering the full potential of learning.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Super easy to pass positive psych. I was not a fan of her teaching style. It seemed like she was never actually prepared for class and she can be kind of preachy. That said, at any time you can shoot her an email or go to her office hours, she's very approachable and will work with you if you are struggling.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Super easy to get an A as long as you do the assignments and look over the slides before the tests. The assignments are very easy and typically don't take much time. The lectures are interesting. It's a material light psych class.

Dr. Traver is great, friendly, and inspirational. While the content of this course (I/O psych) isn't the most interesting for me at least, her lectures make up for it. She frequently uses relevant examples and sometimes tells inspirational stories from her own life. The assignments are very easy, but the quizzes require memorization of the slides.

Prof. Traver's, Positive Psychology is one of the best classes I've taken at RPI. If you truly listen and do the assignments, there is no way you will not enjoy this course. She is a wonderful human being that truly cares about her students and is very lenient with HW extensions. You don't really need the Positive Psych textbook, PPT's are enough.

This was one of my favorite professors at RPI. She really wants every student to learn and succeed. She also genuinely cares about every student's well being and mental health. I looked forward to going to her class every day because she is so positive and her lectures were easy to follow.

She's awesome. Use her study guides and you'll be fine. She tells pretty interesting stories in lecture but attendance isn't mandatory. The exams aren't hard and she is happy when everyone does well on them! Also lots of easy ways to boost your grade.

She gives study guides before each quiz, so if you fill those out using the power points that she posts online or the textbook, you really don't need to come to class. It is very interesting material though, and she tries to have good discussions but most kids don't participate.

I had her for positive psyc.  Very easy psyc course.  No textbook was necessary.  Just do her study guide based off of the lecture notes she posts.  Just don't forget to turn in mini experiments and such, she basically always gives 100% on those experiments.  You don't have to do that well on the tests to still get an A in the course.

Traver is awesome! She is so sweet and always gives real word examples while teaching. If you just study the Power Points, you will most likely get an A. She is an easy grader on essays and projects, even letting you redo it if you didn't do it right. Very big on soft deadlines. Definitely recommend taking a class with her!

The main problem with her Cog Psych class is knowing Too much before you take her class, or studying too much and knowing the material.  If you knowdo either of these 2 things, her quizzes get increasingly difficult.  Poorly worded, ambiguous quizzes.  People who skip class and study the question bank usually get the best letter grade, sadly.
Gives occasional extra credit, easy grader, quizzes aren't very hard.  Pretty easy class overall.
Loved Prof Traver, really easy class

I spent 3 hours of my Sunday before finals completing her extra credit and then was not given my points. Therefore she gave me a B when I should have had a B+. I also had to email her more than 3 times before she responded about being given my points and she has still not added them to my grade. She said "talk to me next semester".

Prof. Traver is not a bad prof, she sometimes has some very useful info. But you can't trust what she says in class, for instance she will tell you if you are busy you can ask her for an extension, and she will typically grant it. That is not true, she very rarely grants extensions and you will most likely waste your time sending her the email.

Professor Traver... where to begin. While she is a very kind lady, she is not meant to be a professor. I took her course, hoping to learn about psychology, and left the semester feeling confused and as though I hadn't learned anything. She didn't have grading rubrics for presentations/papers so you don't know where you stand. Study the powerpoints.
Study the textbook and u'll do fine. She tends to talk about her life often but I can't blame her. It's easier for her to come up with psych examples from her real life experience I guess.

Class is boring but very easy-Powerpoints from lecture are posted to LMS, reading those + skimming the assigned reading is enough to get by. Occasional feminist rants. The course itself is a joke, she makes the occasional useful insight when she's straying from course material.
She's an alright professor. Teaches straight out of the book so buy the book and read it. Should be an easy A/A- if you read. Class averages are usually around 32/40 on the exams.
Boring class, and final poster project reminded me of a 5th grade show and tell on who you're favorite leader was.
Very interesting class. Make sure to keep up with the material and you will do well.

PD II with Traver is all about Feminism. She'll use a lot of samples about herself, and will take any comment/suggestion to heart if you don't say it exactly right. It was supposed to be Leadership, but she makes it clear that's not her goal. Memorize her notes because that is what's on your quiz. Don't plan on getting much out of the class.

Had this professor for Cognitive Psychology. Sometimes gets off track during lectures, but nice and easy to listen to. Very understanding when it comes to the students, I made a scheduling mistake that conflicted with an exam and she allowed me to retake it when most professors would not have done the same. Tests were slightly harder than expected
Lectures were amusing and kept me awake, but I honestly grew tired of all the talk about prejudice and whatnot. This is a class on leadership theory, not the civil rights movement.

She only uses examples that are excessively feminist, and constantly complains about not liking to be told what to do.  Tests are difficult and require reading the textbook and memorizing to get higher than an 85, but everyone gets 100% on the posters, which evens out the class.  Better than the alternative PDII courses, just don't go to class.

Had her for cog. psyc. Her tests were mostly out of the book, so if you don't read then you probably won't get higher than a B+. Easy course, the lectures were right out of the book, and theres no HW, just one presentation, very easy 4000 level course

she's awesome. had her for cognitive psych. her stories are interesting and always tries to relay them to what we're studying (and usually does it sucessfully). she's very nice to talk to if you have personal issues too outside of class.

Horrible lady. Her stories are inchoerent and have nothing to do with the material. Sometimes they are depressing: like the time her friend's dad was shot and her husband went on a month long manhunt to kill the killer.  She talks about last night's American Idol every class.  If she wore a whale suit to class, I wouldn't know the difference.

Hates men. All managerial examples use females as the default. This is incorrect writing and very distracting to the reader, as any good writer knows. That having been said, her biases probably won't affect your grade and the course is easy.
No Comments
Easy to understand. Fair. Interesting. Keeps you awake in class.

Abnormal Psychology is a great course. Professor Traver made the class really informal, but informative. She's the type of professor you want to keep talking with after class is over. The material is interesting and stuff everyone in our society should know about those with psychological disorders.

This PD2 is way better than the STSS one. She has taught this one so much that she forgets what she mentioned in our class and assumes she told us. I'm mainly kept awake in class.  Good class for the lack of homework and only 2 tests and 1 paper and 50 elaborations.

A really nice lady who knows her stuff. The class got boring at times, but she has a decent amount of interesting stories that are quite relevant to the course material. The tests are on exactly what is covered in class, and the grading system in general is very fair.

Stupid class.  I think she's frustrated teaching it, and it comes accross clearly.  Waste of time.  You either know how to work with other or you don't.  You're not going to learn it in a 1 credit class.
she is on a wicked power trip. she is a man hater. the class is easy yet it sucks.
Can't blame her for having to teach a required course.
Worst psych teach i've had. Has serious power trip issues, or as she would call it, serious need for "personal power".
Thickheaded.  She says how women are steriotyped, then stereotypes them herself, and says its ok because its just a 'generalization.'  That's what stereotypes are stupid ****.
Boring material, but a good instructor.

Airhead, plain and simple.  She (along with the entire PD staff) teach a one sided view of how to conduct yourself in the real world.  Her PD2 class is so boring and so easy.  I strongly suggest taking it but get **** before to pass the time.
Understands what PD2 is and makes it great. Worth going to, even. Easy grades -- almost kindergarten at times! Take this version of PD2.
Incoherant at times, useless class
No Comments
a little out of it sometimes, but generally ok
This teacher makes the class interesting!

The best thing about her is her clear lecturing style.
Aside from that, I found her to be very passive-aggressive to students, and not great at answering questions. She also was not very accessible outside of class and seemed to delegate all other duties besides lectures to TAs.
Eh. Grade heavy, tough professor, no quizzes, and doesn't have office hours for whatever reason ?
Solid calc teacher but do not speak out of line or use your phone during class because she absolutely will call you out. She is very knowledgeable and can convey topics clearly so I liked her class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: She has very clear and precise notes and goes over them in detail. Everything on the weekly quizzes was from the gradebook homework and the quizzes were easy  and helped keep me on track. The exams were the easiest of any calc 2 teacher and were the sole reason I passed the class.

Dr. Kucinski is on top of absolutely everything and knows her stuff. She provided a very up-front and direct style of teaching and communication (which I personally prefer) that made it easy to focus on the lecture. Dr. Kucinski has a very professional disposition that makes her a great professor.

Amazing lectures. She was truly one of the best professors at RPI. Calc 2 was a breeze due to the clear lectures and she would answer any questions clearly. Even if you do not attend lectures the notes are clear enough to understand on your own. The only annoying thing is that Exams make up 76% of your grade.

Gina is one of the best professors at RPI. Her class is organized and fair. She gets right to the point in an easy to understand way. Her backtests are also very relevant and helpful. I highly recommended her for Calc 2.

Very good professor, exams are weighted heavily but as long as you do and understand the homework's you'll be fine. She is a good lecturer and they are worth going to but if you don't she posts notes. She will call you out if you are on your phone or ask a dumb question but other than that she is very nice. Best Calc 2 professor at RPI.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: I wish I could take another class with professor Kucinski because she is a great professor! Her lectures and notes are clear and concise. Also, her tests are a good representation of the notes, homeworks, and recitation quizzes. I highly recommend taking her calc 2 class!
Great Professor. I loved the way she taught Calc 1. She does have a lot of rules, but most of those are just basic respect.

Gina is one of the best proffesors I had. She is very caring. Class is very easy and understandable, she explains amazing and you barely will have questions because everything is very very clear. Test grading is very straight foward and they give a bunch of extra points for doing procedure

She constantly complains about how difficult her job is. It gets really annoying. She also does not care at all if something happens to you, she'll give you a 0 on any exam. Other than the fact that attendance isn't taken, she treats us like were in high school. She is a fine professor and teaches everything fine, just some annoying quirks

I had Dr. Kucinski for Calculus 2, and I will say that although harsh at times, she is a very fair grader. Her exams very closely followed the material from the homework and lectures, so if you study the material provided, you will be fine in the class. Lecture is not mandatory, but is helpful. She is definitely one of the best Calc 2 professors.

I had Dr. Kucinski for both Calc 1 and Calc 2. Calc 2 wasn't easy, but it went better than I expected! Dr. Kucinski has very solid notes on her lectures, and I appreciate the way she explains the concepts we're learning. Dr. Kucinski has some of the fairest exams I've taken personally, and I'd use the textbook and lecture slides to prepare.

Kucinski does NOT play she will call you out if you're on your computer or have headphones on. She teaches in an easy to understand way and lecture notes are clear and concise. I'm not a fan of her grading style because I lost points for stuff like "bad formatting" but all in all I enjoyed her class. Wish I had her for calc 2.

Professor Kucinski is a great professor for Calc 2, but the class is very difficult. It combines all of a regular Calc 2 class with parts of Calc 3 and Multivar. Tests are fair but you have to study like crazy to do well on them. The class would be a lot easier if there were back exams, however, the lectures are not confusing and very helpful.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Had her for both calc 1 and 2 and was not a fan. She is passive-aggressive with students, often disturbing lectures to call people out on benign things. She will drop your lowest exam but god forbid you're sick because she gives no makeups. This is extremely unfair and encourages sick students to attend exams. Also no back exams.

Great professor; explains topics with care and thoroughness. Tests are extremely easy as long as you do your homework. Very strict on the other hand: doesn't allow electronic devices unless used for note taking, will call you out for any "misbehavior", and has a bit of a sour attitude.

I'm grateful for Dr. Kucinski's teaching style in Calc 1 this semester! As someone who never took Calculus in high school, I liked how slowly she would explain certain topics as she didn't assume everyone knew them. I'd encourage you to go to her lectures and do your best on all the Exams, as 85% of our grades this semester relied on Exam scores.
She definitely knows the material very well, I just wish she did not dock points for the format of your work and just gave you credit if you showed your work.

1)Poorly formatted lecture notes and gives extremely convoluted ways to solve problems.2) Doesn't communicate properly 1 on 1 with students, gives no guidance on exam material.3) No back exams for her class making it much harded to practice for exams while grade being 85% exam based.

Very good lecturer, everything is clear and easy to understand. Exams are also probably some of the easier ones in the math department, especially compared to others. TA was absolutely brutal grading but that is not on her.
Was not understanding at all, although lectures are good. Good professor, not great face to face.
She's a great teacher. She'd be a 5 if the course wasn't so unnecessarily hard. Definitely your best option for calc 2. Except I heard stevenson is a lot easier.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Extremely taxing class, teacher is extremely knowledgeable but her tests and homework are so much harder than the lectures. Very strict, no phones, you get called out for walking in even a minute late. 0/10
i love this lady. she's straight up, tells you wat you need to know and willing and ready to give extra help. She does not, however, tolerate laziness or apathy. come to learn or dont come at all!

Kucinski is a great professor who explains topics in extreme depth and makes sure that all of the questions asked in class are answered thoroughly. She provides a great foundation of knowledge for a topic.

Professor Kucinski is a professor who cares about her class caring. She doesn't put up with talking or laptops being out. However, she explains the material well and cares about her students. If you are looking for a professor who cares about teaching, she is a great one. If you want an easygoing one who cracks jokes... pick someone else.

She's concise, clear, and easy to understand in lectures, and teaches straight from the textbook. While attendance isn't mandatory, I highly recommend going because it improves your understanding immensely. She assigns textbook problems along with the online homework, but they aren't graded, and she'll go over them at the end of class if you ask.
Clear lectures and really good lecture notes. Very harsh on people who disrupt her lecture, though. Tests were very fair if you studied. Lots of online HW.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: clear note and teaches based on textbook so easy to learn
She grades very strictly compared to other teachers. DO NOT take her class.

Really good lectures, if you go to them and do the assigned homework and make an effort to understand it, you will do well. There are 3 exams and each is 25% of the grade, so definitely grind for them. Overall, good class.

You get what you put in. I had credit for the class from a prior institution so I didn't take the class as seriously. She is the best lecturer for math by far. For most math classes your grade is pretty much determined by exams only. If you mess up with her as a professor it's on you as she gives plenty of examples and lectures/explains well.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: She's very meticulous with her explaining and if you can focus and practice you'll do great. If you're tired, however, you are prone to start dozing off because she's not quite monotonous but very calm in tone. Her examples are the best and be sure to follow her requirements: mask up, no laptops(tablets are allowed), noise to a minimum, etc.
She is very to the point. Her lectures were easy to understand and concise. She does not give extra credit.

Great person; however, can be very mundane and monotone during lectures, not very engaging. Lectures generally only run for 80 minutes unlike the usual 110 minutes, very linear progression through course. Quizzes weekly on previous topics. Definitely know how to use the textbook to learn. HW is assigned but not mandatory.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Her lectures were very easy to understand, and her lecture notes were fantastic. I took her class twice. We moved from in person to online half way through the semester, and she was by far the most organized. I don't remember if the textbook was mandatory, but you do need to purchase webassign, because all the HW was administered through there.

Great lectures! Clear, concise, and engaging. I never regretted attending lecture-- even though it was in Eaton. Gives clear expectations on homework and exams, and if you study you'll do well in this class. She seems a little scary, but Professor Kucinski is really nice and genuinely wants her students to succeed. Great class.

Lecture wasn't mandatory and she would post lecture notes online so it was still easy to keep up with the material. A lot of the test questions come from the textbook homework not just the Web Assign homework, so if you want to do well in the class, you have to do the textbook homework. She can be pretty mean if you talk or have your phone out.

Kucinski is really nice! Even though attendance isn't mandatory, she goes over multiple examples and is very thorough. She is especially helpful if you go to her office hours. As long as you complete all the homework assignments (including textbook ones), the class will be an easy A because exam questions are the same/similar.

I first took her class for MATH 2010, but I've made several (possibly unwise) schedule decisions just so I could take more of her classes. She manages to make any material seem easy, and is always great about reviewing concepts you may have forgotten when you need them. 10/10 would take again!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Lecture heavy

comment: Ms. Gina has the best teaching style you could ask for. Her iPad makes understanding the material easy. However, that's it. Unfortunately, she's often rude to classmates for making mistakes. Also, for some reason, her lectures make me really tired. But, they're only 50 min so just get through it and probably DON'T EVER ASK A QUESTION IN LECTURE.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Super nice and incredibly intelligent. But her lectures are not engaging whatsoever. If you like math and have razor-sharp focus, then by all means take her class. I realized that I would tune out within the first 30 seconds of the class and found more value in skipping class, reading the book myself, and asking questions at office hours.

Fantastic lectures and notes and a soothing voice. I'm taking her again for Calc II. Notes were not posted after lecture in Calc I, however they are being posted in Calc II. Going to lecture is important as she explains things very well. Be sure to be on time as she doesn't like when people are late. Laptops are not allowed unless for note-taking.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Very clear, very organized. Doesn't try and fool you with trick questions and grades on what she teaches. Very easy to talk to and very friendly!
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Best teaches Multi over Calc 1 and 2. If you want to learn the material take her class. Doing the book homework she assigns is your best friend. Asking her for help is no problem, very caring individual.

Very nice teacher, funny, clear lectures. Homeworks are not graded but is almost always must if you want to get a high score on tests (85% of the grade). Quizzes are very easy (15% of grade). Class attendance is VERY important. Sit close and focus for the 80 minute lecture twice a week and you will do much better than in the back. Also, no laptops.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: Not a bad lecturer, although her grading is really tough. Will nickel and dime you for points for small errors. Lots of webassign homework too.
Her lectures are popular, knowledgeable, and inspirational!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures--Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria

comment: If you have not taken Calc 1 before DO NOT take her. The class was taught as more of a review. She would breeze through major topics assuming everyone had already taken the class before. This made very easy material very difficult. She does have beautiful notes that were helpful. She will call people out for making any noise in class even coughing.

The best math teacher I've ever had, period! She is clear and concise in lecture, and as long as you can follow along and stay focused in class, you will easily get an A. The only reason I got a B+ was that I didn't go to the mandatory freshman mentoring sessions (RPI thing, not a Kucinski thing)

She is very friendly, unless you're on your phone, on your laptop, wearing earbuds, etc. during her lecture. You're not required to be there, as she posts all lectures online, but she goes through questions with you and breaks them down into steps.
Great professor overall. She is very good at explaining material and answers questions well. Responds to emails quickly and is very friendly.  Would recommend for calc 1 and 2.

Dr. Kucinski is one of my favorite professors at RPI. I had her for calc 1 and I just had to take her class agin for calc 2. Her lectures are incredibly clear and she posts her lecture notes online. She does a bunch of examples in her notes and the examples are often very similar to the problems on her test. Amazing teacher.

Dr.K is an amazing professor and I had her for both Calculus I and, now, Calculus II. It's definitely doable for someone to take her course and do well, but only if you show up to lecture, and do homeworks. The average grade is around a B-/C+, no curves. Most tests are based on quizzes and homeworks. Overall, she helped me improve A LOT in Math.

She is a great and helpful teacher but it feels like she spends way to much times on some simple concepts. Some how her 50 minute classes feel like hours. I would like to see her in  more difficult  content where here teaching style would be more appreciated.
