She's a great teacher, and you will learn from her lectures. She gives A LOT of examples. She'll answer questions in class, but with short lectures, it's best to save most of your questions for the recitation. For those taking Calc again, you can skip lectures, or use your phone during them, or go for reinforcement. Just DON'T talk during class.
Her classes are very interesting. Quizzes are mandatory.

Very Clear during lectures and her hand writing is impeccable. She posts the notes online so you can pay attention instead of worrying about copying down mindlessly without completely understanding it. I wish she taught more upper level math courses so that I could have her again because I love her teach style and structure.

One of the better math professors I've had. She posts the notes from class online, so you dont have to worry about writing everything down. You can focus in class on understanding the material. Explains stuff very well.
He rounds down grades even on the cutoff.
Pretty good lecturer
Take his courses if you really want to learn things.

The absolute worst lecturer I've ever had. He is the king at rambling while bringing in no context about the problem, and if you attempt to ask a question; he appears to take offense to it, as though it is blatantly obvious what he's talking about. He is, without a doubt, brilliant, and extremely talented. But he is horrific at teaching.
If you take this course, expect your grade to be a C+. But hey, you will learn a ton regardless!

Occasionally accidentally condescending but a good lecturer. Exams are hard and Kapila does not believe in curving exam scores, even when the median score is a 53. Hard class but potentially very rewarding.

Kapila is one of the best professors that I have had. You can tell that he genuinely cares about his students and will put forth the effort to make sure that you learn the material. He will go out of his way to help you. He is also one of the most difficult professors that I have had, but that ensures that you know the material inside and out.

Kapila loves to talk low and rapid fire his lectures. His hand writing is so awful that he manages to make his x's, y's and z's look identical. Rather than focusing on doing examples that are relevant to the homeworks/tests, he gives general proofs that can easily be looked up. The class is largely self taught and tests are way harder than practice

Took Num Comp with him over the summer, and it was one of the better classes I've taken at rpi. He was always very well prepared and well spoken, and posted typeset notes online after every lecture. 10/10 would recommend
Boring, quiet speaker. Notes are dense class moves fast. Homeworks take a while and come from his head. Use office hours and read the notes or book. Stay on top of it and you will pass
Good pace in lectures, incomplete notes, read textbook for homework. Do homework carefully or lose points for no reason

He's a clear and motivated lecturer, and he sometimes banters (well) with students.  It can get a bit dry by the second hour of class, but the material tends to be pretty interesting. He produces and distributes LaTeX versions of his lecture notes, and they're better than the textbook.  Review these and the homework solutions to succeed on tests.

I had already taken BC Calculus (The AP equivalent to this class), so I knew most of the material already. Kapila is an insanely hard grader! He did not curve any of our tests, even when the class average was below a 60%. That being said, If you really pay attention and complete the practice exams he gives you, you can do really well in this class.
Kapila is a wonderful professor who will do his utmost to make sure you learn. He offers plenty of extra credit but his tests are HARD. You will learn whether or not you want to.

The teaching style of this professor is very intuitive. He expects students to show the same intuition during the exam. If you want to do well in the class, you must understand all the material thoroughly. Read all the notes he gives and understand them.

Teaches the material well but is dependent on a particular learning style in order to be clear. Test and homework was challenging but accurately reflected the material needed. Expects a high quality of work from students and those that don't put in the time won't do well. Best thing to happen to Num Comp.

His material was hard and lectures were such a bore, but I can say that I learned a lot.  Not only that but his tests were nearly exactly the same as the tests from previous years, all he did was change some numbers.  Again, hard but will learn a lot and get a good grade if you prepare.

He goes through information a bit too fast and does not seem to teach. Use the textbook to learn the lessons. Try to read his handwriting in class, but it is a bit sloppy. Test questions can be anything. Do the sample tests, and review the homework. You will need to work in groups for matlab.

I began the semester with high regard for him. It fell with the weeks, realizing his overly methodical and unintuitive lectures left me confused often. The book is key, and I certainly recommend looking at other books to gain more insight on a topic when you're attempting to do the homework that often does not totally correspond to the book.
Very hard and bad for average clac I class. he does theory more than examples. good for math and physics majors, not for average engineer. hard tests and does not prepare enough examples
As per below, avoid at all costs.
HE"S SO MEAN! he likes to pick on sleeping kids in class and he grades really harsh!!!

Avoid this guy at all costs.  He is the kind of guy that would drop a nuke on a small town....Overkill...Calc 1, which I received in A at a state university, has turned into my arch nemesis.  His exams are 40% no partial credit, then the rest is impossible.  Class average on exams floats around 60-63%, which is a D by the way.  Take Dr. Blue

Excellent professor. He runs a very strict class, but in the end you really learn the material. He always takes time to help his students IF you seek him out. His class is a lot of work, but it will teach the material very well and give you a sense of accomplishment upon completion of his class (if you do the assigned work. The TA is another story.

Kapila's an awesome professor with good English.  He's very difficult, but he will explain things clearly and concisely.  He's very fair with homework and grading, but tests are tough.  It takes effort, but you'll walk out of his class knowing the topic inside and out.  I reccomend him if you're not taking math for easy A's and you want to learn.
The most polished prof ever. Thoroughly enjoying his class.
The hardest class I have ever taken. Kapila is a good professor; he explains the material well and is generally fair. However, the grading is so tough it'll make you cry.
No Comments

I have an A in every Math class I have taken before and after Calc 2 with him.  I got a C in his class because his homeworks are impossible and so are his tests.  No way will you get a curve either.  Do not take this man ever.

This guy is a fantastic prof.  The only thing I could complain about is the hair on his knuckles (you can see it on the overhead projector!) Seriously, he is very knowledgable and very clear in his explanations.  He demands quality work from his students, which some professors overlook.

His Maple labs are great.. you really learn how to use the software, and apply the concepts.  Calc 2 maple quizzes are a joke compared to this guy's labs. His final's kind of hard, but overall I learned a lot from his class, even though I already knew calc well coming into the class.
The best professor ever.  He knows how to teach.  And he cares a lot about it and knows his stuff.

Tests are easy, homework is hard, but they all make you think.  An A in Calc I is nice, but a B in Calc I special is nicer because I know that I actually learned more than most people.  A great teacher even if it is sometimes difficult.  Take this professor if you want to challenge yourself.
Impossible homework, hard quizes, and even harder tests.  Avoid at all costs, my class was full at the beginning and at the final we had a quarter of the original people in it.

The class was at 8am and everyday he would come in turn on the overhead and start writing. Sitting in the dark listening to someone monotone on about math and poor examples, what else can you do than fall asleep.The HW and test are also nearly impossible
Homework is impossible and it is weighted more than tests, avoid at all costs.
Excellent professor. Speaks English better than 99% of the population. Clear and concise.

I took him for Calc I and again for Calc II. Have to admit though if you're looking for an easy A...wrong prof. But if you really want to learn and are willing to put in some work this is it. He is a great prof !
So much homework!!!! I'm dying!!! He goes obsurdly fast too
very smart and very helpful if you attend his office hours, which i strongly suggest doing if you don't understand what was covered in class
Fairly difficult, he does not make it easy to pull an A.  He allows for students to excel if they put in the effort.

Numb comp sucks, especially when you are an undergrad AERO in a class full of grad students and math majors.  But Kapila is probably the best thing to happen to the class, and does the best anyone can probbaly do to make it tolerable
very difficult, but extremely intelligent and an awesome teacher. he forces you to think a lot.

A very strange, yet funny professor.  He is a strange little indian man with a british accent, walks around with a cowboy hat, and loves to torture students, while feigning ignorance.  If you ask him if he knows how to do something, he'll simply say no.
his class forces one to think for themselves on problems.
His lecture notes are better than the course textbook.  More practice problems would have been helpful.  Some of the homework problems required detailed knowledge of Maple.
Cool Accent, could help out a little more

He really cannot explain anything about numerical computing.  He transcribes his notes onto the projector, but doesnt really explain them.  He grades rather harsh and does not curve the course in any manner.
No Comments
Kapila = Genius
Utter genius...you come out of his class with an IQ five points higher
It was wonderful to watch optimization and experience in optimization together.

This is one of the wonderful course, that I took during my educational career at MSU.  The course works are well organized, and the professor was  awesome in teaching that makes enthusiastic period while taking the course. I can recommend anyone who is willing to take this course.

The lecture is wonderful, and it is definitely one of the most useful courses I've ever taken in graduate school.  It also has a beautiful textbook coming with this course.  Engineering students must take it! It is really helpful for your career.
Prof. Messac is fantastic. The best teacher I have seen. You can learn a lot from this his class.

AWESOME !! He is THE best professor in the department Challenging course, but I highly recommend it. Dr. Messac is the best in his field and is very intelligent in the subject. He is always willing to help. I have learned a lot in his class. His lectures are great!

Had him for split level optimization at Mississippi State.I was a little nervous at first since optimization is a specialty of his, but the course was taught in a very manageable fashion. There was a steady stream of HW, but it's all very useful. He'd always help after class if you got stuck on something (start HW early!) Good Teacher; Good Course

Was assigned as my advisor. I emailed him requesting a meeting for career path advice. He replied to my followup email with an attachment on proper email etiquette, of which mine was fine (you don't need to start a followup email with Dear...). Then he didn't show up for the meeting. Complete blowhard. Meeting etiquette 101, show up.
This man rocks my world.
This guy just blabla in class. A lot of homework, 20 hours. The worst course I ever took.
worst prof ive ever had here

Professor Messac is no doubt the worst professor I have ever had.  I showed up at his office hours 3 times.  The first two he wasn't there, and the third was useless.  He looks at you like you're absolutely nothing compared to him.  I've even considered dropping my Aeronautical Engineering major just so I don't have to put up with him ever again.
No Comments

I had Structures with him 4 yrs ago. I don't know how he could have even one positive review. The fact that he is still teaching shows the admin does not care about the students and the course evals you fill out are meaningless. Not even any of the other profs could stand this man's arrogance and his only friends resided in mirrors.  Avoid him!

This guy is horrible.  Arrogant, condescending, conniving, and a jerk.  Seems to be happiest when no one understand the material.  Gives negative scores for homework.  One on one questions are useless becasue he will tell you to stop talking before you ask question.  Talks down to you then walks about.  Worst teacher I can imagine. Go back to MIT
No Comments
Appears to be a nice guy on the first day, then it's all down-hill from there.

Book was horrible, and class was little more than a complete transcription of the book itself. Immense homework assignments (15-20 hours) every week. Thought he might be a decent guy, until the day he de-exempted people from the final b/c of "class participation" grades... one week after he exempted them for their outstanding performance.

I thought this class was challenging, but the professor has a method to his madness. He is actually very nice and makes sure every class that the student takes home the overall concept, not just the boring lecture. His tests are hard but he leaves room for improvement with make ups. This class is a piece of cake compared to other similar courses.

As the message below this one states "He is not as bad as they say" HE IS WORSE!!!!. The only way he could have gotten a positive review is if he wrote it himself. THIS GUY IS TERRIBLE! I get more from the course by not attending and just reading the book, BECAUSE THAT IS ALL MESSAC CAN DO.

Not as bad as people make him out to be. One of the professors that actually care about teaching the material to their students. Takes the time to make sure the students understand the basic concepts. Might not make sense at times but tries really hard to be good. Also, the hw isnt too bad if you keep up on it and it helps on the tests.
The worst professor I have ever had.  All the man can do is read word for word from the awful text he requires and yank his own chain.  He is his own greatest hero.

He was at Northeastern Univ., Boston, before joining RPI. He worked there for around five years and could not produce a single PhD!  Grad students used to run away!! Crazy guy!! needs Phychiatric help!
No Comments

Worst professor ever, even more so than Scarton.  Totally arrogant ****.  Gives -100% for bad scores homework.  I dropped the class, because I didn't need it, and it was definitely not worth the effort.  Feel bad for the Aero's.

worst prof i've had at rpi and i've had scarton and feesor. he wont let you have your book in class because he just hand copies it onto the projector.  the book is horrible too.  get help from people who already took it because messac is an idiot and the ta is too
Likes to give long homework assignments especially before tests. I thought he was a nice guy the first day of class...but that changed very quickly..what a jerk!

total jack@$$...  teaching style is repitition of material already in the book; no elaboration of concept.  few example problems - too conceptual.  Homework takes for freakin ever!  gives 2/3 large problems then adds 4-6 problems from the text.  gives major - pts for incomplete or hw < 50% correct=(

Refuses to give help or answer questions in class. The epitomy of errogence, this guy says he won't "spoon feed" students.  In other words, he is too lazy to teach! He does not care about any student and will smile when he gives you negative poi

Absolutely awful.  Treats the "A" students more favorably than everyone else.  Will curve DOWN...if you have an 82 average you could end up with a C.  He does not facilitate learning and is probably one of the worst aero professors.

I've started calling this guy Hitler.  30 hours a week for 4 problems is rediculous, he doesn't know anything about the material, and conducts class worse than high school. (takes attendence) He's a royal jerk, and cares nothing about us.  FIRE HIM NOW!
I can not beleive this guy is still teaching.  What a jerk.

Needs spanking.Refuses office hours.I begged for help,but he refused.Does everything in his power to keep you from understanding concepts.  Said it is not unreasonable to have to spend 30 hours on each HW assignment.I received only negative scores on HW.
2nd Worst Prof. I've had, after lvov. If arrogant had a face, it would be this guy. Just because he claims to be professional is no excuse to act the opposite. Gives negative 100's on homeworks.

Worst damn professor at RPI, period. He likes to carry a picture of you around while in class. Gives out negative points. Repeats paragraphs out of the book like a pro. Final? No Final? You'll find out on finals week. No professionalism.
No Comments
Shows lack of knowledge of course material and is very preferential towards certain students
No Comments
No Comments

Achille is a good teacher.  Likes to challenge students, but sometimes forgets that undergrad students and grad students are a bit different.   Lies to you.  Yes, the final will be optional.  Anoop rules!

This guy is such a jerk.  I thought he would be helpful because he seemed passionate about our learning...for about two minutes.  Then he just started playing with our grades and misleading us.  Then he created a problem he didn't know how to do himself!!
DOES NOT GIVE A S*** ABOUT ANYBODY

Terrible, terrible, sadistic teacher.  Gives grades that are below zero, flat out tells you he won't answer any questions on anything, and refuses to work with you at all to help you understand the material.  Avoid at all costs.
Cocky, arrogant, over all ***hole. Doesn't awnser emails. Copies notes directly out of book but you can't follow along in the book during class.

Messac can easily be replaced by the BOOK or the TA. He cant solve his own problems. TA knows far more than him and is a better teacher than Messac. Messac is very vague and he doesnt keep his word. This is the only class you can get a NEGATIVE grade in.

This guy is the biggest ***hole. He goes back on his word and didnt even have the **** to confront the class when we sent emails about his decision. He should never teach another class ever. DO NOT UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES TAKE A CLASS FROM THIS PROFESSOR

**** doesn't even begin to describe this guy. He has a major superiority complex. If I hear the words "Professional Maturity" I tend to get very angry and violent.  I really would like to optimize the impact of shoving my foot up his ass!
he should not be teaching...ever...seriously
No Comments
No Comments

You won't understand the material if you don't go to class. Lecture notes have no real content to them as he just uses them to introduce actual information that he says aloud. Be ready to use R-Studio a lot, a coding program, even though it's not taught how to be used effectively.

This professor is okay. His best quality is that he cares about his students. He is helpful in office hours and likes to joke with his students. For MAU, his teaching seemed a bit disorganized. He sometimes went off topic, and there were times we didn't cover all the material we were supposed to. In conclusion, great guy, okay teacher.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Beware of pop quizzes--Caring

comment: first-time teaching this course sometimes unclear with the material. overall a caring teacher, nice to help students

I think Prof. Aboul-Seoud is one of the worst professors I've ever had. He is very condescending, and can often be quoted saying everything is "so easy," when no one in the class is able to answer the questions he asks because he isn't the best lecturer to begin with. Do not recommend him for MAU. There are also pop quizzes that are timed.

Only about half the class attends the lectures because they are at 8:30am, and he does not make the class engaging or interesting, so you are better off not going. The homeworks are confusing and difficult. The only redeeming quality about this class is the fact that the tests are easy and online. Take this class with a different professor.
Great professor

EASY A ONLY IF you watched the lectures and did homework. (but you can get and A if you did not watch lectures, but it would require more studying) In addition, if you did not know something he's very helpful during class, office hours & all times. He cares about students, he was sad when our section got the worst average & helped us improve.

Amazing teacher. Not just another giant lecture class. Watch the pre-class lectures for IEA! They are extremely helpful (and awesome if you can follow the double speed).  He cares for his students and

Professor Aboul-Seoud was a great professor for IEA. He pre-recorded his lectures for you to watch before class and would use class time to clarify any issues and had us work on group problems that really enhanced the subject matter. Doing the HW really prepares you well for the tests. He is always available for help even outside his office hours.

Absolutely amazing professor.  Very very helpful during office hours and extremely invested in making sure students learn the material.  Makes really dumb jokes that are hilarious anyways.  Probably the best professor that I've had at RPI.
Very nice if you go to office hours.  Expects participation
Great Teacher

He's a genius. He perfectly understands that students must THINK not MEMORIZE the materials. He can be slow and boring to FACT RETENTION type of students. However the engineering is never meant to be a memorization intensive subject anyway. He's one of the best professors RPI can offer.
AT THE END OF THE DAY.... EPIC PROFESSOR

Great teacher for IEA. Compared to my friends I always had a better grasp on the material because this professor knew how to teach. The class assignments seem like a pain in class but they really help you understand the material. Make sure you do the assigned homework the same day of lecture so you can review the material learned.

A genuinely nice man. Easily one of the most friendly on campus. He is easy to understand, and certainly one of the best profs for IEA. Any difficulty in the course came from the material, not him. Take him for IEA!
Excellent professor. Explains material thoroughly and cares about the material he teaches, as well as his students. I strongly recommend taking him for IEA.
He actually cares about his students instead of research. Holds 9 hours of office hours a week and is always willing to help if you need help. I definitely recommend you take his class.
very helpful! definitely the best teacher for this class.
8am lecture is not the best idea with him but other than that he knows all his stuff
Doesn't really keep the class engaged, which is important, especially at 8 AM

This professor is great. He really knows this stuff and is very good at explaining things to the class. He does not have much of an accent either. The only problem I ever had with him was that my IEA class was at 8am everyday, so I often missed it or slept through some of his lecture. If I had him anytime else and his class would have been amazing.
cool professor who really knows his stuff, seems like a better professor than some of the other professors who teach IEA, from what some of my friends who were in other sections said.
Awesome professor!
Fun, easy to learn from and to understand. He was always willing to help students. One of the best teachers i have had here, second only to prof schimt.
He was very easy to understand...very helpful as well.
Awesome professor. He's very explains things very well and makes examples very clear. He makes IEA somewhat interesting.  And his accent is not very strong.

After getting over a small accent, he is a very knowledgable prof and is very good at correlating examples to material and tests, actually has some personality, which is hard to comeby here, only isssue is that he can do high powered math in his head and sometimes forgets to write little things down

Great prof for a tough class. I got through it with a decent grade thanks to his generous help. Lots of good example problems. Take good notes in class and really pay attention to what he is saying; zoning out and just reading through the power points after class will be the end of you.
Great course, great teacher. He can be condescending at times, but the tests are exactly what is taught in class. I learned a lot with this professor.
great professor with easy tests.
Great Guy!
No Comments
Horrible IED professor, didn't give any direction, ignored emails, and always acted like he didn't want to be there
Mo rocks! Best DSES professor.
Great profesor for IEA, explains well, is patient and thoughtful, also seems genuinely to care about the people who take the time to visit his office hours. Can't wait to have him for OR...
not very good IED prof. didn't know anything, was directionless. and boring.

Not the best for IED. I think he is so busy with all his other classes and committies that IED gets put on the back burner. Didn't give any feedback, but I guess all of IED is like that. A nice guy tho...
Had him for IEA. One of the best professors I've ever had. Very helpful, good person, and knows his stuff really well and can explain very well. You're lucky to have him.
Good Heart, he can understand his students
best u get for IEA
Very helpful when you go to his office hours. Great person all around also. Hard to find a professor with his sense of humor.
Don't take litec with him. he is never prepared and is so boring. he never knows when anything is due
Mohamed is one of the best teachers at RPI.
Best DSES professor I've had so far.
Yeah... I didn't really find his course that easy. It was impossible to understand him the majority of the time, and he wasn't always very clear with the problems.

He actually cared to teach us something. He was really nice about giving us points if we thought we deserved them, and he'd go over problems until we understood them. I'd be so excited if I could take another class with him.

Very nice guy.  Amazing quantitative abilities.  He was very eager to help even 30 min before the final exam!  The class wasn't too exciting, but that's the nature of the beast, and he understood it.  He's one of the best professors you'll have.
The man is a Genius.  He did all the math in his head.  He brought in his 3 year old daughter and she could do it also.  We all were amazing.  He does talk like Kermit the Frog though.
Hard to understand in class but a huge help one on one. Definitely get face time with him.

Prof. Greene is kind & her personal research seems interesting, but the course overall was not. She teaches fine but I zoned out every class after the 1st one, & by the end 20ish people showed up. Definitely do take b/c HW and quizzes allow unlimited attempts. Tests are take-home and papers are graded on completion. Easy to do well & low effort.
Don't come. Lecture sucks, mandatory reading, confusing class pace, foggy syllabus, blindly chosen textbook and waste of time.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Hilarious

comment: Attendance wasn't mandatory. All lectures online. Homework and 3 tests on Pearson due at the end of each month or so. 2 500-word papers about basically anything you want. HW and quizzes have unlimited retries. Definitely an easy A if that's what you're looking for. This style worked for me and I still think I learned the material pretty well.
Her class was very easy but very boring. I really liked economics in high school but sitting through lectures in this class was painful.

REALLY BORING LECTURES. Granted I'm not interested in economics and took this course for my inquiry, but I can't understate how easy it is for your attention to drift when you're in her class. You'll learn a fair amount if you're actually interested in the topic however.

Granted I was never a big fan of economics before taking the class, the lectures were hard to sit through and weren't very engaging. She seemed like a cool person and she definitely knows what she is talking about. But the lecture material wasn't reflected in the tests, which I learned the hard way.

P.S. Goes by Dr.Greene

Econ 1200 is a really light load. There were 2 essays graded on completion, and the 2 tests (and optional final) were all open note. However, Dr. Greene is also an incredibly boring lecturer. I would recommend this class if you have already taken some form of economics, and you want an easy inquiry without ever showing up.

I had Professor Parrales in Spring 2023 and I really liked the class. Everything including the exams were online. She's also empathetic and understanding if you ever get a chance to speak to her. The exams are pretty similar to the homework too. I didn't find the content too challenging and overall, the class was great.

The class was great and overall well taught. However, attendance wasn't mandatory and 100% of the material was posted online. Because of this, my 300 kid lecture turned into 30 kids by the end of the semester. The class is an easy A and a good elective to add to a rigorous schedule. Overall, the professor was kind and clearly loves economics.
This class is a lot of "listen to lecture, do homework on this textbook homework platform". Really easy and the lectures are of fairly good quality.
lecture is a little dry, test and hw are not that hard

I can't speak for her in-person class, but I would advise against her online class. Her class is entirely prerecorded lectures from 2015, using a different textbook. There are homeworks that ask about things she's never even mentioned in her lectures. If you don't mind cheating though, it's pretty easy.

I would rather die than hear her voice at 8 am. You basically don't ever have to show up for class except for the exam as long as you follow what she posts on LMS and the online homework. She's very clear about what you have to do and the tests are basically identical to the online homework questions.
The curve is really good

You don't need to show up to one lecture, just do the online homework and show up for the final and you can get a A in the class. She tends to go off on random tangents in lecture and most sessions are ran by TAs
Terrible lecturer. Unless you love econ this class is extremely boring.

Prof. Parrales is fine. Took her for ECON-1200 back when it was cross-listed as IHSS-1200. I think it's tough to teach the intro material because it is very, very DRY. I think she did her best all things considered. However, her lecture style is not for everyone. That said, if you pay attention, and/or read the textbook, you should be fine.

You don't need to attend class, and the exams are pretty hard because the backtests do not help. There is no curve and the two tests are worth 40%. The work you do for the class does not really help for the exam either, but you could easily make a B if you do the hw and journals. The way she explains is hard to understand and gets messy quick.

There's no extra credit in this class any longer. If you want an A, which is 94, you need to do well not only on the homework, but also on the test. First, you need to get at least 95 on your homework which means you are already loss 2 point on your final grade. Second, get average 92 on both of your exams, which is much harder than back tests.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: This professor is fair and pretty easy. Lectures can get boring though if you are not very interested in the subject. If you mess something up, she is very understanding, and gives you multiple opportunities to succeed. Beyond accepting some late work, there is extra credit available, and an optional final. Good choice for your HASS class.

Her lectures are not clear at all, especially because of the extremely blurry notes she writes every class. Don't expect to learn much from her notes and during her lectures. You definitely need to study the past exams on LMS hard in order to score higher on the exams!
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Lectures are extremely unclear and she says to read the book but that didnt seem to help much. Took the class in Fall 2017 and the only way to do decently on tests was to grind 3-4 back exams and memory dump on the test.

She gets a lot of heat from students sometimes, but I can't complain. She made the course criteria very clear and taught everything clearly. She's a good lecturer, the tests are very fair, and she gives a lot of material for you to study from. Can I say I like economics? No, but Dr.P was a good professor. Not the best, but not bad.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: This course, unfortunately, suffers similarly to her ECON 1200 course, but without lecture videos. Lectures are drawn out and seemingly helpful only on a few occasions. The backwork she provides is somewhat similar, but encourages memorization of answers, because her teaching style does not promote learning of the material.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I'm no ECON major, but there's really too much to dedicate to this course given that it's introductory and only meets twice a week. Her lecture style is obviously directed towards those who already understand economics. Even if you show up, her online materials are more helpful (I guess) but lengthy at best, just like her lectures.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Show up, take some light notes. Do the back tests she gives you. Get A, simple as that.
Show up and listen, or just sleep. Read the textbook and then do the backtests she gives(which have similar questions as test). Get an A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Her voice makes me sleepy, but the A was easy. Goes for ECON1200 too.
It was easy if you showed up to class or read the textbook or watched her online videos.  Lectures were boring but covered the material.  Tests were all multiple choice.
Grades depended on 4 tests (2 micro, 2 macro). Final can replace your whole grade, so you will either need to do well on the 4 tests, or focus on the final. The tests are fairly difficult.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: One of the best teachers I've had at RPI. The lecture videos were great. She provides the tools you need to get an A.
Easiest class I've taken since preschool
Read the book or watch video lectures. Do back tests. Easy A.  Her lectures aren't especially helpful but the course is easy enough.
She puts all content to LMS lecture. But always late and she cannot clarify the knowledge very clearly. Too many tests, with 2.5 each question and 94 for A.
You do most of the work yourself but as long as it gets done it's a super easy class.

I wasn't really interested in ECON-1200 but Parrales makes the class very clear. She records lectures online which is extremely convenient and makes it so that one good night of studying will have you earning A's on the tests. Great personality, great professor. ECON was much less painful than it could have been thanks to her.

Lectures rarely last longer than an hour.  She requires you to watch recorded lectures of her to learn the material which can be annoying but allow you to study at your own rate.  Tests were of moderate difficulty but very passable if you study.  Her voice can sometimes be annoying.  Often rewords powerpoint slides in answer to questions.

The tests were difficult if you had no previous economics background. She is very knowledgeable of the material but power points may not be the best presentation method. The final can count as your entire grade if it is better than your test averages.
Class is boring. Stopped going after the 3rd week. Can learn everything without her

Friendliest and most accommodating professor I have had during my tenure as a student here. It was her first time teaching Money & Banking and she didn't always have all the answers at her fingertips, but you could tell she put in a lot of work to know what she was saying and deliver it well. If there was a tough question, she always followed up.
Awesome teacher. Homework/projects/ etc are all online and nearly impossible to fail.
she is a really amazing teacher. Does everything in her power to help you out, and the class is insanely easy.
Outstanding intro to economics professor.  All course material is online, meaning tests can be taken online at home with classmates and all the resources you want, and she has no problem with it.

Overall good professor. Usually only holds the class for about an hour and leaves the rest of the time for studying. Uses old exams. Keeps lectures entertaining with videos and activities. Good amount of homework, but it really helps you study for the exams.

Doesn't teach from the text, but uses videos as supplemental material.  Very good at explaining concepts if the text was somehow too difficult.  Material is easy, exams are mixed.  Extra credit available.  The exams are no longer open book or open notes.

This teacher is obviously teaching straight from the text book.  She lacks any intuition or common-sense regarding economics, i.e. she uses material from "The Onion" to depict current evens, oblivious to the fact that its a satire.  I feel like i've lost intelligence from being in this class.

Really, she looks like Sarah Palin. And is definitely past her prime. She has her degree in Wood Forestry, not Economics. She no longer gives open book tests, but is still a horrible teacher. Wear plaid and eat pancakes for an A.

One of the easiest classes I have ever taken. The tests are open note and open book, plus there is significant amount of extra credit offered, but you probably won't even need to take advantage of it. If you even try in the least you will get an A.
This class has open book and open note tests, and she tells you in class what in her notes will be on the tests.
Pretty good looking professor. In her mid twenties. Blonde. VERY easy on the eyes =) Gives extra credit. Easy A. Easy B for the dumbasses
The class was the easiest I've taken at RPI, but I wasn't bored. The material was fairly interesting. Parrales explains it well. She's easy on the eyes, too.
The class was easy. I stopped attending after the third lecture. Gregor makes the class basically a joke because of the leniency on exams. I have no passion for this degree…..
Just very easy test, good for your GPA. His exam total is 60 and with 10 extra points! If you just spend some time before his exam, you should never worry about your grade on that.
The TA Francis carries the entire course, as the teacher isn't really good at his job...
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: He's so, SO funny. But, his lectures are slow + in the end half of the course the logic is hard to follow re formula derivations. Weekly recitation quizzes clarify concepts as TAs review problems before quizzes. Exams are plug-and-chug, similar to quizzes. You're allowed a crib sheet, and e/ exam offers ~16% EC that can boost other exam grades.

The professor isn't the best lecturer and his handwriting is a spectacle. However, the homework in the class is very nice, and as long as you do proficiently on the test and quizzes, you can obtain a reasonably good grade.
Kovacic if you're reading this, why tf do you use "n" as a variable in your classes? The way you write it, it could be mistaken for an r, u, a, h, v, or m. Why. Why

He may not be a great lecturer but his personality is great. And tests are 70% of your final grade but you are allowed a crib sheet and he offers  bonus question so you can earn 10 extra points on an exam out of 50. Content is difficult but not unbearable so just study and go to office hours if needed as he is helpful (just tell him you are coming)
The lectures are confusing and hard to digest. The notes are illegible, and there aren't really any office hours. The TAs are helpful and honestly the only reason I passed this class.
If you want get a high GPA. No! NO! NO!
Lots of extra credit and a big curve.

Good and nice professor. 
He offers a lot of extra credits and useful office hours. 
Also, with a nice curve on the final grade.
Good professor. Lots of extra credit. Gig curve.

Very nice and hilarious person to talk to.
However, his notes are terrible and not legible at all. Homework is notoriously difficult, especially for the extra credits.
Tests are fine, actually, very easy compared to hw.

His notes are awful and nothing can be learned from them as they are so disorganized. Often on example questions he skips steps making it impossible to understand his process. He often bashes the textbook he assigned for the class for being awful, which it is, and not much can be learned from the textbook.

Prof. Kovacic is a really nice and funny person. Unfortunately, this did not come through with his lectures, which were not engaging. This class can be very difficult if you are not comfortable with Calculus. Some of his tests are very tough. To keep up, do all optional HW assignments and seek out help when you need it. It also helps to read ahead
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: He's a real sweetheart who genuinely cares about students. His lectures are easy to follow and he lays out how quizzes and tests will go. After they grade they give you the rubric so you can challenge and potentially get points back. The quizzes are easy and the tests are either easy or impossible. (look out for test 2) (hw not checked/required)

Linear algebra this summer was great. Professor provides clean, parseable lecture notes, and the lectures are good. Doesn't reign in harshly grading TAs, however, so be very meticulous in your assignments to make sure they see everything they could possibly be looking for.
Those were the hardest homeworks I have ever done but the curve is very generous.
No exams. Homeworks are insanely hard. Gives good lectures, though. Make sure you buy the book by Sanchez, it actually helps a lot; start the homeworks early!!!
He's a little hard to understand but its manageable if you pay attention. Tests are nothing like the homeworks and the homeworks are quite difficult.
rating_tags: Respected--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Dr Kovacic gives a lot of homework which is really hard, plus the lecture notes only help sometimes. Beware you have to mainly do a lot of work on your own. On the first test he gave in our class a lot of our class failed so be careful.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: The homework is hard. The class is daunting, five people walked out on the first day. But it's incredibly worth it. I came out understanding calculus better than ever before, and for the first time in my life, I actually UNDERSTAND the fundamental theorem of calculus. This class was amazing.
This guy is a straight up G! Hes absolutely hilarious, though his lectures were a little hard to understand through his thick accent.

Easiest class I took my first semester here. I stopped attending lectures after the first week, and skipped a few recitation session. Instead,I watched khan Academy and PatrickJMT and went over the class notes online days before the test. Only had to take two test all semester. (Quiz average can be used as the 3rd test grade) Easy A!

He writes down the lecture notes on a digital format and posts them online. These are a good reference for the homework. The learning process is done while doing the homework as there is not much learning from lecture. Easy exams, no final, and he's very approachable for questions. The homework works you a lot, but you will learn. Overall, good.
Homework is extremely hard for students. And do not expect his class note to be helpful while doing homework.

Very friendly and funny. His general gaiety is almost infectious. Great professor for math majors or anyone interested in seriously pursuing mathematics; has a lot of advice about the culture of academia. His Analysis homework is astoundingly difficult and time-consuming, but it pays great dividends for your understanding. Tests are almost trivial.

Gregor Kovacic is a pretty good professor. He presents the material well and assigns homework problem that are very similar to test questions. His tests can be a little hard since he has a hard time understanding what students find difficult. Still, not a bad experience.
This guy is the man. Multiple choice tests, no homework, no textbook. He even co-authored a paper on the practical challenges of creating an invisibility cloak.

Don't expect great instruction, and you'll need to get several of the textbooks listed on his webpage to refer to (he uses material from many sources).  The homework is a challenge, and is where the learning happens, just don't expect it to be graded, make and keep a copy to compare with posted solutions.
Lectures are horrible and boring, his English is terrible, and his notes are illegible and don't really explain a single thing. I also had an awful TA which didn't help.
Kovacic works you hard, but it ppays off in the end. He is also a funny guy.

Very intelligent professor. Knows his stuff. Has trouble explaining exactly what he means, but extremely knowledgeable. Rarely makes mistakes on the board, and can answer difficult questions immediately. The homework load is a lot, but not impossible. Over all good teacher.
my favorite professor, homeworks are longer but are deeper than plugging numbers into formulas

Kind of hard to explain this man.  He's a really good guy, and he teaches the material and tests on the material as difficult as anyone I've heard of, but class averages are generally low.  He has huge curves at the end though, so you'll probably get the grade you want even if you are expecting the worst.
No Comments
Really easy grader, tons of extra credit on tests, good TAs, take it with him!

Interesting person.  Hard to understand sometimes.  Doesn't care if you attend lecture and his notes are on line anyway.  At the end of the couse there was a 5 point curve so getting a good grade shouldn't be much of a problem.  Knows his stuff but has trouble explaining it.
Nice guy. Lectures are fairly unorganized and often contain mistakes. Suggested homework is nicely organized.
Very unorganized lectures, and not very clear as to what needed to be known. my TA was terrible too
Tends to push so hard in the beginning that students start the semester behind and can't catch up.  Intro to integration is really advanced integration techniques.
"Say you walk into a room and you find a corpse..." Great professor, funny and taught the material well.
Best teacher ever.  He reminds me forcefully of Goldmember.  His laugh is infectious and he loves gold.
Even though there is an accent you get used to it. Very good class,some lectures painful at times. Great TA's.
Really nice guy, knows his stuff.  Always willing to make sure you understand a concept if you ask him.  Excellent boardwork.  Makes the classroom atmosphere friendly, if a little corny.
No Comments
I'm repeating diffeq, it's 10x easier with Kovacic than it could've been
Differential Equations. Difficult subject, but he made it a bit clearer. Has a thick accent. Is often giddy, which can be contagious. Laughs at self frequently.
not so easy, but not utterly impossible
Very thick accent, not available.  No req-ed final tho.

Social Psychology. Good lecturer, but you don't need to go to class if you don't want to. There are a good bit of essays but he grades them very lenient. No tests, only online quizzes. One of two "memorization" assignments but you actually just read off a paper. Overall easy comm intensive class, and pretty entertaining if you go to class.

VerWys is the best professor at RPI. I was Aeronautical Engineering until I took his course. Go to office hours! I had a heart-to-heart with him and switched into a career path that I love. The course isn't difficult, but he makes it interesting. Very self-aware and conscientious professor!
Good class, lots of papers and its very interesting, he will randomly take attendance.

Super easy. We did one presentation over the FBI motivational model and wrote a paper with a group of 6. Very knowledgeable if you talk to him in a small setting doesn't lecture enough to figure that out during class
Easy class. Don't buy textbook. Attend class for majority of classes to get attendance. Finish essays. Not need to attend class for last two weeks of semester

Lax deadlines on easy assignments make this one of the easiest communications-intensive classes out there. Promises 3 tests, there's actually just 1, which is literally impossible to fail. Class gets cancelled a lot, when it doesn't you'll watch videos most of the time, or he'll read off his overhead slides. Class usually ends early.

forensic psychology, interesting course, and the professor teaches about classic serial killers as well as current serial killers (serial killers or spee killers who are active when you take the course)

This guy is as useless as it gets. Easiest A I have ever gotten in my life, which I guess is good, but I didn't learn anything about psychology. I don't think we even discussed anything relative to psychology. He spent most of our class lectures reading us news stories out loud. Another excellent use of tuition at RPI...

i had him for social psych the class was real easy, as long as the essays are the right length you get hundreds,had enough points by the beginning of novemeber and didn't have to do any work for the rest of the semester to get an A

Basically the coolest professor at RPI. So long as you can fathom SOME form of insightful, introspective thinking, his classes are the easiest in the world, and rich with enlightenment for those who seek it.

Good teacher, but his assignments were a little excessive. Expects you to write 20 page papers like it ain't no thang. At times, it seemed like they were graded based on length alone rather than content/quality.
no enthusiasm was not prepared for class ever.  rarely taught actual material
Best prof @ rpi.  The only one that knows how to give information at our level of study as opposed to phd level information.

His grading system is absurd.  If you've ever heard that quality is more important than quantity, well forget that now.  He requires 60 pages of writing by the end of the year and doesn't think anything of it, not to mention the course isn't considered "writing intensive."
had him for social psych, basically the man, work is easy, he grades essays on how long they are
He slaps the projector A LOT, can get kinda annoying at times.  Otherwise, easy A if you come to class and pay attention.

This is the easiest class EVER! He gives out 25% bonuses on all the tests so you don't even need to study or read (or come to class, since social psych is all common sense)! Don't buy all the books either, since he never assigns reading, only "recommends" it. Easy A.
No Comments

He's a really good lecturer and has interesting projects or paper. Sometimes I wish there was more structure to the class but this allows him to experiment with us and it's fun so eh... It's overall very enjoyable.
i agree. an all around excellent professor regardless of what class he teaches. i've had him in social psych, forensic psych, and im taking his psych and the law class.

Very nice man, and not a bad lecturer either. i always enjoyed the videos he had for class, and it was a little unnerving how the entire grade was based on one huge paper, but it turned out not to be so bad.
If you love sarcasm and you find psychology interesting, then take anything you can from him!  It is a lot of fun and really interesting.

VerWys is one of the best professors on the RPI campus regardless what they teach. Forensic Psych with him was an extremely interesting class and the presentations you have to do actually help you improve your presenting skills for other classes. He is an easy grader and I would suggest everyone try and take at least one course with Prof. VerWys.

A 35-40 paper is easy?  I wrote almost 50 in the end and it challenged me the whole way. Class is not mandatory, but if you go to class, you learn the topics you're going to write about.  If you don't, then you do it on your own and that's your choice.  The class was great and the prof was funny! :)

I don't think I learned a single thing in this class. It sounds unbelievable but I'm serious. I never once needed to open the textbook. We watched movies half the time, and the other half was Prof. VerWys making stuff up and not teaching. Your only grade was 8 BS essays about how you feel.
I am also in personality.... it's 30 pages, not 35.. and he gives you the whole semesters.. it's pretty easy.

I have him for social psych and personality.  Many classes are devoted to watching movies or TV shows.  Entire grade in both classes is a 35-40 page paper--which he refuses to meet with students about.  Take him only if you want a grade for doing a 35 page independent research project.
Very easy to understand, and really wanted students to be interested and excel.
Somewhat entertaining and the tests are really fair, they test you proportional to what you learn.
So easy yet so boring.  Tests are direct word for word from the notes that he posts online.  Some interesting videos but when he speaks bring your pillow.  An easy A.
His lectures were boring.  He didn't seem like he wanted to be teaching.  However, the course was fairly easy.  Make sure you attend class because he tests you on videos you watch in class.
Easy class.  Frequently cancels classes, especially in winter months.

I've had him as a professor and I've worked with him.  He's extremely knowledgable.  He insists on students being able to recognize classroom concepts in the everyday world.  His workload and ease varies, but work had and you'll get an A.

Great classes... He's very straightforward about the non-manditory attendance.  Tests are multiple choice and no real HW (just a few "worksheets" in some classes).  Big Lebowski movie clips defiantlty a plus.
Frequently blew off class, spent most classes listening to a monotone lecture or watching a movie.

Psychological Tests and Measures ... the class writes the tests (all multiple choice).  The course material is mostly about testing making and what tests are actually testing.  Easy A, does require some work
Took personality with him.  Wants his students to pass, opinionated, but honestly tries to teach material.

easiest class by far.  He is not afraid to talk to us about whats really on every college kids mind... SEX.  what other topic in this world could get 250 college students to pay attention all at once.. and we are actually learning, bc his lectures r great

I have taken every class he has offered since my freshman year, he is the best teacher I have ever had, Period. You learn massive amounts of information easily, you do well, you have fun, AND you actually use it. Prof of Decade material.
Easiest class I've taken so far.  Only class I haven't taken notes in.
Best professor ever... and I've had Hagerup and Li
No Comments
No Comments
we watch lots of FOX on TV during class
No Comments
pretty cool guy...
No Comments
No Comments
she is very tough grader and alway make people lower grade.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: So accessible! She would always respond in less than < 5min to pms on webex teams, even late night and outside of office hours. Lectures were clear and homeworks are fair.

Professor Adali is an amazing professor. I really enjoyed this class, but I wish I had taken it not online since I would enjoy lectures more. Still, she works hard to give notes/lectures/examples and used the online format to her advantage in interacting with students. Always available outside class and super understanding when I talked to her.
Lovely professor
Good class, Great Professor.

Professor Adali's lectures are helpful. She is nice to everyone she meets. If YOU ask her questions face to face or on the piazza, or even by emailing her, she would reply to you with words easy to understand. I took the course in fall 2017. The tests were not heavy but you should review all the materials she posts on website.

Phenomenal teacher! If you have any background in coding at all, you can honestly just skip lecture most of the time, but if you're not so well versed in coding, she does a pretty decent job in explaining everything. I mainly went to class once a week to chat with her about the new Rick and Morty episode (they will show up in class quite a bit).

She is a rather poor lecturer; luckily Professor Turner had lectures which ran parallel to hers, earlier in the day, and covered the same content (same course). Id avoid her; she is a bit annoying and tends to be quite poor at illustrating concepts. Im very glad this course is over. Be prepared for poor instructions on assignments and esoteric..
She's one of the nicest and funniest professors. CS1 with her was an easy A for someone with no prior experience.
Her lectures are very clear. If you have any question the TAs are very helpful. She also gives a lot of extra credit. Just do the work and its an easy A.
Many bugs in homework that I have to wait for them to be fixed.

Sibel Adali is a great teacher.  I had her for CS1 and she really helps you understand new topics.  She has a site set up where her and her TAs will answer nearly all questions students have. The class isn't an easy A, because the nature of the class itself requires time and energy, but she gives several late days and decent partial credit.
Excellent instructor

Such a great professor! Really enjoys working with students. Makes assignments fun by making them about student interests. Lectures are a little boring. It can be hard to pay attention, especially with your computer right in front of you. It doesn't really matter if you skip class, all the notes are online. You should try to go though!

She's just great especially if you get to know her personally. The labs are mandatory but the lecture isn't because the notes are recorded and  online. Tests are straightforward and there's tons of help if you don't understand the work.
love her teaching style. She give enough time to do homework and review when they are hard. Offers extra credit sometimes but not often. Classes are engaging.

She's very engaging and uses good example problems to keep students interested. Gives three late days for no points off during the semester. Homework and labs can be really tricky, there're frequently lots of kids in office hours the day before an assignment is due, but they are graded generously. Hw grade counteracts my low (70's) test average.

Sibel Adali is not only the most adorable woman I've ever met but is literally the best professor I've had. People who posted bad things about her are just bitter because it's a difficult subject and requires a lot of work to do well. She makes classes interesting and is in NO way hard to understand. Everybody I've ever encountered loves her.
She taught the comp sci 1 class with Stewart the first semester it was offered in python (fall 2012). I preferred the days she taught because she explained things better.
She was very helpful and I loved her teaching style!

One of the better CS profs. Looking at older comments, I get the idea she's come a long way. She really knows her stuff and puts a lot of work into the class. She is very nice and helpful in office hours. The class is challenging, but fair, and certainly not impossible. The average on exam 1 was 83, exam 2: 85, final: 77.
I enjoyed her class

I think she teaches well.  She really knows her stuff. Her accent might lose some people, but if you pay attention, and take notes you will pass the course.  Her tests are open note and book.  I think she's great!
Completely worthless...waste of time...not at all easy to understand..neither does she make it easy...tests and homeworks are impossible to crack...take another course instead!!

I understand why people don't like her... her tests are difficult, the homeworks can be long, and the projects both difficult and long. However, I felt that she was one of the better instructors I've had at RPI. She could explain things more clearly, but at least she took an interest in the course. Overall, I thought she was great.
Projects were difficult

She was helpful during office hours, her tests were on the notes and the book, so go to class. I have no idea why she has gotten such bad ratings, she was actually one of the better CSCI teachers because she would actually explain the material in office hours rather than tell you 'go read the book' or 'think about it'
Projects were much harder than everything else in the class. Exams and homeworks were fairly straightforward. Lectures were pretty dry. Slight accent, but little difficulty understanding.

She admitted she was bad at programming and using a database. Her practice test answers were almost always wrong. She always left the country before a test. The course wiki was never up. Her lectures were unhelpful after the first test. She seemed to get lost a lot in her own examples. Don't expect to learn much practical info from this class.
Very intelligent...very helpful..Willing to help those who show interest in learning.  The class was difficult, but at the same time very satisfying and worthwhile.  Plus she's kinda cute! :)

Boo!!!  RAISED cutoffs 5 points after initial ones were posted!  Very misleading/secretive about grading process; you have to live, breathe, and eat Database Systems in order to get an A in one of her courses.

Database Systems is not as hard as she makes it out to be.  Weekly quizzes are very hard, even though they are open book.  Homeworks border on annoying, where you really don't learn anything because the problem lies in some stupid slide she put up and talked about for a minute.  Avoid.
One of the best classes I ever took. Adali was very helpful during office hours.
her teaching sucks

The class is extremely hard and the work is extremely difficult and out of scope. The tests do not cover the material well, and are very difficult to understand. The book sucks, and so does her notes. Plus you can't possibly pay attention to her.

Exams make you feel smart, but only when taking them. Once your grade gets back, you basically go...WTF,I thought this was right. But not according to the mysterious, or non-explination given in class. 2nd test she tested us on some material never covered

For Database Systems - she is very unclear.  Her notes are impossible to decipher.  Her examples often have incorrect answers.  The exams were impossible (average on the 2nd exam was 54). Project descriptions were changing the evening before due.  Avoid.
Sibel is unclear, posts examples with wrong solutions, is unfair and gives impossibly hard exams and projects.
Not the greatest.
OK
Cool.
Favors effort over ability, so somebody that trys hard will get a much better grade than somebody that grasps the subject matter.  Effort should have no effect on grade.
HARD COURSE!!!!
Unfair grader, hard to understand.
madd nice teacher... very helpful and easy grader
She's nice, but the class is much harder than it should be.
No Comments
the average for Adali's class is below a 70,other DBS class: 90!

Everyone knows him and everyone likes him. An incredibly smart person with SO MUCH experience. Can tell you everything about anything. Also funny and easygoing and does not expect unrealistic things from students. Would always recommend taking a class with him.
A hard course but extra credit up to 10% could be applied if you manage to get a license for some kind of engineering tools. Test requires lots of calculation and most people could only barely finish
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: Quiz every week, plus he very soft spoken- sit close. A lot of times he dosnt know what hes doin.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Best professor I've ever had. Great stories,sometimes relevant to class. I wouldn't say the course is easy, but it is highly math based so if you learn the rules you can do most problems. Exams are very close to past years and he goes over a back exam in class. Does not get caught up in covering all mtl as long, just teaches what he can well.

I had this class a couple years ago. Now I am in a graduate program at another institution, and have a much better appreciation for Anderson's knowledge of the subject, and his rigor as to how things are really done. This is an excellent first course in spaceflight mechanics.

Very interesting class. The instructor has great stories (best part of the class is when he gets side tracked and tells one of his stories about a satellite screw up). This really should be split into two courses (too much material)
A very tough class, but he did much better than the prior instructor. He likes his math and emphasizes understanding. He needs to do more examples. Too little time and too much material
My favorite prof. He is very clear in his teaching. Keeps the class interesting by telling us the practical use of the material. Do the homework, study for tests, you should do fine.

I've taken three classes from this guy so far.  Best professor I've had -- by a long shot.  Makes everything interesting and has some amazing stories.  Worked in the field -- so he's not strictly academic.  Absolutely brilliant, great at teaching, and always VERY helpful with any problems a student may have.
This guy is the best IEA teacher. Very clear with the examples and really cares about the students.

Incredibly thorough. Does a lot of problems in class. Shows you multiple ways to do each problem, and generally lets you use the method that you are most comfortable with. He won't tell you exactly whats on the tests like some other profs would. very helpful in office hours, but be prepared to spend time if you ask him a question.

Find a way to do the problems that makes sense to you- not necessarily the method he uses. Be prepared to spend about an hour if you ask him for help with a problem. The course itself is setup a bit strangely. Uses "interesting" terminology.
Very good professor. Works problems and tells why and how thing done in real world. He was clear and willing to help.

He's tough but he works out detailed problems in class, so you can learn how to do it out, not just theory.  You will learn the material with him better than with anyone else.  Very helpful in office hours.

Really interesting class. The professor always tried to relate material to real world experience, but this caused him to deviate from the book some what. The course really needs to be be split in to two courses which cover a year
No Comments
Excellent professor. Taught how to solve problems in general, not with tricks. He should write his own book because what he does is so different than how the book does it (Better).

Probably the best professor I have ever had. Made a difficult subject clear and interesting. My expericence with his undergraduate research was also great. He shows much more interest in the students than other professors at RPI.
Explains everything very clearly. Great teacher and very helpful.
he explanes everything verywell, starting with the derivations and going from there. very streight forward, very clear. he is the best teacher for dynamics and has an honest love of the subject.
Very clear and relates material to real life application and experience. Probably the best professor I have ever had at RPI
Really good professor, if you like professors that do examples all during class, pick him.  He's a really reasonable guy and speaks english!

Made the subject very easy to understand.  Taught general cases that worked for every situation and helped set up homework problems in class.  Some classes got boring because it was the same method every time.  Not his fault though -- he taught with great clarity.
Teaches General Cases, one of the best teachers I've ever had
Explains the material and derivations verry clearly. Uses general formulas to make problem solving much easier than Prof. Scarton's methods. Excellent professor.

Do not take this class with another professor if Anderson is an option. His inthusasm in and out of class is contagious. He gets you intersted in the material and is willing to work with you until you get it. Young, Enthusastic, Organized, Helpful, Understanding. GREAT PROFESSOR!!!
Great Professor!!!! He works very hard to make material clear and understandable.
He explains everything clearly and puts it into a real world prespective.
Great professor. He explains the subjsct thouroughly and makes it seem easy. Much much better than Scarton.

Very good Professor. Probably the best I have ever had. He works very hard to make a difficult subject uderstandable. Bashes the book. He is willing to spend as much time as it takes to help a student
Great guy.  Very thorough and makes mincemeat of the book.  A little flaky, but very intelligent.  He was understanding about the tough course load too.  Whatever you do, don't get Scarton.

biggest goon ever... he is just plain uninteresting... it is impossible to sit in his class and learn because you are too busy thinking about how much you cant stand being in the same room with the guy... says the same thing over and over and over and OVER AND OVER... terrible professor
This guy is a ROBOT...talks and thinks like one. Not very helpful unless you speak "robot" language also. Take Dymanics with a different teacher (or at a different school bc Scarton sucks too)
One of the best in his field.  Very helpful.  Makes a very hard class clear and easy to understand.
Professor Anderson is one of the best you'll come by at RPI. He is gifted as a teacher and will make an effort far beyond what is required of him.
Very Clear, and explains things well. Exactly opposite of Scarton
He's the best there is!
Excellent Professor - Brilliant in getting the material through to us
Really Clear & Fair workload
Quite possibly the worst prof I've had in 4 years of Aero/Mech.

A really awesome teacher, he makes dynamics lots of fun and loves feedback. Always there to help if you have questions, even if it's on homework due right then.  He loves students to do well and encourages them. Only teaches in the fall at the moment.

Eventhough this class is one of the most challenging for engineering majors, with professor anderson it's the most interesting class, you learn a lot with him, and from him. I can say that he is by far the best dynamics professor. BTW Scarton is the worst
Probably one of the best engineering professors i've had. Plus, a graduate of UC Berkeley!!!!!
One of the best professors I've had, although I'd recommend him more for dynamics than EMD.
Really cool prof. He's cynical to the point of hilarity
good dude
No Comments

Really great professor, he is very helpful and his classes are very interesting. However, FOAM with him is probably the hardest course I've ever taken at RPI. Homeworks take sooo long, however there aren't too many of them. You will get a lot out of this class though. I would strongly recommend, but not for the faint of heart.

Good teacher, class isn't as hard as others say most just dont go to class. If you go and understand the equations, you'll be fine. Lots of extra credit on tests and through weekly quizzes.  Does tend to ramble but he lets you know so you can tune out. Very helpful during office hours and does post back exams which are helpful for studying.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Avoid unless you have to take diffeq in this semester and its the only professor's class you can get into. Kam is so much better, take her. The grade is all exams, so if you don't do well on exams or have test anxiety this class will be very stressful. He also tailors the lectures towards math major when I'm sure 95% of the class aren't them.

He tends to delve into the deep analysis problems a little too much, and while this is helpful for math majors, it might not be for everybody and can get mundane. Going over examples of problems that would be on the test I feel would be more helpful.

Dr. Kramer is definitely better than most people think, although his lectures can get boring. While your grade is entirely based on the exams, he gives several extra credit opportunities, including weekly quizzes on a homework problem. Be prepared to think through the modeling problems he emphasizes! He also tries to know his students by name.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Dont. Take. Kramer. IF you didn't get into Kam's diff eqs, drop it and take Multivar. Tests were 100% of the grade. The tests (1,2,3) averages were 67, 62, 47 with deviations of 24, 26, 26. Final was optional which was an avg of 60/135. The positive reviews for this guy are literally just sabotage, so here are the actual facts. GPA ANCHOR, trust me
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I think that Dr. Kramer is an underrated teacher. He has a sense of humor and is an EXTREMELY generous grader. I am aware that one's grade relies entirely on test scores, however, given that he is generous on partial credit and 20-35% extra credit is available for each test, a score less than satisfactory is entirely one's own doing. Pay attention.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment:
It's a hard class, but Kramer makes it easy to do well (given you work your ass off).  Kramer's lectures were clear and concise.  The only grade in the course is the tests and maybe some quizzes.  Lots of extra credit but don't expect to earn much of it.  keep up with the notes and homework

Took this class with AP calc BC credit and did well.

Loved Prof. Kramer.  Although this is a tricky class, Kramer's teaching methods were very clear and concise.  Lots of extra credit on the tests but don't expect to rely on it carrying your grade.  If you study hard and take notes during lectures it's not too hard to get A's on tests.
He knows his stuff. So he is great at answering questions, but that also means he goes very fast in lectures.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Avoid Diffeq with Kramer if you can. Lectures were fine for the most part, but he would do very few example problems and instead say "you can zone out for the next 15 minutes, you don't need to know this." You have to be very self-sufficient to succeed in this class, with lots of independent learning. Was unnecessarily hard. Exam 2  worst one.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Exams are pretty much the only grades that you are going to get in this class and that can either be very beneficial or detrimental depending on if you understand the course content very well.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: AVOID AT ALL COST. I have to take this class to graduate, but this class is killing me. He gives five homework for a semester, and it takes at least two days to complete each one. His homework is not actually relevant to his lecture notes, so you have to know a lot about complex variables outside the class to get an A or B.

Lectures were smooth and enjoyable. Applying them for the assignments will probably be more challenging. His class is an A for one of two kinds of people: the bright and the hard working. If you are neither don't expect an A.
Do not take his class if you are graduate student. He gives Cs to graduate students. Very bad grader.

Dude managed to take off points even though I had the right answers with the right work. He's a horrible grader. Do not take his classes because the grading is unfair. He single handedly ruined my academic career.

One of the more difficult DiffEq professors I'd imagine. Lectures are a bit confusing. His background is mathematical modeling, so his tests are extremely difficult. However, every test has a possibility of getting at least a 125/100 with all the extra credit. Plus, his recitation quizzes add 1% to your final grade for every one you get right.

The lectures are extensive, thorough, but boring. It took all I had to stay engaged. He's very smart and very helpful during office hours, but the lectures are hard to sit through and he rambles a bit. Tests 1 and 3 were pretty similar to back exams in difficulty, but test 2 came out of nowhere, so there's a little inconsistency.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Worst math professor ever in my entire life! Patrice exam will nothing like the real exam.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: He has boring lectures with already filled paragraphs long lecture notes which are very difficult to follow during lectures. Exam questions are far different than practice exams and it is almost impossible to get extra points unless you're on top of the materials. There are no TA hours to help you either just office hours.
The practice final exam is nothing like the actual exam. He is smart, but not really good at explaining the questions.

Not an ez A class, but also hard to pass, in terms of he is giving lots of bonus but meaningless. He won't really help you when you have no idea about the homework. The practice exam is easy, and the actual exam is really another world. But, you do learn stuff from his class. Of course, most depend on yourself.
Lectures often contain topics that are not important for tests. Tests end up covering material he barely goes over.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: Very intelligent man but he doesn't know how to be a teacher. If you're only looking to get your math requirements, avoid him. Otherwise, you'll be placed in a class with an extremely high bar that requires mostly self-learning/motivation to succeed. Extremely disappointed with my experience. Ruined my GPA and wasted my time.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: A lot of homework with really huge extra credit which is no way to get. The hardest course

By far the most awful math experience of my life. I know I know, it sounds like I just had a bad time. There is no curve, your grade depends primarily on the tests, and the tests feel like they're written in another language. If you get above a 70% you're doing better than the vast majority. Wish I could go back in time and stop myself.

This was the worst math experience I've ever had. Not only were his lectures terribly boring and useless, his tests were insanely hard and lacked the ability to accurately assess my knowledge of the subjects at hand.
