He would also ramble about things we didn't need to know during class which wasted time he could have use to better explain the topic

Probably the best lecturer I've had. He teaches the material extremely well, going beyond the sequential and formulaic methods and really giving good understanding. He has optional homework which helps gain extra credit and the tests are easy A if you know how to do the math. If you are mathematically strong, he will be easy and you will learn a lot

A little awkward, and boring lectures, but not too hard to do well on the exams. Exams are similar to the back tests. Goes into details for the people that care about the subject, and doesn't require that knowledge for the people that don't care too much.

I found Kramer's lectures to be SO BORING. Could not stay awake in class. He is so smart, but he sometimes goes on and on about things that we don't need to know, and he admits that we don't need to know that! I did not do well on his test and that's what your final grade is based on. He's smart, but I wasn't convinced he should be teaching a class

Not many homeworks but they were super hard. The last homework of the semester had a median score in the 30's. Tests were very hard but had a lot of bonus points as a safety net for students who really understood what was going on. Even though it was difficult it was a really good class. Id take another class with him if I had the opportunity.
He's tough but you will learn a lot from him. Going to office hours can really help and he's a cool nice guy. But getting an A is tough and questionably possible.

One of the smartest people I've ever met and a great teacher. If you go to lecture and pay attention, you will learn Diff Eq. Otherwise you will not do well. Felt like I had actually learned by the end of the class, which is very rare among other professors for this course. He's kinda awkward but super nice and his tests have a lot of extra credit.
He is extremely smart and extremely good at teaching. He made hard things so easy to understand.

Quite monotonous and thorough. I called it "DiffEq for math majors." His tests aren't linear, but studying his back exams can help. His tests are a bit difficult and LONG, so study a lot. Optional final brought me from a B- to an A in the class. Lots of extra credit on tests! By the end, I felt like I understood the material quite well.
Good Professor!
Great class, great professor. The homework problems were particularly helpful.

He did a good job teaching the material, which is something that most of the people teaching 2000-level math courses at RPI have a problem with. However, his tests never resembled the back tests he claimed they would, or any of the material in the class or homeworks for that matter.
Dr. Kramer is an excellent teacher who knows his stuff.  Made diff. eq. enjoyable, which is no small task.
Great Professor, very helpful and fair, responds to emails very quickly and explains things very well. Also very realistic.
Nice guy extremly smart extremly hard to pass.
Fabulous teacher.  Really presented the material in an organized manner that was easy to understand.  Always more than willing to give help, anytime.  Deffinitly take a course by him.
No Comments
Excellent professor and lecturer.  Work is ridiculously hard compared to examples and class materials

One of the smartest people on the campus, more likely in all of New York. Could teach applied math to a monkey, though that is often what you feel like once you start work on the homework. O and if it's due in 2 weeks, you start NOW. Tough but great.
Excellent teacher and lecturer.  Knows the material very well.  Also a nice guy.
His homeworks are ridiculous.  He is extremely anal.  Knows the material very well but you better study because the tests will kill you.
This Guy is goated, Wrote the textbook and has a simple syllabus to make your life easier

All the quiz questions are taken from the textbook problems, so if you do the homework, it's easy to do well on quizzes. The lectures are okay, but I found the textbook very helpful for learning content.

Holmes is a very knowledgeable guy. His exams and quizzes are exactly like the back exams and homework problems. Nothing is a surprise. Lectures can be a little boring and he likes to go on the same tangent about covid every other week. My only major issue was that the small lecture hall made cheating on exams and quizzes rampant.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: You can really tell that he cared about teaching the class in an effective way that made sure students understood the material, without pounding them with work or super difficult exams. 10/10, would take again if given the chance.
Very Fair Professor. He wrote the textbook and make everything clear. Although there is no graded HW, he makes up for it by having the quizzes and test just like the optional HW.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: Great Professor, a must-take for differential equations. Tests are exactly like the quizzes with a few numerical changes, and the quizzes are exactly like the problems assigned.

He is definitely very accomplished and a good teacher. Although I definitely don't like his grading system. He only gives A's, B's, and C's, with no + or - it's really frustrating because instead of getting a B-, you'll get a C, even if you're very close to a B. Because he's older, he gets angry easily and can be intimidating, but he's nice person.

- His lectures are optional but are super helpful
- Fast response time
- Quiz questions are all taken directly from the textbook, and test questions are always comparable in terms of difficulty
- No grade modifiers, no curves, no dropping the lowest score, only quizzes and tests are graded, no final exam
- Anything above 87.5 counts as an A
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Teaches to the textbook, which is great when he's the one who wrote it! Dr. Holmes teaches Diff Eq like it's one of the easiest math courses out there, and with him, it kind of is. Weekly quizzes and three exams which are all fair, no final, and no homework. Is very clear about class expectations. He's sometimes hard to follow in lecture.
Took MATH 1900 w/ him but this man is I think genuinely one of the last few competent professors and advisors at this school. If you're a math major and ur advisor sucks switch to this guy.

Useful stuffs. 
Amazing lectures. 
Easy tests and homework.

Professor Homles's lecture is amazing, he is very knowledgable. 
His textbook is very clear as well, if you read through the textbook, it is easy to follow and refresh your understanding from the lecture. 
Tests and homework are very easy to get full credits as well.
Also, 70/80 is a A in his class.
He is good at explaining the theory behind differential equations and he goes at a pace appropriate for anyone even if they don't have experience with difeq.
Trust me, Prof. Holmes is the goat. If you can do the Homework you can get a 100% on each test. This Prof. response time is literally within minutes of you reaching out.
Altogether a great professor--one of the best at Rensselaer.  He is extraordinarily knowledgeable and excellent at communicating the course material.

Holmes' class is dead easy. His Quizzes are VERBATIM from the suggested problem sheet. No HW's, and optional classes/recitations. And the Exams are the same format as the suggested problems but with different numbers. No modifiers (+/-) but since the A is an 87.5% that's more of a benefit than a curse. Optional final as well.

Holmes has the best approach to teaching I've seen in a long time. He teaches diffeq while convincing us it is actually really easy. He wrote the textbook and its one of the best textbooks I've ever read. If you can, take any math class you can with him. No +/- on grades but quizzes are copy paste textbook problems and exams are more than fair.

Fantastic lecturer, best prof I've had so far, very entertaining in lecture. Explains practical applications to make the theory more understandable. Strange grading system but very advantageous for students. Checks online class forum frequently. Homework not required but strongly recommended; same with recitation attendance. Go to lectures!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Good calc prof, his lectures weren't the most engaging and he often added unnecessary material but he still made it clear what would be on exams. There was no HW requirement so the entire grade was based on weekly quizzes and the 3 midterm tests. He did give non required hw and the quiz questions came directly from those problems (same numbers).
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Prof. Holmes is the perfect prof if you want a no surprises course. Weekly quizzes are copy pasted from the recommended problems assigned for each textbook section (optional). Exams are also copy pasted from the textbook but with numbers changed around. The only thing you may not like is that he does not do +/- on grades, it's either an A or B.
Very engaging lectures, funny guy

I am trying to retake the course this summer, which is by the other professor who also teaches 4800 in rpi. Holmes' textbook is written as confusing as possible. Comparing to the 4800 I m having now, the teacher is actually explaining things, and the textbook have a lot of examples. These classes are teaching the same things, but Holmes is not good

He knows his material and is able to relate it to various fields of study so you know why you're taking the class. His lectures are engaging and as long as you show up and pay attention you'll do fine. The quizzes are questions word for word from the homework. Tests are similar to hw questions, but no crib sheet (some diff-eq teachers allow one).

Very clear and concise lectures and gives good examples of everything covered and teaches effectively. If you do the hw and go to recitation and-or office hours, you'll do well in the class. Grading scheme voted on by students allowed a 75+ to be a B with an 87.5+ to be an A.
Extremely straightforward and willing to help you succeed, but only if you show up and do the work. Completing the assigned problems is a must along with attending recitations.
rating_tags: Respected--Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: His lectures are really clean cut and cover everything well (you can tell he wrote the textbook on it) and homework is reasonably challenging. He uses Piazza for everything, gets lecture videos and resources up quickly, announces things well, and does an amazing job responding to questions on there--average response time is 20 minutes.
Great prof. Be sure not to skip the lectures, they are super worth attending. He is a great lecturer and even better at answering your miscellaneous questions.

Quite possibly the worst math professor/instructor I have had in my life. Teaches way too quickly. Typically loses students 10 min into the lecture. I am doing well so far but self taught literally all the material. He seems very intelligent but doesn't process that not everyone has done this material several times before.

Where do I begin? To put it briefly, 1) No way of knowing your grade until the semester is over. 2) Textbook that the homework is from is specifically designed to make as little sense as possible. Ugh

He is nice, but he is the laziest and fakest professor you can imagine. When I was taking his class he was so focused on his own work that he barely took our class seriously. It was very hard to actually learn in his class, but getting an A isn't that hard.

Possibly the best math professor at RPI. The course pace is rapid and the material is complex, but he does such a great job that everyone ends up doing well. No grade modifiers (only A, B, C no - or +) so push for an A! The best part of class was when he connected what we were learning to actual papers and fields of study. Highly, recommend.
Not super accessible out of class. The class itself was fairly interesting and Holmes WANTS you to pass. If you go to class, take notes, and do the homework, then you will do fine on the exams.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Gives good feedback

comment: The professor taught Intro to Differential Equations again and last time is 2006 (10 years ago). The greatest part is his lecture, because it is extremely clear with almost all the words he has said written down on the projector. The exams are easy and number of questions is very small (110 min for only around five problems). Class is fast-paced.
Shares a dropbox folder with the class which contains a few textbooks and other interesting/necessary material.  Overall a great class and a great professor.
Really good class. He gives solid lectures and really cares about the material! Hes an energetic guy so be ready for that but overall awesome teacher! go to recitation for sure.

Decent professor for DiffEq. Lectures are straightforward and well-explained as long as you pay attention. Homework (from the book) is not mandatory, but since the quiz questions are taken from the homework it is a good idea to do it. My only complaint is that it can be difficult to know when to do which homeworks.

He is an amazing person and a great professor. You can tell that he truly enjoys his field when he's teaching. Although some of the things he teachers aren't relevant to the test, it gives depth to your learning which helps to remember what he teaches for longer periods of time. He is very fair, and cares about his students.

He replaced my first teacher halfway through the semester after the professor fell ill. Material not always presented in clearest way and he doesn't do examples like our other professor did. Stuff gone over in class also not relevant to homework a lot of the times.
Great teacher, a lot of charisma when lecturing.  You can find 95% of his lecture, word for word, in his book.  If you read his book before hand, the grade will be easier (though not an easy A)

GREAT PROFESSOR. He wrote the book used in class(the book it great by the way). His lectures are always well organized and clear, homeworks can be somewhat difficult but tests are easy if you pay attention. His humor is subtle but its worth listening for, he also pokes fun at pure mathematicians and chemists, as a physics major this was great.
He doesn't go into much detail at all so you don't learn much but the tests are word for word from the quizzes which are from the homework.  I slept thru several lectures and got an A.

The material is diffficult, but having him as a professor makes things so much easier.  He is one of the only professors I've had who can lecture without reading off of slides, notes, etc. in a CLEAR and COMPLETE fashion.  Take a class with him if you can -- you won't regret it.
amazing ... i'd take a course just to have him as my professor again.
Even though he has not taught this class for years, he explains the material like he has been doing this forever.
No Comments
knows his****
Easy in a very hard way. I found his class a pleasent experience.
No Comments
An excellent professor.  Extremely learned in the material.  His work is challenging yet enlightening and far from impossible.  If you have trouble, his door's always open.
I love this professor, really good guy.
Very nice professor! He is very nice answering questions!

Malaviya really knows what he is talking about when it comes to MAU but doesn't present in the most effective manner. He zooms through lectures very fast making notes hard to copy down and rarely pauses for questions. He often mocks you if you do not understand something and try to talk to him during office hours. The class also doesn't get curved.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Extremely rude and dismissive when I came in to ask questions. Questioned if I even care about my grades, even when I came in to ask clarifying questions. Is overall a difficult human being to communicate with on a one to one level.

Really nice guy.  Cares about his students.  Difficult to understand accent at first but it isn't bad after a few days.  He is the go to professor for MAU.  Make sure he knows your name.  That definitely helps when he gives you the grade.
Prof. Malaviya is a sweet and brilliant man. Great teacher and very willing to help you outside of class, he even helped me find a job! Homework's not too bad but the take-home final was tough.
Best professor i have ever had. period.
Bimal is the man! Boring as heck to hear lecture, but he's very thorough. Very helpful in office hours.
He's the best teahcer of this class hands down!
Not only are his lectures pretty good, with plenty of examples, but he's SO nice. I showed up to an exam without my book or notes, and he let me leave to get them and gave me extra time at the end.

He has a really mumbly and quiet voice, but if you actually pay attention, his lectures are clear, logical and helpful. Office hours were also a big help. What sucks is when he's out of town (often), because his TA's generally are terrible at explaining the material.

Prof. Malaviya really cares about his students.  He takes the time to write out notes and examples rather than using Power Point.  He also goes through lots of examples in Minitab so you'll be prepared to answer test questions quickly.  Great for answering questions.  The key to success is going to class.

i dont know what you pple are talking abt, but he's an awesome professor! brilliant man! very easy going and diligent. definitely helps with the understanding of difficult materials and knows how to grade fairly!
Tests are easy, but he is really hard to understand.  Lectures are very boring.  He is helpful if you ask him questions after class or during office hours.  TAs are good too.

Professor Malaviya is rather poor in expalining things, and worse at presenting them. The class is easy, but Professor Malaviya seems to find a grading  scheme to make sure that it follows the "normal distribution"...that means you will probably get a B in MAU.

Thanks for the comments about the final grading, I am in MAU now and didnt realize that he did that.   If you can get past the mumbling (pay attention to what he writes) the lectures are actually quite clear and progress in a logical sequence. He is an extremely nice guy and very willing to help out.

Good: Professor Malaviya knows how to do mau.... Bad: Prof. Malavuya can't explain how to do mau, he mumbles, he gives the same incomprehensable explanations in office hours as he does in class. Finally he believes that grades should follow a normal distribution. Yes he curved down...That means my 89 was a C.

He made the minimum A grade a 95 without any warning that the final grade cutoff would be adjusted -- of course I was in the low 90's and got a B.  Anyway, noone could understand him in class, the subject was just naturally easy once you figured out what you were doing.  So, everyone spent all lecture playing games on their laptops.
He was really fast in trying to get through class with as much information as possible.  Provided very thourough class with useful information.
He is a really nice guy but my god i cant understand a thing he says.
Very nice caring professor. One of the best I haver had
No Comments
No Comments

I LOVE PROF. MALAVIYA!He is the best professor and person I've ever met.More professors and people should be like him.He is so personable and I just love his amazing personality.I just want to give him a big hug everytime I see him.I aspire to be more like him in my personal/professional life. His friendly personality is inspiring. He's the best!!!
Awful mumbling indian professor who only confuses you more when you ask him something IF you can either a) hear him, or b) understand him.

Taking MAU with him for the 3rd time now.  He was abysmmal the first two times. This year he's teaching basics he never taught and giving new notes I don't remeber him giving. Also, either I'm getting used to his heavy accent, or he's worked on his english. Last year I would have rated him a 1.
VERY hard to understand, doesn't present material in a clear manner... seems nice enough, but i wish i had picked a better teacher
He is extremely difficult to understand.
...still waiting for that email
nice guys..really helpful..
looks like a confused chimp most of the time, but will do your work for you if you go to office hours
Impossible to understand. Seemed confused most of the time.

doesn't help students understand the material. he gave me half the answers to the microquizes while i was taking them. i've learned more of the course while taking hte open book test than from his lectures. the homeworks on "ilearn" are nearly i

Heard he used to be pretty good ... That's changed!  MAU stinks to begin with (unless you like statistics anyhow) but he makes it worse.  He tries sometimes but he's usually pretty unclear.  Seems like somethings not quite right upstairs?
doesnt return your emails.
he is aweosme if u dont take mau with him u r an idiot ... hes such a nice person
Does not cover course material well.  If he doesn't agree with the course coordinator he just doesn't cover the topic.  Did not cover the material at a level that prepared us for the tests
No Comments
was alright... ease of class made up for his lesser points
good dude...funny. HE LAUGHED AT ME TOO MANY TIMES!!
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
Nice and Helpful, but very heavy accent.
No Comments
end of every sentence trails off into mumbling, possibly a bit senile
Hard to follow lectures, extremely condescending when interacting with students and out of touch with the field.

Absolutely the worst prof ever.. overloads students with never-ending stream of homework, but never has time to finish marking everything and return on time. in fact, the midterms were not marked 1 week before the finals week. the notes were horrible, totally illegible and disorganised and outdated
An honest man who does his best. He's approachable and willing to help you when you have trouble. He teaches a tough subject and gets short changed in this forum.

DO NOT TAKE A CLASS FROM HIM EVER! I know a previous post says lowest grade he gives is a C. Not True, he actually failed me. Good thing the class is not needed.  Well I fail him too. He has poorly written lecture notes, too many assigned books, too many HW assignments, having incomprehensible due dates. Lecture material is way too scattered.
He can't really answer questions well.  If you ask him a question it seems like he can't answer it without bumping into you with his belly.
I can't understand a thing. Even the TAs couldn't understand a thing. The worse prof I have ever had. And I have finished with my undergraduate degree.

He gives you all the answers to the homework upfront. 2 take home tests for the semester that take literally 40 hours to do alone (and he doesnt give the answers to). Lowest grade he will give you is a C if you do all the work.
No Comments

If you have him, drop it, do it as soon as possible.  He seems smart, but he can't teach.  His classwork takes like 5 hours to do cuz he makes up ridiculously hard classwork problems when most people have classwork problems from the book and do them in class. He is a terrible professor.
he's really confusing and says um alot
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

WHATEVER U DO, DO NOT TAKE A CLASS WITH HENRY!!!!! HE IS HORRIBLE!!!GIVES CLASSWORK THAT IS NOT TO BE DONE IN CLASS (no other professor does this). He has an obsession with Maple and will make u do ur classwork, after u have done it on paper, in Maple.He is paid to hit enter on his keyboard and advance the powerpoint slide show. In a nutshell,SUCK

Yes his methods of teaching are very hard, and he goes into theory alot.  But there is a method behind his madness.  If you stick with him, you'll have a hard time keeping up, but you'll gain more knowledge and understanding than the other professors. IMO.

We just had our last test.  I learned more in a 1.5 hour review session with Tichy then I did in four weeks with this dumbass.  It's depressing to think what my grade could be if I didn't have this 'tard.
worst professor ever
Boring, he doesn't know the material, impossible to pay attention in class, and even if u could u wouldnt learn anything because he cant teach his way out of a paper bag
NOT HELPFUL AT ALL DURING CLASS AND SHOWED NO INTEREST IN BETTERING OUR KNOWLEDGE OF THE MATERIAL OR OUR PREFORMANCE
Worst Prof ever.  Run away!!!  NO SERIOUSLY!     He is horrible.
I wish I had dropped it...  It's not worth struggling just because he's a ****.  Make it up, change majors, drop out, anything but a class with Henry!!!!

He is the most condescending, self absorbed, pompus, arrogant **** I have ever met.  He knows nothing, but likes to say stuff that I swear he makes up half of the time.  Its funny when you catch him with a problem that he hasnt worked out before hadn because he has no idea.  Fire him!
No Comments
He's snaps his suspenders while the rest of the class wonders why they should even pay attention. He's retarded.
HE IS A AWFUL TEACHER.  AVOID AT ALL COSTS, EVEN IF YOU HAVE TO DROP IT AND TAKE IT IN A LATER SEMESTER!!!  DO NOT TAKE A CLASS WITH SCARTON!
Take away his teaching license
this guy can't teach at all

He sucks, I haven't learned anything in his class, I have to learn the material from a friend who has a different professor.  If he was as good as he thought he is he would be godlike.  Scarton is the biggest douche on campus.
Absolutely sucks
Cant explain topics well.  Makes you buy his notes which you cant read, and uses them as his lecture material. Doesnt explain anything.  Everyone does worse in his sections.
boooooooooo
hes a boy scout, but that doesnt mean anything in the engineering world.

I wish I could give a score lower than a 1.  Scarton is the worst, most cryptic professor I have ever had, bar none. Avoid him at all costs. He is arrogant, and makes it known that he thinks he's smarter than anyone else who has ever walked the earth.

do not take this class with him. he forces you to buy his notes which you cant read then proceeds to read them as his lecture. if you some ungodly reason you cant understand them he will get upset with you rather than clarify topics. worst prof. ever.
Reads aloud from his "textbook" which is both incomplete and more often incorrect than not.  Since I didn't understand him he deemed me Learning Disabled.  Avoid the plague like it's him.

Simple-he cant teach.  His lectures are horrible, his notes not legible, his derivations are pointless, his example problems are rediculous and do not prepare us for ANYTHING, and he gets mad when the TA's or other professors try and help/give hints.
No Comments

Horrible.  He gives computer problems that are already done, so you just do them out by hand, which is a pain.  His lectures are from his notes, which you can't even read.  His section avg's are 10 to 15 points lower than the other sections averages

Do whatever possible to not get this professor.  All he does is derive equations which you have in the notes he requires you to buy which are in the worst handwriting ever. Our averages are consistantly 10-20 points below other classes
Do not take his class if possible.  Impossible to read his notes, that are required.  Says things are 'simple' and never end up that way - EVER.
Yes, hes a bad teacher.  Everytime he says the word 'clearly', be prepared to hear the most abstract concept ever.  Good man though, hard hws and easy exams.
*Get out while you still can!!!!* He's nice but no teaching skills what so ever. I'm currently suffering in his class. But his grading fair: 85=A but be prepared to do a whole **** load of work.

Scarton is the worst professor out there - god help you people who're still taking this class with him - TAKE IT WITH ANDERSON - YOU"LL GET SO MUCH MORE AT THE END - AND U WILL LEARN AND UNDERSTAND SO MUCH MORE!!!
Scarton should not be allowed among Living beings.
Horrible Teacher.  Expects you to buy his hand scribbled notes that are completely unreadable.  has no concept of how to teach and uses every minute of class time to remind you how smart he is.
Bram is a super funny guy. Overall, a great person and teacher. He makes class interesting and it was surprisingly a fun class and I got way more out of it than I was expecting.

Professor Bram is excellent. He has a very deep knowledge of the material, and is clearly extremely passionate about the course and its content. Occasionally he overexplains things, so you may find yourself zoning out. However, altogether he's a superb professor for Logic. Only graded items are homeworks and quizzes, both of which are easy.
He is very responsive, replies quickly to emails and Webex messages. The quizzes are 40 minutes long, which isn't much time for 10+ questions. Overall, he's very nice and enthusiastic.
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Bram, as he likes to be called, is an engaging and interesting professor. Very passionate about what he teaches and that shows in his lectures. Often times there are videos or class participation so he is not just talking at you. Weekly quizzes reflect the lectures. I appreciate that he gave us essentially free rein for final project.

Bram is great. The more you participate the more you will learn from him. He does try to work in group activities a lot, but overall they are pretty painless if you put in a decent amount of effort. He tries to get to know his students outside the classroom and seems like a genuinely sweet person (his office hours are great)!

Bram is a very nice professor, who is clearly passionate about the class. There is barely any homework, but there are a couple group projects, including a presentation, and a paper, and he grades fairly. Minds and machines is definitely not just AI, but he makes some of the topics interesting in class and lecture.
He is really nice and gives great lectures
The professor is really nice but the assignments are pretty hard.
Great professor.

Very concise in his lectures and very helpful when it comes to homework and project feedback. Grading is lenient for the class, but it does require some effort. One problem I had is that during lectures, I struggled to keep my attention during lectures both online and in person, and I wish he adopted a more impassioned lecture style like John.

I didn't want to take this course until I saw Bram was the teacher but now I'm so glad that I did. He's a fantastic lecture prof and you don't even feel like you're being lectured at because everything he says is so genuinely interesting
Spend 5 minutes with the guy and you'll want to be a cog sci major.
Professor Bram challenges you to think critically and evaluate things logically. This was framed by the search for sentient robots.
Bram's lectures are engaging and he's always available during office hours or after class. He is well informed of the subject matter.

Bram is one of the best professors I've ever had.  His passion for the topics he teaches is contagious.  He's also just a really interesting guy! Absolutely take one of his classes if you can, and try to get to know him a bit too!  His classes are super interesting and a good break from the norms.
Bram is quite enjoyable to have as a professor. He is very entertaining when explaining new concepts and provides clear criteria for essays.

I've had Bram twice: once for Minds and Machines and once for Intro to Cognitive Science. In both classes he's awesome, entertaining, funny, and teaches interesting course material. Get into a class of his if you can.

Bram's an amazing professor.  Intermediate Logic (PHIL 4140) isn't as fun with him as Minds & Machines or Critical Thinking--it's his first semester teaching it, and Intermediate Logic is mostly about proofs, proofs, proofs rather than logic puzzles or more abstract logic--but I'd recommend any class he teaches.
Professor is good, sometimes hard to pay attention to some of the material. Be prepared to write some essays about topics that are not always the most interesting.
He's definitely one of the most fun professors. I had him my first semester in Minds and Machines and the course was relatively easy. He's interesting, funny, and knowledgeable.
My cognitive thought is that he is dreamy

Bram's awesome, but his Intro to Logic class is too easy. His other classes are more difficult. The question with blue eyed/brown eyed people is not a trick question. The Oracle speaks once and then disappears. You die an excruciating death if you are wrong about your eye's color on boarding. There's no sneakiness to it. It's just a logic question.

He knows what he is talking about. I mostly went to lecture to do the homework in class. The textbook is really helpful and go to the TA for help on homework. If you do practice problems you should do fine on quizzes. His online notes are useful. Going to class is optional, but I would go and do other work while half listening. He uses every minute
Excellent Teacher.  One of the best I've ever had.  Highly recommend for any class.

His teacher is just amazing!!! He is different (in a funny way) and he once let us out to have class outside on a hill. For the final project, he let some of us work on building and programming robots to solve puzzles! I will take as many of his classes to fulfill my Humanities + elective requirements
Bram rocks! Really easy class and he let us go outside for lecture sometimes.  Discussions were enjoyable.  Plus he learned everyone's names in less than two weeks.

This is a very easy class.  If you took discrete math, or had any formal logic proofs in high school, just show up for the lectures which introduce Fitch and you will be fine.  I didn't attend class 90% of the time and I got an A.
Good Professor, very clear and you don't have to go to the lectures, but they would probably help.
Very helpful when material becomes tough...2 extra help sessions brought me from thinking I would have to drop it to getting an A in the course and final exam.

Bram is the BEST teacher in the history of the world.  He has a box, and he gave me A's even though I didn't do jack.  I slept during most of the classes and was wicked annoying.  Also, he's hilarious and awesome.  Take any class he teaches.
Circular! Answered right answer too early, told me I was wrong until the end, where he concluded the same thing I said an hour earlier.
it's so easy... but sooo hard to care. dry dry dry. zzzzzz... i'm bored again.
made class fun and interesting
Funny guy, explains the material well.
Bram is one of the most helpful teachers i've had. He has a great way of explaining concepts and all three of the classes i've had with him have been great.
Interesting lectures, but the subject is such that you won't learn it from them.  Probably not Bram's fault.
first 10 weeks were repeat of hs - only thing i didn't care for was attendance requirement
I hated this class, nothing seemed to make any sense, and it was a logic class. I found the material more difficult to grasp than some of my Engineering classes....unfortunately.
Bram's got a box!!! His class was interesting and fun.
I was expecting to absolutely love the class, but I find it kind of dry - but maybe that's just me.  Be prepared to feel like an outsider if you are not Comp Sci, Comp Sys Eng, or just a plain nerd

By far, one of the most interesting and provocative classes I've ever taken.  Almost nobody in the class can stay quiet for the entire session, because you get so involved.  Oh, and do the reading--it's REALLY interesting.  Lastly, Bram ROCKS.
an excellent prof. we should have more like him, or make copies =P (ask him, he'll debate the copy-a-person thing for hours)
funny professor, good class, very easy if you are naturally smart
Take Logic with him. Easy grades, interesting class.
Bram is da bomb!!!!!!!!
No Comments
nice working on legos with him :o)
Bad handwriting, unhelpful office hours. Took this course in spring 2023 but review was taken down despite not violating guidelines, just gonna leave it as this

Professor Piper is really good at teaching math. He is really knowledgeable. If you go to lecture and take notes, you will learn the material. Homework is weekly and consists of 3 textbook problems. His tests are straightforward, if you work through his study guides you will be well prepared.
Very good professor, his second and third exams were harder. His 2010 was relatively good A. He even gave curve in final grade at the end and my friend and I went from A- to A.

The textbook was required for homework but you don't need to buy it. Grading is test heavy but he teaches everything you need to know. Prof. Piper hits every you need to know but doesn't explain concepts well and his handwriting is terrible.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: One of the best professors I've ever had. He makes difficult concepts seem trivial and helps build a genuine passion for the subject. I have never felt more interested in what I was learning in a class.
Awesome dude. He produces study guides before each quiz and exam. Be sure to do the assigned practice problems before the exams and you're golden.

Professor Piper does an EXCELLENT job teaching Number Theory. The quizzes and tests are very fair and he includes a study guide to help study for them. It should be noted that tests (3 exams and final) account for 80% of the grade so it is the majority of the grade depends on a few items.

I've had Professor Piper for 3 different classes MT4020/4090/MP4400. Lectures are not mandatory, but highly recommended since he does a GREAT job really explaining the material, but will also clarify in-detail if something doesn't make sense. He's also a bit silly. HW/tests are 100% fair, and provides study guides too. Office hours are a bit short.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Piper is really intelligent and knows his stuff, but his lectures can be really overwhelming. He kind of just gets up there and starts spitting out knowledge, so it can be hard to keep up. He's pretty lazy though so he grades pretty easy. The labs are really easy, and his homeworks are fair. Overall, he's okay and would recommend.
The class is really good. I can understand it very clearly.
Tough to understand. Would not recommend taking again.

Piper's tests are very reasonable but you need to go to class to know what to expect on the tests. If you do the book work and write down the examples from class he says are important, you will have seen every problem on the tests.
Nice guy but very mono-toned. Difficult to stay awake but I already took calc in high school so it wasn't too bad.

In high school, I used to be terrible at Calculus and hated the subject. After attending his lectures, Calculus finally made sense and I actually liked it. The tests are very straightforward and he even tells you exactly what will be on the test. He teaches at a nice pace with plenty of examples. A very good professor!
Very good teach, a bit boring, but easily understood. Tests arent too hard, and his class is worth going to.
piper makes everything harder than it needs to be. however, he is a nice enough guy and calculus isn't inherently difficult, so it doesn't really matter who your professor is.
Prof. Piper is definitely one of my favorite professors at RPI. He really challenges you, but the workload is reasonable and he's available for help if needed.
Good teacher, the material is hard the way he teaches it.

Decent teacher but lectures were very boring. He wasn't the best at explaining the why's and how's of concepts which led to issues in clarity, although the TA helped with that during office hours. Overall, not too bad but not nearly my favorite.

I'm surprised people rate Piper as boring, his Calc II class is my favorite class this semester.  His voice takes a little getting used to, but he is a very good calculus teacher.  The class moves fast and is not very easy, but it is good.
I had BP for 3 classes while at RPI.  He is one of the best professors I had in college.
His lectures are REALLY boring...his voice is monotonous.

One of my best classes, I have credit for the course already, but I do feel like I am gaining from the class. He speaks clearly, gives several examples and its a quick and dry, but easy to get through class.
good
very very dry. nice guy, means well, but sometimes is hard to follow...lectures very boring, but what math lectures arent?
This guy sucks... changed the textbook mid-semester, along with class format.  horrible teacher for this class
No Comments

Great professor! I used to have so much trouble with calc and now it's a breeze. He explains it well, and follows it up with examples. It's obvious that he's taught this class for many years and that he knows what confuses students and what doesn't. Great prof!

Piper is a great guy, BUT he talks to the board constantly. He is very structured and quizes you before the start of (almost) every class. Goes at a fast pace and difficult to understand many a times. Looks into his book instead of interacting with class.
good professor, a little boring, but teaches well. i had no problems with tests, though i actually went to lecture
I wasn't able to learn much from him.  Maybe he's good if you're already a great mathematician.
Great Prof, definitely recommend to take his class. Give out bonus points, but you do have to do(look over) a lot of suggested problems to prepare for test.
good prof, a litle boring, but good.
teaching method good, personality good
Math Analysis was the worst class I took at RPI
good man .. but BORING
Excellent and very caring teacher.  The required workload was not excessive, but he provided many optional problems to enhance your understanding.
Don't slack off.  Ever.  He's a great guy, and will help you when you need it, but you are expected to pull your own weight and then some.
Prof Piper is a really good teacher who is available for help often.

Believe it or not, with a drop-out of 47% it was less than the other section of this course.  Also had him for MATH4020 which was a more interesting course and as such had a drop-out of less than 10%.  Very clear and always willing to help.
No Comments
Best Math Professor out there
Great guy and very willing to help.  Definately one of the best in the math dept.
Great Prof.  Extraordinarilly flexible and helpful.   Horrible puns, though.
Hard grader but makes you learn stuff

Terrible teacher. The averages were almost always below 50 and he liked to point out how we should have done better because a small percentage of the class got A's on the Test, while never addressing the fact that over half the class failed the test and tried to say it was our fault that the grades where bad.

Took ochem 1 and 2 with him, and did fine.  GO TO CLASS! it really does help.  Reading the textbook clarifies lots of points that he often circles around, but you have to do the problems.  They are the most important part of the class.  Cutler is really good with explanations for how difficult of a subject ochem is.
If you enjoy being insulted on a daily basis, little to no out of class help, and tests that do not reflect lectures, this class is for you!

He definitely cares about his students.  He has many office hours where asking questions really helps! In the beginning of ochem I, I thought he was a bad teacher, but then I had Michael Aldersley and realized how much of a BETTER teacher Cutler is!Tests are hard, but if you work hard, it's fine.  Took ochem I with him and now in ochem II ;)

Prof Cutler is a very good lecturer. The trick to O Chem is keeping up with the reading /problems.  It helped me to READ every word of the text and do all in chapters problems while reading. Doing prep before the course helps especially Klein's Organic chemistry as a Second Language. Exams are hard, but not impossible, generous curve. I got an A-.
terribad

He's tough and expects students to put in a lot of work on their own, but he's not the horrible person these ratings make him out to be. He does care, somewhat, about students if they ask for help. Also, you leave this class with a ton of knowledge if you put in the effort.

material on tests is barely covered in class meeting with cutler one-on-one is mildly helpful..he is less rude but still doesn't help very much writes test questions exactly like he speaks..not with proper english not easy to understand

This is the worst professor I have ever had. He does not know how to write questions and his tests take most of time to just decode the questions. He does not help you in extra help just basically tells you that you are stupid. This man is really making me reconsider med school. The class started with over a 250 students and now has about 100.

Cutler is a decent professor who doesn't deserve all the horrible ratings that he gets. He is a bit impatient, and maybe even rude at times, but he does thoroughly go through all the material that are on his tests. He will sometimes avoid answering questions in class, but if you talk to him one-on-one he'll clarify any problems you are having.
he is a good teacher and explains things clear but unfortunately he doesnt really teach what is going to be on his tests...
Horrible professor. His teaching style is difficult to understand. The questions on his tests are weirdly worded. Try to avoid him.

This guy absolutely does not test on what he teaches. i learn more from the book than from anything he teaches. you can attend class every day, take perfect notes, and STILL fail his exams. there's a reason we call him prof.****ler. that explains it all
I understood next to nothing he said.  I tried super hard, but it was no use.  I dropped the class, my major, and became a successful high school math teacher instead.

Class was structured well. I learned a lot. He's not very helpful for office hours because he takes a long time to explain, but in the end it's ok. Overall, he's not that bad as people say, as long as you actually buckle down and do the work.

Oh my God!!! he told me that my major should not be called a major and that I should really consider doing something more useful with my time!!! plus he is arrogant and can't lecture at all... Avoid this man at all costs
No Comments
worst teacher i've had. ever. i dislike this arrogant, obnoxious man with all my heart.
I heard he used to be mean, but he's ok now. He seems to be willing to help anyone who puts in an honest effort. He's got a Boston accent that is kind of amusing.

Cutler is a difficult professor to work with, especially in a freshman chemistry class.  Go to his office hours early and often during the course of the semester.  Befriend the TAs, study at least a litle bit each day, and DO THE PRE-LABS whether they are do or not, as well as the POST-LABS.
THE WORST!!!  he teaches as if he's speaking to a room full of respected and award winning chemists.  He CANNOT bring things down to a level of student understanding.  And he's mean.
Sucks at teaching. Goes fast over things that are confusing, dwells too long on easy stuff
He cares about his students' learning.
He was rude, impatient, and just a poor example of an educator at any level
bla...not a good teacher at all, in face, he's a little mean, and he is not good at explaining things, it's better to go to the TAs for help
No Comments
CANNOT TEACH
Horrible, assumes everyone knows everything
It is clear that Prf. Cutler is an organic chemist...it is the only section of the curriculum that he seems to take interest in.

this man is satan. he is egotistical, self righteous, and many many profain words that rhyme with smastard. face it now. you are wrong. he is right. he told my class he was 'there to do research, not teach' i can't stress how much i hate him.

the class is not as hard as it seems. if you put in the work you will do well. he scares you that its hard but its not. lecture is a waste of time, he goes through it very fast i found it very tough to take notes and understand info right away
if you take this class just shoot yourself. its terrible, and the notes are bad, teh book is no supplement, as cutler frequently says that it is not germane to his in class teaching

He made this the worst class of my life. There's no effective way to study the course material. The book is no help. Each day's topic switches randomly. It was a terrible experience. Cutler, stay away from teaching.
terrible.  kind of like dennis hopper but slightly smarter and more confusing.  likes to make up words like specoscopy.
awful teacher
Don't do it!
take this class and it's a guarentee F on trans.
advice--dont even think about taking his class
No Comments
No Comments
he sucks
No Comments
No Comments
not as bad as everyone says but takes getting used to

Dr. Traldi is a kind professor, but this class (MATH4040) was just frustrating. The difficult nature of the course contributed, but half the class was lost. Homework is fair and she is helpful, but exams were challenging, even when they were made to be easy. I thought the class was just presented poorly, though I have heard good things from others.

Super sweet professor and extremely helpful if you go to her office hours. Weekly quizzes which means you actually have to go to lecture but they're a good grade boost. Exams sometimes are more difficult than they need to be which is unfortunate but overall not too bad.

Traldi is a great teacher and if you pay attention in lectures the class is not hard at all. It kinda sucks that almost 70% of the grade is based on exams, but the exams are fair and are true to what she teaches. She gives weekly quizzes that are not hard and help you prepare for exams. Homeworks are easily manageable. I'd recommend her.

Dr.Traldi is such a awesome teacher. She makes her lectures very engaging and she is very helpful during office hours. Although she gives quizzes every week, they are at most 1-2 questions related to the curriculum that REALLY help you boost your grade. If you have the chance, take her class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: This course is so hard, traldi is the worst teacher I saw in RPI

Required recitation attendance because of quizzes. If you do all the hw, the quizzes are not too bad. It is hard to revisit her notes after the lecture. If you pay attention in class, it's not too hard to do well. She is very understanding and a great person.

DO NOT TAKE. Exams are worth 70% of the grade and tend to not match the material covered in class/on homework. Professors refused to provide solutions to review problems (and were reluctant to provide those). Grading was extremely slow and little to no feedback was given. Lectures were awful and occasionally had errors that were never fixed.
Good professor for Calculus I & II. Really terriable for high level math course.

She has very clear and precise notes and goes over them in detail. Everything on the quizzes was from the textbook homework which was optional and the tests were very fair. She is a great professor the only thing is if you're a freshman taking multi-var, review calc 2.

Traldi is a very sweet and caring professor and I really enjoyed having her this semester. Her lectures are informative and she uses many examples to explain concepts. The homeworks aren't graded but it is important to do them if you want an A. Overall a great professor and I'm looking forward to taking more classes with her in the future.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Traldi is a fine professor but doesn't really teach for understanding but more so to remember a format. Lectures aren't terrible to listen to but looking at the notes independently is pretty difficult. The text books aren't very much help (at least the matrix algebra one isn't) so I would not recommend paying for it.

Though Traldi's mult required a lot of work, I learned a lot about calculus and linear algebra that weren't taught in other classes. Besides that, she's super kind and works hard to be accessible outside of class. Can't wait to take linear algebra with her in the Spring!

Awesome professor all around that understands that math can only be learned thoroughly with the use of examples. You will find that going to her lectures will flood you with examples of all sorts to ensure you are prepared for tests. 10/10 would take again.
Professor Traldi is the best professor I had by far. She is extremely caring and passionate about the subject she teaches and she teaches it well.
She's really as good as they say. Great explanations, clear notes, fair tests. And she's super sweet.

Very nice and caring professor. Does lots of examples in lectures and gives fair tests. The grading is a bit rough  but she is always accessible outside of class to help. Overall the best math professor I've had!
Professor Traldi is a good teacher with long but good lectures. She does a lot of example problems. All homework is on an online site called Achieve. Exams give partial credit and there is no final
Dr. Traldi is an amazing professor who's sensible in her grading as opposed to rigid and truly cares about her students

Dr. Traldi is a very kind and caring person. Unfortunately, this does not always translate into being a good professor, and she is a great example of this. She provides no review sessions or study material for exams and states what to expect on exams and does something different. In lectures, she has a talent for making very simple topics confusing

She is a very nice person who cares about teaching. But often she makes many mistakes during lecture in which students must correct her (she understands and admits when she is wrong, though). Her lectures also include a lot of material that we are never expected to know on HW/Exams.

A lot of people seem to equate being a great professor to a professor being a nice person. Sure Professor Traldi is nice but she cannot teach at all! It is very disappointing because I heard such great things about her. Her classes are dry, she seems to not even know her lecture material, and she expects you to basically be a math major.
Great professor, lots of office hours.
Nice professor.
Very fair and understanding.

Prof. Traldi is a fantastic teacher who really cares about all her students. I had a very good experience in her class. Her lectures and notes were easy to follow, though class could be a little slow at times. The only thing I didn't like about this course was the homework which often had many problems that were totally unrelated to class material.

One of the best professors at RPI, if not the best in the math department. Lectures are very thorough with a lot of examples to show applications. Dr. Traldi worked so hard to get the class engaged and we did not make it easy, but the time she put in made the lectures and hw so much more enjoyable. Highly recommend! (This is for Linear Algebra)
Wonderful professor

Professor Traldi is probably the best RPI math professor. She genuinely cares about her students and does her best to answer questions outside of class. On top of that, her notes are so clear that you will understand the material after reading it just once.
Loved her lectures and her notes. Lots of homework, but if you do it the exams will be easy

Such a nice person. The math department had just said that they would not be rounding up grades but I had a 89.9 something so I put in the webex chat that I was sad my grade wouldn't be rounded up. She went through my homework assignments and found a few more points for me so that I could get an A- in the class instead of a B+. Such a kind person.
really good and clear lectures, seems like she really cares about her students

Dr. Traldi is one of the kindest professors at RPI. She is so accommodating and helpful. She made a point to learn the names of all her students. On the last day of class, she was able to name everyone in the lecture hall. Her lectures can be a bit dry, however that is to be expected from an hour and a half calc lecture. Overall, a great prof.

Class was 80% exams, lecture notes were not the best as far as examples but they were very thorough on definitions. Be prepared to show every scrap of work you can think of on exams though... there have been many points lost for not showing enough work even when the question was simple enough to do it in your head.
She's very sweet, responds to emails rather quickly, and teaches very thoroughly. You have to study for the tests though because grading is tough

Traldi is wonderful. If you can understand a person with an accent just fine, I highly suggest taking her class. The textbook is only used for homework, practice before a test, and anything you might've missed. You can tell she really loves calculus and wants everyone to enjoy it as she teaches.
Overall great professor. Notes are always very helpful, posts them after the lecture incase you miss it. The tests were fair usually very similar to notes and homework.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: You can not attend lecture all year and still pass, which indicates how detailed her lecture slides are. If you decide to attend, her accent isn't hard to understand and she will end early, time permitted. She's witty, and funny, often cracking jokes about how her student attendance dwindles throughout the year. She understands and is there to help
Great prof who I would defiantly recommend. Has an accent but it is not bad and doesn't make the class hard to understand. Great lecture notes and will let us our early if we don't have a ton to do.

Great prof all around. Lectures are amazing, lecture notes are as well. Concepts are explained super thoroughly and everything is very easy to understand, only if you're willing to spend the time to learn. Obv calcII is not a breeze, just put the work in and you're good. The resources are there for you!

Professor Traldi is the best professor I had in RPI. She is super nice. If you have any questions, just email her, she will answer your questions soon. Sometimes, she may not see your email because she got lots of email from students, just email her again or go to her office hour. Her office hour is very helpful.

One of the best classes I've taken in the Math Department. We had homework almost every week but if you understood everything in the homework, you are good for the tests. If you have any questions, ask her. She is very generous and is always willing to help her students out. I would 100% recommend this class

She explains her lecture notes very clearly, not just reading off her notes, but actually explaining more of the concept's application & all the related terms and details. She explains in simple language so that we can really understand the terminology and concepts. She's also super nice and cares about her students' wellbeing!

Professor Traldi is a great professor. She's always willing to help her students with any questions they have. Her office hours were very helpful (but there's a lot of stairs). Her lectures could be a little dry at times but she actively engages the lecture hall by asking the students questions. No need to buy the textbook, she posts HW online.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: there was a lot of not mandatory homework but the quizzes were basically homework questions with different numbers. The tests were straight forward and similar to homework. If you go to office hours she is the sweetest lady ever, she will remember your name and will prob be a nice grading your assignments.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: I appreciate how Dr. Wozny is always willing to make time to help students even though he's busy being the ECSE department head. Explains concepts slowly but very thoroughly. Actively encourages study groups.

Signals is a tough class with lots of HW and quizzes. Wozny is a good professor who's been teaching for a long time, so he knows how to teach his course. He cares about his students and likes interacting with them so if you're stuck, just ask for help. Keep paying attention and you'll do alright. Miss class and signals might suck for you
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I took Signals and Systems over the summer and I think Prof. Wozny is one of the best professors at RPI! He makes the subject understandable. While he gave out a lot of works, it was all helpful in better understanding the concepts.
I took Signals and Systems in the Summer. He gave SO MUCH work. However, he explains everything clearly and is a really good professor.
Hard, but you will learn a lot.

Really tough class. If you can make it through, you will be grateful that you did. Best professor I've ever had not because it was easy (it was brutal), but he really knows his stuff and it makes all makes sense at the end I promise.

Signals and Systems is known to be ruthless, but many people do not consider how awful the course would be if any other professor at RPI were teaching it. In my opinion, Prof. Wozny has already structured the course to be as painless as possible. So everyone please relax, just be happy that homework doesn't come from our textbook.

Had him for Signals and Systems. He refuses to use overhead projectors and generally talks to either the chalk board or just the right side of the room. He generally doesn't progress in a linear manner but goes back in forth referencing things he had written earlier because he forgot to explain something.

Had him for signals and systems. Took a while for me to understand the concepts, but I eventually did. Did below average or equal to class average for both tests, but ended up getting a B in the class.  He depends too much on video lectures to help fill in the gaps. I did enjoy the material and e did apply most concepts to real life.

I didn't enjoy Signals and Systems with him in the slightest. He never seemed terribly interested in helping people to do well in the course - very "take it or leave it" attitude. His tests and homeworks were very difficult, and my semester he resorted to exams that were almost entirely multi choice! It was just terrible. Not recommended.
Lots of homework and quizs. Be prepared to work very hard.
He is one of the worst professors I've learned from he never explains himself good and goes way too fast bevliving the video lectures will substitute for it
Horrible at teaching material. Be prepared to learn everything by yourself. Goes WAY too fast!

I took signals with wozny in Spring 2009. GO TO OFFICE hours!! The homeworks are very similar to how they were in previous semesters. Wozny is actually not a bad teacher. And he is a nice guy. If you go to class,pay attention, and take notes, you'll be fine. If you go to his office hours and he sees that you are trying and he gets to know you, you'
If you want to learn concepts there is no one better.

Professor Wozny despite being a congenial guy is a hard professor to learn from. He is very much an analytical instructor and explains things using math or equations most times which is generally not conducive to understanding the material conceptually. I feel Desrochers is definitely easier to learn from as he prepares printed notes.
I took signals and systems with him. He had to attend a conference and made a video for the lecture. During the video, he would look up from the projector and ask, ¨Are there any questions?¨

Ignore all these bad ratings. Wozny is an excellent professor. If you go to class, pay attention, and work, the class will be a breeze. Wozny ties the class to real life scenarios. Easily one of the best teachers I have had. I got an A with a bit of work and studying.

I've learned nothing except how badly Wozny explains things. 2 or 3 skew the curve and wozny will look at it and think "Oh, most of the class isn't studying enough, but these two or three guys did ok, so I must be teaching fine. I should treat myself to a night of wine tasting" Then he'll email at 2am, when its due at 8am.

Cannot seem to write out his notes on a chalkboard without making it look almost unfollowable, even if you pay attention to him. Often gives homework on barely covered material, assuming students can master advanced material through arduous study of basic examples. Administers I-clicker quizzes, is frequently baffled when ~35/53 get questions wrong
HAND WAVING IS NOT TEACHING. told useless stories and didn't always finish his examples. assigned homework on things we hadn't learned yet.

Seems to show up 10mins late every class. Won't go over previous homework. No exam reviews. Has taught the material for homeworks after they were due. Once gave a quiz full of errors, admitted he finished making it after a wine tasting.

Assumes students have already taken the course he is "teaching". At least this is the only explanation I can come up with for the quality of his teaching. Sadly signals and systems is not a prerequisite for signals and systems. Otherwise test average might break 60s. Some kind of review wouldn't hurt either. And then there are the clicker quizes...

Can't teach his way out of a paper bag. Gives homework on material that he may or may not have even touched upon, then sends notes in an email thinking that this is sufficient for concept mastery. Entire review for the first exam consisted of: "You have an exam on Wednesday".  Unsurprisingly the average was a 55%. Lessons have no direction.

Great instructor.  He teaches the most important undergrad class in the department very well.  He ensures that students have a firm grasp of the basics before moving on to more advanced topics.  He explains how to do things AND why things work the way they do.  He has a tendency to drift off-topic from time to time, but the stories are interesting.

One of the best professors at RPI.. Very well thought out lectures.. Easy to get lost if you miss a couple of classes, but same thing with any other class.. If you are in college to actually learn something, you won't regret taking any of his courses.

He has great office hours, and is very helpful when you ask him the right questions. He is a little crazy when it comes to the chalkboard; you can catch him finish writing something on the board at one end of the room and then drawing an arrow to connect it to something he wrote on the other side of the room 15 minutes ago. Great guy though!

He's a good teacher if you like learning concepts and not practical uses. Refuses to do examples, so most of the time you look at a HW and don't know how to do it. If you ask him in class he'll start doing it then say "you know how to do this" and stop.

Looks like Santa Claus, and has a low, monotone voice that puts you to sleep.  However, f you can get past that, he is a GREAT teacher and does an excellent job of explaining the material.  Plus, when I had him, he did video presentations on the course webpage, which were a MILLION times better than reading the textbook. (and better than class, cuz if you fall asleep you can just rewind it.)
Best prof I've had at rpi. Teaches very well and cares for his students. Puts a great deal work and effort in course material outside of class to help his students as much as possible.

Actually cares how the students preform.  He is one of those few professors that is very bright and can actually explain the material so the students can understand.  I learned so much in this class due to him.
Best teacher at RPI...He should be running this place
Hands down the best professor at RPI.  Very helpful

Absolute best professor I've had at RPI in the four years I've been here.  Greatest person in the ECSE department, hands down.  Yuksel, Desrochers, Sikdar and Roysam should learn from Wozny on how to be a professor. JERKS!
Excellent professor.  Knows what he's doing.  Will go into more depth with anything if you ask.  Wants students to get the basics, THEN build on them.  Highly recommeded!
Had him for signals and Computer Graphics. He teaches so well.
Totally awesome teacher.  Devoted to his students, I don't think he ever goes home.
Does a good job of making Signals & Systems bearable.  Is not the best at making Computer Graphics lectures interesting or worthwhile.
Briliant teacher.  Helpful and dedicated to teaching the students/
He is very helpful in his office hours.  He really wants the students to succeed.  The material is very hard, but he gets you through it.
had him for graphics too... was much better in signals but overall was extremely helpful considering the difficulty of the subject matter
Extremely helpful, and cares a lot about student learning. An exemplary example of what a Professor shoudl be.
No Comments

Amazing person who is very caring towards students. While attendance was not mandatory I would 100% tell you to go to class otherwise the concepts become confusing. Overall, a great professor and class.

MATH 2400 is diffeq.
Fantastic lecturer, everything makes sense. 
However, the exams (and the final) were extremely difficult. Strongly recommend taking another professor; all their exams are pulled from homework or quizzes and are much simpler.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Kam is fantastic. She is very knowledgeable and a very kind professor. She always does her best and it really shows. I really liked her explanations, and she would also drop little jokes and stories here and there to make the class more fun. If you have to take DiffEq, I would definitely recommend it with Kam.

Kam's lecture style is very fast and wasn't the best fit for me. She is a great professor nonetheless, but the HW pretty much taught me the class.
There are quizzes at recitation. 
Exams were difficult but weighted so your best one counted more and your worst one least.

Dr. Kam is a very good lecturer but falls short on every other aspect. The quizzes were fine. However, the homework was usually confusing and the exams were extremely difficult. The final was only 10 multiple choice questions with no partial credit. She also refused to curve any grade even though her class avg was lower than every other professor.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I love Dr. Kam with my whole heart. She's my favorite professor I've had at this school and she's an amazing lecturer. Although the lectures aren't mandatory, I highly highly recommend going to them. Dr. Kam is so funny and really wants you to succeed. I haven't experienced that from anyone else.
Great Professor

Professor Kam is a really good person and a decent teacher, but there were a few things I didn't like. In my opinion, the exam questions (especially the final) had questions that were much harder and had questions that we basically never talked about in class. Also, there was only a crib sheet allowed on the final and tests take forever to grade.

Extremely good at teaching DiffEqs concepts, never felt like I didn't understand something in the class. HW has random difficulty spikes (spent 8 hours on one assignment), but you don't lose credit for wrong answers. Exams have extremely slow grading, but are fair and mostly cover content emphasized on in lecture. Altogether a fantastic professor.

Elizabeth Kam is by far one of the best math professors on campus. Her lectures are very engaging and she posts her notes for you to see after each class (very easy to follow if you didn't attend). She is a very kind and understanding professor and she is always there for you if you need help with something! Loved having her this semester.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Most of my peers in other schools would say diff eq is awful. Kam made diff eq extremely fun for me. Absolutely the best class I've taken at RPI and the best professor I've had. Fantastic lectures, notes were easy to understand (though attending helps to understand it more). Just do the homework, do some practice, and exams will be a breeze.

kam was the best lecturer in math department, her class was so easy that you can only read the note to understand, because the attendance was not mandatory. The online homework system was stupid, It will waste you lot of time to correct the form of answer. For her class is easy to get A, if you get good grade in exam.

Her TA sucked. His grading was the biggest reason why I probably didn't do as well as I should've, since his feedback was nonexistent. Other than that, Kam is a fantastic professor. She cares, is accessible, and will answer any question no matter how simple. Her tests reflect the lectures, but her notes are somewhat hard to follow once leaving.
An awesome professor and a great lecturer. Do attend the lectures though, her notes can be hard to understand if you try to understand them outside of class for the first time.

Kam as a professor is amazing, and she has great lectures, but honestly, the TA for her sells the class. He grades (takes off points) extremely harshly and gives off random points, and leaves alot of students confused on what they got wrong, for the average RPI student, leniency is much appreciated, but not offered alot in the class. My opinion ofc

Kam is a great lecturer, but definitely go to lecture, she explains the notes in a way that is easy to comprehend. She makes class entertaining and uses the time well. Exams and quizzes are fair, very similar to hw and class examples.

Dr.Kam is not only the kindest woman I've ever met but her class is also the most straight forward math course I've ever taken! Lecture notes are extremely detailed and organized, exam questions are straight from notes, & quizzes were made optional about 1/2 way into the semester. Just watch out for the eigenvalue HW (mastering sucks not her fault)

Good lectures, although sometimes she uses analogies that make things more confusing. Went over time by 5 minutes or so for about half the lectures. Homeworks were really annoying because of the terrible online software, but she agreed to drop one that nobody could get the answer format right on. Offers bonus questions on exams.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Kam does a thorough job of explaining all concepts and methods. She assigns weekly homeworks and quizzes, but they are fairly light and are always directly related to the lecture material. The textbook for this class is really cheep if you wanted to buy it, but she provides the questions for you on blackboard anyways. Overall a great professor.

Dr. Kam is an amazing professor. She posts her notes after every lecture which are crystal clear. Homeworks are done on Pearson, usually 8-10 shorter problems that are due every 2 weeks (plenty of time to do them). Her exams are very straightforward, usually just iterations of past homework/lecture problems. Extra credit is even available on tests!

Dr. Kam is a great lecturer. She has very clear notes and explains every single step of every single example problem. Tests are exactly what she says they will be, and she wants students to do well. Homework isn't excessive and she does not require a textbook. I don't even feel like I need a book because her explanations are great.
Best math professor.
Really clear on grading criteria, easy to learn.
Dr. Kam is super helpful and thorough in teaching. Never assesses on any information not covered in lecture. Also a very generous grader when it comes to grade breakdown.
She's enthusiastic about teaching and really wants you to succeed.

Dr. Kam is easily the best prof you can have for Diff Eq. A lot of fellow students failed Cramer/switched from his section into Kam. She has very thorough notes and always goes back for questions. She also gave me fist bumps before every exam. Ends up lowering the exam percent of lowest exam and raising highest. Drops lowest 2 HW and quiz grades.
Took differential equations with her. Great professor with great lecture notes. Gave bouns questions on every exam. She doesn't want anyone to fail.

Dr. Kam cares if you understand the material, and is accessible outside of class if you need it. She is funny and explains things well. My only critique is that she goes quite fast sometimes and it's hard to keep up when taking notes. However, she posts her notes after class, so you can go back and fix them. Helpful study guides for tests.

Elizabeth Kam is not only my prof for this class but also my advisor and I believe she is one of the greatest professors I have ever had. The amount of joy and excitement she has for teaching is staggering. She is always able to help a student out and has confidence in everyone to succeed. I am very grateful to have her as a professor :D
Professor Kam genuinely tries to make sure all of her students succeed. One of the best professors at RPI.
Overall, she is a good professor. Her teaching skill is okay, but she is approachable after the class. Test is fair. However, you do need to watch out for which TA you are getting.
Lectures are well-organized, exams aren't difficult, and if you've stopped believing in humanity, Dr. Kam will change that.

The best professor! She is very patient to everyone. The lectures are awesome. It is easy for you to get A if you attend every lectures. The notes are good and useful. You will learn knowledge and get good score!

You don't need to show up as long as you look at the examples and do them. For the quizzes, the TA will go over the weekly material. For exam just do the practice problems until you know how to do them by heart and you'll do great.

Kam is probably one of the easiest Math professors to take, attendance is not mandatory (you can look at her notes online), and she is a pretty fun and bubbly person in lecture. Since she's obviously acquired a PhD in Mathematics, some topics she might breeze by too fast because she does the calculations in her head, but an easy A. Do extra credit!
Nice Teacher!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Dr. Kam is truly an awesome professor. Probably one of the best Ive had. She really cares about your education and your wellbeing, both in/out of school. You can tell she actually cares for her students and will do anything to help you understand the topic. Lectures are straightforward & you can print the notes before class go follow along. 10/10

Great, caring professor with lowkey hilarious asides during her lectures which are very helpful. Tests are straight out of the homework and study guide. Quizzes are straight out of the lecture. Great class, would take again.

Dr. Kam is incredibly intelligent and very kind. Her exams are short and sweet and you're never graded unfairly or on anything you didn't study. Her passion for math and teaching is very clear by how much she explains and how willing she is to help anyone that asks for clarification.

Kam is truly a real gem. She cares about all her students and posts all her lecture notes online, whether you want to print them out before and fill them out with her, or print out her filled-out ones after. Her tests are also remarkably less difficult than other professors, but are accurate in determining your understanding - and have Xtra Cred.
