One of the few classes I would always look forward to - always made it interesting
I played volleyball for an A.  Doesn't get much easier than that.
I enjoyed his class. I dunno. It was fun & easy.
Best HCI Professor. Ever!
Very relaxed classroom atmosphere, flexible teacher,
funny guy, laid back, cool class

Great and funny human being. Lectures also were great, he does lots of videos and slides but his commentary adds to content. Not too difficult either, just memorize slides/video details and you will be golden on assessments. Homeworks are not too challenging either. The final group project is also pretty fun.

Really surprised to see all of the high reviews for Dr. Farrell... To be perfectly honest a majority of the questions came out of nowhere on his quizzes/exams. Best advice I can give is to get back exams as studying the PowerPoints shown in class will not help you. Asked for help with the final for office hours and was given nothing...
rating_tags: Tough grader--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Really awesome professor! I despise biology, but he made the course fun, and a little more bearable. Quizzes and exams were easy as long as you have the back exams and/or go to lecture.

He is a very funny and respectable person however for an introductory biology course, I do not think I would have done well had I not taken AP Bio previous to his class. He likes to test on current events that he mentions briefly. That being said, it is a easy class just requires note taking on what he talks about in lecture.

Dr. Farrell's passion makes even the most dull of topics interesting, to the point where it was disappointing when he ended class early. His lectures covered the material effectively and he made efforts to relate the content to other majors. Exams were fair and assignments encouraged us to think beyond the material while not being too difficult.

His exams and quizzes are very straight-forward if you actually pay attention during lecture. Lots of flexibility with attendance and homework. Exams are typically 50 multiple choice questions. Optional final exam to replace your lowest exam score. Dr. Farrell isn't the sweetest, but he was always willing to help and gave lots of hints for quizzes.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Class is not hard, but it is not easy. Quiz and test questions come from obscure moments in a video he showed once in lecture. If it is possible to take someone else do it. Overall he rubbed me the wrong way and I never felt comfortable near him. Beware, he takes his shoes off in class.

Is not helpful or accommodating to mental health issues while himself being neurodivergent, and using it as an excuse to speak poorly of and degrade students. Class is not hard, but it is not worth your time to spend with him.

Farrell seems to not underestand everyone in his class is forced to take BIOL1010. His class consists of watching youtube videos and giving multiple choice tests and quizzes on a bunch of useless biology facts. If you're looking for an easy A, go on right ahead. This class is an absolute waste of everyone's time.

Homework is due at 5 pm the day before class- this is only an issue when I have classes until 5 pm. On a few occasions, I submitted class reflections, only to see them ignored and entered as zeros. After asking about this, I was told that too much time had passed after submission & it could not be fixed- they are worth a large number of points.

Clear as to class expectations. Lectures were seldom unengaging or boring. Clearly wants his students to have a full understanding of the material so they can excel. If you pay attention in lectures, and study good notes you should do well. Quizzes often had some questions that seemingly came out of nowhere but were easy enough to do well overall.
He is very good at teaching this class and shows that he likes to teach it.

Dr. Farrell's passion for the material he teaches will be apparent the moment you enter his room. It reaches a near infectious point (says someone who's switching their focus from cybersecurity to ecology thanks to him). Lectures can be a bit drawn out but attending them is absolutely worthwhile. If you like lakes, he'll be your new best friend!

Prof. Farrell was a very good professor. His communication was clear, and his presentations are a great resource to study from. The material covered in class was also genuinely interesting. My only point of contention is that his quizzes were much harder than expected, and the questions in them were sometimes worded poorly.

BIOL-1010 is a lecture-heavy class, and unfortunately I often found Prof. Farrell's lectures to be boring and drawn-out. He is a nice person and a fair, quick grader, but I wish I had been more engaged in his class. BIOL-1010 is not a hard class, but you really need to know all details in the lecture slides. Anything in them is fair game for exams.

dr. farrell is a really funny and knowledgable guy. his lectures aren't painful to sit through, and you can tell how passionate he is about biology. it really makes a difference. i will say exams and quizzes are way more difficult than i expected. make sure to study all of the details of each powerpoint.

Farrell is super funny and sweet. Lecture wasn't particularly interesting but it was easy to follow. You don't really have to come to class but he has questions on LMS at the end you need a "codeword" for (that he shares in class). Tests and quizzes are harder than expected, be sure to review even the smaller details. Overall easy course.
Farrell is hilarious, but pretty absent minded. It's really a matter of making sure that you're on top of your own work and studying for the tests if needed. The tests/quizzes are TOUGH
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Hilarious

comment: Overall, an amazing professor who puts his all in teaching a subject he very much loves.
Truly loves the class and what he's teaching. Takes in a lot of feedback and gets to know students. Can be energetic at times and excited about topics.

Awesome professor for Bio and non-Bio majors. Very clear and concise lectures, if you give feedback on what you learned in class you receive extra credit for each submission, 1-2 easy group presentations, and tests came straight from the presentation videos and back work. If you ever have to take Biology, go with this professor!

Dr. Farrell is one of my favorite professors at RPI! He's chill, funny, and nice, but also smart and really into the content which makes class enjoyable. Homework is to just read the book and exams are easy if you study. Fun research paper and presentation projects. He really cares about student feedback; if you have a concern, let him know!

Great professor! He is invested in his students and really cares about teaching. He is also easy to talk to, approachable, funny and is willing to help in any way he can. Tests were fair and came directly from powerpoints.
I love him <3
Great guy, great prof. He makes sure everyone, regardless of major, is invested in the material and he does his best at making sure you do well by giving pretty obvious hints as to what to study.

Took his biology course as a comp sci major because of a department requirement. He actually made the course material interesting. Show up, watch the quality videos he shows in class, and either read the powerpoints or listen to his lectures and you'll have an easy time.
His quizzes and exams come right from his lecture slides. Make sure to rewatch the videos he shows in class because some questions come from there too

Farrell is fantastic. His lectures are long, filled with videos, and good class notes are important, but if you get to know him he is a great guy and really cares about what his students think about his performance.
Professor Turner cares very deeply about RCOS and really does his best to ensure student success. He creates a very welcoming and collaborative environment in which open source projects thrive.

Overall great experience, wrote my first line of code in this class and it really developed my love for the discipline as a whole. Homeworks can be time-consuming, but nothing out of the ordinary for a cs course at RPI, level of rigor is just right imo. Prof Turner is also a great guy, pretty engaging during lecture, would recommend.

I have only had Professor Turner for RCOS, so I cannot speak on other classes, but he has always been an excellent professor who is very nice, caring, and respectful. He runs a very fun class while also having it be very useful and informative for students
A lot a lot a lot of reading the textbook to understand
Lecture wise probably the best I've had so far at RPI. Assignments and exams are pretty fair if you put in the work. Not much to complain about. Solid guy.

Professor Turner is a cool dude. He tells dad jokes every class, and they're awful yet funny. CS is hard, but he does his best to make it better. He is really good in office hours and in online replies on Submitty. The course content is boring (naturally, not his fault), but his explanations are good.

Firstly, this class is NOT an intro class. As someone who came into RPI not knowing a lick of code, it was extremely difficult to grasp this class, theoretically. Prof. Turner is a cool guy and all but the speed of his teaching is not easily adjustable. ALAC tutoring is available but always crowded and provides limited help
Never, ever take this class! It's homework > rest of homework
love em
Failed to teach me anything substantial

The class I had with Prof. Turner was meant to be a class you can take if you've never coded before however I don't believe this is the case. The class was challenging even for someone like myself who has been coding for a few years. The tests are very nit-picky and it is almost impossible to get a 100 even if you are near perfect in other sections
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: CS 1 with Prof. Turner can be tough. For my year, he used pre-recorded video lectures in place of live classes, and it created a major disconnect between him and the students. Often, explanations of concepts were not very clear or engaging. Prof. Turner is a nice person, and he cares about this class. He will not hesitate to help you if you ask.

He is a horrible professor. I recently just finished taking his class, barely passing, and feel that I have learned nothing useful or valuable from him. He used pre recorded lectures and used his actual lecture times, in which he was supposed to be teaching, as Q&A, which were not helpful at all. Failed to teach me anything substantial

Honestly this was the hardest class I have ever taken and it wasn't like I was not putting in the effort. I was spending about 30-35 hours from monday-thursday just on Comp sci alone with 0 progress/learning anything. The lectures didn't help and notes barley helped. Overall this is one of those classes that students have nightmares about. Horrible

I had Professor Turner as both a student and now a TA for the same class. He is honestly still one of my favorite professors. Lectures can drag if you have CS experience, but he tells jokes. Once in class I asked a question and didn't understand his answer, so he found me after class and reexplained it for me. All-around caring guy.

I took Comp Sci 1 P/NC as a science major just to get a taste for it. Prof Turner seems nice and caring and has a great sense of humor, but I got NOTHING at all from lectures or labs. Homeworks were difficult and time consuming. Tests were hard when I took it, so we were given massive curves. Overall, I probably would've taken this course elsewhere
So far the best lecturer I've ever seen. the exams and homework are not easy, but they all look far from tedious.

Lectures were useless for me. Taught myself pretty much the entire class. Best part about the class is the homework. There's a lot of it, but it's helpful and, unlike the tests, useful. Tests are hard, and they use weird, arbitrary examples. Poor tests of programming ability, imo.
Very flawed course. Exams are very hard and everything is toughly graded.

Wish I was exaggerating by saying he is the worst instructor I have ever had. Has no idea what he is doing half of the time, the wordings of homework and test questions are terrible, and no useful instruction is given. Sometimes he literally just posts he wrong thing. Anticipating an A-, but terrible experience getting there. Nothing good to say.
CS 1 is pretty easy. Not the best lecturer but got through the content. Homeworks were regular but pretty easy.
Professor Turner is the best CS1 prof! He stayed well past his posted office hours on numerous occasions to help this lost freshman debug their code. The mentors and TA's are wonderful.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: A lot of work, get ready for 12 hours a week for homework, lab, lecture exercises, and studying for exams. He is funny though and good lecturer, and knows the material.

Turner is an extremely caring professor and is always trying to help students. Lectures are decent. You should review them first if you want to have a better grasp of the material. They can and should be boring if you prepared for them. Turner provides all the necessary materials to succeed you just have to put the work in. Tests aren't the easiest

Hes not a terrible lecturer, but the problem overall with the class is that its hard to take notes about coding. A lot of times he will use things in examples that people who have never coded before dont know.

He was my favorite professor ever. I completely respect him and his teaching style. he is funny and caring. If you ever need help his door is always open and he will help to the best of his ability. If you can take his class you should. 100/100 :)

He's pretty funny usually his jokes are really corny but he tries. He gives great examples and he even provides print outs of the notes at each class so you can grab a copy. He's super nice. Realizes the class is hard if you don't have prior experience and gives lots of examples.

If you've done programming before, especially Python, this will probably be easy for you. I struggled the whole semester, but Turner was extremely helpful. I visited him a few times in office hours and he was able to explain even the most difficult concepts I was having trouble with. He cares a lot about his students. Take in the spring for curve.

He is a overall decent professor. His lectures are okay, but, similarly to most CS classes, the majority of the material is learned through homework. Tests are kind of difficult, but they don't count as a lot relative to other classes. He also can't seem to get through a lecture without at least one corny joke.
Straightforward lecturer with coding examples and tangential intro to higher level programming topics. Usually tells 1-2 corny jokes in the beginning of each lecture.
Very good professor. Yale Ph.D. Knows what he is doing

Bases lectures on very clear and helpful slides which he elaborates on and clarifies very well. Is extremely knowledgeable and can clearly answer any question. The work is difficult, but fair, with no surprises. Seems like a nice guy and has an awesome (but easy to understand) accent. Favorite class in CS so far (doesn't say a ton but still...)
Professor Drineas' lectures are both clear and exact.

Very good at portraying information. Slides online for entire semester, and writes the notes then goes through the slides for double reinforcement. Strong accent, but easily understandable. Very approachable.

He's great at teaching the material, but he teaches a subject that's really hard for most students, and he doesn't give much leeway with grading.  His accent is crazy, but easy enough to understand.  Some semesters he assigns less work, try to get one of those: the homework isn't very helpful, and the projects are worthless.
A very good professor. Attractive, too.
Lectures were pretty good - questions answered during office hours - tests were reasonable except there's no partial credit! The TA's grade way too harshly and the homeworks are impossible.
hotttness  :o)
sometimes hard to understand because of his accent, but, other than that, a pretty good prof

Course material presented well, but professor took a hands off approach to grading, and left it to incompetent TAs. Exams were rather difficult compared to HW's and material actually taught (applied mathematics). Result ...a MASSIVE curve put on the class at the end of the semester.

Very clear lectures, good at teaching the material. Always seems kind of angry though when people get things wrong, but he will take time to explain things and answer questions well. And his accent is fun
He looks like a Greek older version Jimmy Fallon.

This class can be pretty confusing but I found that actually paying attention in lecture made it alot easier.  Its a hard class but he teaches it pretty well.  I had more problems with the homeworks than the tests.

His tests are rediculously difficult and he doesn't give partial credit on exams.  He does, however really know how to teach and knows how to get the material across to the class, unfortunately labs and homework don't reflect the lecture.
No Comments
Teaches well. Learned a lot but the tests are hard, so be ready to study. You learn a lot from lecture, so don't skip. Hw is difficult but feasible. Overall, a good professor.
Good Professor, he knows his stuff. Easy to understand.  Difficult, but not impossible.  Homeworks took a considerable amount of time but covered the material well.

An excellent professor overall.  Its not exaggerating when I say I learned more from him in the first lecture than in the entire year with Prof. Hardwick (CS 1).  Tests are hard, but curved, and the homeworks/labs truly help to understand concepts.
Definitely has an accent, but does a good job presenting the information clearly. Tests are difficult, but looking through his lectures prepare you pretty well
His undecipherable Greek accent, poorly-written homework instructions that leave you wondering what the hell he wants you to do, and his difficult tests are all reasons he was never meant to teach.
Good Teacher. Does an awesome job of explaining in lecture and, if you attend his office hours, he will give you tons of help. The tests are difficult but if you study, you'll be fine.
He is a demanding professor, and yes he does resemble a lizard. Most people come out of his exams brain dead. But he's cool guy.
All I have to say ehhhhhhh
One of the better CS prof's I have had
No Comments
Looks like a lizard.  Class is  fool  of boring  exit signs.
No Comments
No Comments
Very good professor. Can help every student carefully.

I have never had a teacher as passionate about his students than Professor Pindaro. Not only is he passionate about his subject, but he helps you learn about accumulating capital, starting a business and being in the top 6% your whole life. A true inspiration. Other lally staff should observe the way he teaches and follow in his steps.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: He was awesome, super great teacher and passionate about what he was teaching.
One of the best Professors I've ever had. He is passionate about what he does and he cares about his students. He is a very nice guy and a great teacher.

As long as you actually do and hand in homework on time, the class is an easy A. The first test can be a bit tough, however, the tests weigh little compared to the assignments you submit every class. Pindaro is super helpful; one of the best professors.

You will want to show up to this class every day. The man is an inspiration to his students. Tests are fair, and you must keep up with assignments as they come in order to succeed. Expectations are clear: show up, participate and do the work. Keep doing you professor Pindaro.

Pindaro has been my favorite professor at RPI so far.  His class is incredibly helpful and he makes you apply your skills in a real world project at the end of the semester which looks great on your resume.  He is incredibly helpful and genuinely wants to see all his students succeed.  He gives lots of extra credit and is a great guy.
Very clear and helpful !!

One of the best in RPI. Such a great clarity in lectures and a genuine industry expert with  decades of experience of what he teaches in class. I would recommend this Professor's classes for all future MGMT students who needs to take a course on Data Management.

Dr. Pindaro is the best professor I have ever had. He is so nice and very understanding to every problem that I might have. He helps you inside and outside of the class, and makes sure you feel appreciated. I have never heard a mean word come out of his mouth, and his teaching style is great. If you do the tutorials and get B's on the test, easy A.
Best prof at RPI
Best Prof ever

He's probably the best professor I've had at RPI. I hate technology. I had it not been for him teaching the class, I wouldn't have gotten an A. He is extremely helpful and clear. I almost wished I liked IT after taking his class.

Every management major will invariably have to take this class, but what you get out of it is MUCH more important. Pindaro inspired me to pursue my dual major in IT (MIS), which is what the overall structure of the class really represents. You're only working with MS Access & Excel--excellent precursor to getting into the IT field. Highly recommend
What an amazing professor. Learnt so much practicable material. Cares so much about his students. Also genius in disguise.
YOU ARE AMAZING!!!

Pindaro is a Genius in disguise. He excels at giving his students the introduction to database systems that they need, while also explaining their necessity and usefulness in everyday life. He has written multiple books on the subject and possesses all all the skills needed to imbue his students not only with understanding, but with genuine interes
Great Professor, really cares about the material and the students.

Professor Pindaro is a great guy.  He loves his job and does a great job.  He does use the textbook a lot, but does not like it.  He much rather lecture and teach life lessons than do tutorials.  The class is an easy A if you do the work.  You will learn about databases and their use in a corporate environment which can be useful.

Pindaro is a great teacher. Although it is a very textbook tutorial based class, he takes pride in his students and makes sure they know the use of what they are learning. Do all the tutorials and get B's on the test and you will do fine
EASY CLASS. GREAT TEACHER. He's so nice and so helpful it will blow your mind.
One of the best professors on campus. He is rock solid on his subject, knows your name, and will help you achieve and A in the class. Great personality and great teacher.
Awesome professor-cares about students-Easy A if you do all the cases and get B's on the tests

He is the easiest teacher i have had here at RPI he is there for the students you go into his office hours and he will do your work for you. He is also a cool guy to talk to outside of class he has a lot of knowledge of the outside world.
Pindaro We all love you. Best professor we have ever had so far...and above a great guy! Thank you for all you have done.

Pindaro is such a nice guy! Anyone who knows what a typical RPI professor is like will tell you that he is the nicest professor at the school! I wish he taught more courses at RPI at the undergraduate level.

I've never had a professor who cared about the students as much as he does. He is a great guy all around and is willing to give you advice about your career. I would take another class with him if I had the opportunity. Stay on his good side by showing up to class.

Great Guy and very helpful.  Do all the tutorials and cases and its a A.  The guy really cares about his students and wants to give them all A's just do the work.  the first test might be a little of a shocker but if you get at least an 80 on all of them you can get an A by doing all the assignments

Don't let his intro algo reputation stop you from taking this course. He is so much more engaging and entertaining in crypto. You can really tell that he loves this stuff and wants you to as well. Can be a tad confusing at times but is always willing to try to explain again. Super caring and nice too. He's so incredibly Bulent Yener its awesome.

Literally the highlight of my schedule. He's absolutely an enthusiastic teacher. Classwork is appropriately difficult but not too hard, tests are a bit harder but nowhere near the level FOCS or something. Great class to take to brighten up an otherwise heavy semester.
Very knowledgable but sometimes confusing. Has english accent. Ran a very organized class.
god gives his toughest soldiers his strongest battles. and this one was too tough for me.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Lectures were meh, most people stopped showing up pretty quickly. Homeworks and labs are kinda difficult and will take a few hours, but are well put together and are what I learned from. Midterm was 30% of the grade, final was 40%. Back exams are easily available on google, but someone snitched after the midterm, so he made the final a nightmare :(

He teaches the class in a poor and disorganized manner. His handwriting is very hard to read. He could easily be replaced by distributing copies of the textbook and relevant practice problems to students and providing a list of required chapters to read: then the quality of the class would skyrocket.
Rude towards the students and just overall a lazy professor that does not care about teaching.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Bulent Yener is a thoroughly confusing man. His verbal lectures are difficult to follow at best, and his handwritten notes are virtually illegible. Regard Yener not as a teacher but as a guide. Use his resources to follow the pace of the class, then teach yourself from Google. Don't expect any support from him; you will only be disappointed.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: I have different opinions about the 70% rule because I think it is fair to put all the students under the same standard. But two exams increases uncertainty.

I am sure Yener is very knowledgeable, but unfortunately translating that into a way that the students can understand is his weakness. 70% of our grade was composed of two tests! That is absolutely ridiculous, it really only takes for you to have one bad night or lack of sleep for your whole semester of work to be drained in the toilet.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment:
It is fundamentally impossible to describe the emotions this man evokes.
Two exams worth 70% combined which is awful, lectures are not very helpful, but is a fairly nice guy. Final was insanely difficult. He's the most Bulent Yener I've ever seen.
Also he uses a fountain pen.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Yener is like a coin. It's like flipping a coin, he's like an anomaly, if he wakes up on the wrong side of the bed its war.  Research should be done on what Yener is thinking, a day in the life of Yener is needed.
Worst professor ever. Bad handwriting, uses a bad textbook, makes two tests worth 70% of your final grade, and is super rude. Don't take him.
Get ready to read bruh, you never gonna understand his lecture. The explanations in the lecture is HORRIBLE. just don't take his class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: There are two exams worth 70% of your grade, the prof does not explain anything, and instructions for most assignments are extremely unclear.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Lectures are dry and provide little benefit compared to just going over the slides yourself. Yener would often suggest watching the online videos instead of covering various topics in class. Too bad the videos are just as bad (and often worse) than the in-person lectures. Unreasonable workload towards the end, assigned exam on top of project.

Although many people will complain about his lectures, especially his handwriting, most I've heard negative things from tended not to even attend the lecture and just look at the notes posted online. He goes into great detail about examples and step by step methods, and shows a great passion for the course.
Professor Yener is very responsible, instead of reading slides he prepared for every lecture with hand-written notes, which encouraged you to attend the class in person.

Python skills make labs easier, and back work really helps midterms. Lectures aren't bad, but handwritten notes are hard to understand without attending. Poor criticism handling as he tried to take down ALL notes due to an inflammatory post on his bad handwriting and notes. I feel for him but he's uninterested in improving based on our feedback.

Seems like he dosen't care about any of his students doing well in the class. When we complained that his lecture notes were impossible to read he took them down online saying "if you guys don't like them then I won't post them". His test reviews are awful indications of the exams and he ignores anyone trying to point out his faults.
Lectures were like reading chicken scratch. Had to constanly use the textbook to fufill my learning. Yener is alright but just does not teach well
great professor, easy exam

I am in algo currently trying to prepare for a quiz we have at the end of class despite the fact that he has completely abnegated his responsibility to teach the material. I got a 6/15 on the last quiz and I do not know what I did wrong, or how to improve. His teaching style fosters an environment that discourages understanding the material.
Worst Professor! Incredibly rude and had a rude Post doc. Lacks basic courtesy towards students

Professor Yener is without a doubt the worst professor I've encountered since I've been in college. For lectures he just copies directly out of the low quality textbook onto the document camera. The labs typically don't really work that well for teaching you the material. 3 test dictate 80% of the your grade. Luckily he will curve at the end.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: took crypto 1 with yener and algorithm, he is one of the worse prof i had for cs courses. He did not communicate with student at all, no responses in piazza and email, he said he had a busy schedule but he was busy the entire semester. No explanantion of test and homeworks, always delayed posting lecture slides for more than a week

Very scatterbrained, will do things like accidentally schedule a test on Thanksgiving. Lectures are dry. Homeworks vary from moderately easy to somewhat hard. Final project is long but fun/rewarding. Tests are insanely hard and tend to assign disproportionate point values to things that were barely mentioned, while not testing on major concepts.
Took crypto with him first semester as a freshman... was both the toughest and the most enjoyable course I had. If the thought of cracking RSA on exams doesn't scare you off, you'll fit right in.
Homeworks are easy. Tests are overall not too bad but the questions are either pretty easy or about one specific thing that was said in class which is really bizarre.

Last time he's teaching, but good for all students since no one will be misguided by his high score on this website again. Homeworks are required now, with no clear rubrics. Tests are weird, some questions are about what he implied in the class, not what he said. Some are about a single sentence he briefly said in class

Out of all the Intro to Bio teachers, he gives the least work. You have to go to lecture only to copy notes (you don't even have to pay attention I put on my headphones and copy the PowerPoint on my computer at my own pace) and you just have to pass the tests. If you do the preclass and post-class you should be fine. He doesn't even give homework.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: As a computer science major, I was forced to take this class. Knowing this, he designed this class to be easy for us. Most of your grade depends on attendance to lectures and three tests. Lectures are easy and fun, well, as fun as bio can be to non-bio majors. Tests are easy, as long as you look over lecture notes and back tests, you will be fine.

Show up to every class, do every reading, and be the perfect student yet still won't get an A. The exams are ridiculous and pointless. Another class where you don't learn but cram for exams. 20 credit junior semester and this is the only class I won't get an A in. Grading needs a rework.

Great lectures and a nice guy, but the tests. From previous years, it looks like the tests were better. Questions are just too specific. I don't have time to know every little detail about everything assigned. One question on the test showed up in one slide of a forty slide presentation, where there are 8 class presentations per test and readings.

Honestly, I loved lectures.  Tests however?  Be prepared for a long list of bad multiple choice questions, a majority of which are to be found no where in the reading, in class, or post class materials.  Basically? Know everything about biology or you're screwed.

Nice and helpful teacher. The content itself can be a bit boring, but he tries to make it interesting. Can be a bit sarcastic in a light/humorous sort of way. Only gripe is his constant jokes sometimes make it hard to know what he wants us to remember =P

The teacher I had the first time I took this course was terrible, so I was glad to get Hanna the second time. Really nice guy, and very entertaining. The class content itself is boring, but he can make it bearable. He's the one who writes the tests, so if you do the preclass and postclass you'll be fine.

Great professor, funny and friendly, explains material well.  You should have absolutely no trouble getting an A in this course if you put in some work reading the book and for pre and post class activities.

Amazingly entertaining and enthusiastic. Best teacher I've ever had by far. His class is the only class I have yet to fall asleep in. Its an interactive lecture with plenty of iClicker questions as well as in class simulations and open discussions.
Go to all lectures and labs and do all assignments and you should do fine. Prepare his tests by reviewing everything on WebCT, and you will DEFINITELY get an A.
Dude, drop off a pint of Chunky Monkey ice cream at his lab and you got a friend for life.  Seriously though, he was good at teaching for being a professor.
One of the nicest professors on campus.  And funny too.  Don't forget his other food obsession- chunky monkey!
Knew his stuff but made a few too many pepperoni pizza jokes for my liking.  His multiple choice questions can be rough.  Decent professor though.
he has a great pesonality and is very easy to talk to. the multiple choice tests are pretty dirty, but there are plenty of other opportunities to do well. Definitely take his class.
Studio course was a lot of fun though sometimes the mini lectures that Hanna incorporates into class are VERY boring.  You definitely want Hanna over McDaniel, though.
although his lectures aren't very informative, he's a great guy. go to his office and  you'll find out anything you ever need to know about his course.
Fun teacher but the essay tests are not clear or very fair
Hanna explains things very well, but simplifies everything. His tests are harder than the material he teaches
Too easy, tells too many stories, and you don't learn anything from him.
Lab is harder than lecture. Edick does the lab part.

had him for microbiology and intro to cell biology. he is a great professor. involved lecturer. funny jokes that help keep things moving. he says the words "pepperoni pizza" on average 26 times per lecture. that says something.
No Comments
yes he's nice and sometimes could be funny.  but i want him to get to the point sometimes those jokes sorta sidetrack me and get boring.  (maybe the test average say something about his jokes)
he's cool
many jokes in lecture to lighten things up;  outside reading a necessity
One of the best Prof at RPI. You will learn despite the hard topic she will cover. At the end of the day, you feel rewarded for the class that you took.
rating_tags: Respected--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Does not consider if students are learning or not!
Great teacher. Her lectures are very clear and she is precise in her teaching. Professor Maniatty is very knowledgable in the courses she teaches.

People say they don't like the lecture style. This is one of the best lecture courses I've had at RPI. Professor Maniatty always comes to class prepared and makes the most of lecture time. She has handwritten lecture notes that she posts after and goes through completely in class. She accurately explains theory and presents releva example problems.

The exams are very similar to the practice exams she posts online. Homeworks are graded based off the fact that you did it. So as long as you have an answer you can get a 10/10 all all homeworks. Memorize the practice exam and go through the homeworks and this class is easy.

I took EMD as a senior. It seems that everyone who did poorly was incapable of working hard-doing HW. Class instruction was dull, clear (at least to me), and very relevent to the tests. Test ?'s were very similar to HW and class examples. I never did her worksheets, but you will fail if you don't understand the HW. Was very helpful in office hours.
this class sucks
The class was sooo terrible! She has no empathy towards students or understanding of student's learning styles, so she ends up being a terrible teacher.
STAY AWAY FROM HER CLASS!! SHE IS BORING AND DULL. HER LECTURES ARE TERRIBLE AND HER TESTS WILL DEFINITELY OWN YOU. MAKE SURE YOU SUCK UP TO HER

Be prepared 90% of the homework you will have to teach yourself as she teaches it the day it is due or after. Her tests are absolutely horrible, bordering on sadistic. There is also only 1 crib sheet for every test (including the final).  Learn to love the book as you will write in it a lot in order to put everything relevant to the test somewhere.

Prof. Maniatty is very passionate about the subject.  Explained the topics well, but there were still a few instances of not fully understanding a topic before doing the homework. Tests are similar to the practice exams but for some reason seemed to get more complicated than the practice exam in a sadistic sort of way.  The worksheets have no value

Previous ratings on this professor are far too critical. Professor Maniatty is quite good at teaching this course. Her notes are very clear and she posts all of them online. Go to class and pay attention, this class will not be very difficult. Plus, all of her tests are alike. Best of all, you will really learn the material from this professor.

Classes are long, and she sometimes starts writing stuff where you don't know where it came from.  However, her tests are extremely easy because she never changes problems from previous years.  All homework and worksheet solutions can be found from previous years, and all of the problems are identical.

This professor is absolutely brutal.  She made me want to get out of Mechanical Engineering.  I pray to God that the rest of my ME courses/profs at RPI are not as horrific as her.  Please find employment elsewhere, lady.
Pretty bad teacher.   From what i hear you can find allot better people to do the job

Don't bother asking for help.. ever.  Consider yourself alone in this course, basically you are going to teach yourself in this class.  Asking her for help is like asking the devil for candy... not going to happen.  Just give up the teaching thing and be that great engineer that hides from the world in pile of paperwork.

Her class is incredibly boring.  Lots of notes to copy, some of which she seems to make up on the fly and is incorrect.  Very poor social skills; often she will pause and just stare at the students for a while.  Clears her throat in possibly the most annoyiing way possible.  Vicious grader - only scale is that she will make the highest grade a 100.
No Comments

Maniatty shouldn't be a professor... she doesn't have what it takes to teach college students... she needs to just be a mechanical engineer and that's it.  I go to her office hours, I work hard, and she did nothing for me.  Plus that she's extremely cold and unfriendly.
incredibly boring... did not learn a thing from lectures

Her lectures are awful and boring. She has given out incorrect info. Everygroup did somethign wrong and all did it the same way... We want to put her as a source of error on our reports. She says there's no curve and the TA this semester is brutal at grading lab reports (worth 50% of grade).
Pretty boring class ... but she is smart & the tests aren't that bad if you're not a complete idiot ... I like her
This class isn't fun, but it's not her fault.  Everyone one says she's an awful lecturer, I disagree.  She just need to do some example problems.
she sucks all life out of the material.  tests are not easy.

Someone PLEASE nominate her for "What Not to Wear"! No fashion sense whatsoever, its funny, she tries to dress up for the first day. You have to be self motivated to do well in her class, 'cause she doesnt collect most hw.  I dropped the course.
Exams are fair, problems similar to the homework.  She is helpful at office hours. Not easy, but reasonable.  She is not an exciting lecturer, but gives the important info clearly.
She looks really passive, but don't let her fool you, she really DOESN'T have a personality.  oh and her tests suck.
awesome class
Great professor, easy to understand, cares about students.  One of the better Thermals professors you can get.

Professor Peles is a fantastic person and teacher!  His lectures are some of the best lectures I have ever had; He explains the material very well, can answer questions thoroughly, constantly ngages the class to participate and most important, patient and loves his students. Go to his office hours! They help so much.
Very clear and straightforward lectures. He repeats concepts and formulas often so it sticks in your mind. Tests and quizzes were right out of the book.

Dr. Peles was really and truly the best teacher I have ever had. I had virtually little or no interest in the subject, but he made everything so simple to understand. He is very fair and encourages questions. He teaches so well. Take a class with him if you get a chance.
Great Professor
He is knowledgeable in the subject, tries to make you understand the basic concept and teaches at a good pace

Yoav is an instant classic.  I took IEA with Yoav freshman year (now a senior) and still remember it.  He was really helpful, clear, and showed a real personal interest.  Even over 3 years later he still says "Hi" and is always available to talk about anything.  Great professor, great mentor, great guy.

I didn't go to class. I taught myself the material during the tests. I did well.  Most did not.  I didn't go to class because he didn't teach well. He waited so long for people to answer boring questions that he never taught anything by the end of the class.
Class is retelling of the book.  It doesn't help with the homework or tests at all. The class is how well you can teach yourself.
Peles is very nice, helpful. good for IEA
peles doesn't speak english!  he's sort of helpful if you talk to him one on one, but you really have to rely on the ta's and other students to learn the material

i dont know how he taught in the past but last spring he was horrable. He explaniations were unbalanced, taking forever to explain simple things and skiming over complex concepts. Hes a nice guy but had a lot of people lost. My section had the lowest avg . Best bet is to learn with friends and do the homework

Peles is damn smart, but he is HORRIBLE at explaining stuff. Use the TA's and fellow students that have taken the class to keep up. He blazes through the presenations. Best suggestion: bring your 'top so you don't get left behind. Best thing about him: His accent is funny, he can't say clockwise.
Peles is an amazing professor, very clear and far too smart.
Good guy, seemed to care about the students and learning.  Powerpoint presentations are awesome!

He is an awesome teacher, my favorite at RPI. He explains everything so well and is very willing to help, especially if you have questions.  He uses powerpoint lectures to teach the material so the homework is a lot easier. He also does practice exams so the tests are a lot easier!

It is not a french accent but whatever..His class has the highest average on the exams, which reflects how he is teaching. He may seem to not get the point across, but the tests prove that wrong. He is helpful after office hours even if you are not his student.
sometimes his french accent is a little hard to catch up to, but he's always willing to explain something to you (even if he's not the best at explaining it).
Professor had highest averages of all the classes.  Teaches fairly well, but you will hardly ever get points back on a test (even if you should)
A good professor that really knows how to teach the material, but not very helpful to students.  If you have troubles in the class I suggest going to your TAs for advice or help
As pointed out before, he consistently gets the highest test scores out of all the sections. He may have an accent, but he explains material very well and is very friendly.
This guy is the man, he consistently has better test performance than any other IEA professor
Very good teacher for IEA, explains the material well.
No Comments
I liked this dude for some reason.  He was hard to understand, but if you got a little one on one help from him, he explained the information much better

This guy is as smart as can be, but he's fresh from Israel and almost impossible to understand.  Also, flies through lectures and sparsely explains material.  Just doesn't understand how dumb freshmen are.
Art History 2 was a pretty easy class. Lectures are kinda boring but worth the easy A. A lot of the grade is also based off of attendance. He is very knowledgeable of the material. Would recommend.
Art History-Great class. I learned a lot. Milo is a great professor and a very nice man.
AWESOME.

Lectures could be a little boring at times. He loves his job, but forgets that he is dealing with a group of engineers and science students who just want an A.  I don't approve of his life adage.  He, himself, skipped out on the draft and said that Obama was the only candidate he ever donated to. His exams are very easy.  Attendance is mandatory.
Woah, I love his art history class...def the bestest professor I've had at RPI so far :D I heart Milo and his random jokes...

Great professor, very knowledgable on subject as well as world issues! he's an interesting guy... I enjoyed what he had to say about the art pieces as well as his jokes.  Tests were easy if you go to class , which is mandatory.
One of the shining lights at RPI. Hot European accent and so smart. Sometimes it's a chalange to follow his passionate lectures but it's very worth the effort.
I enjoyed the class, but if you're a woman expect to be hit on.  That part I didn't like so much.

An awesome guy who is obviously dedicated to art and teaching.  While the class may get tedious if you're not into the material, he always spices things up with his funny stories and often sexual innuendos.

I always got along well with him. I never liked art teachers before college because it seemed like they were forcing you to do what they wanted you to. Dr. Lazarevic, tho, teaches you how to think critically and creatively as well as determine whether or not those ideas are good. The skills he teaches are good for everyone to learn - especially engineers who will need to find creative solutions for problems after they graduate. He's a cool guy, too, and very easy to deal with.

This class was easy, but I still learned a ton and now I love going to art museums.  Milo is seriously the best professor at RPI.  The best.  Ever.  Take anything from him and it will be great.  He's hilarious, informative, and thoughtful, what could be better?
Milo is an excellant teacher. He is very interested in all of his students work. He is passionate about art and his enthusiam spreads to the classroom. All around great guy!
He is very much into his field, artistically and philosophically. Also very interested in the learning and interest of his students. Kind & funny.
This guy rocks!!

Classes Milo has taught have made a huge impact on me.  It is very apparent that he really knows art history and is an talented atist himself.  He takes personal interests in his students and his classes are interesting and fun.

Milo is a great professor teaching about life which is crucial for a great art professor. He was able to work with a wide range of talents within the same class and help them all to achieve a level beyond what they previously thought possible.

Milo is a brilliant professor who inspires his students towards excellence and defers them away from mediocrity. His passion for knowledge in the field of art and beyond is illuminated by his enthusiasm for spreading this knowledge to others. In no other

Milo is the best out there. His ability to see beauty in everyone's sculpture is what makes Milo and excellent professor. I loved his anecdotes of his travels and life expereiences.  His knowledge on art and life  is what makes Milo so rad.
he's so enthusiastic you gotta love it. i learned alot about scultpure and visual arts. hes funny and he makes you look at things in new ways
"Grading, then is a folly in the education concoction, which does not speed, but slows the footsteps of learning.  It conjures up images of Pavlovian dogs jumping through hoops ..." Milo Lazarevic

Milo is a great person. His passion for art and art history makes the course. I think its a crucial class for anyone in the arts department, or anyone with interest. I came out of it with a much greater appreciation for art, and for Milo.
Great Professor! I learn more from him than from anyone else at RPI
Great Prof!!! I learned much more than Art from him.
Real passion for teaching and helping students understand and appreciate art. Encourages every student to work at their ability level and helps them grow in their ability. Asset to the institute.

Very knowledgable about the subjet.  Lots of fun different information about the history that goes along with the art that we were seeing.  Incrediably fair professor and wants students to succeed and learn.
Knows a lot about the subject, he makes it very enjoyable, random comments make you laugh out loud, and best of all its an easy A.
Milo made art history so much fun!
uzma pls teach data structures

Uzma teaches clearly and she's willing to repeat concepts. She writes code in class which is better for understanding. Not every HW is complex, but they took 3-15 hours depending on the week. Tests aren't bad if you do the HW yourself. All assignments & tests are same for everyone regardless of the professor, so pick the best lecturer (Uzma).
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: She's really great, loved taking her class, everything was explained very clearly, always provided examples.
Very good lecturer who shares her experiences

For an intro computer science class it's too hard for non-cs majors and too easy for people with coding experience. Her lectures are fine, the structure of notes is nice, and the homework is pretty easy if you can manage your time. The hardest part was one-liners on tests. You get out of it what you put in.

Overall, it's just OK and unhelpful. She has a bit of an accent however, when she's teaching the lessons, she moves on too fast without properly or fully in details, explaining what's going on. If you come to this class, be prepared to spend all of your time in doing assignments, labs and homework.
Great lecturer; explains things thoroughly and willing to answer as many questions as you have. As long as you don't underestimate the course you will do just fine.

Class is more about you than the prof. She is a good lecturer and very clear in class but if you already know python you dont need to go to class. I got an A- and never went, the hard parts are the exams which are on paper and Homework 8 which took me like 20 hours.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Online Savvy

comment: It's awful to write python by hand. But that's how the tests are taken. If you can't take lots of extra time in exercise, there's no way to get an A
Exams are the hardest part about this course. Work load is heavy but manageable if you decide to start every assignment early. Use office hours throughout the semester.
Best professor I have ever had. Excellent lectures, extremely clear and very helpful outside and inside the class.

Professor Mushtaque is a friendly and knowledgeable CS1 instructor. Her lectures are clear and the tests are challenging but fair. Most of the labs and lecture exercises are straightforward and quick, however, some of the homework can be time-consuming and challenging. CS1 is a great course and as long as you don't procrastinate, it's not too hard.

The class can be difficult for those coding for the first time. Labs are standard, tests are a bit hard, and homework can get very difficult, especially toward the end. The best way to get by this class is through Uzma's office hours, she helped me a bit with the last homework. She tries her best to answer questions too. Overall, she's just okay.

Extremely clear and well-prepared lectures. For first-time programmers, this is a very hard introductory course, with difficult, sometimes nitpicky tests, a pretty fast pace, and weekly homework and labs. (No HWs if there's a test). If it's not difficult, it's a time-consuming course, with HWs nearing ~10 hrs by the end. Time management is key.
I learnt a lot in this course. Best Python programming class. Professor is very helpful and the lectures are fun.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: I loved her teaching style. Was helpful in office hours.
Well-paced for a introductory-level course
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: I suck at Computer Science and this professor didn't help by giving advanced material.
Absolutely terrible. Hated every second of this class.

Professor Mushtaque is really clear in her lectures. The homeworks and labs are difficult, but doable with some grit and perseverance. Overall, great course, just requires you to step outside of your comfort zone and actually think hard.

horrible. supposed to be an intro class, and it is definitely not taught that way. this was my first time coding, and let's just say it was a disaster! my TA was amazing, and is the only reason i passed this class or learned anything at all. he deserves double whatever he's being paid. avoid this class if you can.

I thought her lectures were okay and an average prof. No matter who you choose, you'll need to self-teach and practice a lot. Do back exam problems by hand, review lecture exercises, and labs in order to prepare for the exams. Exams are long and tedious, so try being quick with your answers. Very do-able course, good luck.
Tough for an intro to cs class

This is the worst professor I have ever had. She has not actually worked since about 2017. The TA's definitely deserve a raise for all the work they're doing and basically carrying the entire course on their back. On the discussion forum to ask questions she has never answered a single student. If you have the option, don't take her class.

Uzma is passive-aggressive in emails, rarely responds to students' questions (either late or telling you to go to office hours instead of answering). Her exams/homework clearly show she's out of touch with students' level, and if this is your first time coding you'll have a hard time. There is no feedback given for assignments either. Good luck.

The class itself was a lot of work, but professor mushtaque was one of the sweetest teachers, especially during the online semester. her lectures were pretty easy to follow, and would answer any questions during her online sessions! 10/10 would take a class with her again!
I enjoyed this class overall.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Decent lecture. Quite accessible outside of lectures.

Her teaching style is unclear and so unhelpful. Everything she says is confusingly phrased, and she teaches the elements of each lecture out of order. Be ready to teach yourself to program. I got lucky and already know Python, but if you dont, its a struggle. Have fun chipping away at the homeworks (ask friends for help). Get Turner if you can.
she's one of if not my favorite professor at rpi
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: Great professor! A nice person.

She was the most caring professor I had at RPI. She went lengths to ensure we don't get stressed out by her class and was constantly concerned about our mental health. She actively communicates her concerns to the administration, does her best to help us succeed in her class and do well on assignments. She is a great lecturer and fantastic teacher.

I took Science and Fiction as a six week class during arch. It was a great class and she was really understanding of the fact that we all had super busy schedules and that six weeks is not a long time. I'm definitely going to try to take another one of her classes in the future.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Professor Deery is incredibly nice, understanding, and personable with a sharp wit. She accommodated to the class' struggle to hit the four page requirement. She allows the class to go on (reasonably controlled) tangents. Irish Literature required weekly readings and four total essays. She is probably my favorite professor here. Take her class.
Irish Literature was an amazing class! Even though the discussions do go off topic most of the time, you will still learn a lot!

Very good professor overall. If youre interested in literature, definitely take one of her literature courses. Has a very relaxed environment during lectures. Allows and encourages free discussion of the texts. Her Irish Literature class was very fun for me.

June Deery has a passion for her material and it shows in her classes. She assigns interesting texts, and allows for discussions in class to evolve organically. Don't take Deery if you want regimented assignments and strong structure. Take Deery if you want to enjoy your life, enjoy your assignments, and enjoy earning your grade.
Best professor at RPI
BEST TEACHER OF ALL TIME
She actually managed to keep me awake during classes.  She's really funny and does a great job leading discussions.
Excellent Professor
Awesome teacher. Fun, informative class.

Amazing! She is the only professor I have purposely signed up for classes just because she is teaching them.  She leads great discussions. You have to do your work for the classes, but she is very fair and very helpful.  I wish I had room in my schedule to take everything she offers
Irish lit was an amazing class!
Excellent professor. I highly enjoyed the class.
June Deery is an AWESOME professor, but her classes are WRITING INTENSIVE! Unless you enjoy writing for hours and hours for every assignment, DO NOT TAKE A CLASS WITH HER! You're welcome.
She's a very good professor, too bad she goes on sabatical all the time.  Every takes her classes to have HER as a prof, not just to take the class.  That's RARE at RPI.

An excellent class that sparked some very interesting *discussions* (compared to the usual RPI lectures) and never was boring.  Deery is very intelligent and loves to stimulate thought beyond what day to day engineering requires.  The class and the prof are highly recommended.
The class was a nice change from engineering courses.  The off-topic discussions could be irritating at times, but then I grew to enjoy them.  Definitely recommend her.
Great Prof.
She is a really great professor.  Very helpful and will go to great lengths to help students succeed.  I would highly recommend her Irish Lit class.
Great class, she keeps it really interesting and the dicussions somewhat on course.  Very helpful
Great teacher. Knows how to lead a discussion, and is open-minded.
Great class ! Discussions were a little frustrating at times, but the course inspired real interest.
Great teacher, thorough, sometimes gets too bogged down in stupid details, but some of the off topic discussions were fun and actually opened your eyes.  A great humanities teacher.

love he accent....she kind of rambles...but i like her. science and fiction is soo fun..aside from the weird readings and the guy who talks maaad slow. i get ready for bed everytime he raises his hand.

If you do the homework and attend every lecture, you'll get an A. Quizzes and tests are normally homework questions and he curves pretty well. He's pretty strict on attendance so just make sure you go!

Homework's were optional, but if you don't do them you most certainly wont be prepared for the exams. I found the exams to be very fair, usually the questions on the exam were modified homework problems. He's a great guy, very nice, but I didn't learn that well from his lecture style.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: The professor's lecture notes and homework solutions have many typos in them. He tends to change the layout of the problem. When he does this, I can't really tell what's given by the problem or something that you have to figure out. His quizzes and tests aren't horribly difficult as they're remarkably similar to problems done in lecture.

I don't know how Tichy has such great reviews in other classes. Fluid Mechanics has been a mess. His notes are all over the place and gets annoyed when the test averages are lower than what he wanted. Everything is extremely confusing and I would not recommend him.

Tichy's a solid choice for Dynamics. The first half of class is notes, the second half is examples. Just go over notes and the examples before tests or quizzes and the class should be a breeze. He also has really cool life stories, you can learn a thing or two from them.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Pretty good professor, willing to help anyone out. He's very old, and getting the projector to work / doc cam to focus was an every-20 minute ordeal. Makes class interesting because most of the class is working through examples, and usually lets us out early. Fun Fact: he was in Commander Cody & His Lost Planet Airmen in the 70s-80s. Cool guy.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Clear grading criteria

comment: You should definitely try to take a class with Tichy at some point at RPI. I took dynamics with him as an elective and learned a lot. There were never any surprises on tests, so it's not too hard to do well if you put in just a bit of work. He gave weekly quizzes, and is also pretty strict about attendance and phone usage though.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Show up to all the classes, do the homework (or at least copy the solution), study a little for the tests and you should get a relatively easy A. Quizzes every other class. Test 1 was easy, test 2 was hard, and the final was medium difficulty.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: The most interesting teacher and one of the best guys, will miss him after classes.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: very straightforward with quiztest problems  - very very similar to homeworks. tons of examples to work off of. don't buy the textbook!!!!!!!!!!!
Overall a good professor, but could be moody at times. Explains things well, but too impatient to listen.
Fairly easy class. Good at teacing / explaining. Strict on policy such as no cell phone/ no sleeping/ attendance...Has weird grading system and also funny history(he used to be in rock band).

DOWN SIDE-has an attitude. no phones, can't be late. can't talk in class.UPSIDE-crystal clear methodological approach to dynamics, follow his steps and you can't go wrong. fair grader, generous curve, and really helpful outside of class. tests are awefully similar to the homework/class examples. so do your part, and   ace this class!

Prof. Tichy was one of the best teachers I have had at RPI.  He was very helpful outside of class and his teaching methods were very straight forward.  He does tons of example problems, which are very similar to the HW and tests.  More professors should teach like this.
Great Prof. Will help you if you need it although the class is straightforward if you go to class. Tests are extremely similar to practice problems in class.

Uses methods different from the book and other professors that seem more roundabout and difficult. All problems on tests are directly from class and homeworks so if you study there is no reason not to get an A. Pesky quizzes make attendance mandatory which is annoying especially at 8 am. Decent professor though a nice. plus tichy's a rock star!

He was a good professor.  Went over theory then problems during class.  He was clear and understandable in class.  Tests were over in class problems of homeworks, so if you studied those you were fine.

If you go to class, you basically get an A for quizzes.  If you study the problems he goes over in class and actually try them again at home, you can't do poorly on the tests.  If you even slightly make an attempt at this class, you will do pretty well.  Good class and good prof.

I don't know what these other people are talking about because Tichy is a great teacher.  He made the class interesting and did many example questions to help you learn.  No graded hw and some pop quizes that were mad easy.  As long as you do the hw on your own and study a little for the tests from his example problems in class you'll do good.

Tichy is one of the worst professor's I've had at RPI in 3.5 years.  He treats his students like middle schoolers and demands they learn the way he wants to teach them - or you will be penalized through attendance/participation and quiz grades.  He makes up for his lack of teaching ability by grading exams generously.

doesn't follow the book's notation.  you will get screwed when it comes to common exams because of his non-traditional ways.  realtively easy though once you get the hang of his teaching style.  very laid back, maybe has a lazyish attitude but wouldnt say he doesnt care at all.  a bit of a clown sometimes.no confidence in him lecturing.

Strengths isn't the hardest engineering class, and he made it even easier.  Did an OK job of teaching his way and for his particular tests, but once the general final comes from other professors, you'll get killed.  He skipped over some of the more difficult concepts in the class, which may hurt you if your a civil.

Great professor.. His teaching style takes a little while to get used to but he does a really good job.  Always goes over what's going to be on the tests unlike other professors (according to friends). Has a slide set about his rock band.  If you have to take strengths, this is definitely your best choice. He checks ratemyprofessors.com.
No Comments

What he went over in class, was learned. The hard part of the class was when other professors made the tests and used different notation. Great at explaining the material espeically since he hadn't taught dynamics before.
Tichy isn't great at teaching but the material was easy to learn, and he grades really generously.  Put a few equations for like 85%.
easy grader, not too clear on class notes, but goes over problems similar to the homework. gives lots of helpful handouts.
The smartest and best professor ever.

The class is easy and his grading is lax! You can easily get an A from this course. The problem is you just need more time to get used to his Russian accent. I always get confused in class for misunderstanding his words, but he is really helpful in office hour!

Roytburd is a very smart man and knows exactly what he's talking about.  Unfortunately he is a terrible teacher.  His lectures jump around and he does not answer questions well.  I felt often as if he did not understand my question and just danced around it until I was forced to say I understood.   Going to office hours with this man is pointless.
He explains things really well.  He throws in jokes just to see if you are listening during lecture.  You have to keep up with the class, but he is good about making that easy.

Avoid him in any class with more than 20 people unless you can skip all lectures and still get an A. If you're in a small class with less than 20 people (assume 1/3 will drop in early weeks), he is tolerable. Bad at teaching, but personable and wants students to learn. In choosing between him and another prof with a frown rating, choose Roytburd.

hard to understand. lectures are all over the place, not continuous at all, very hard to follow. when you go to office hrs & ask for help he gets frustrated if you don't understand things & isn't much help. good part is that he doesn't let anyone get below a C if they seem like they're trying. but hw & test material never relates to stuff in class.
No Comments
very hard to understand, and not that helpful, but if you're a girl and make friends with him, u'll do fine.  i should've gotten a C/D in the class but i made friends with him and got a B!!!

I had this guy back in fall.  Complete idiot, but do some homework and you'll be ok.  Don't bother with lectures, because you'll just end up laughing.  His voice is straight out of the tootsie roll pop commercial. How many licks does it take to get to the center of a tootsie roll pop? a 1, a 2, a 3!
he's got personality, but he's a bad teacher. definitely very unclear.

Useless recitations.  I think looking back on the notes I took in class made me more confused about the subject.  If you are stuck with him, make sure to look at Schmidt's online lectures.  Five minutes of those equals two weeks of lectures from Roytburd.

Doesnt know anything about this subject. Teaches only from the book. Doesn't help you during office hours. Asked for help on hw, his response "well, figure it out". Spent an hour and a half on 4 problems, WITH HIS HELP and recieved a 9/25 for my efforts. thanks for a fantastic fall semester genius.
Horrid.

This guy is basically Borat from Ali G, his tests are hard and his reviews are pointless, dont waste ur time, Schmidt's lectures got me a C in this class, otherwise I'd be taking it over, diff eq is hard anyway, but take it with schmidt if u can instead of Victor, hes a good guy but schmidt is best
He is a terrible teacher that makes a hard math class impossible.

He's really boring.  He does tell a lot of jokes, but they're kinda lame so they end up being funny.  He goes off on too many tangents so if you don't pay attention you end up lost.  He's also hard to understand at first.
Friendly but hard to understand, doesn't explain too well
Victor is kind of hard to understand, but he is very funny.  He draws awesome pictures, and he makes really subtile jokes that are SO FUNNY if you can puck on them.
This guy hurts bad.  The few times I went to class he spent a majority of the time trying to get the projector to work.  I didn't learn anything.
Hard to understand his accent, but he's a good teacher. Tests and assignments are easy and fair.
Tries to explain concepts but never ends up doing it effectively... goes off on tangents a lot. Fair tests, though he doesn't prepare students well for them. Learned more from the TA than him.
as stated by someone else, he goes off on tangents in class somewhat regularly, but his homework and grading policies are fairly relaxed.  I ended up needing a 60 on the final to pull an A.
No Comments
When he explains concepts it is really round-about so it is very easy to get lost in his atrocity of a thought process.  But his grading is very lax
No Comments
Knows his stuff, but spends too much time trying to teach beyond the scope of the curriculum and forgets to prepare sutdents for tests.

Thermo might be difficult because of its 8:30am start time but Theo is a comprehensive lecturer! He covers everything needed on the homework and exams are pretty similar to homework problems. He also invites students to do research with him at the end of the semester.

I don't get why his ratings are so low on here. His lectures can definitely get boring especially because they're at 8 am, but he's incredibly knowledgeable on thermo. Even though lecture attendance is not mandatory, you will fail if you dont go. He's not super warm and friendly, but he's funny and really wants you to do well in the course.

Only has class at an early time. Seemed to reminice about problems instead of explaining what was going on. I hope they have someone else teach thermodynamics in the future. He's simply too familitar with topics to think they need explaining. seems like a nice guy, had good conversations out of class, simply not passionate for basics

Professor Theos lectures can put you to sleep at times, considering this class is usually at 8am. However, if you reach out to him he is extremely understanding and helpful. If you study enough you will do fine in the class.

Thermodynamics has been the most frustrating class I have taken at RPI, and that says something. Professor was no help in thermo, expecting that before each lecture we would understand the content covered in the assigned reading. He then proceeded to not finish the examples provided in class on top of not going over content covered in the reading.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Theo is a really knowledgeable professor, and cares about his students. Students having academic questions can also go to his two-hour office hour every week. I really learned a lot from his thermodynamics courses. I definitely recommend Professor Theo for his excellent teaching.
He literally does not know how to teach this class. Spending the whole lecture time to just do one example question. Lecture slides are just the copy from textbook.
Does not speak clearly at all. Really hard to listen to for long periods of time. Really take your time studying textbook and lecture "notes" to do well because he wont really teach you much
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Horrible lecturer. His slides are incredibly unhelpful and he does a poor job of explaining the complex topic that thermodynamics is. Expect to teach yourself this class from the text book.
Theo is the worst. He goes over 1 example per lecture and expects students to teach the course to themselves by reading through the textbook.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Unbelievably uncompromising amid the covid situation.

Phenomenal professor, genuinely care about his students and their success. Attend office hours if you're struggling at all and he will straighten it right out for you. If the accent bothers you, try sitting up front so you can read off the slides as he goes through them.

Boring lectures. Reads off the slides and is difficult to understand. Slides are copied from the textbook and he doesnt elaborate on any concepts in class very well. Reading the textbook is crucial for success.
Hard to understand, not very engaging in lectures
Great professor. Lectures can be boring but his tests are different and easier then other Dynamics professors.  No mandatory homework.

A really nice guy, however his classes were often times really difficult to understand. His accent first off is hard to grasp. On days where we had subs, it felt like the sun finally came out and enlightened us. So, yah, he's good but a bit difficult to live through. Take physics I at the same time if you want to understand it better.

Really nice guy. Slightly difficult to understand sometimes. Likes to tell jokes and really cares about the students. Still is a slightly difficult course. Especially being basically the first college course that you'll be taking. Good guy though.
Terrible Professor.  Accent makes him hard to understand, and even when you do understand what he's saying, it makes no sense.  Avoid him at all costs!

you get the idea that he wants to try to help you out, but hardly succeeds at it. his teaching method, diction, notes and explanations are pretty horrible. txtbook helped but not  enough to make up for bad teaching.
Boring, accent makes him hard to understand.  Gets behind in the material.

Lets put it this way, the only time i actually learned something in IEA was when professor simmons came into substitute.  he's sort of hard to understand, but not all that bad.  it doesn't matter though because his lectures make no sense, even if he goes off the pre-made powerpoints.
He is no good. His lectures are hard to understand and if he goes off the ppts nothing gets done. We mostly had to use the TAs to learn anything. IEA itself needs to be restructured.
He's not very good with the english. his lecuters are no good. he likes what he does, but his grading is nitpicky
very easy! w00t
No Comments
Not a very clear lecturer but tries hard to help students, and is helpful when asked or visited in office hours.
Great guy, took a few courses  with him and enjoyed them all.

Incredibly hard to get a hold of outside of class. If he doesn't like you, you're in for it. Grades arbitrarily, and you'll have no idea what grade you have until after finals. Class is absolutely mandatory and even if you have a legitimate reason to miss even one class, he'll have no sympathy.

Makes you believe that you are doing well in the course and then slams you at the end with your grade. Doesn't clarify the reason for giving bad grades. I strongly recommend not taking any courses from him.

Professor Zenzen cares very much about what he teaches, can be funny and charming, and has substantial background. Philosophy of Mathematics isn't easy, but he uses Moore's "The Infinite" and it's a very clear text. This class was extremely thought provoking and Zenzen is a superb lecturer.
lots of discussion, some lecture
Highly recommended. One of my favorite professors. Introduced me to philosophy, now I love it. Shows a personal interest in students, is generous with time, and is an effective teacher.

Intro to Phil can get boring, but it's an intro class.  You'll either love or hate Zenzen though.  I think he's a great professor.  You'll work, but if you put in effort, you should get an A.  You'll see a bit more of his personality in Existentialism, so don't judge him from Intro.  The classes may actually change your life.
Good lecturer and caring professor. Helped ease my transition to RPI.
this class may change your life.
Helpful
