The amount of examples that she did in class and posted on the website clarified the course significantly.  She was very helpful when I brought her questions about the grading of an exam, and I got 4 more points.
Do not take a class with this professor.  She is a self involved lazy teacher.
i like her..she is cool beans
cares little about material/students

The class can get a bit dull at points.  It seems like a lot of the information could be left out to get to the main point.  But overall it's a decent class.  Tests aren't too hard because you get to make a cheat sheet.  The projects are so vague, take forever to finish, and are graded ruthlessly by the TA (who is no help).  Homework is a pain too.
Nice guy. Pretty good teacher. Explains things pretty well, answers questions in class. Tells you pretty much exactly what to expect on exams.
No Comments

Spilker's IEA class is fairly boring but only because it is IEA.  I think he is a good teacher and he covers the material very in depth.  Seems like a helpful guy although I have not visited his office hours.  Unfortunately IEA is really boring.  Bring your laptop and do other homework during class!

He's very clear about everything he explains, but he doesn't really teach you how to fend for yourself -- he definitely treats you like a freshman (good or bad? You decide). I could do everything well IN class, but he did easy examples. As soon as I was out of class, different story. Do the homework sooner than the night before or you'll lose it.

Helpful guy, in advising as well as in class time.  Tried his best not to read too much from IEA slides, helped students as well.  Didn't even collect class activities.  However, if you're not interested in IEA from the get-go, he's not going to make it especially interesting.  You do have to keep your own.

Its not his fault the class sucks and is boring... once we got started he tailored the class to fit our needs,.... its just not an easy class.... i thought he was a pretty good teacher teaching crappy material.... GO TO THE EXTRA HELP SESSIONS IF YOU WANT TO PASS THE CLASS!!!
not recommended if u plan to absorb anything in class.  outside class he's nice.  but strength is just not his thing...
Lecture is boring, tests aren't horrible
Seemed to be a pretty nice guy, but had boring lectures.  Having the class at 8 in the morning didn't help.  If you do have him, make sure to go to his office - he's a lot more helpful there.
he jumps around the lecture and can easily confuse you... but is very open to helping you outside of class.... has a funny and great personality... take it for who he is and have fun....
He's a mess.  Class is hard to follow b/c he rushes through everything.  He is approachable and a nice guy, however IEA isn't that hard and he makes it seem like it is.

Spilker is overall a good guy.  He gets a little frazzled at times, so it gets a little confusing.  IEA isn't difficult to begin with though so it's not bad.  If you need help with anything, just ask.  He's good at explaining specific things to one or two people.
I agree -- he was very approachable and also friendly.
Spilker's really helpful, approachable, and clear. He is concise and easy to understand. IEA really isn't that difficult to begin with but Spilker makes it even easier.
No Comments
Odell is pretty chill. Owns some cool hats and doesn't assign too much homework. If you figure out what he wants in his essays, you will do fine.

Not too hard to get an A if you do what he tells you. A bit of work outside of class on the papers, but he's willing to read through your writing and help you. Really nice guy, could be a stressful class/ a bit more work if you aren't so good at writing.

As a freshman I enjoyed professor odell's class and I learned so much on how to write. This class will be helpful through rest of career because it improved the way I used to write (horrible writing) dramatically. I wish I can always be taught by him. I recommend this course personally because it is not difficult to get high grade if you try!

Took his class freshmen year as a requirement. All reviewers are correct that "his style of writing is the only way to receive an A in the class". On the first paper when I questioned my grade, which was written in his format, he told me, "You wrote this very aggressively, and that's not how women get ahead in life." I wish I could make that up.

Writing for Classroom career was straightforward for me, which was due to Odell, and being a good writer. I thought his methods were easy to follow. However, I knew many others in the class who did NOT understand his methods and as such got Cs when I was getting As. He goes out of his way to meet with and help students. He was funny, too.

He does not deserve all the bad comments.  Honestly his grading is pretty straight forward, do what he asks you to do and put a lot of work into your writing, and get an A.  However, if you decide you know how to write and he does not, just drop the class since it is a waste of your time.  He taught me how to write (one way granted) very well.

He's never clear on the assignments and he wants you to print multiple copies of assignments as if we have we can print infinitely. He doesn't care about the class and he is a snot. Even after a rewrite, he can give you a worse grade if you put in a lot of effort. AVOID HIM. AVOID HIM. YOU HAVE BEEN ADVISED.

Ok. Let me rewrite first essay and accepted late even then. Not sure how grading will go yet. Unfair with grading at times (first group to present given short notice; graded harshly imo considering work and painstaking care to follow his guidelines). Ditto below otherwise.

Useless. Seems to only know one style of writing. If you're looking to write for magazines and infomercials, consider this. Looking to write to write for classroom and career? Try something else. He's used a plethora of student samples and seems to be easily swayed by class opinion.

More than half my class dropped after the first paper.  His writing style was the only correct way.  He once told me I could rewrite a paper for a better grade.  I went to 2 meetings with him to talk about the guidelines of what he wanted, rewrote it and he refused to change anything, just encouraged me to go to the Dean of Students to complain.
One of the worst professors I've had at RPI.  Very unhelpful to students and gives very hazy feedback.  Avoid having him like the plague.
No Comments

You will actually learn how to write in this class. Before I took Writing for the Classroom & Career with Odell I wasn't very confident in my writing skills. After taking this class, I have recieved all A's on my papers.  There's a not a lot of work (only 4 papers and presentation). Just do what he says in your writing and you'll be fine.
A very dedicated professor. After every class he sends each student a bunch of very useful comments.  He will definitely improve your writing ability.

Worst professor I have ever had. Demanded ridiculous things and if your writing wasn't just like his, he would grade it poorly. Didn't learn anything about writing, just learned how to write more like him. Take this class, but not from this professor!!

Good prof, but too demanding from engineering students. Grade hard, but guranteed to learn a lot from him. Take his class if you are a good writer. Expect to get more work than any other writing class.
The most inspiring professor I have ever had.
No Comments
Ken is the man!

Terriffic human being. Excelent professor who cares about the welfare and education of the student as well. Has taught @ RPI for several decades - so he's above the "architectureally trendy" notions of younger profesors. Used to be a stoner and promotes the existance of counterculture as well as resistance against "the man" You Wont Regret It

Ken is one of those rare teachers that actually care about your work; no amount of sucking up has anything to do with your grade. This is what school should be...just based on the worl you do and nothing else.

ken somehow manages to be both easy and challenging.  if you dont "get it" right away, he trusts that you will, so he waits.  no eye rolling.  no ego stroking.  has worked with the best-kahn, for one, though youd never know it b/c he doesnt need to brag.  actually takes education seriously.

One of the last great educators - a genuinely curious, caring guy. While he isn't a political player, i agree with the gossip queen comment. Confide in him and the news will spread to faculty and students alike faster than you can say "aleatory"
No Comments

Ken is thoughtful and truly interested in helping people learn.  He shares the excitement of students and defends them in crits.  Don't tell him personal info because it will get around.  He is well read but lacks real-world application.  Decent human being.
ken is the man
ken is the man, although ive never fully recovered of the first cda class
the man
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

This was a great course. Jim always comes to class prepared and very knowledgeable of the subject. He is very easy to understand and very helpful outside of class, especially at office hours. The homework is not just meant as busy work. Quizzes are challenging. There is usually a "trick" to the problem and if you don't see it, you won't do well.

This is the second course I have taken with him, I am always happy with what I have learned.  This course is pretty dense so pay attention, and it is pretty heavy on theory though he will work in some applications.  He is easy to approach and is very helpful.  The tests are not super difficult however he still curves. Take this course and learn.

Regardless of the class, if he is teaching it take it.  He really strives for all the students to understand the material, plus he tries to get to know each student.  The class itself won't be very easy, but if you pay attention you will do well and you will understand it.  Tests are reasonable and he curves them to make the average about 75.

Napolitano is really a brilliant professor. His lectures are clear, fun, and easy to stay awake during. He genuinely cares about the well-being of his students, memorizing names to pictures before the semester even begins. An outstanding professor who does his best as a teacher and mentor. Also, real swell outside the classroom, definitely helpful!

Jim is a great professor, one of the best Physics teachers at RPI. His teaching style is pristine. The class is two hours  long. He lectures for the first hour. It is wise to take notes. And then he gives a couple of practice problems along with a typed copy of the notes. His homework is tedious, but doable. Go to office hours and TA sessions.

Great Professor. I had him for Honors Physics 1 and he is definitely the best professor I have ever had. Presented the material in a clear, and more importantly, organized manner. You just can't help but learn from this guy. And definitely go to his office hours, you will learn even better there.
He's a great professor, but his classes are difficult. Use the office hours he offers and go to your TA's and you can make it through.
Was very helpful and patient. Fair with grades, and made a point of getting to know his students, which was great.
real good teacher
Napolitano is the best Physics Professor at RPI...take his classes and you will learn.  You will be challenged but you will learn.

Had Napolitano for a few classes and was always impressed. He's got a real rapport with the students, and is very dedicated to teaching. He spends a great deal of time answering students questions and helping them out. Gotten better help from him for ExPhys than I did from the professor that was "teaching" it. Jim's an all around great professor!
Napolitano cares about students' well being and success in and outside of class.  He is always willing to offer extra help.  His tests are pretty hard, though.
Really a great professor. Very pro-active in helping students. A pleasure to talk to, and I'll miss his lectures. Take his class if you can, even for fun.
Good teacher and a great guy in general. The lectures are very good and the labs are a lot of fun. Very helpful in office hours as well.

One of the nicest, smartest people you will ever meet.  Very helpful during his office hours and always willing to lend a hand to help you advance in your studies.  One of the very best professors I had during my time at RPI.
Awesome lecturer... Watchout Feyman

If I could pick one memorable professor from studying in the US and abroad, I would pick Payen every time. He showed you how to look at games from a practical point of view. Harsh grader but gave you the advice you needed to hear to improve. Deeply cared abt students. Eccentric in the best way. Highly regarded. Pushed me out of my comfort zone.
tough grader

I previously had prof Payen in the 1st term so I was prepared for GD2 as a final boss. It is during this class that I understood why he was so tough before and do not let us do a broken game. There were some conflicts between my team members, he spent so much time outside of class to find solutions and we managed to have something good at the end.

This class was one of the most difficult at GSAS, and professor Payen can be very stressful at times, but I learned so much in this class to the point that the other ones seemed easy.
I do recommend this course, but be prepared to be challenged.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: He is by far the most memorable professor Ive ever had. He is excellent and knows what hes doing when he teaches his students. He cares more about us than RPI ever will. His grading is tough and his accent is thick but he knows how to make an impactful learning experience. Hes eccentric but game design 1 was the class I had learned the most in.

He is by far one of the best professors I have met at RPI. He is a very hard grader, but it comes with good intentions. The only downside I would say is that your grade will reflect more on your group's ability than your own. He is nice if you warm up to him!
The grim reaper of GSAS
Best professor!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: Let's be blunt: Sylvain is going to kick your ass. He is going to throw a million projects at you (Expect to have a group project literally every single week of the semester) and give you some brutally honest grades. But, by the time you're done with the class, you truly will emerge a stronger and better designer. Trial by fire.

Intro to Game Design with Professor Payen is an experience. This class is largely based on group projects with random group members. He grades very strictly, so don't expect an A. He will find criticize every flaw in your games. Despite that, if you engage with the lectures and talk to him outside of class, you should learn a lot about game design.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Very very tough at grading and unable to understand his accent
The professor has a really weird policy, and he does not give fair grades. Be prepared.
Very tough grader, if you do not meet HIS standard, you will receive a bad grade and tough comments. Very opinioned, not good at teaching at all. Very negative.
Very opinionated, very tough
Unfair on grading, he might explain his criteria, but he would always pick on some tiny faults and give an F on that.

If you're considering taking this class as an elective, don't. You will get a streamline of projects, and the professor is a harsh grader so you will have to work really hard to at least pass. He does try to help you by providing feedback whenever you talk with him, but his expectations are just way too high for an intro class.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: She is awful at explaining things and answering students' questions. Good luck using her lecture notes to study, they seem super organized but are terrible at guiding you in the solving process. Take with CSL if possible so that you have access to notes from the lab

Lectures are terrible and she forces you to show with in class assignments. Your best bet is to use lecture notes from other professor's classes as her notes often are unreadable/don't have the info necessary to do the homeworks.
Literally the worst professor I've had in my 4 years at RPI. And that's saying a lot

I think she gets bad reviews b/c students put in no work besides in lecture: if you put in work on your own to understand the math, her lectures are extremely clear and office hours are very helpful. ModCon can seem abstract and she does a great job of explaining real life applications. Favorite class at RPI and one of the best professors I've had.

Somewhat new teacher. Lectures are very poor, but forces you attend with in class assignments. Gives homework with some problems on topics not covered yet, so you can't complete immediately. When I reach out for clarification on homework she tells me I'm wrong, but it turned out I was correct. Diverges from textbook methods, gl making out her notes

She seems to struggle as a lecturer, she is a very good lab professor. She seems to be more comfortable with that. I have had her for both CSL and MODCON (in her first time teaching it) and can attest to her being helpful and cared about the students passing if you went to her for help. Would recommend for lab(CSL) as she is very knowledgeable

Good luck!
She is a very new teacher and has a hard time teaching material. She has not yet found a way to relate her industry experience to class material. Lectures are often unclear and don't include many relevant example problems. The goal of specific problem solving methods is often unclear.

The class was incredibly easy, but the way she taught and lectured was abominable. You would probably get more lost and gather the wrong information if you paid attention to her in lecture. I suggest just reading the next book and doing back exams, and you'll get an A. Take the class with Hurst if you can.

Professor Felix teaches well and clearly. The previous raters clearly didn't bother showing up to class, because I did and received an easy A by just applying what she described in her lectures to the homework and exams. She was very accessible by email and offered clear feedback on my grades when I asked for it.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Do not at all costs take Mod-Con with Felix. If you do, find someone who is in CSL to give you Joshua Hurst's recorded Mod-Con Lectures. (If she realizes that really cannot teach the class a semester, then she will even post them as well to the Mod-Con LMS). If she is the only option, take it next semester. Need to graduate? Take them at same time.

About to take the final tmm, learning and reviewing solely from another prof's lecture vids/notes, just like for previous exams throughout the semester. Her in-person lectures were poorly communicated, and exam content didn't match what was taught or given from the lectures/homework. If I have to take again, it'll 100% be under a different prof
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Sarah Felix is by far the worst professor Ive had in my 3 years at RPI. In lecture, she has no idea what she is talking about, and posts past professors' lecture notes instead of her own. The back tests and homework problems she gives have little to no relevance to test material, and doesnt even post solutions. Also cant use methods from textbook
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: I am not sure she really knows what she is talking about at all, lots of inconsistencies with lecture notes, homework solutions. Very difficult to tell what material will be on tests
If the prof knows what she is doing, she does not communicate it well.
strange class
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Required to purchase textbook then told expressly NOT to use textbook methods, exam material does not reflect material covered in lecture or homeworks

Pretty easy course, I missed the first three weeks and still got a 97. You get two to three weeks to do all the in-person labs, and the full 10 weeks to finish some long-term projects. She also gives many makeup opportunities. The worst part was the lecture, she'll go over all of the modules for an hour or so before the wet lab. Very enthusiastic.

She is an exceptionally kind, understanding, and caring teacher. However, her lectures are very fast paced and don't teach anything substantial. In addition the lab aspects of the class are poorly described, leading to confusion and are mostly busywork. That being said, she does not let anyone fail and always is happy to explain a topic again.

She's very passionate about the content that she teaches and the field of biology as a whole. Her directions can be a bit confusing, and she moves very fast. She's very lenient if you don't complete the dry labs on time and overall, she ensures that you don't fail at the end. Just keep up with the work because it can build up.

OMG I love her. She's amazing and the kindest woman alive. She may be a little unclear with instructions but her class is super easy and I did all the work while in class. The tests were easy; my roommate studied for them the night before and did even better than me. The class is point-based and gives some opportunity for extra credit.
If you are not a biology major student, and plan to do arch and biol1010. Take it in arch, amazing course with field trip

She is a really kind prof but, she doesn't teach anything. She makes students write slides on topics they choose, most of time is spent with students reading their slides which usually is too specific or the about the same things. The exams are too simple and there were lot of cheatings going on during the exams and she wasn't able to prevent it.

Professor Ramanath was an enthusiastic professor. However, I'm not sure I learned much of anything new or interesting. Most of the lecture material was covered in online modules to be done outside of class. In-Class, we chose to do a lab or write a 100 word response relating to the topic. Why give the option to not do lab in a lab? (Fall 2022)

Dr. R is a very kind professor who genuinely seems to care about her students. I had her for lab and she was very helpful to my group whenever we were stuck. My only issue was that a lot of her lectures did not reflect the homework, which was mostly just busy work.
Dr. R was a great lab professor.  She made every lab interesting and interactive.  Although sometimes it's hard to figure out what's going on, Dr. R is very helpful and will guide you through.

Prof. Ramanath was very enthusiastic and seemed to genuinely care about her students, but her teaching style, didn't click with me at all. The quizzes in class were not easy, and the simulations were long and tedious. The only reason I haven't given a lower rating is because she went far beyond what is required to help struggling students.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Attendance is a must like most if not all labs. She can be a bit erratic but she seems to love what she does. The online labs really only take a small amount of time and as long as you're done with everything for the day and she takes attendance then you can leave.

Dr. Ramanath is not that bad of a teacher. She clearly loves what she does. My only issue is that her discussions before the lab part usually did not pertain to the online lab a lot. She would go on for about an hour over what was being done in the lab and what the homework was about, and then the lab usually took all of 15 minutes.

Dr. Ramanath is a great professor. Although I took her as a non bio major, she made the class interesting and even tailored some parts to non majors. BIOL 1010 is easy as long as you pay attention and study for tests.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Always go to lecture. There is a participation exercise everyday. Her tests are VERY hard. Usually asked about some random specific detail that she did not emphasize. There are much easier professors for intro to biology. She a super awesome person though. Her test are just hard.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She's so sweet! She's a great and engaging lecturer. Her exams are not very difficult at all. 30% of your grade is from participation, which is just writing a couple paragraphs on some biological topic she has taught, due every class. Easy A, and you actually learn.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This class is very easy if you do the homework and read over the slides before tests. Look at the back exams because some of the questions are the same questions on the test. You will have to do a group presentation at the end of the semester so choose your group wisely.

honestly idk y is professor's rating so low. She is a wonderful professor and even though the lectures are a bit long, they are really interesting. There would be an amount of homework but they wont take long. boil-1010 is a basic course with lots content, so it's really not the professor's problem and she's doing great.

Wonderful person, but not a great lecturer. The 2 HOUR lecture is her reading directly off the slides and having you watch videos. I just can't pay attention like that. The homework assignments are busywork at best, but usually pretty easy. She posts all the slides, which the exams are all based on, so as long as you just study you'll be fine.

Super nice Prof! Don't be afraid to email her.

That said, I couldn't pay attention to lecture. She plays videos in class and talks slowly. To be fair, she did do a poll in the beginning and most people said they learned best through videos, it just didn't work for me. 

I got a B+ because I was bad at remembering assignments, the class is easy.

Hw assignments are easy. Review her slides before the test and memorize them and you'll be good (I'm not good at memorizing but her lectures r great and interesting so it makes it easy). Tests are online and multiple choice, but must be taken in class (system shows if u are not in class). Final is optional and replaces lowest test score.
Tests were most of the grade and they were really easy.

Lecture is intensely boring. Unless you learn super well from videos you won't learn much. She clearly doesn't have a deep understanding of her own lectures and basically just reads off the slide. Youre better off staying home and reviewing the slides on your own.

While Prof. seems to do her best to be accommodating, questions on her exams can often be overly specific, poorly worded, even to the point where the correct interpretation of what the question actually says results in the wrong answer. Additionally Prof. is an uninteresting lecturer, and slow talker--you'll learn more from the videos than from her

She isn't awful but if you cant learn from videos don't take the class she doesn't really explain anything. If you aren't good at memorizing stuff don't take this course it's all memorization and a lot of work. The really good thing is that her final is optional and will replace the lowest test. Homework is all busy work and kind of annoying.

Pay attention, the previous reviews are all from 10 years ago. She just started teaching again and shes way better than she was before. Literally just watch the videos she shows again before the test and you'll get an A. Pretty engaging lectures too, because she tries really hard to appeal to CS majors who are forced to take bio.
Awful teacher. Didn't know what she was doing, and the course material was abysmally boring.

Try to get a different bio teacher if you can. She basically reads of the slides, but I guess thats ok, as it's a canned course.  But she doesn't seem to very interested in teaching...  she definitely belongs in research.
OMG.  Makes things up as she goes. I can read your powerpoint just as good, ma'am!  Boring, unenthusiastic. Shouldn't be teaching.

Worst. Class. Ever. The work is mindless and tedious, rather reminiscent of elementary/middle school, and there's tons of it. I spent more time on this ridiculous class than most of my real classes combined. I have gotten no benefit out of taking it, only frustration. This class in only here to mess up my GPA.
Doesn't teach, just reads the powerpoints and makes the TA's do the rest.

Going into the last months, I was in a bad spot on this course, but Prof. Reilly helped me out a lot. He's very reasonable and personable, and he lays out everything on the table. His assignments and tests aren't too hard, and although his lectures leave something to be desired, as long as you complete the HW and ICA's, this class will be a breeze.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Im going to get an A in the class. Regardless, I would not take again. He demeans me at every turn, and he brags about his availability, but it takes forever for him to respond. He's personable but calls all his content easy. I feel dumb and angry in his class, two emotions I don't usually feel. Refuses to answer my "simple" questions.

Professor Reilly is great, but you dont learn that much from him and its all dependent on how hard the TA's grade you. Go to him and regrade every test and you'll get points back. Hes an amazing guy and outside of class, he really does care.
rating_tags: Hilarious--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Do not use textbooks, mass transit is easy, a few hw and two take home tests, and final 10 page paper thats it.
you need to depend on you own and group for your capstone project
Professor Reilly was one of the best Professors Ive had at RPI. Very accessible outside of class, super personable, and always there to help students in anyway possible. Overall great guy

He was one of my favorite teachers I have had. He genuinely wants his students to learn and if you have trouble understanding, he will give you the help he needs. Great lectures and cares about his students. Tests were not super hard, but definitely tests that you know what has been happening in the class. You do need to study and learn excel.
Reilly is a good guy. He is not here to trick you like most professors. His homework and exams are very straight forward. I highly recommend him as a professor. Just wants everyone to do well.
Cool professor, makes jokes and talks to students outside of the class. low voice, have to focus to hear what he is talking about during lecture.

Mass Transit - Jack loves Mass Transit as he was big shot in CDTA. Class includes analyzing NYC MTA and international systems. Very Easy class! 2 HW's and 2 take home tests. 1 10 page paper due last day. Jack is an easy grader. Very interesting class and we went on field trips. Highly Recommended for easy A, interesting and he is good prof!
One of the best Professors at RPI.  Is very approachable and is always around to help students.  Genuinely cares about students

Slow teacher, doesn't like to deal with 'nonsense'.  Doesn't answer student's questions in class, rather asks them to ask him after class 'off-line' which isn't helpful to the rest of the class who might be wondering the same thing.  Definitely holds theory X about students, always first to assume that the student is trying to BS him.
One of the best professors at RPI
Can drag lectures on sometimes but he's not a hard teacher.  If you pay attention in class you should get an A in the class.  He is really helpful if you go to office hours and a nice guy overall.
Not understandable.
Jack is a great guy and runs a fluid class.  He encourages students to learn from each other and encourages his teaching staff to help.  Interested in students on a personal level also.

Fake class. I finished every lab perfectly, I got 20 points deducted because I put in wrong link. No explanation about grading, never replies to emails. Don't work on group projects too much, they don't decide your grades. Read the instructions carefully, make sure on every things, double-check. Learned nothing from him, just stressed.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Very knowledgeable and likable guy. He's always accessible outside of class for help. Only complaints were that assignments took forever to be graded (sometimes up to 3 weeks) and you could have up to 5 assignments due on the same day. There was one day where we had a case study, a lab, a group project writeup, and a quiz all on the same day.

prepare for plotka to move deadlines to earlier dates without warning and not provide groups for projects until 3 days before they are due (when we should have had groups from day 1). i have had weekends where 3+ labs and projects were assigned due monday. expects you to already know everything in an intro course so get ready to teach yourself

Plotka is very knowledgeable but he also demands a lot sometimes. He really wants people to participate and also sometimes speak up on things they really don't know anything about. The course content is interesting but we also move very fast and there's a lot, so be sure to keep up and do all your assignments.
Very knowledgeable professor who is able to clearly explain concepts to all levels of students. He is a bit of a strict grader but always strives for student improvement.
Class is a free A if you are putting in your time. Quizzes are open note so you don't even need to study and group project is fun
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Plotka is a little hard to follow at times but he truly wants the best for everyone and is always available on Discord or after class to explain things. He makes it all clear if you're brave enough to admit that you're lost which is fair in a lot of intro level courses.

Professor Plotka is a wonderful professor. He is knowledgeable in what he teaches, approachable, friendly, and an overall excellent professor. He is also very flexible with deadlines and grading, offering a generous amount of time for any assignment.
So many labs and the material for them is expected to be learned on your own
Did not give any feedback for the submitted section work and give a really bad grade on the final report. Didn't really learn anything. If possible, DON'T take his course (guess not possible)
Great professor, well respected, always gives clear grading criteria and projects.

What an amazing professor. He's willing to bring in outside lecturers and really teaches you practical things you use in industry. He makes you work in teams and do a lot of technical projects and presentations. He prepared by so much for my co-op and is really helpful in helping students apply for interships. He really cares a lot.

Professor Plotka is an extremely knowledgeable and respected professor, and it is an exciting opportunity just to take one of his classes. The class wasn't the easiest, but I learned a ton. He also really cares about his students, and is really accessible during office hours.

Profesor Plotka is my favorite professor at RPI. He grades fairly, and his classes are entertaining. Plotka actually got my group together to tell the other members he could see that they were not pulling their weight. He continued to intervene to help us work better together as a group, this is a skill I needed help with.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Plotka teaches the majority of the core ITWS classes and he's absolutely wonderful. His classes are definitely tough, but you learn so much. He is also really accessible during office hours if you ever need him. His classes involve a lot of group work, presentations, and labs so be ready to work hard. Overall, he's a great guy, would recommend.
Amazing teacher. Classes are well structured. Always willing to help. Literally always
He is an amazing man.

Professor Finger doesn't seem to take any interest in her students at all and it comes off that she thinks her time is more valuable then ours. She basically just reads her lecture slides and leaves. Thank god the material is somewhat interesting. If you read the book and do the homeworks, its not that hard to get a good grade though.

Posts her powerpoints, which were actually very thorough, making studying for tests much more reasonable.  Tests are not that absurd if you do study.  The weekly homeworks are a bit intense, but they are the same type of problems that go on the test so its definitely worth knowing what you're doing then instead of just copying.

Definitely a challenging course, but doable if the effort is put in.  Homework helps out your grade.  You can work with other people during in class quizzes.  Tests weren't bad after a lot of studying.  I went in thinking it was going to be hard but I pulled off the A.  Definitely better than Ochem.

I don't know...I thought her class was easy (though I relied on the textbook a lot). I mean the stuff is straight-forward, but she obviously has no interest in her students! Her office hours are at a completely useless time and she just rattles from the textbook...she also confuses herself sometimes and has a HUGE habit of saying "um" all the time!

She completely changed the course.  You've homework and in class problems that count for a grade as well as three exams and the final.  She comes off a bit snobby, but go to her office hours, they help.
Ummmmmmmm....
The hardest biology class and a lot of work. Make sure to read the chapters and be thorough with her lectures. Her exams are very detailed and challenging. Good luck!

Her lectures are very far from stimulating as she just repeats what the book says.  Neither is she seemingly interested in her students.  Definitely not one of my favorite classes here, and it wasn't due to the material covered.
Very knowledgeble but has difficulty explaining. Quizzes are easy and so are the first 2 exams. Tip: know the whole textbook!!

She changed the course. It's easy now. Rd ch's b4 class, then get EASY 5-? qzs everyday. 2hrs for tests - plenty of time. Tests pretty easy. Lectures straight from txtbk and boring. No hw. Competent prof, but not the best.

Boring. Not very good at answering questions. Tests were very long but not necc difficult. They did require thinking; some questions were pretty clever. If you could finish her test you were usually fine, but very fw people actually finished.
One of the worst classes i've taken! i'm guessing it was because it was her first time teaching, but at any rate, she could have been much more open to suggestions.
Don't bother to ask questions in class, she'll just tell you to read the book. She clearly does not enjoy teaching at all.

Worst professor I've had at RPI. Does not know how to teach, does not know how to explain problems, and can not answer half her own questions herself. She even has trouble reading off the slides which are word for word from the textbook. Should be removed from teaching position in my opinion.
Doesn't teach. Learn by yourself method.

Has good advice on how to improve your painting skills.  Not afraid to tell you what you need work on, which is good. You have time out of class to come into the studio to continue working on your art.

Take the course if need to get credits out of the way and don't have many options. If you've got a background in art at all, this course will bore you and the assignments/reviews will make you grind your teeth. Requires very little deep thought; very shallow discussions and understandings of art.

She liked people who could draw, but didn't really give below a B if you gave some effort. Does critiques for each project she assigns. Projects were usually pretty easy. Class assignments were sometimes annoying.
You'll never get the same professor twice, because she's got some serious mood swings.  Sometimes she hates everything, sometimes she praises everything.  Good luck.
A very nice woman who seems to know what she is talking about.
I really liked her course! Not a blow off elective. Get ready to work.

Caren is always very nice and understanding. She always has something good to say during critiques and also always has advice, no matter what level the student is at. She is specific for you and your painting and understands everyone is at a different level. She is very clear in what she wants, though sometimes rambles on more than I'd like.
AWFUL!
vague
the most critical person u'll ever meet, doesnt know how to hold a disscusion, contradicts herself constantly and has mood swings. very headstrong, just weird.
my portfolio came up missing...
No Comments
good... but if you weren't an art student the class was kinda hard
No Comments
Very nice and intelligent

Prof Blanchet is a legend. His course is so structured, even though the concepts were tough to understand he made it simple. Lots of homework but if you can do the homework don't worry about the exam.
Amazing person..
He gives really meaningful lectures and homework, showing respect for students' work.
His homeworks are difficult, but if you work through them, it makes the tests much easier. He is very helpful at office hours.

This professor very clearly explains all the concepts. His homework requires thinking. Tests are similar to homework. Make sure that you understand homework problems thoroughly. He is very helpful during his office hours. It is also pleasant to attend his office hours.

For an engineering class, Blanchet was good.  He can be boring, but overall he is approachable, helpful, and very knowledgeable.  I had him for MSL lab, I'd recommend getting him for EMD too if it's between him and Maniatty.  A nice guy, though the MSL quizzes were rather hard.
His notes are great.  The material he teaches is fairly difficult but if you show up to class, have a decent background, and a brain.  Very easy to understand.  Always there for extra help.
No Comments
i guess he's cool ... and pretty hot
No Comments
He is very boring. SKIP CLASS and show up for test. He seems like a dick in class but e is actually pretty cool
Good guy. Good biker.  Not super exciting, but a really nice guy.
Get a tutor and skip class!  He says "uh" so many times.  Smart guy, not a great teacher.  HW is HARD, but 50% of the grade. (which is good) Only 2 tests, one is the final, but not cumulative. :)

Pretty good prof. although sometimes gets caught in side tracks.  Very understanding and willing to help outside of class.  Although sometimes seeming a bit spaced out, he always makes sure that you know what's going on.
Great Class.  Great Prof.
Great teacher. Very difficult homework, but very willing to help outside of class.

Despite what the rating says, Professor Wang is an energetic and kind lecturer despite the minor accent. From taking this last fall, it was very chill: just show up for labs (they are easy) and do homework. Tests are challenging, but she gives a class for review and almost always the back exams have similar types of questions. Lecture slides help!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Professor Wang is a very good professor. She is very energetic in lecture, frequently demoing little experiments for the class. Her voice can quiet, especially as she wears a mask, but she is still understandable. **You DEFINITELY need to attend class tho. In-class activities are a LARGE amount of your grade.** Tests aren't too bad; do back exams.

I had Dr. Wang for Physics 1 this semester, and she was very kind to me! She was hard to understand in lectures due to her accent, but she seemed to care about students with the way she explained concepts and reminded us to understand the material. I have problems with the way RPI teaches physics, but her office hours were helpful when I went.

While hard to understand in lecture, Professor Wang is very good at giving 1 on 1 help.  If you're not someone who pays attention in lectures (you can just read notes and/or read the textbook, but still go to lecture for activities), she's not too bad.
lectures are hard to follow and doesn't always answer student's questions very clearly. she will make you work for a good grade.
Doesnt explain things well during lecture but when you ask for help explains things really well and drops lowest test score
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Prof. Wang is very friendly and knowledgeable in the subject. She will help and almost baby you until the answer is found. Lecture slides are clearly laid out with a recap of important formulas at the end. She does not create the tests but a formula sheet is allowed. There is a significant HW but it boosts the grade. Once past her accent, EZ dub.

difficult to understand through think accent over Webex and bad speakers because our class was split into two rooms because of covid restrictions (fall 2021) so she teaches from one room one day and Webex meets with the other and vis versa depending on the day. She is a somewhat decent professor though actually at least tries to help if you need it
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: Very poor lecturer in my opinion, paired with her  accent makes the class very challenging. A lot of homework in this class, two mastering physics per week and two written problems. She is very intelligent, but not good at teaching. Avoid if possible.

There's a lab twice a week and they're always graded very easily. The average lab grade in the class is a 94. Homework is usually 2-3 hours per week and is only sometimes difficult. The tests are appropriately tough, although it's worth noting that Wang does not create the tests. Wang is hard to understand, but not too terrible.

I was more confused after lectures then I was after reading the book.  She had more powerpoint slides than there were pages in the book and would jump back an forth between them a hundred at a time.  This unorganized style mixed with the lights being off often put half the class literally to sleep.

Wow.  Really nice in a grandmotherly sort of way, but very hard to understand (accent & poor wording on tests).  I dropped her class just because it was so rediculous what she wanted us to memorize.  She had in-class quizzes to make sure people came to class, but they were difficult to understand.  She had 100's of pages of notes!
Loved her accent!

Very knowledgeable and helpful.  She has a strong accent, but she manages to convey the fundamental ideas better than most native English speaker professors.  Her tests are very fair and to the point.  She is interested in teaching and having the students learn and she strives to achieve that goal.

Most ridiculous class taken at RPI. Class is useless except for the Worksheets/Quizzes she hands out (Answers for which can be copied exactly from the book). Book is almost as confusing as her unintelligible accent. Reads directly off PP slides. Aviod Wang; even if it means waiting another semester.

Hard to understand, uses terrible analogies. Ex:When talking about energy bands, she asked if anyone in the class was in a rock band.  She then commented on the difference between rock and energy bands.  Tests are impossible, HW takes a while.  There's a reason she only teaches every few years...

Made QPhys way harder than it should have been. Classes consist of powerpoint slides of equations with little explanation. Thick accent. Impossible tests. Tends to create extended metaphors of grandchildren to explain wave equations instead of math.  Very willing to help, but not actually helpful.

The most boring professor I've ever had. The topics of the class are actually kind of interesting but Professor Zarif just reads off the slides. I'm pretty sure most of the resources are from another professor. I had to teach myself the material and went to ALAC. Trying to learn MIPS from his slides was hell. Make sure you look at back exams.

Pros: test is fair and do curve the exam and the final grade, have extra 2 percent credit for doing submitty poll question for every class. 
Cons: lecture is boring, only reading ppts, i feel like it is kind of wasting time for getting up at 8am and listen to his lectures, just do the back exam and you dont need to actually listen to his lecture
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Terrible lecturer. Class is structured horribly. You won't learn anything but he curves the grades at the end.

Not a good professor, his teaching in lectures was really boring reading of the slides so I stopped attending after the first few classes.  The class was always disorganized and confusing.  I taught myself everything and got an A without too much struggle but that wasn't the case for most, wouldn't recommend in general

Impossible to pay attention to, makes the content way more boring than it needs to be. He only reads from the slides and does not explain anything well at all. Combined with it being a tough class to begin with, it is a very bad combination.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: The lectures are oddly paced and generally it feels like there's no proper lesson plan. Not rare for lab assignments to be completely unrelated to what's been covered in recent lectures. Just feels very unplanned.
Worst lectures I have ever witnessed. Incredibly boring and bloated with useless and unrelated information.

Yet another professor that's paid by textbook companies to charge every student $70 to be able to complete homework.
Also has no idea what he's assigning - see mandatory 1000+ problem week 1 assignment.
Exams are horrible. Pray for a huge curve.
Labs can take from 10 minutes to 4 hours.
Lectures are very monotonous. Homeworks & Labs are busy work.

Shows a general lack of enthusiasm for teaching his class, and does not respect his students. Assigns regular busywork and does not give labs, tests, and homeworks that accurately reflect the level of material that was taught. Monotone lecturer, hard to stay engaged.

You will not learn anything in class, you will not learn anything from the textbook, you will not receive study materials related to the tests whatsoever, then when everyone fails on account of the test being completely unrelated to things even mentioned in class, he will curve it till a 50% is passing. Also worst and longest HW's I've had so far.
Lectures are boring. Homeworks are tedius.

I disagree with other comments. The lectures were boring however the tests were very fair and almost the same as the example exam provided by the professor. He did a HUGE curve even though he shouldn't have and 85 people out 100 got an A. I don't know why everyone is complaining much. This is college you need to work hard to get good grades!

Aside from his poor lecture style, Masoud made many questionable-at-best choices with the structure of this course, like assigning a homework on MIPS only after we took an exam on MIPS. He also barely answers students' concerns on the discussion forum, and he fails to follow his own syllabus on many counts, such as the number of late days we have.

Awful. Worst experience I have ever had. He breaks several institute rules and fails to prepare his students for exams. He is also an extremely inconsiderate person and does not care about students success.

One of the worst professors of all time, labs are either almost impossible or the easiest thing ever. The syllabus has two different rubrics for course grades, he never answers students questions on discussion boards. Homework's are given out randomly, and he does not let you use late days despite giving you five. Take this course with anyone else.

Masoud explains the content pretty decently but hes kinda quiet. Lectures are recorded so you don't have to go to class. The course content kinda sucks and the tests are miserable. The homeworks and labs are also sometimes annoying. No curve, but no final either. Seems like everyone is collectively doing bad in this class lol
There are so many tedious homework in this course. Such as you need to finish at least 200-300 questions in zybooks weekly. Addtionally, there so many high repetitive homework.

Roberge is awesome and is very concerned with students.  He realizes not everyone taking the course wants to work in Astrophysics, so he makes it worth everyone's time.  Honestly, I feel a bit hazy about some of the material not sure I learned everything I was supposed to.  I am taking another elective with him next semester and am looking forward.

attending his class feels like going to physics colloquium. He is very clear about topics of cosmology, contemporary or ancient, very resourceful and he is always glad to answer questions. I took one credit section but still its lot fun.

Roberge = Wise master of Physics. He is without a doubt the top physicist at RPI, and one dealing in theoretical astrophysics. He worked at the Institute for Advanced Study. His lectures were very clean. He is a perfectionist and pays careful attention to detail. It was an honor to take a class with him.

He is a great teacher. He knows what he is talking about and has a great passion for the subject. The material is straight forward and he provides great slides to study. I did not read the textbook though...if you have time it seems like an interesting read, but not required to get an A. Use his study sheets for the quizzes. Just answer them before
Dr.Roberge is the kind of proffessor that is deeply commited and enmeshed to his work without being pompous. humble, and brilliant, it was a pleasure to have learned from him.

Not a bad professor.  Material covered in the Quasars and Cosmology class was very conceptual.  However, make sure to review for the class quizzes, as those are extremely detail-oriented.  The final was just the opposite, very general.  Always a helpful man, in office hours and within class time.  Take the 2-credit; it helped me appreciate it more.

Very clear consice lectures.  Pretty much teaches from the book.  Homeworks can be difficult but the tests are much more conceptual than hard core mathamatics.  Very willing to help the student in any way he can.
He makes tensor mathematics about as straightforward as anyone ever could, and he's very easy to talk to and get along with. He has some wonderful stories to tell, also.

He's very  particular and clear when it comes to lecturing.  He expects students to be prepared for class and paying attention.  Don't even think about doing something else during his class!  He's very demanding of students, and he would be a good person to ask for help if he wasn't so busy and stressed out.

He is one of the best prof. I have ever had (undergrad included). He knows the material very well, and warns the students in the notes of pitfalls. He has a very sarcastic outlook and plays the fool a lot, but this he isn't. His treatment of multipoles was excellent.
good class, very clear at explaining a difficult subject. homework is all from the Jackson book - i wish he made his own problems too. exams were conceptual! very nice guy.

He follows the book so tight that he hasn't his own opinions. The most frequently used phrase is "Jackson said ..." or "The book says..." I can't believe that he actually admitted he has never taken that course before when he was a grad. Now he's teaching it only because he wants to punish himself and push himself to learn the material! Ridiculous!

Taught the course directly from the book.  Gave very little physical insight into the material.  Examinations were very easy if you had memorized the formulas.  Class overall was not challenging or enlightening....

Dr. Roberge was my advisor, and although my major wasn't even in his department, he was very helpful and available. I imagine he is a good professor assuming he cares about his classes as much as his advisees.
Dr. Roberge is brilliant yet humble. He is an excellent lecturer, clear communicator, and demonstrates that he cares about his classes.

Nao was totally awesome. I think art is a hard subject that is very controversial, so if you're a sheltered freak, living under a rock with super conservative parents, she will blow your mind. cognitive dissonance from real learning makes you wanna hate her but she's the most caring person ever. she cared about me. bigtime
Facebook-based class interaction, movies in class, and encourages free and creative thinking...  A breath of fresh air for this engineering school environment.

It appears as if many of the RPI students who gave Nao ridiculously harsh criticism are afraid of themselves and being free thinkers.  Nao excels at getting students to think outside the norm and she challenges us to look at ourselves in new ways.  She is wonderful!

Nao is the coolest. If you can take a class with her, do it! She has done a lot of really interesting work, and is very helpful if you have any questions. Just look up "Nanookie of the North" on YouTube. It explains Nao to a "T".

She is a little weak in the music arena but strong in film performance and fine art, but as a capstone teacher she is varied enough. as long as shes not restricting media thats not "creative enough" or is too "corporate" for her tastes, i think shes all around totally cool.

She studied at the San Francisco Art institute, I think she critique's bad work harshly, but usually the work presented is clearly mediocre, and therefore deserves the critism. RPI students are just living in a bubble and she tends to pop it with clear explanations of what the real world is like.

nao is smart and knows how to be an artist and teaches that expertly. she's creative, her work is great, and the work she shows is great as well. she's sometimes disorganized but you can learn a lot by examining how she's fashioned her own arts career.
great
"Precisely what's wrong with the EMAC department."
dumb b*tch.  can't teach.  won't learn anything.  waste of time and money.  and she has a knack of picking horrible TAs.
She seems to have her own agenda but is a nice person.  MAybe not the best teacher, maybe a little stange, but if you really wanted to get something out of her course you could.

The worst part of this is that she's incredibly stupid.  She's teaching a class that she has no knowledge of, regardless of the fact that she's spent (and wasted) her life in the same field.  She knows nothing.  By far the worst class I've taken, ever.

Absolutely, without a doubt, the worst professor I've ever had, period.  A trained monkey could do her job.  She offers no incentive to get involved with the class.  Why she gets paid, I have no idea.  The class is easy as hell, but it's intolerable.

Absolutely horrid, she doesn't teach she just shows movies and wants you to agree with her not that it matters. If you can get Igor Vamos to teach, he guest taught once and I learned more in a day than all year in her class.
Joke of a class.  A waste of 4 credits.  Take it if it's required, but try something more intense if you're allowed to skip it.
funny and knowledgeable, will end class early if the topic is something easy. lots of practice material availible if you need it
funny and smart.
best teacher I had at rpi my freshman year hands down
Amazing teacher! I would definitely recommend him. He is very nice, and keeps you interested. He is clear and helpful.

Knew his stuff and went out of his way to make sure we knew the material. Accent's not a problem, random tangents on his favorite movies & books made an awful class somewhat bearable-we once watched his 10 favorite movie moments at the end of class. He would solve the in-class problems himself rather than use the solutions manual

IEA is a terrible class.  That said, it's required for all engineers.  Dobry was a great guy and a pretty good teacher.  Never went to his office hours (IEA is REALLY EASY) but his explanations in class were clear.  Big fan of movies, one class we even watched his top 10 movie quotes of all time.

might be hard to understand at first but you do get used to it. and he does like to say "substraction" instead of "subtraction". he randomly talks about movies which is a nice tiny break from the class material. but he teaches well and is really nice.

Great teacher! The subject sucks, but he keeps everybody awake with jokes, and a funny accent. You'll get used to hearing "soob-straction" instead of subtraction. Once we took a break from work, and watched a quick movie.
Good teacher, probably my best in my first semester at RPI.  Tries his best to help you out, it's just really up to you as to whether you want to take advantage of this or not.
He is the human form of Strongbad.  Really funny, not my favorite class for sure but he made it bearable.  It sucked when he left the TAs to teaching though...
no child left behind!
i don't really like his way of teaching...
No Comments
Takes the awfulness out of IEA by slipping up on english phrases. My favorite..."It is time to get you hands wet and your feet dirty"
doesn't speak english well but you get used to the way he speaks.  Its hard to get an A in this class unless you put a lot of time into it.  Sometimes he is funny.

This class has too much work for a 2 credit class... The midterm and final are not difficult except for the fact that we also have a weekly reading on top of those assignments. And the final draft of our group research paper is also due the week of the final and another weekly assignment. I spent too much time on this class.

Interesting and kinda funny in lectures. Doesn't reply when you reach out in both emails and WebEx, stick to office hours. Grades assignments extremely late, and final grades were released ~ 1 week after all my other classes. Long readings & little worktime for final assignments/group projects for 2 credits. TLDR: Take any other PD II professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Please take this class with Hoffman instead. Dr.Lyles is funny at first and then you quickly realize he doesn't grade anything on time for the majority of the semester and gives strict yet unclear deadlines. You won't have the time to work through your essays/ projects. He doesn't respond to any of his emails either.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: spends the entire 2 hours pretending he's giving a ted talk - have to attend in to get participation points. midterm, final, & group project are super long essays that he wont grade until the very last minute & won't give any feedback. if you ask for help, he's super condescending. he makes this reqired prof dev class much harder than it should be.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: There is a lot of reading material assigned each week and thought-provoking questions about arguably interesting topics. During lecture, Lyles would talk for the whole time which I didnt mind, though he is very difficult to get in touch with via email, and is not very clear on his expectations for papers and the group project.

Take Hoffman or a different professor. Spends entire 2-hour lecture wasting your time about jokes he thinks are funny. Takes forever to grade and assigns midterm paper with 1 week to write. Takes class way too seriously and assigns some seriously wordy weekly readings as well as movies/videos. Grades much more harshly than other professors in PD.

2 hour lectures of regurgitated information from Reddit, always running 2-7 minutes overtime because he goes off on political tangents. Loves to talk about how talented and smart he is, but has admitted to doing incredibly stupid things like credit card fraud. Recently said that English majors get paid more than STEM because they have "taste".
Try Hoffman not him, trust me

Don't understand why people think he gives too much work. It's 1 assignment that's 2-4 questions and there's no packback for his classes. Only downside is that he assigns midterm and final paper a week before it's due. He talks for a full class time which sometimes is a little tiring but all in all this class is low workload and easily manageable.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment:
Lyles is an incredible lecturer and runs a great class. The text and films he selects are interesting and Lyles has genuine insights to share. You can get a lot out of his class, but it is a lot of reading and a decent amount of writing. 

He also doesn't do discussion posts.
its a 2 credit class with the workload of about 6 credits. not just at all. inaccessible
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Don't take PD2 with Professor Lyles! In lecture he spends most of his time trying to prove how smart and funny he is (he's not) instead of teaching. He assigns the midterm one week before it is due in addition to normal homework and it is a 1750 word paper with a system diagram. He is unresponsive to email, so don't bother trying that either.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Does not use class time effectively and is horrible at relating his lectures to the weekly readings and the syllabus material. Talks about himself and how smart he is every chance he gets. Doesn't update grades until the very last minute so you're always wondering what your grade is. Tells only Millenial jokes and does a poor job of engaging us.

No students got their grades until a week before finals. Don't expect email responses either. Other than that, the readings are okay and the class isn't hard. Genuinely a nice guy and has a fun time in lecture.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--So many papers

comment: Lyles is a good professor who talks about relevant information in class. Makes PD2 a little harder then it needs to be I recommend taking it with Hoffman. Still an easy course regardless though. Takes a LONG time to grade and give back work.

I heard he only gives A-s (as long as you put in *some* effort) & this is definitely true. He has a lot of wisdom, & I respect him, but he kind of phones it in when it comes to being a professor. He barely grades anything & gives no feedback. If you're the type to argue that you deserved an A over an A- in a 2-credit class, choose a different prof.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: He's a funny and entertaining guy, but he grades hard. PD2 is supposed to be an easy A because it's introducing you to engineering in the real world, but this class I actually put a lot of work in and got an A-. He takes forever to grade/give feedback, so the final project is hard to improve your grade. Take it with Hoffman if possible.

The course is designed to build your ability to read technical articles so you're gonna be reading a lot every week. I only had one group assignment at the end of the semester so I say the workload was appropriate.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Took PD 2 with Professor Lyles. He takes this 2 credit course too f***ing seriously. Throughout the semester, I was more stressed about getting his work done rather than my advanced CS classes. One 40+ page reading a week plus a reflection, on top of a group project dye every week. Should be a 4 credit class or there should be less work.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Langdon is my best memory of RPI. What a great experience. Favorite teacher!
He is an excellent teacher, and very engaging as a professor.  Extremely helpful and understanding, and I look forward to taking my lass HASS elective with him :)
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Had him for American Politics in Crisis. Fantastic class. Class discussions motivated by weekly readings that were extremely interesting. Winner had great discussion starters that made for great conversation in and out of class. Also, out of class, he is one of the most interesting and personable people I have ever met.

Winner is a very smart man who will tell you exactly what he thinks.  He's very good at getting people to think about and discuss the subjects at hand.  His classes have a good amount of reading and writing in them.  Also, he'll sometimes use lead-in questions to try to put words in your mouth if you don't agree with him, so be careful.
Langdon is a task master but he also takes the time to be extremely helpful and engaging with each and every student in his class.

Winner is a really good professor and caused me to become interested in politics and how terrible they really are.His grading on papers can make doing well difficult if you are a poor writer. Not the biggest fan of technology...may lead to our downfall. STSS and PDI courses are good with this professor.
No Comments

Langdon is an extremely conscientious professor and is now the Thomas Phelan Professor by that very merit. He neglects noone in class and brings out peoples strengths so that everone feels included in discussions that turn into conversations.

the big winner of science and technology studies is an extreme technology sceptic. hes really liberal and postmodern and i bet his political beleifs get int the way of product design. if you wanto help 3rd world countries and poor people and stuff with engineering go for PDI

Winner isn't fantastic, but he's better than most professors I've met here. He's very clear and useful for everything outside of the class. In class stuff (design as in this) he's decent. He actually has a designer point of view instead of the engineers that we had. Just a tad better than average.
No Comments
American Politics and Elections was the perfect elective for freshman year, first semester. Interesting class, interesting and intelligent professor.
this guy knows nothing about design. he needs to stop talking about hair care products and start teaching.

Intelligent, humerous, fair, open minded, a good teacher.  Respectible and responsible as a person.  Knows what he's talking about.  RPI asks "Why not change the world?" He asks "Is that change for the better?"
Excellent professor, fairly laid back

He's amazingly knowledgeable of loads of useful information about software engineering but the problem is that he rambles. It's a real shame because often times I feel like I have no control of the conversation whatsoever and that I can't steer it where I want.

i was hoping for an easy humanity but this was something else.  hes good about extending deadlines but terrible at correcting quickly. he admitted the class was harder than he wanted so hopefully its better now. can be helpful but sometimes gets on long tangents.

I took History and culture of games....in my opinion, the easiest humanities class at RPI..it requires some work and occasional projects/papers, but it sure beats other classes like Minds and Machines...No tests, lecture is basically a napping session...some stuff was interesting...Lynch is pretty cool
Good professor...know's his stuff (and many interesting things beyond what he teaches in this class).  Labs are fairly easy and useful. 30 page paper isn't really that bad.
Dry, yet mildly informative lectures.  Seems more like a survey style of teaching.  Not very good about communication outside of class.  Overall a fairly average professor.

History and Culture of Games is the easiest humanities class ever.  If your a freshmen in first semester take this class.  There are no tests or quizzes.  The most you do is write small one page papers on games.  And the lectures, don't pay attention, do homework, because he doesn't care.

Very nice guy and knows his games.  The class is easy do teh assignments and your fine.  Class might change and have tests but in the fall 2005 semester there were none since it was the classes first semester.
No Comments

Never responds to emails. Tried repeatedly to contact him about problems in class. Ended up with an F, which was my fault, but he never gave grades or talked to students EVER so I had no idea until I saw the grade. Rambles off topic constantly, teachers STRAIGHT from the book. Avoid.
Boring class lectures... no reason to go... just go to labs
very boring but very easy
Excellent Professor who definatly knows what he is talking about. He definatly could use a TA though, he doesnt seem to have enough time.
Needs to put more emphasis on making sure his 'technology' functions correctly in his classroom.
At least he's a libertarian...

Adams was a pretty good professor. His lectures are informative, though sometimes a bit boring, not helped by the fact that they were at 8:00 in the morning, and the tests were very easy since they were almost identical to the practice tests. Also, he didn't give a final, which is always a plus.

Adams is one of my favorite professors. He posts all of the slides online, but they're not always clear so I recommend going to class. The tests are easy because he gives you back tests that are nearly identical to the real tests.  The grade is based on two tests (no final), an easy paper, & a few quick hw asmts.

A great professor for this class and among H&SS professors at RPI. He teaches the material very well and is very understanding toward students that take his class seriously. Prof. Adams wants you to learn, but he tries to make it so that his class doesn't interfere with his students' science and engineering class work, especially at the end.

The previous rater was correct. This is not an easy class in economics, however if you are interested in the topic and put work into the course then you will gain knowlege into cutting edge economics. Professor Adams does repeat things-yes but they are the most important topics.

Goes Over and Over on the simple stuff and completely skips the hard stuff. This class shouldn't be that hard but he makes it unbearable AND NO CRIB SHEET!!!! The tests knock you on your butt....if you you're looking for an easy class in econ this is far from it!

Great professor, knows the material and can explain it well.  Sometimes things can get a little drawn out when seemingly simple concepts are explained again and again, but the course caters to non-econ majors so I guess it's to be expected.

He's nice at first glance but a real **** if you actually need something from him, like an extension if you're sick or if you're late to class. He's pretty much by the book and doesn't allow for humanity.
Difficult material that he makes moderately easy by only testing a limited set of what he teaches.

Prof Adams is enjoyable. A surprising find at RPI. A prof with economics PHd from University of Chicago! I mean UChicago is an excellent place known for its economics. And Prof Adams knows his economics, very knowledgable, and has a great feel for his students. I love this guy, easy and fun!

Prof Adams is definitely an interesting one.  Your best bet is to sit in class and not say a word and you will be fine.  He hates being emailed so I recommend not doing it.  His tests are fairly easy and if you need help I suggest forming a study group or going to see him during his office hours.

This guy is really easy and is pretty helpful. The guy who wrote that hes strict is a moron. So he wants you to raise your hand. Its basic classroom etiquette. Plus he tries to find outside material that is interesting.
This guy is so old fashioned and mean.... cant eat or drink... have to raise hand... cant walk in late... basically if he could hit u with a ruler he would.... i dont recommend him
awesome guy and easy as hell
Wow. Easiest A.... ever. Take as many classes with him as possible.
One of the best professors on campus
He's a very friendly guy, but sometimes he seems lost and like he doesn't know what he's doing.
Very friendly and caring professor. Knows his material well and has a sense of humor. Answered all my questions without being condescending and responded to all my emails promptly.

I suppose it's not really fair for me to rate this guy as I never actually went to his class. He put me to sleep in the first two lectures so I figured might as well stay home in bed if I was going to sleep.  With that said the curve in this class was awesome, I had a B with a 48 average.
Breneman is a really helpful professor. Easy to contact if you had questions.
No Comments
No Comments
Since I like this subject, it's quite easy for me to understand him. Enough said.
No Comments
He can sometimes go off on a tangent during lectures, telling stories about his grad work and whatnot, but most of them are funny.
Friendly. Replied to emails quickly.
He is ok, but he is very unclear in what he wants.  He has 3 TAs!!!  What a jerk.  He assigns a lot of hw and asks questions on tests that are unreleated to class dissucsions.
No Comments
Breneman is very clear & helpful, willing to give students extra atention

Every exam/quiz question is taken directly from assigned homework. Questions were selected from the simpler/exemplary type homework problems. Calculator & crib-sheet were allowed in all exams but not in quizzes. Use the solution manual. No attendance, no graded homework. 3-exams, a cumulative final & a weekly quiz from the previous weeks homework.

Honestly hes probably one of the better DS profs out there.  Subject material can be challenging but most of his test and quiz questions come straight out of HW problems that he assigns.  Lectures can be somewhat boring but hes clearly trying his best to teach it.

Every time I show up to lecture, I regret it. The lectures are not helpful, just read the book. If you stay exactly where the syllabus says you should be, you'll be ahead, because he is ALWAYS behind in his lectures.
He was a terrible teacher. I'm so lucky I took Calc 1 in H.S. His exams questions come exactly from the homework problems so make sure you do those. Don't go to class. It's definitely not worth it.

Extremely easy for Diffeq, we could use a crib sheet to put all formulas so tests essentially came down to copying the right equation and doing some algebraic simplification. Lectures were boring, yet somehow useful.  Weekly quizzes not hard if you do even just a few of the suggest problems from the book.

Dont bother attending class. Just teach yourself and go to office hours and you are pretty much guaranteed an A... Going and listening to him for 2 hours is the BIGGEST waste of time. Do yourself a favor and go have a beer instead.
By far the easiest differential equations professor. Questions on the tests are straight out of the practice problems assigned to you. Easy A

Makes absolutely no sense in lecture. Sometimes you can get lucky and get a qualified TA who can translate his two hours of nonsense for the past 3 classes into an easily understandable 20 min review. Then again, you can get a TA who doesn't speak english very well and is equally unorganized. Avoid him if you can, and if not - do the optional hw.

No homework, class attendance is optional, only tests and quizzes, and he drops the lowest test(aka. no FINAL!!!). Study homework problems and you should do fine. His lectures do get long and boring, and he has trouble explaining things, but eventually you'll understand, maybe if its not the same day of class.
He does not give homework or projects. There are just tests and quizzes. His lectures can get a little long but overall he teaches well. The TA is very helpful.
