I even visited her during some weekends.  She did have high standard on assignments though. Extra reading was required to complete them well.

The professor is accessible outside class.   Otherwise, things are pretty bad - lectures are insipid with too many slides and people dozing off, HWs do not have clear requirements, late day policy is a joke etc.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: The professor always picks up most up-to-date modern techniques and explains them in clear manner with lots of examples. I learned a lot of interesting and useful methods. This is the best part of the course. Based on my observations, late assignment submissions were never allowed. It's the best course I've taken .
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: The Professor is really awful at explaining things.  Saving grace: Easy A-s and relaxed late day policies. The only caveat is that these things are never stated explicitly.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Like others who stay in the class I really enjoyed both of her NLP course and AI course. I plan to take her other courses in the future.  Her lectures are always extremely informative and up-to-date.  All of the assignments are challenging and fun. She offers many extra office hours and always makes herself available upon request.  Take her!

What happens in this class: You sleep in the class or you don't show up. You do the 5 HWs whose requirements are not clear. You do a final project (often trivial) on a topic of your choice. The professor offers little help.  Silver Lining: Whatever is mentioned in the class policy section of this course's website, none of that is followed!
Extremely disorganized class, lectures are mostly filled with useless material with 200+ ppt slides. Homeworks are spent deciphering what to do rather than actually doing it

Spends too much time on simple things then not enough time on harder things. Still learned what he taught in class, but he doesn't cover the information with enough depth to do the homework. You should definitely read to understand the material well.

Really terrible lecturer. We were always behind and sometimes we didn't even cover all the material before the tests. Half the time he's talking to himself and not lecturing, so it's really hard to learn anything in his classes. some people show up to the lecture for attendance and watch videos of other prof's lectures. It's the only way to pass.

Dr. Ryu should have a high score because he is one of the best lecturers I've had. You have to go to class for clicker questions, but it's actually helpful compared to Ma's lectures because it's all practice problems, which are similar to what the tests are comprised of. Good idea to read the textbook, you'll ace the exams. Cute little guy.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Heavy accent. Boring lecture.  Too much time on basic topics-falls behind other lectures quickly. Doesn't hit main topics of lectures that are usually on exams.
He was a horrible teacher, for some reason he would laugh all the time for no reason.  He also changed his grading scheme at the end of the semester. I remember nothing from his class

I didn't really learn anything from his class, out of our 3 exams, 2 of them were take home so in the end, I ended up not really learning anything.  He laughs a lot, even over stuff that isn't funny...the test questions are the ones from past exams that he posts online..good thing, or else Phy chem at RPI would be as hard as it is at other colleges

Dr. Ryu was an excellent teacher, his problems were of the correct difficulty to maximize my learning, and his tests were as expected, challenging, and of a correct length.  Overall, he was an excellent professor.
SO EASY. tests were just like homework. he made certain to repeat the important stuff so you had no excuse for not knowing it.

he spends far too much time on simple subjects. his tests have not followed a pattern (1st was multiple-choice, 2nd was open-ended, 3rd remains to be seen). difficult topics are not covered in sufficient detail. i wish i had a different professor

Spends too much time explaining simple concepts and not enough time explaining hard areas. Tends to ask at least one question on each test that cannot be studied for. Fairly easy on grading, though, can be convinced to give somewhat generous curves.

Course was definitely on the easier side of ECSE courses, and overlaps early on with both ECSE 4670 and 4560. Was lab work heavy with sometimes buggy/lacking setups. However, final creative project allowed for a lot of freedom but seemed to be difficult for a lot of other students to complete.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: This course was exceptionally interesting for those looking for a course in communication systems, although a bit theory heavy. Professor Kar provided all materials online and was easily reached for help and feedback. As a senior, homeworks were more difficult than average, with heavy focus on Signals & Systems math and MATLAB demos.

Professor Kar decided to make the cutoff for an A absurdly high (95) without warning at the end of the semester, after we already submitted course evaluations. Lectures were useless for the labs and final project, so you could do this course on your own. No one would have attended his mumbling lectures if there weren't quizzes due after each one.

IoT doesn't have exams but has labs, homeworks, and daily in-class quizzes. Professor Kar is always willing to help for any questions you may have and is very flexible on due dates. Lectures were interesting.

Easy class, material is well explained. Professor has a bit of an accent/stutter but it's not severe. Excellent notes provided. Exams were open everything. There was a semester project, but options were pretty much unlimited.

The class was not bad as I thought it would be and I was really nervous about the probability stuff but it was not difficult at all and overall an easy class if you are used to do your stuff on time and also if you do understand the homeworks you should be fine.

I don't know what everyone is talking about...Kar is a good teacher.  He does stutter, but his examples are straightfoward.  The homeworks really weren't that bad and the tests were a little long, but comon, it was curved (not to mention open book open notes).

The assignments from this professor are very long and difficult to finish.  I would aspend 8 hours working on any given assignment.  Furthermore, the tests are way to long.  Many people in the class including myself were unable to finish many of them.  Though we did finish class a week early.
Way too much work, tests too long....even if you know all the answers you can't finish them. Hard to understand, stutters more than porky ****..Nice guy....but bad teacher

15 weeks felt like an eternity.  Hard to understand.  Usually unprepared for class.  Never finishes examples, most likely because he doesn't know how.  Has no clue how long a test takes. (Nobody ever finished them.)  Shouldn't be teaching graduate courses

Prof. Gowdy is someones who actually knows things beyond the boring standard textbook stuff. His projects are amazing and often real applications compared to most other professors, who research theoretical stuff from the last century. His smaller classes are the best if you like to discuss and learn about current issues.
Takes the interesting bits and makes them boring. Makes the boring bits tortuous. Doesn't seem to want to be in class himself.....
His voice trails off during lectures, making the ends of his thoughts difficult to understand.  Otherwise, is an easy professor since the exam questions are given out ahead of time.
Excellent professor.  A little difficult to understand sometimes, but he tries to keep your interest.  This was the only class I actually looked forward to going to, and it was mostly because of him.
Hes Way easy! Does nothing but lecture off of power point during class, gives you the test questions before the exam and rarely gives homework.... easiest class I have taken so far... have fun!
Lectures are useless in studying for tests, but it doesn't matter because he gives you the test questions ahead of time.
easiest class at rpi...no hw, gives questions and answers to mult. choice questions before tests.  let us out after an hour in every class when we should have had 2.
Gives you all the questions and answers to the test beforehand.  He does mumble a lot however, but I still love the man.
he's pretty kewl. kinda freaky too. do the work and get an easy A. Thas all dat matters!
Pretty leniant for Humanities courses. Good teaching style, but antagonistic with students who disagree and don't support their arguments.

The amount you are supposed to read is very high, but to be honest I never read all I was supposed to, only enough to make his slave Colin give me credit. His lectures are very boring and usually, he ends up talking about some "Ouroboros" philosophical crap and looking for a way to seem thoughtful and unique. Colin doesnt read, OnlyWordCountMatters
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I have no idea how he is so highly rated. In the class I took with him, he was universally hated. From his smartass quips to students who disagree with him to his expectation for us to agree with his viewpoint on a contentious issue. Everyone hated his class, though the grades were generous.
Great guy, class is easy, just do the readings and do well on your final projects.

Professor Fortun is one of if not the best teacher Ive had here. He is so passionate about his work, and a truly outstanding guy. The discussion is awesome! Although the lectures can be a little long-winded (he'll admit to that the first class). I had him for both the century of the gene and biofutures. he is truly awesome.
Great professor. Very passionate about the subject matter and really makes you think about it! One of the best professor's I've had.

The best professor ive had at RPI, a cool guy and really understanding and interesting, actually has a personality which is hard to comeby here, overall the man, especially when he wears his all purple outfit including purple alligator skin shoes
Excellent professor

The lectures can be a little on the dry side, but overall tolerable. Dr. Fortun is a good professor in the sense that he tells you what it is that he expects and it is your choice whether you do it or not. Only advice is be involved with the discussions if you want to know the material for the test.
OK I guess

He cares about you LEARNING, not you passing tests on memorizations.  His class was interesting and was 1 hr discussion and then 1 hour movie/him teaching.  He's the most understanding guy I've met here, definitly take this class to learn alot and for an easy A.
Ok. Not bad at all but not great. Solid grinder.

Wonderful man, who will be greatly missed. To the nimrod who flamed him in his final month of teaching: you most likely have a long, painful life ahead of you. Peter was one of the most personally invested profs I've had and is a wellspring of info / experience. If he ever seems a tad arrogant, I'd say he has good reason to be. Best wishes to him.

Arrogant, self-important waste of time.  Interested in jamming his own limited and parochial viewpoints on students -- NOT in cultivating THEIR views, regardless of how well-informed they are.  Inconsistent. Two-faced at times.
Really dedicated professor who understands teaching
Peter is an amazingly smart and devastatingly handsome man. Really gets to know his students and allows them to do what they want with their projects, rather than pushing his own ideas.
Really sensitive human being, doesn't always come across as such.  Excellent designer, which makes for a really perceptive and supportive pedagogical style.
terriffic professor, and generally a Badass  rpi. There to help the students, provides objective and clear views on sensitive topics in history, class issues, etc. One of the best prof @ RPI by FAR!
lets you find your own path, perceptive, great educator and human being.
A decent human being (difficult to find in architecture), critical only when in the best interest of the student, supportive, a great mentor.
Great designer.  Thoughtful person when it comes to architecture.  Can be very nasty and rude. His comments "I know that" are annoying to say the least.

The lectures for this class were insufficient and did not cover the material asked on the homework, quizzes, and exams. Attendance is counted, despite the time being better spent self-studying. This professor will not hesitate to delay the class and interrupt lectures for multiple minutes in order to scold individual students.
Avoid this professor for ECSE 2410, Kimberly is much better. Lectures doesn't cover the homework and quiz. Mandatory quiz on each week.
Be self-sufficient if you want to take the course. Otherwise you are doomed.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Assigns homework without covering the material first, useless lecture notes. Would avoid taking her class if possible (for me it wasn't).
Just don't take her courses. Her course is not worth to attend at all. Take about nothing you needed for homework. By taking her course, all you need to do is self-taught and it's hard.
Bad performance, don't take her course!!
This professor knows nothing, and can't make anything clear.
Generally incompetent.  She's unable to understand and/or listen to students' problems and does not exhibit interest in helping them.

She covered all the material, but did not really go into depth on any of the subjects.  I learned most of the material from the labs and homeworks (and  from image processing, which I'm also taking).  No exams, other than one take home.  I had her for PEA as well, and I really didn't have  a problem (it's not as hard as people make it out to be).

Let's get one thing straight...she is NOT a good professor.  Her lectures move way to fast to keep notes on, which would be more of a problem if her lectures contained any worthwhile content whatsoever.  I don't doubt she knows the material, she just cannot teach it for the life of her.  She just lacks clarity and is just way too disorganized.
No Comments

Horible teacher, she is completely worthless for learning and very unhelpful in office hours.  Her exams are imposible, in fact she told us not to study material that she decided to include for 25% of the final. Another 25% of the final, which was open book, according to the book "the difficultly of this material is out of the scope of this course"

Dr. Vastola is a fantastic guy with funny, engaging lectures. Unfortunately, you get almost nothing from class. He simply reads from the slides,  and a majority of his examples and explanations are not very intuitive. I understand that the subject matter itself is not very intuitive, but online sources were far more helpful.

I've had Vastola for 3 classes now and I have to say he is the worst professor I've ever had. He's a nice guy, but he is an awful teacher. He just clicks through power points and reads them verbatim. Half the time he gets confused by his own slides so I'm not even sure he wrote them.

The worst professor I've encountered at RPI. He may not have an accent, but his teaching style doesn't foster learning. Hard, long assignments. TAs were mildly helpful. Very deaf to student feedback and over-all not the most popular teacher.
I can not think of words horrible enough to describe Kenneth Vastola. He steals his lecture slides from other professors and if you ask a question and the answer isn't on the slides, he doesn't know.
Worst class I've ever taken. Ever.

Most worthless professor i have ever had. Lectures are stupid and pointless. Have to teach yourself everything as you do in-class activities. Old Prof had open book/ open notes tests designed with that in mind, Vastola takes the same tests but without open book/notes because 'he doesnt believe in open book tests' and expects encyclopedic knowledge
This guys joke are just so bizarre. I mean I actually laugh at them because there so bizarre. I mean there bad but just odd. Anyways great guy, did well at teaching.

Wasn't an outstanding professor, but he was very clear and helpful when you asked for assistance and did everything he could to work out issues with grading. He's really a good guy with a not-so-hot sense of humor.

Vastola is a bloated man-ball of a professor, whose ego somehow surpasses even his incredulous girth. Vastola finds it an unfortunate accident that he has students in his class each semester and treats them accordingly with general disdain.  The concept of answering questions or encouraging discussion is clearly far below him.
No Comments

Nate is a great professor. He really cares about his students and provides thoughtful, individualized feedback. He's additionally very knowledgeable about STS authors and cyberbullying. Lastly, I wish I could give him more than one chili pepper, bc Nate is the HOTTEST professor I've had at RPI.

The load of coursework can be a lot to handle, especially because there is a large amount of assignments to cover all at once, but the conversations and topics we get to cover in class are varied and interesting.
Great Professor with a wide breadth of knowledge regarding social issues.

Extremely easy class with one big group writing assignment and presentation at the end.  Reading assignments are long and heavily worded but you can totally get a good grade without reading them.  Prof. Fisk took a class I had no interest in and made it fun.

Fisk himself was good teacher, although he gave too much authority to his section instructors, and they weren't that great. I mean, they were nice people, but they didn't do much teaching, or much of anything, really.

Professor Fisk is a great professor who is very passionate about his research and really wants us to understand the material ("Artifacts have politics"). His lectures are intriguing and explore topics which are crucial to our ability to make informed decisions about IT and Society.

Great professor, had him for IT&Society. I don't know if I would have been interested in STS before, but I very much am now thanks to him. Material is kind of difficult, but he helps you through it very well. Just hope he doesn't use Reddit for your class...
Great professor!! Very intelligent and interested in providing students the best learning experience possible. He made this class a lot more interesting than I thought it would be.

Professor is amazing at making the class useful and relevant to each student. He works with you on anything, including scheduling issues. He may be pretty laid back, but the class was very helpful and he intelligent.

Great professor! I had little interest in the course when I signed up for it, but he made it very interesting and entertaining. Homework includes reading short chapters from the textbook as well as articles he finds relevant, and about one paper a week.

(Actually for CSCI1100, wasn't a selectable option)
Just a really bad professor. You can't understand her during lectures, she doesn't seem to ever want to help anyone, and she's just not good at teaching. She would get angry when people weren't participating but didn't understand that it's not gonna happen in an 150 person class.

Her main ideology is that "I'm the professor, so what I say goes". She would repeat the instructions for assignments multiple times, but each time, details would change. We had to ask repeatedly to get a straight answer. She threatened to lower everybody's grade multiple times. She posted assignments at the last minute on the discussion forum.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Take this class, not with this prof. Arbitrary grading, multiple crashouts over ppl asking questions, she is physically incapable of giving a singular set of clear instructions for any assignment. Rlly tried to like her at the beginning of the semester and was proven very wrong in this at the end.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: absolutely horrible, the grading scheme is arbitrary, the assignments are posted in the discussion forum and if you're not constantly checking it you will miss it. You have two "skip days" and if you get sick then tough luck you better go book an appointment two weeks in advance at the health center. Avoid this prof at all costs, 1/10 at best.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: This is an extraordinarily disorganized individual. She routinely fails to follow through on promises that she makes in class, and demonstrates little to no understanding of her own grading criteria. In order to obtain a conclusive answer to a question, one must ask her it 3-4 times. Overall, she is a very poor instructor.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: Does not listen to student opinions, and has little regard for proper communication. Changed an assignment's parameters early in the morning and then refused to listen to student complaints about it. Also threatened to dock 10% from the entire class multiple times.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: grading is arbitrary, assignments are worded poorly, and "I am the professor and what I say goes" is a near-direct quote. Assignments are given via SUBMITTY DISCUSSION FORUM WITH NO WARNING. Do not take this class if you can avoid it, whether or not you'll get an A or fail is basically a coin toss, a complete waste of my time, just read Wikipedia

DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS
"I am the professor, so I get to decide whatever I want" quoted from her 
no syllabi, no rubric, no nothing. 
Just arbitrary grades, whatever she chooses to give you.

Professor Keshan utilized lecture time more effectively than Professor Xiao did when teaching CSCI-1200, though her reliance on forcing students to participate often made lectures stressful for students with anxiety. Furthermore, she is dismissive of criticism and chooses to double-down on decisions that negatively affect the majority of students.

This professor single handedly de-railed the entire Data Structures course by three units because she wanted to teach us some arbitrary form of a tree (Red Black Tree) only to not even teach it properly and then test us on it. 

She tries really hard to be a good professor but lacks the experience for being a professor.
my life was already on a downhill trend and then I had neha as a professor

Dr. Keshan is kind and her explanations make a lot of sense for the topics she teaches. That being said, her time management could use some work - for most lectures, she wasn't able to get through the whole thing without running out of time. She also really likes participation so try to raise your hand if you can
The worst professor

Not sure why this guys rating's so low, I really liked him. He doesn't take his class too seriously and leaves a lot of room for interesting discussion. He doesn't get offended if you disagree with him. I NEVER go to class, and I ended up going to this one. Very little work, and the grading is forgiving. One of the better classes I've taken overall
One easy Assignment for the whole semester, but the tests are harder than expected
Really easy to get an A in the class, can re-do assignments and he gives you all homeworks at the beginning of the year. Only has Satisfactory/ Unsatisfactory grading system.
this class is very easy, he used a satisfactory/unsatisfactory grading system, but he is a horrible teacher and i think i feel asleep at least three times every class

Managerial econ is supposed to be a huge stepping stone to the harder econ classes.  He skipped over many of the important topics that are suppose to be learned for the future, and one of the things he worked with the most, the XGame, did not even affect your grade.  Easy as hell though if you just need an A.

This guy SUCKS!! I took this class b/c it used to interest me.He failed a bunch of people in the class, and no one knows how and why!!He compares RPI students and talks bad about the RPI administration all the time.He always talks about beer, his kids and his SUNY Albany students, I hope to never see him again. Take Prof. Julia, she's the best.
He is quite possibly the worst professor.  He gave us no tests and only pop quizes so if you dont like going to class you are screwed.  He is very full of himself.  Stay away from this professor.
Professor Hadsell is very strict and gives us a lot of work. He expects you to know details from the lectures and readings when you take the quizes and tests. Be careful.

Most Useless teacher of Economics Ever! Class could only be better if experienced with a hangover. He is soooo boring &a pain in the ass who doesnt let his students sleep in his boring class. He expects more from his students that go to RPI & makes you redo,redo,redo your papers until they meet his standards. Economics Sleepfest!

This professors is probably one of the toughest at rpi. His homeworks were extremely long. The fact that were do once a week and office hours right before class didn't help much. His test was ok. Overall, he is a very professional and serious guy and he likes what he does but he expects way too much.

The absolute worst teacher I have ever had at RPI. His lectures are completely useless and unorganized. His homeworks are unreasonably long. His tests are completely unfair and test you on exceptions rather than the norm. He can take on a completely different personality if you talk to him out of class. Writing the text may have gone to his head.

As a TF2 professor, he is probably one of the best. He knows the material but teaches it in a very abstract way. He assumes that students know how to do every problem given to them so the homeworks are hard. His exams are hard as well and are not very representative of the homework that he gives.
Probably the best professor for this course.  He wrote the book so everything is laid out predictably. Applies nicely to real engineering applications.

Awesome professor. Took TF2 with him and he was great. He teaches the material well, explains things clearly, answers questions thoroughly, and also tells you interesting things. He is helpful and genuine. Take a class with him.

As an IED teacher he can be a little unclear as to what he wants from you. You'll ask him a question and he'll come back at you with a question. In the end though he is an easy grader about it. Maybe it is just his way of stimulating thought?
Totally straight forward and cool professor.  Genuinely expresses an interest in helping and teaching.  Very in touch with his students.  I enjoyed him and respect the man.
Professor Jensen is one of the best and most genuine professors I have had during my time at RPI.  Do yourself a favor and take his class.
Great professor, very smart and has the natural ability to pass his knowledge to the class.  Very fair tests and homeworks.
This class is so much fun. I would not say it is an easy A but it is not a lot of homework or anything like that. Ade is great, and funny and very knowledgeable and talented.

I absolutely loved Ade. I had him for a new freshman only HASS course for the fall 2015 semester, called Back to the 60s. The only work in this course you are expected to complete is 15 pages of writing and a presentation. There was assigned reading but it was pointless to do in terms of assignments. Ade is an easy grader and a great guy! Take him!
Fun class! There is not to much work throughout the semester, but make sure to practice for the final evaluation!
Eh

Professor Knowles truely inspires students to learn and perform well in his class. The learning is largely up to the students, which is why to many it seems hard, but this can be helped by taking notes. I suggest more emphasis on teaching the technique at the start (especially slaps) and having everyone take notes.
an amazing musician

Amazing course with a great professor.  Eddie challenges students to understand all aspects of drumming.  He really cares about his students and creates an atmosphere in the class that the nutures  learning process.  Thanks Eddie!
This teacher was awesome! I never knew drumming was so complicated. He really knows his stuff and is an incredible drummer himself. You will love this course and it will do you good to take it.
tough teacher but knows his stuff. loves his students and teaches with passion. bit of a stickler with papers and attendance but he's worth it!

Professor Oakes is a very good lecturer, and circuits in general are organized well. The content is clearly presented, and the content on the tests always matches what we learned in class. Alpha Labs were not overly difficult, and grading on labs and tests was usually fairly generous. Overall, if you put effort into the class, you will be good.

I really liked this class and this professor. She is flexible with students, even live streaming her lectures and uploading recordings for those who can't make it to class. She definitely assumes that you have taken a more advanced linear algebra class than Multi, but overall not having done that didn't really affect my grade. The project was fun.
Simply amazing. Great lectures filled with practice problems, which are very similar to what comes on test. Clear and concise, no fluff, straight to the point as every course should be.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: highly recommend

She doesn't normally teaches circuits but she did a great job, the lecture consists pretty much exclusively of practice problems and a few group assignments. So if that style doesn't work well for you the videos on the course website might help. 
Very accessible at her office hours and very quick to respond to inquiries. HW is tough but completion
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: This is the best professor I ever met during college. She's a very kind and helpful lady with rich teaching experience.  If you miss something in class, everything covered would go to piazza including the recordings of entire class. The policy of taking home exam portion is also great. Just go for this professor if you want the best outcome.

Extremely considerate and willing to help with any questions you may have about the material. She has a recitation period every week, will schedule other appointments, and responds very quickly to online questions. There's a lot of material covered in this course, but grading is easy. Median has to be close to an A-.

Actually meant for ECSE-2410, but great professor all the same! Shows how to derive seemingly complex topics, allots 2hrs where you can ask questions about course material, and records the lectures so you don't even need to attend class. Would give 10/5 if I could!

This review is actually for robotics 1.

One of the best profs at RPI. They will solve all your doubts and queries. A great depth of knowledge in the field. Leninat Grader. Their in-class lectures were difficult to follow because they spoke softly. Easy to understand notes but difficult to follow their handwriting.
Awesome professor! She is willing to answer my stupid question anytime, until I fully understand what is going on.

Professor Oakes was the only reason that IED was remotely tolerable. In a class where expectations are vague and ill defined, Oakes was able to provide clear, grounded information, and helping to point my team in the right direction. Furthermore, she provides effective constructive criticism, and all of her feedback on reports was fair and useful.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: One of the best professors I ever had and actually cares for the understanding of her students. AMAZING lectures. Just make sure to study homework problems and the practice exam while knowing the concept itself

Small class. Gao is very friendly and has passion for the topic.
Interesting course material. Gave me an appreciation for the breadth of applications for network science.
He can be a little hard to understand at times but is a talent professor who is patient with students.
One of my favorite courses at RPI.

He's a decent lecturer, but the exams do not reflect what is taught in class and the assigned homeworks.  This is a major problem because your final grade will either be the homeworks or the exams, and it will be the worst of the two.

Issue is grading & final grade policy. Final grade is based on "min of ExamAvg&HwAvg", so, it doesn't matter if you do well on hws, bc your exam avgs is what your final grade will really be based on. RG doesn't reflect the weighted totals, so until you calculate the min of the two avgs, you will think you are doing much better than you really are.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: You need to read the book to get a good grade since the method taught in class might not be the correct one to be use in test since they're only examples but not general solutions.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Take this class with him. You won't regret it.

I took Introduction to Network Science, he is really passionate about this field and is eager to share his knowledge in an extremely digestible manner. Despite the material being the state of the art models concerning network science and very focused on research papers he neatly distills the information to a clear and deliverable lecture. Amazing!

Gao's courses on Network Science are great. He is an expert in this subject and makes the material understandable to undergrads. He uses quizzes/tests as a way to gauge student's ability so he can teach to their level, but they do not incorporate as much into the final grade. Grading can be vague, but you just need to demonstrate effort.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Caring

comment: Very goooood professor, nice and friendly. His class has many interesting points and little practices which I love the most. He is a professor who really consider students' feeling. All in all, one of the best prof I have ever met

Intro to Algorithms can be a nightmare with other professors, but Gao presents the subject matter in a pretty straightforward way. He's not patronizing when you ask questions, and will work with you to make sure that you understand the material if you're struggling. 10/10 would take a class with him again.
Best thermodynamics (MANE 2710) professor in the department. He is really good at explaining difficult concepts in an easy way. Highly recommended.

MANE 27210, (Not in drop-down menu for some reason)

Very good lecturer who makes sure his TA's are generous with grading. Attend class since there are in-class assignments.
Good experience with him for IEA. Class always ends early which was nice. Knows and communicates the material very well.

Prof. Han is not a native speaker. But he is very knowledgeable and explains the course materials very well. He is also very accommodating. My favorite course and favorite professor for the first semester. Would like to take his other courses in the future.

As a B student, I enjoyed Prof. Han's class very much. He very appreciated students' difficulties in understanding and has been trying to introduce complicated concept in a way as simple as possible. Highly Recommended.
Excellent instructor. Knowledgeable and down to earth.

Constantly makes mistakes and lecture notes are illegible; is still using a mask, which would be a problem if it were not for the fact that his English is rough and he barely speaks up. Nice guy, but he should not be teaching this course.

Professor Han is fairly hard to understand and basically only reads off lecture slides. I had to do a lot of learning on my own. 3 exams plus a final. Exams give a lot of partial credit. Not crazy hard topics, just not a great teacher with the material

This is Prof. Han's first course at RPI, but he did an excellent job explaining the content despite some occasional grammar mistakes. Prof. Han is very knowledgeable. He is also very approachable and he had many additional office hours. He is caring about students.

Professor Han is clearly not a good teacher for this class. He strictly reads off the slides given to him making going to class of little help other than completing the in-class assignments. Professor Han also frequently makes mistakes and does not clearly answer the student's questions.

"Casey" is very helpful when a need arises, and has quickly provided our team with needed materials. However, he will also be very quick to point out your every misstep, which can make him feel more like a critic than an educator.

Casey was extremely helpful as an advisor to my capstone team.  He is very knowledgeable in several technical areas and can be a great resource if you need to hammer out the details of a design or procedure.

Goes on tangents, rarely knows what he's talking about and absurdly harsh grading. Semantics can be grounds for huge deductions, if by some miracle you get him to help you, he'll make you start again from scratch; he'll accuse you of 'not following the design process' if you don't follow his insane instructions to the word.

Took forever to return things, didn't follow rubric on LMS for grading them and did not explain grading criteria/rationale. Hard to get a hold of, and not helpful even if you do-he'll basically make you rewrite/redesign your memo/project to his own standards; narrow-minded & very preferential towards students who come in sharing his worldview.

I do not agree with the previous rating. let me separate truth and fiction here:  He does not return things in time- yes, does not explain clearly what he wants- yes, but he is willing to go above and beyond to help you.  Really harsh grader because you dont know what he wants.... all you have to do is ask.

A grad student with no business teaching. Rambled endlessly & answered questions with useless tangents, so we never got in-class work done on time. He didn't tell us when class got moved to another room, gave us little to no guidance on writing the mini-project reports and never held office hours. Picked on the gay student in our class.

Casey was our group's project engineer for our senior Capstone project. Talk about the hardest person to work under. He is a great guy - when he is not there (which happens to be 99% of the time). Don't bother emailing him because he won't respond. Don't bother asking him questions either, because he'll turn it into a yelling match. Worst guy ever.

Made IED HELL when i took it. mini project reports were returned AFTER the first draft of the final paper was due. He failed to mention what he wanted in the papers and graded harshly for not meeting the unknown reqs. what could have been a great class became a nightmare.

He was my Project Engineer for Senior Design Capstone.  Unfortunately, Professor Steiner selects him to be in charge of our group, so I can't suggest you select him. Casey supports his teams the best, by being very devoted to our success, and definitely kept us in line with our decisions. You may be able to choose him as an IED professor.

Outstanding professor. His passion for the material is as clear as day. He gives very clear and interesting lectures, which contain much material the textbook does not have. Professor Fajen is one of the first professors of mine who I feel is great to have beyond simply reading the textbook to understand the material.

One of the best professors at RPI.  The only professor that I have witnessed to be capable of teaching extremely complex and difficult course material in such a manner that a novice can follow.  As a student, you cannot be lazy in his class, or you will do poorly.  If you put in the effort though, you will learn an immense amount.
Do not take this class if you want an A. The class material is very interesting and Fajen knows what he is talking about, but the way the grading is structured makes it hard to get an A.
I aspire to his greatness.
Great teacher.  Material can be challenging but everything is completely FAIR.
Really good teacher, lectures and course content are interesting, which is rare at RPI. Very helpful, and cares about his students.
Good guy, very well run classes
Do the reading and you'll be fine.  Get involved in class.  He's a good guy, and a decent lecturer, and the material is actually very interesting.  An all-round awesome experience.
He knows his stuff and not too bad on the eyes either.

Hands down one of my favorite professors. The class was interesting and he gave us opportunities to see what we were learning in class, in person. Most of your grade will depend heavily on the exams while homework's are usually pass/fail. Everything is also very clear in the syllabus. The professor is also very accessible outside class hours.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Love this man. He just wants everyone to learn and he wants to know his students. Takes class on field trips so we to see things in action, is very approachable 10/10 would absolutely recommend taking any class with him.

I have had the honor of having Sam Chiappone as my instructor for three classes, and as my boss. He holds his students to high standards and helps them excel. He can be slightly intimidating, but that's mainly from the sheer amount of respect you will have for this distinguished and quality instructor. Approach him about anything. He will help you.

Sam Chiappone is a fantastic teacher, and now, boss. He is easy to get along with but does expect and demand a certain level of commitment to a project. If he sees you performing below an acceptable level, he will call you out on it. You know? He will be right. He will go out of his way to help you in what you need, as long as you don't demand it.
He was our team's advisor.  He was really cool and REALLY helpful.  He knows exactly who to talk to if you need something done.
fair,approachable, good class, enjoyed working with the Haas machines.
This class was unorganized and Sam always seems like he has somewhere better to be. Jerk.
Great guy.  Down to business, but still has a sense of humor.  Really knows his stuff and teaches a fun class that is up to date with the outside world.  Field trips are a plus.  Take this class.
Funny guy, loves his videos, easy class, pay any attention at all and do fine on the tests. A very informative class, highly recommended.

I remember him from the mid 1980s. He was funny and interesting. Yes, the class was his podium. He was interesting but of course you needed to learn the material on your own. He did tell you what to expect on the exams, etc.
Be prepared to teach yourself the material and the mathematics behind it.  He spends most of class teaching broad concepts with little depth.  Homework and exam solutions are given in class only.

His classes are interesting. He has a really good grasp of the subject, and could relate very well with real life examples. Gave great feedback on homeworks and exams, it showed that the grading was done carefully. Homeworks can be a little hard. You have to attend his classes though as he does not put things up online. Genuinely cares for students

DON'T take a course with him. Very egotistical and doesn't teach very well. Expects you to learn all material on your own. For the final, he gave us the option of doing a project or taking a test. I offered 4 proposals to him, he rejected all of them. His interactions and approach to teaching made me feel bad about myself every time we had class.

If you get him as a grading professor for capstone switch projects or drop the class. It's impossible to please him and he arbitrarily issues grade based on 30 second meetings he has with you. Awful teacher, worse person.

He's funny, and really enjoys what he's teaching.  However, he tends to ramble and not really teach much during lecture.  He'll mention something, and then tell you to investigate it yourself (if I just wanted to investigate things myself I wouldn't be going to college).  I tended to learn everything during the lectures Prof. Radke gave.

He makes the class fun but he doesn't teach you most of the material that's on the tests or homework nor does he tell you what the tests will cover so you can study it yourself. He manages to talk a lot, though.
hilarious man. Mel brooks watch out!

Nice guy, but tends to not teach anything that is going to be on the homework, tests, etc.  Expects you to learn everything on your own.  Class is just him saying  This is amazing!  It really works!  and not really teaching much.

She's changed the class. Now, not only is 4 tedious hours a week of annoying noises and dull anecdotes, there's also an amazing amount of repetitious and ultimately pointless homework. The meditation was somewhat relaxing, but if I want to sit quietly for ten minutes, I can go do that somewhere else. I would not recommend this course.

Pauline is quite an interesting person and is friendly and helpful inside and outside of class (as long as she's around). Her class provided an escape from engineering, in part because it was extremely easy and laid-back.
what do you say about an old hippy who wants to wrap a copyright around listening ?
Lots of insights... 4 hours isn't always easy to get by but A is almost certain in that class.
Easy, but very deep and spiritual.  Kind of tedious, being four hours, but a very easy A.
Her class Deep Listening might seem like a joke to some but take it seriously and you'll hear the difference. As a musician and composer I gained a lot.

Pauline Oliveros' class came at a good time in the middle of the week (in '03). You just relax, forget about everything else, sleep if you're really tired.  Her unorthodox way of teaching can be strange, but it doesn't hurt anyone -- quite the opposite.

Pauline is one of the most amazing women I've met.  The only people sleeping through the class are those that do not take the inquiry seriously.  If you choose to rise to the difficult challenge you will leave the class with new perspective.
u have to take this class....hahaha ...DEEP LISTENING IS THE ****...all u do is sleep in class

He is a great professor for differential equations. He takes his time explaining the concept and examples. His lectures are thorough and fairly easy to understand. The only thing I wish he did was to post his notes online.

If your passion is math, this is your guy. Otherwise, if this class is just a required math course for you, try not to take. Doesn't spend much time on actual problems like what you'll see on his tests. His notes are on the overhead (not posted on LMS) so show up to class. HW is optional but I recommend doing it. Helpful to visit office hours.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Jenkinson is a difficult professor -- you have to go to class, and you have to be awake (not easy). He doesn't post his lecture notes anywhere. I learned a lot from him though and his in depth explanations and examples made the math very interesting. Make sure to do the homework.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: His lectures are confusing, goes very in-depth very fast. The only grades are 3 Tests and a quiz average each worth 25% with an optional final. Weekly quizzes are covered in the weekly recitations right before so they aren't too bad. Tests are hard because they do not represent what was on the quizzes and sometimes things not covered well in class.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Jenkinson did not really teach, he showed complicated topics with many examples that were difficult to follow. He was poor at explaining major topics and went very in depth to the point where his class was behind other Calculus 2 classes. The test questions extremely difficult because they were harder than anything seen on HW or class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests are tough

comment: Jenkinson was a solid teacher for differential equations. Lectures were pretty boring but he actually works out a lot of example problems which is useful. Weekly quizzes are pretty easy. Tests you may need to study for but he offers you a crib sheet. Likable guy and easy to approach because he is young.
Jenkinson is so easy. Just show up, take notes, do the homework, and you'll get an easy A in this course. Also, he's really hot.

Dr. Mike is my favorite professor ever! He cares about all his students and would do anything for them! He's so passionate and loves what he does. You're so lucky if you get the chance to take  his class. OOO
Good teacher, class is pretty entertaining plus he is a very young teacher.

Dr. Sotoudeh is very nice person, but during class she doesn't look that way. She gets upset that people are not participating in class. All you have to do to succeed is pay attention during her lectures and do the homework. Everything is done in WileyPlus. The tests are very similar to the homework.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is a very good professor. She is flexible if you have special circumstances outside of class. You will earn a good grade in her class if you do your homework. Her tests are very similar to the assigned homework. She is even better during office hours. I wish I could take her for more classes. I took her for 326,327 and 329

I honestly don't know why Dr. Sotoudeh has bad ratings on here. She is by far one of the most caring professors and all she wants you to do is succeed. I don't think people understand that her teaching style is active learning, meaning you do HW, figure it out, or ask for help. Lecture is only there to introduce the concept to be applied.

She is very caring and makes sure you know the subject but you will need to participate. She is very very academic and her lectures are dry. the first half of the subject is actually easy to understand. After chapter 4 if your on wiley(online txt book) then the subject gets very difficult to understand. I highly recommend going to SI.

Yells at her class, asked her friend to ask our class what she could improve upon, then purposefully sabotaged our class by changing the entire structure of the class and told us "well you guys wanted this right?"She likes math more than dynamics, so instead of teaching you a simple procedure, she spends too much time deriving everything in class.

She explains concepts very well and cares if you understand the material or not. For homework, she only assigns about 4 problems or less. This quarter we started turning in hw online. Also sometimes she has class activities for a few points. In the class activities you try to solve an example on your own but does not care if it is right.
Easy A

She's OK. Here grading criteria is very specific. What I mean by that is that you need to follow her solution to a T. She is a bit unclear during Lecture and doesn't explain the whole picture behind a problem. That said her exam problems are fairly easy. She uses linear algebra in her class. Overall I barely learned anything from her.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Her lectures are good but she grades very harshly on the exams. A simple mistake can be detrimental to your exam grade with her. She tries her best, the main issue is the grading. Good prof but discourages students with her grading.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment:
Professor Li: If everyone fail, then everyone fail. I am not gonna curve it. 
Take this as a result for your final grade, and you will get a extremely hard final at the end. 
Do not take any of her classes, unless you really do not care about your GPA.

She clearly did not know what she was talking about and set many of us up for failure. Many I people I know including myself did way worse in her class than we ever had in our lives (even with tough classes some being tougher than this). Never knew who the TA was even though that was who graded everything and she did not care about others success.

Very harsh grader. She did not understand all the material she was teaching and told us so. The first two exams are fine, very fair. However, the final is significantly more difficult than the two exams, and it has nothing to do with the material. Your grade in the course will go down by at least a letter grade due to the final. Take with Stevenson

Professor Li is a good teacher. The pace of her class is rigorous and the courseload is a little bit heavy. Yet you can learn a ton with her. If you are a Maths major student and want to actually learn something, I would definitely recommend her.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Amazing lectures

comment: Her lectures are hard to follow, and she has pretty bad handwriting. I ended up skipping them all together and learned the material through the textbooks and her homeworks, which are actually really good at getting you to know the course material, which is a big plus. Her tests are very fair and she often offers extra credit on assignments.
Very helpful in office hour. Clear note and great lecture. You can really learn something during the homework, which is not very hard but helps you to understand the lecture.
She is a good professor,
She is a good professor.

Math Analysis is very difficult by nature, but Professor Li did not really help lessen the blow in any way.  Her lectures do not have clear direction, her writing is often illegible, and she tends to talk quietly at the board.  From my experience she also does not consider arguments different from hers, and is therefore is a very tough grader.

Arguably the worst professor I have ever experienced here at RPI. Not only is he lost within the content he is teaching, but he teaches and preaches the wrong information. I was able to comprehend him through the thick accent, but the illegible handwriting on the projector screen was unacceptable. I will not be taking any future classes with him.

Rosty is amazing! This class wasn't hard in comparison to other classes at RPI but it was actually fun. You'll learn SQL, R, etc and the extent to which we learned wasn't a lot but was basic and efficient. Grading is so so lenient and is practically graded off on effort. I had to teach myself out of class but from the slides and it wasn't hard!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: Slides are helpful, grading criteria is not strict so long as your logic is sound. Fun class overall.
Super chill and nice guy, and is very lenient with deadlines.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: One of the easiest professors in the IE department. Even if you do not show up to class, his lectures are easy to follow and he is accessible 24/7. If you can take any class with him - take it!

Favorite IE professor. He's very accessible outside of class, and lenient on grading EVERYTHING (late work, assignments, take-home tests, etc). If you stay on top of your work and occasionally ask him for help (& know what you're talking about) you can get an A. His slides are also straightforward and you can easily do assignments from those.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Korolov has probably been my funniest teacher yet though I don't believe it was intentional. He is very knowledgable, but he often lost control of the class and let students disrespect him which would sidetrack the entire class. He's a solid choice for IEA and was always flexible with absences and make ups as long as they were rare.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Lecture heavy

comment: I took MAU his first semester EVER as a professor. Somehow ended up with an A because he was lenient of redoing assignments, and tests were take-home or open-computer. Lectures are extremely confusing though, and he's a little hard to understand. A little condescending when you ask for help as well.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: Lecture intensive class, and while the material can be difficult, Korolov's open-everything policy helps mitigate the tediousness of the material. He tries to test understanding rather than memorization in quizzes and exams. Homework is easy, group projects can be difficult though, there is little to no instructions on how to use statistic software
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Her class is structured in a very unique way that allows students to explore a variety of sustainability topics from different perspectives without doing much homework aside from reading. There are lots of class discussions, but participation is never mandatory. There is also a lot of work done in assigned groups, including the final project.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Gives good feedback

comment: I had no issue with Dr. Cardinal, but she seemed to have a bit too picky and was harsh at times. She denied taking reports from students just because they were not stapled properly... Also, was not very considerate of students missing class due to not feeling well or having a broken leg... Class is an easy A if you do the work though.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Lots of assigned reading, but you can generally skim the material and get the point. Classes are structured as debates, participation is encouraged but not mandatory. Overall good professor, was easy to communicate with and made grading clear and understandable.
Professor is very involved with the students in discussion, goes above a beyond to make classes fun and interactive. Very easy grader if you take the time and do the work.

Dr. Cardinal is very knowledgeable teacher and clearly is very passionate about what she teaches. Most assignments in this class are very easy, and the longer assignments have very specific grading criteria which she is strict about. The professor does make some class blocks more interesting through nature walks and exploring the city.

I took Sustainability Debates to see if I was interested in a Sustainability a minor and this class helped me want to do that. Dr Cardinal is nice and respectful of all opinions, through is a bit strict with some things. It's a lot of reading, though especially in the beginning, and the final is a group project.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Dr. Cardinal is a wonderful professor and passionate in her field. Classes are interesting and engaging and she is always open to new ideas from students' perspectives. Everything for the course was very clearly laid out in the syllabus. I would highly recommend taking a course with her.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Cardinal is a joyful teacher, with lively lectures, a respectful attention to inclusion and social justice causes, and a careful adherence to principled education. Plenty of jokes in class, an infectious intellectual curiosity and a classroom atmosphere that doesn't put you to sleep.

Very understanding teacher, grades fairly and gives chances for extra credit. Attendance is mandatory, as HW is handed in in person (printed or handwritten.) Class revolves around a lot of interesting discussions, just make sure you do the reading so you can participate! I learned so much, and was inspired to minor in sustainability.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Solid professor. Posts lecture notes and solutions to the homeworks, class activities, and exams. Hosts a review session outside of class before each exam. Exams are comprehensive but fair. The guy himself is pretty chill. Asks students for feedback and is willing to answer questions. Homework assignments are short. Not the best lecturer though.

Micro is a tough class. Your grade is really dependent on how much effort you put into the class. The professor was only accessible if you made an effort to see him. Once you make that effort, he'll help you with whatever you need

Classes are a lecture for the first half and then an activity for the second half. The activities are great practice and really help prepare you for the tests. Tests are very fair and cover the material --he doesn't really try to trick you on the problems. He really cares and will go around the class to make sure students understand the material.
Lecture was clear but about 50% review of previous lecture. Kept lecture interesting and much better than any substitutes that lectured.
No Comments

Nice guy and a pretty good professor, knows the material well but sometimes gets tripped up explaining things in the large lecture hall.  A little hard to understand at first but that gets better, and many stop attending class so it's easier to hear and pay attention after a while.  Tests are fair, and you're allowed to make your own crib sheets.
No Comments
Good professor, very helpful. Explains concepts in a clear manor.
You get a little used to the accent.  Lectures are boring, but if you pay attention, you'll do fine.
cool dude

Dr. Spear is a great professor; as long as you take notes on the slides (which he uploads online), you should be fine. He isn't the best at explaining content, but as long as you ask him questions, he'll answer and break it down for you! He grades based on how much background knowledge you have as well. Overall, he's very kind and understanding!
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--So many papers--Caring

comment: To understand the class content, you have to participate and go to classes and listen/take notes during lecture. He's not the best lecturer and isn't the best at explaining content, but he's knowledgeable and knows his field, and you just have to ask the right questions. He's very kind and funny, and is a relatively easy grader. Highly recommend.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes--So many papers

comment: Frank Spear is both a caring and very knowledgeable professor, who is willing to put in one-on-one time when needed. He is the head of the Earth Sciences Department and is well respected. You cannot go wrong with taking his classes, as you learn a large amount and there is a lot of hands on work.

he has good moments but he is really not a good teacher.  he seems more interested in sounding good but is clueless if we are following him or not. he gave me a good grade but i am not sure i learned anything that will stick. avoid.
Hard to reach outside of class as he is very busy being the head of the department, but very approachable in class and easy to learn from with any effort.
Yuck!Regret paying for this course, don't recommend even if offered for free! One of the worst at RPI - a perfect example of how a professor can end a student's interest.
Completely stuck in the 1960s, unapproachable and never around for extra help.  Don't take a class with him if you can avoid it.
No Comments

Prof. Caracappa loves to teach, and he's a great lecturer.  He's great at simplifying hard concepts in class.  His tests are well-written, if a little difficult, and he's a tough but fair grader.  I enjoyed having him as a teacher, and I'll be taking more of his classes.

Prof. Caracappa did an outstanding job with this class. He was very enthusiastic about teaching and willing to meet with us outside of class. Gave real-world & conceptual problems & examples rather than straight theory. That being said, this was probably the hardest class I ever took.

First time the class was taught without a lab. Didn't write much on the board, which made the conceptual parts of the class difficult, but the math-heavy parts of the class were taught well. Tests were fair and easily graded, but harsh grading on the project. Posted lecture notes and HW solutions were very helpful.
If you have an alternative pro, Avoid him.

Still not sure what to think of him. Had good intentions and was very clear with expectations on projects/HW, assignments were graded & returned quickly, and he seems to want us to do well. But he didn't always know what he was talking about, didn't right enough on the board & was a harsh grader. Tests were fair and not too hard.

He's pretty good at lecturing and his slides are helpful study guides. The key to doing well is pay attention to the little details, because they often wind up on a test. Labs are sometimes tedious, and he'll often give you an inquisition to see if you actually understand what the hell you're doing. I liked this, although others were often annoyed.
No Comments
No Comments
Peter is a really nice guy and he knows what he is talking about too. He is very practicle and doenst try to give you projects that are meaningless or impossible to do.

Very good teacher, the class structure was a little unorganized but he is very helpful and kind. He has plenty of resources online which make the tests pretty easy. Interesting guy. The labs arent bad if you have a good group who is willing to work together.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Had him for Fields I, and as an ECSE advisor.  Very helpful and clear.

Great guy and a good teacher, but a moderately difficult class.  The homeworks do take a lot of time (second only to signals) but the exams are fair and with some studying most do fairly well on them.  Most "lab" sessions are really open shop to work on homework and the 2 projects for the semester.
Very thorough and intelligent guy.  The homeworks and tests are pretty damn hard, but he's extraordinarily helpful.
Took Fields 1 and II with this guy. Very bright...

Nice guy, lectures are thorough, but his HW are impossible. It's like doing a graduate research paper. You have to scrounge all over the place for answers. It may be hidden deep in the lecture slides, or in the book, or something that you just should know. He really pushes you to the limit. You really learn a lot when you get through his course.
Good guy, tons of knowledge
Keeping EE's sane for yet another semester. SWWEEEET
No Comments

Anna is an amazing academic; not only does she comprehend meticulous scientific knowledge but pushes theoretical boundaries to a new level.  She has advised me as a graduate student for over three years, and I find her insights and guidance invaluable.

Anna Dyson is one of the most brilliant professors I've encountered.  Her continuing dedication to students? intellectual growth and enthusiasm has made her one of the most inspirational mentors in my life and career.
Immensely influential, she has been an inspiring figure for my career and life goals.

Anna is a dedicated teacher and brilliant individual.  To appreciate her intelligence you must have a legitimate understanding of the topics at-hand, or else a writing utensil to jot down references and look them up later.  She expects much from students and certainly won't entertain individuals unwilling to engage in upper level discussion

Amazingly intelligent woman, but should never have gotten tenure. Constantly bites off more than she can chew and is very disorganized. Her comments are wishy washy... (e.g. "Third graders could've done this work" one day and the next "Oh my god this is like Alvar Aalto"). Excellent w/ theory work, but bad w/ implementation into design.
Anna is definitely flighty but amazingly intelligent.   Its almost like too much is going on for her to sort it out.    She's such a hottie I spent my class staring at her and fantasizing-- if only--

Anna Dyson is a disorganized mess.  She is not on top of either her schedule or her subject.  She is very unprofessional and plays favorites.  There is only one right answer: hers.  That is no way to run a studio.

Anna is a good teacher, but like all good teachers, she does not baby you and hold your hand all day. You have to take the initiative to open the book and apply the knowledge to your design. She gives you the basics and what you need to know and leaves the rest up to you. For those of you with a bad design sense...well...you're not going to do well
No Comments

Dr. Allard is so kind and awesome. She definitely is under appreciated in the Business department. Class is relatively easy if you show up and do what is asked. One exam ( study!!!), and a final group project are the bulk of the grade. She will be generous, but don't take advantage of that fact. Not a ton of assignments but each is weighted heavy

This class gives the appearance that it's going to be easy, then your whole class bombs both the quiz and exam because it is simply impossible to study for. You'll be asked to buy a textbook that you won't want to read, but that's the only way to even get some of the exam information. Forcing it for a 2 credit class.

I had PD3 over summer arch. Follow the readings and lecture slides to pass the quizzes. There is a writing assignment but she'll give you full points as long as you follow the rubrics given. You'll have a couple representations but she is a lenient grader. She's quick to provide written feedback on papers and is very approachable.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She is a saint. Only thing that made IED tolerable. Always excited to teach, very engaging and helpful.

The only thing that made PD1 even more of a joke that it was to begin with was the fact that she takes it so seriously! It's like student orientation all over again with all the activities, except this time you get graded for it.
I agree with the poster below.
She does her best with the material. I only wish she didn't take it as seriously as she does. She has to realize that we all think the material is pretty ridiculous.
Excellent teacher, very involved with her students.  You should have fun taking a class with her.
The class is really boring but it's easy to get an A if you do the reading and take notes.  She's a nice person but the material just isn't very interesting.
AVOID AT ALL COST! Worst "teacher" I've ever had. Honestly, I'd rather jump off a cliff than take a class with her again.

THE WORST PROFESSOR I HAD AT RPI. She gave no feedback, and no grades throughout the semester. She was disrespectful during final presentations and hardly paid attention. I put traps in my paper (circle or point out this line when grading) so I can confirm that she did not read my final paper, she just made up an unfair grade. You deserve better.
Incomprehensible and discouraging of genuine discussion.

Could be interesting content turned completely dull.  Far too much incomprehensible reading with pop quizzes that make no sense.  Largely liberal and feminist opinions, intimidating and unfriendly environment.  Assigned mock trial case to complete in the 2 days we had off for Thanksgiving.  Could have been a good class if she led discussions better

Condescending and useless...all we did was discuss the insane amount of reading we did. Basically dumps a ton of work on students but fails to do any herself (two papers and some newspapers). Short-sighted and one-sided. Avoid !

Good God. She assigns an insane amount of reading, doesn't really teach anything, and when she does contribute something, you hope to god she'd stay silent. I don't have my grade yet, ande I have no idea what it'll be. Know why? She doesn't give any grade feedback in the entire semester. STAY CLEAR!
Horrible, horrible,  horrible.  Avoid this woman at all cost.  Boring, one sided discussions.  Always talks about how much money she has.  Just a horrible woman.
Her teaching method is mainly "we'll talk about something and you all agree with my UPPER upper middle class view." Same goes with her grading style. "her way or the highway"

She makes this class very difficult.  She assigns frusteratingly huge amounts of reading but does not teach much in class.  She actually cancels class a lot for no apparent reason.  I would not take another class with her... ever.

Despite having very little knowledge about Information Technology, Pierce managed to make class really interesting. There was a fair amount of work - each lecture had readings and a response paper, we had individual and group presentations, and a final paper - but it was all graded easily. Overall a really sweet guy, very approachable.

Steve Pierce was an awesome teacher. I really enjoyed Engineering Ethics. And of course, most importantly, it was probably the easiest class I've ever taken at RPI. Super easy A. On top of the easy grade, you do learn quite a bit and my class had some quality classes. Take this class with this teacher if you can!!

Great guy and great professor.  Class is unstructured from day to day, but somehow manages to stay on course with what he planned for us.  If you participate and write decent journals you will get a decent grade.  I recommend presenting instead of writing the paper.

Contempory Political Thought was a great course; very informative, with a field trip to Mass MOCA. There was very little actual work involved, but a lot of interesting videos, articles, and handouts. Steve Pierce was one of the best instructors I have had at RPI.

He assigns a lot of reading.  You need to skim the readings and participate in class discussions.  Also, the journal articles are time consuming, but not too hard.  The final project will take a bit of time, but it can be very interesting based on the topic you choose.  Pierce is an awesome prof, and very easy to talk to about the class.

Every class is pretty much spent listening to other people's projects, so be prepared not to learn much.  The class itself isn't hard...but expect to do a LOT of time consuming work.  Get the work done and put some thought into it and you'll be fine though.
Don't take this class if you expect fair grading.
Awesome teacher and class is madd easy for a class that requires audio editing.  Is really easy on you if you have no editing experience.
No Comments
While the class is hard, and a lot of work is given out, it is very rewarding.
This guy is a baller. He helps out noob freshmen such as me and is very approachable. I breezed thru this class like a boss
You won't find a better professor than Greg Hughes in your time at RPI.
Awesome Professor. Crystal clear concepts.
awesome & interesting

Professor Hughes is both an awesome professor and a person.  A very fun guy to hang out for a few minutes and chat once in a while.  He offers tons of real world experience from his years at major companies and knows many people working at other companies.  Sometimes frustrating course work but overall challenging and definitely a worthwhile course
No Comments
IT Capstone.  The class is a good culmination to the IT major, but there is too much emphasis on weekly case studies. There is freedom to go after any project you want, but beware of the final paper!
Fantastic! The best professor ive ever had! Simple amazing!
Chillest professor at RPI. I didnt even get an A and I still respect the man.
Quite possibly one of the most chill professors at RPI. God bless this man!

Awesome professor. HIGHLY recommend for IED. He did not have unreasonable expectations. Explained every grading decision he made. Was very personable. Always offered to review our work before we submitted. Incredibly knowledgeable and shared real world experiences frequently. Overall great guy
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: Second time with Professor Young and he is still my favorite aero professor I've had. He is very clear and goes over all the necessary equations prior to solving example problems. Many of these example problems are similar to the homework problems. Tests are tough but the class got a generous curve in the end. Would recommend for Prop Systems.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Would take again

comment: Solid professor.

First time teaching propulsion systems, great professor! He cares about his students if they're unclear on  the material. Willing to help during his office hours and has a fair grading policy. Exams were a mix of straightforward/challenging. Textbook was not clear, however his notes made things easier since he derived. Would recommend!

Best lecturer I've ever had. Crystal clear. Homework is challenging but appropriately treated as a learning exercise. Fair grader. Prepared me very well for TFII. RPI should be trying very hard to retain this guy as he is a valuable asset to the department with regard to his teaching ability.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Excellent professor, by far the best for TF1. Lectures are great, and the tests/quizzes/HWs are very reasonable. He went out of his way to meet with me for help when I needed it. Young is one of the few teachers I have had that sympathizes with the students in his class. Best professor I've had so far.

Prof Young is the best prof. for TF 1. He is a little new but he explains everything and tries his hardest to make you sure you get a clear understanding of the topic. He answers questions during classes no matter what which is also awesome. His  grading policies are super fair and he's one of the best prof. I've had at rpi so far.
I got C in her class while I had no clue about it. I was a PhD student at RPI. She never teaches in her undergrad classes, She just shows movies and then TAs lead the class. She does nothing!

I really enjoyed her class and her teaching style.  She is laid back but expects a lot from her students AND she's fair.  Plus, she really cares about the class topics and students and it shows through her teaching.  I highly recommend her.
She is assertive, which might lead some of the other students to not enjoy her teaching style, but I found that it aided in the presentation of the material.  I learned a lot in her class.
Very intersting class, very clear about assignments, not too much written hw, mainly reading.  Classes are in debate format, makes for good discussions and class involvement.  Def recommend.
No Comments
No Comments
Hated her.  Always thought she was right and no one else had an opinion.  TAs were terrible.
No Comments
Amazing intellect -- knows something about everything
Used real world examples and insight not just textbook cases.  Definitely the real deal not just an academic...

Awesome guy. I'd take a class with him again in a heartbeat. Even though the class was at 8 am I had no trouble paying attention to this guy. Grades everything fairly and distributes grade percentages evenly between tests, projects, etc.

This guy is legit. Real-world examples. Spontaneous yet relevant examples. Fair grader (this is a good thing). Tests are based on in-class discussion and PowerPoint. He ends class earlier frequently too. Just wonderful.
Fair, reasonable.  Knows stuff.  Good use of outside material / cases / discussion.
Doesn't hod your hand, but is fair.  Knows his stuff.
Great Professor. Uses real life cases to justify text book lessons. Tests are easy, BACK TESTS are key!!
