Gall is very good at teaching Materials Science if you pay attention in class. The quizzes are difficult, but that is because they are made by the grad-ta. He prepares you very well for the cumulative quizzes. This is a tough class, but he wants everyone to pass, and will curve the grade.
dgall is awesome... he explains concepts well and is pretty entertaining... his demonstrations are awesome, like his gymnast molecule, and swerds!
DGALL IS BOMB!!! GO FISH ANALOGY!  and TEETA and all his other crazy words
Very nice guy, also pretty goofy at times.  Has a little bit of an accent, but totally understandable.  Did a very good job of preparing you for the cumulative quizzes.

Gall is the man! Very nice guy, explains the material well, makes good analogies, and has a good sense of humor. It's a shame that he's not teaching Mat Sci in Fall 04, but look for him in the future.
No Comments
Professor Embrechts is very knowledgeable in the subject matter and students can learn a lot from him. If you seek out help he is more than willing to assist. Definitely go to lectures.
PROVIDE US WITH A WIDE VARIETY OF KNOWLEDGE ABOUT DATA MINING, BUT NOT VERY DEEPLY. BUT STUDENTS WHO HAVE INTERESTS IN DATA MINING COULD LEARN MORE BY HIM/HERSELF WITH HIS GUIDE.
cool
WORST PROF IN LECTURING. He doesn't know how to teach, making the class boring, and he never explain things clear. NOT HELPFUL AT ALL. worst class taken.
The worst professor I've ever had. His lectures are boring. He is cocky, arrogant, and does not care what about students.
No Comments

A wonderful professor teaching an intriguing class! Professor Zappen's IHSS 1550 class is well laid out, and introduces students to a variety of topics in technology through the lens of literature. This is a communication-intensive course; thus, there are discussions in almost every class and a handful of group projects. 11/10, would recommend.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: He is super nice and is an easy grader.
Very open minded and understanding, and definitely a lot of practice writing. Will give feedback on essays and outlines before the due date, and flexible with submissions
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Dr. Zappen is a kind and fair professor. He's extremely knowledgeable about this topic and it's a great class to take if you like to read. He gives a lot of feedback for all assignments and really cares that his students do well. He answers emails back quickly. I slept through a quiz because i was sick and he let me make it up!

James Zappen's couirse in WRIT 2110 may be one of the most useful non technical courses I have taken. The course load is not a lot. His homeworks and due dates are reasonable and they have a lot of value in them. You really learn in this class. Highly recommend it. Writing assignments and presentations help enhanced your skills in those areas.

I really enjoy professor zappen's class. He chose a nice classroom with comfortable soft-like chairs. The workload is appropriate. Even though the lecture itself is not so fun, the assignment is fun to work on.   He always replies to email fast and provides a lot of feedbacks in essays and presentations. I learned a lot from him.
Great professor! Learned a lot in their class

ARTS-1030 is a fun class, but to succeed you will need to put in effort. Scripting, filming, and editing is a time consuming process. This is not a HASS class where you can coast with no work.

Prof. Press is very knowledgeable in her field, though her feedback and rubric requirements can often be vague, leading to some unexpectedly low grades.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: EP is quite knowledgeable about video production and does everything she can to help you with your production. IHSS-1030 is a communication-intensive course, so be prepared to write a lot! As long as you show up to class and do the homework, EP's class should be an easy A. Just be sure to put effort into all of the group projects!
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: Vague and subjective grading system and criteria, somewhat unhelpful when approached for help, TA was horribly unhelpful and graded arbitrarily harshly

Pros:
Nice professor
Fun class
Small class

Cons:
Instructions and grading requirements on many assignments are vague and at times very subjective 
No grading rubrics were provided
Feedback is unhelpful, many times correcting formatting rather than anything of substance
Inconsistent with how far in advance some assignments are posted
rating_tags: Group projects--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: A dishonest, disgusting professor. Extremely regret for taking her course.

Press is super knowledgable about video, audio, writing, and everything else involved in broadcast/journalism. She was very down to earth and was there to help you through the process. Her class was a lot of fun. Make sure you study for your tests and do the projects assigned.

Great professor and person in general. Clear lectures and the grading was lenient enough to not be stressed out over the class but still be able to learn the material. Also loves to talk to students about any work/research/side projects they are working on. Highly recommend taking her course.

Probably the best prof I've had.  Clear lectures, great at explaining concepts and using examples.  She will reference current day events and papers, often with humor included!  The class felt easy but I know I was learning a lot at the same time-- thats the true mark of an exceptional professor
Shes a really good teacher. You can read her slides and get the gist of all of the material and during lecture she makes them all really clear and easy to follow if you pay attention.

Prof. Fan is my favorite econ prof. She really cares about her students and you can feel her passion on what she's teaching. Her slides are neat and clean and her teaching is explicat and useful. I can tell you the contents in this course is pretty helpful when you have a quant BA interview. Will take her others courses(4580 and 4590).
A very reasonable professor who puts her students well beings into mind all while teaching a very interesting class. I would highly recommend her to anyone interested in taking Econ classes at RPI
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: ECONOMETRICS is INTERESTING
A very solid professor, the materials is challenging but he makes it very manageable. Always finishes lectures early and stays to help out with any questions you have.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: GOATed teacher, but a bit too fast.

Professor Shi is amazing. His classes are pretty lecture heavy but they are always entertaining. Whether it be his odd Chinese proverbs he applies to MatSci or when he gets students to march around the front of the classroom pretending to atoms, there isn't ever really a dull moment. The class is a lot of work but it is super interesting as well.

Nice guy, pretty clear on most of the stuff. Super helpful outside the class and respect his students. Lots of components in the class: labs, presentations, hws, quiz and exams. Exams are super easy, similar to past exams (but he is not providing past exams anymore). Love his course, but really need to get used to his Chinese accent.
He's really nice. He cares about his students a lot.

Professor Shi genuinely cares about his students, and will go the extra mile through demonstrations and extra explanations to teach. He's a little hard to understand because of the Chinese accent, but overall he's a really good professor.
Videos and uploaded notes are very high-quality.  Teaches this class like a well oiled machine.

Very knowledgeable about the course. He can be very condescending towards students, and hard to find in office hours. If you are able to learn everything through lectures and do not have to talk to him directly, you shouldnt have a problem.
No nonsense professor who covers material thoroughly

Nightmare professor. His lectures aren't too bad; fairly slow-paced and easy to follow if you pay attention. But he regularly belittles/is rude to students, and is very inconsiderate/dismissive in office hours. Finally, his grading philosophy is a mess; tread carefully.

I only last a month in Multi-Rotor with UAV Systems with Gandhi before dropping the class. This is his first time teaching the class and the structure was terrible. There is no textbook and the course is based on memorizing and deriving millions of equations. Homework graded very harshly and takes on the order of 12-15 hrs IF you can code well.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Gandhi is super clear in his explanations. Even when he subs for other professors, students leave the class wishing he was their professor all the time. No book, so only his notes. And tests are open notes as well. I fall asleep in his class sometimes, however.

One of my favorite professors at RPI. she is very fair and gave me a one time exception to turn in a homework a few hours late due to an error on my part ( for a different class that she taught but still). She isn't as social with the students as other professors but if you ask her a question after lecture she's always willing to help.

I think she still does not know how to teach a class. She presents poor materials which are simply copied online, speaks too fast to catch up with, and she does not care about students at all. I won't take her class again.

i could not sit through her lectures, and ive sat through a lot of long lectures, i just couldnt do it. tests are only a few really long questions. and quizzes are just about as long a tough as tests. i ended up failing and i refuse to retake this class with her
She doesn't hit on key concepts- just talks, but doesn't know what to talk about. She goes through material like it's a review even though it's your first time seeing it.
Very useful materials. Very interesting presentation. Easy to reach, and very nice. Very helpful. She even helped me with my research, and we've got two publications out of our discussion.
She is a great professor! Always prepared to explain the material in best way possible. Uploads her class lectures which helps a lot!
Fair tests and extra credit given on the homeworks

Professor Banks cares for his students and wants his students to do well in his class. His lectures are engaging and he does a great job explaining the material. The class is test-heavy but most of the test questions are very similar to the hw or lecture examples.

His lectures are very easy to follow, and he does just enough to make sure we are able to follow him. I'm not sure if this was him or his TA, but I was given a plethora of extra credit points on my homework for using LaTeX. If you take this class specifically with him, beware that he likes incorporating tricks into his problem sets.
Good lecture notes, and homework solutions are posted after they're due. Exams are fair if you put in the work. Goated professor.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Professor Banks knows how to lecture and knows how to answer a question from a student.
He is one of the best Professors I've ever had in my life.
Very clear lectures and very helpful in office hours. Class uses Matlab and is test heavy; 40% two midterms, 30% final.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--Amazing lectures

comment: A very good professor. His homeworks are very long.

He's a very intelligent professor with obvious social and political beliefs.  He won't stomp on yours if they're different, though.  Through lecture, class interaction, readings, and assignments, I learned a lot.  This is the only class I've EVER taken that was fully engaging 3 hours/day 5 days/week.  Never a dull moment.

To keep up you need to read most of what he sends, and he's a spam machine.  He tries to engage people in conversation, encourage opinion, and question.  His political views are quite obvious, but he doesn't stomp on yours as long as you have something to back yourself up.  A lot of fun, the grading is a bit obtuse.

He's very liberal and wastes no time trying to hide that fact.  He likes to hear himself talk, but he is genuinely interested in student discussion, questions, and learning.  I would recommend Breyman, but not if you want an "easy" professor.  He has a keen sense of grading.
No Comments
Wacky fun, as well as full of knowledge on environmentalism and social movements.

Zimmie made this class very enjoyable for his students. If you attend lecture and hand in your work on time, you are guaranteed an A in the course. He was extremely good at answering questions and ensuring students came out of the class knowing something they hadn't before.

The class i'm in is a laid back 1 credit course but it runs for 2 hours from 7 to 9 at night but  I would never miss a class because the man is hilarious and insightful. Not to mention the man looks like Kenny Rogers, that's enough to keep me amused for at least the first hour alone.
Zimmie is a great teacher.  He is laid back but very fair and understandable.  Makes sure students take lessons from class rather than trying to fufill learning requirements.
He looks like Kenny Rogers.
Zimmie is great. Take as many calsses as you can with him!

Hands out packets every class so you're just filling in missing information not full notes. He's very thorough when lecturing, really cares about his students, has a good sense of humor and grades fairly. The tests are difficult, but it's a difficult class. Class is def mandatory though. He knows EVERYONE, and also doesn't put announcements on LMS.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Aram is a great guy and really cares about the success of each one of his students. He will accommodate your schedule for office hours and is very helpful when you go to them.  You must show up to class bc he knows everyone's name and will know if you are absent.  He is very clear and will teach the class at whatever pace works best for the student

Intelligent and accomplished professor. Tries and succeeds at making the class interesting by adding a few cool demos. Tough grading criteria, but if you really want to learn thermals and fluids, take his class.  Truly wants his students to succeed.

He is one of the nicest guys you'll meet and he always tries to engage the students and be funny. He made thermals interesting. It was a little rough at the beginning because he was brand new but once he got into it his lectures were pretty good. He is fair and will not give you ridiculous tests. I enjoyed the class.
Such a great class!

One of the best profs at RPI. Dr. Gold is very real in terms of her worldview, and understands students have lives. Class is relatively easy as long as you attend a bulk of the lectures and study a few hours for the exams (online). I finished all the homeworks online in the first month of classes which made everything so light for the rest of sem.

Professor Gold is a great professor and you can tell she cares if her students learn. The class itself isn't very difficult but make sure to study for the final as I found it to be significantly harder than the quizzes.

Prof Gold has a lot of knowledge in the subject and likes to provide stories as example. She is really nice. Classes are an hour long. There are weekly quizzes, midterm, short paper which is easy, and a final. Before the midterm and final, Prof Gold goes over the study guide item by item in class.

Her class is quite interesting, though easy. There were only two tests, the midterm and then the final and the final thankfully is not cumulative. There is one paper in her class, only about one page long, and weekly quizzes with the lowest scoring one being dropped. Professor Gold is pretty funny during lectures too and she is super nice.

Super easy professor.  Lectures never last more than an hour.  LMS quizzes every week but all the answers can be found online.  Definitely has an interesting personality but is really likeable.  Gives out a midterm topics sheet which is all you need to study.

It is a new class for learning ML and then doing an individual project. The professor keeps the class interesting and engaging. It was his first time teaching it and he did a good job. He know the students by name & gave useful feedback to everyone. Homework and tests are easy. set up Python and you are good for the semester. Will take again.

Pretty tough material with exams being the bulk of the grade. Luckily, exams are graded pretty generously. Homework eats a lot of time but relevant to exams. The class was very interesting! Professor is nice and engaging.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: NIce guy. Go to office hours, he helps you a lot. Tests are tough but fair. Homeworks are really long but he helps. Though the grading can be a bit inconsistent. Recommended for design classes like EMD.
Definitely recommend taking Chowdhury for EMD, his lectures are clear and understandable and he offers videos if you can't make it to class. Exams are easy if you do the homework.
Really enjoyed taking EMD with Professor Chowdhury, he was pretty lenient on Exam Grading, he's definitely my favorite professor at RPI
Decent.
Would recommend for elements of mechanical design and similar courses. Recieves feedback and is always looking to improve lectures. Exams are thorough but open note and very reasonable.
horrible.
Good. Highly interested in what he teaches but can ramble. Took during summer. Workload was hard but doable. Usually 2 writing assignments a week.

Blaise Farina is an absolutely wonderful teachers who is ready and willing to help his students succeed. He provides great feedback and sparks great discussion in each class. I would highly recommend him.
His classes will not be easy.  If you just want an easy A, find another professor.  However, he is a great guy and he wants to see his students succeed.
He was a super friendly guy but the class didn't really know what he wanted from us in terms of the essays. Lecture was dull. He did not make me a better writer.

She is genuinely a nice professor, but to be honest if I could have switched out of her class I would have. There is way too much work for a 2000 level class and here grading is entirely too harsh. She likes if you write the way she wants you to and if you don't you'll lose points. I should have taken an STS class like I normally do....
Dr. Jan was awesome!

WAY too much work for a 2000 level class, more work than some of my 4000 level classes. You will spend more time learning rhetoric than anything else. She has almost no knowledge of Web development, students wound up teaching technical classes for her. She is helpful outside of class though, and she's kinda hot. Take it with Grice and get the "A."

Assigns way too much work for a 2000 class. Unclear about topics and isnt experienced at with web design. I didn't find this class helpful and would recomend Grice. More than half of the class dropped out.
Too much work for a 2000 level writing class. Grice is much better and actually teaches what the course description says.
Excellent professor. Clearly knows his subject. Make sure you really prepare for the tests. Don't use the solution manual.
Excellent professor. Clearly knows his subject. Don't use the solution manual.

Shaver is a good professor for understanding the material that is being presented.  That said, he hand writes all his notes and his handwriting can best be described as terrible.  Expect to have to ask the person sitting next to you for clarification on what he actually wrote.  The other problem with Shaver is that his tests are merciless.

He lectures from the book, which is excellent, and has everything you need to know for the course. He also can answer any question you might have. He knows his stuff. That said, he makes up his own exam questions and they are DIFFICULT. Averages in the low 50's. Tests concepts and understanding with abstract problems. Highly recommended.

Shaver is a great professor who genuinely cares that students understand the material. He didn't post his lecture notes online (even though he had them typed up for lesson planning) but hand-wrote them every class. I actually really enjoyed this because although his handwriting kinda sucks, he is very clear and makes the material easy to understand
expect homework inspirational amazing lectures would take again
best class ever at rpi

Prof. Tracy is a great professor. He keeps up to date with all news and incorporates it into the classroom. We studied old and very current cases, so much so that our strategy memos would change based on current news. The class is challenging (he grades pretty hard on memos) if you don't read cases and do not open your mind to strategic thinking.
Very smart guy who makes the class very interesting. Make sure you do the reading, the majority of the grade is based on class participation and a couple of group projects.
Interesting Class. I like his way of teaching. participation counts so go to class. Keep up with the readings and you will do well.
very well taught, as is every other class I have ever taken from hwe, (about 3-4 now) interesting course, hard if you dont have the background for it
not helpful at ALL do not take this she will suck the life out of you. most guys just think shes hot but shes just just incredibly arrogant. only likes boys.

Quirky and fascinating! Once did an entire lecture backwards! Heard she won all sorts of lifetime achievement awards, but once came into class in a full cat costume! She had us ALL convinced she was a cat! But believe me, no cat knows aerospace like this one.  TAKE HER CLASS!

Professor Alder is passionate but spends much of class time talking about mathematics that are too abstract and high level for us to easily understand.  Don't worry, though, if you stop by her office, she'll explain anything you need to know with ease, demonstrating her proficiency in the subject area.  Plus, she ALWAYS has snacks for you.
Professor Alder is a MUST for aero majors. Very clear and engaging. I recommend dropping by during her office hours... she's pretty funny and cares about her students.

I took IED with him. It's his first time teaching this course so he tried to show himself off by lowering students' grades and asking unreasonable requirements. This resulted in the average grades of his sections being roughly 10% lower than all other sections.

Great professor. Highly suggest taking IEA with him. He understands the material and understands student's weaknesses which are the most ideal qualities you want in a professor. If you don't understand something, go to office hours. That being said, don't skip lectures and do pre-readings from the textbook.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Too hard
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Great professor for IEA, so dedicated to everyone and makes sure you are all caught up with the material.

Very good prof. Tests are straightforward and overall a good estimation of your apptitude in thermals. He drops the lowest of 3 tests, with each on counting for 25% of the grade, and has a final worth 40%. He covers everything he will test and gives out very useful review. I highly reccomend him unless you struggle with test heavy courses.

Typical classes are lectures followed by easy mini group project that you work on with an assigned group for 10 minutes and then present. She gives notice for pop quizzes that are just one short answer question. Hw assignments are just readings that you write a page on which are fairly easy to do but you need to remember when they are due.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: TONS of homework. Hard to get an A, but most people can get an A-.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Great class. A little too much to read and I missed the first assignment (my bad, it was already posted). The project was interesting and the class had a lot of activities to keep it fun. Learned a lot and used it in a job interview
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Very cool examples. Really easy to approach!
super easy and caring if you get to know her. show up and participate in class and she'll love you.
Had him for BIOL 2125 (lab). Good stuff. Just remember to keep up with lab reports since they're due at checkpoints.

I had Dr Cheeseman as my Intro to Cell and Molec Bio lab professor, and he's very helpful! He's always willing to answer questions and his instructions are pretty clear! He's also pretty easy to talk to and get along with, and his grading is very fair.

I took molecular biochem with him as a 6 week class during the summer arch. It was a solid class, and he was very understanding that we were all very busy and that 6 weeks is not a long time. He would always discuss what to expect for an upcoming test (and often give some important hints) during the previous class.

He knows his stuff and makes it relevant to students. The students who complain are the ones who honestly arent trying. He works with you if you are struggling. Theres really no reason to do poorly if you really put in effort.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: This professor was quite possibly the worst I have ever had. His tests were unnecessarily difficult and long, the TAs graded differently depending on which one you had (they alternated), the homework was long and had little to no test correlation. He was very unresponsive and slow on responding to emails. Thank god for generous test curves.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: Great guy, caring and flexible

I found his lectures fascinating. He doesn't just teach from the textbook, but he also tries to incorporate new and up-to-date information form research in the field. The class discussions were incredibly thought-provoking, and even though the class wasn't "difficult" per-se, it was an environment that encouraged and fostered learning.

Had him for PSYC4370 - such a great class & prof. Lectures were interesting & was very fair with grading. He is such a kind & charismatic person, & wants you to succeed. There was pop quizzes almost every week, but as long as you go to lecture & review the slides, you will do fine. Not a lot of assignments but the ones given required time & effort.

prof sims is a great prof. lectures can feel long, but he is really interested in what he is teaching and it definitely helps time go by. quizzes are all open note, but he doesn't always tell you when they'll be (this is how he tries to make sure people go to class). i'd be happy to take another class of his!
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Sims is a good teacher and cares about you as a student. If you have any questions he is easily accessible outside of class. The lectures feel long sometimes but he knows that and tries to make them shorter. He is truly interested in the subject. Would definitely take him as a professor again.

This guy is too big brained to be a professor. He doesn't understand what we don't understand. If you go to office hours he's happy to help but homeworks are insane anyway. Only take this class if you have a very easy semester aside from the class

The guy is so far detached from his students he just rambles on about theory that no one in the room understands. He may be a genius, but I can honestly say he is by far the worst prof I have ever had.

Here's the problem, Professor Wen knows what he's talking about but he's really bad at teaching effectively. He's so familiar with this subject that he can't empathize with students when they struggle. It's hard to get help. The homeworks are NOT CLEAR AT ALL. It is never understandable what he's asking for. Visual learners will not do well.

Class is called robotics but is really just kinematics/controls. JW is a good researcher but a bad teacher. Worst problem is HE'S NOT APPROACHABLE BY STUDENTS!!! Students must learn on their own :) and he's usually too busy/unfriendly to help. Lectures were fast paced examples in MATLAB and barely legible notes. The few .ppts are the most useful.

He was really hard, wasn't friendly, and wasn't helpful.  He assigned a lot of homework and if you fell behind...TOO BAD.  Worst class I've taken here at RPI.  Very unorganized and the expectations are very high to learn on your own.
Great professor, really easy to understand.  You definitely want him for Diff Eq
Yes, you want him for DiffEQ.  Clear, and actually teaches very well.  Watch out for flying candy!
Very clear to understand. Goes through the proof of all the equations that you need to know. Also, very clear to understand.

Professor Siegmann is without doubt a genius at mathematics He is funny and really enthusiastic. (He gives out candy!) At the beginning of each class he reviews the previous lesson, which is very helpful. If you get lost, you can ask questions during class or during his office hours. Just do the hws and read through the notes to ace the class.
very clear and personable
Go to class. Go to office hours. Likes it when students participate in lecture. Go to extra help when available.

Easily one of the best professors at RPI. Truly cares about his students, if the lecture isn't going well, he will back track and go over material again. He will spend as much time as you need in office hours.  Tough course, people fail, he tries to make sure that doesn't happen.

Strength of materials is a difficult class, no matter what professor you have.  Attary does his best to help you.  His sections score the highest on the exams.  Ask questions in class, if you don't understand something, ASK IT!  Strengths builds on previous material.

His section had the highest average with a 52100. Decided not to curve the second test and instead told the class to "just do good on the final." Instead of explaining examples during lectures he likes to force students to solve them and then laughs when they struggle.  If attendance wasn't a grade no one would bother going.
His sections always scored significantly higher on the exams, which says it all.

He is such an easy professor. He doesn't give  multiple choice tests, but they are straightforward. He is an awesome lecturer and will tell you the most important stuff to know. Labs are easy. All you have to do is go to lab to get an A in it.

Best Biology Professor at HVCC! He is very helpful, his lectures are very clear. Conducts very helpful exam reviews prior to all exams. I wish the guy were teaching General Bio II instead of the tenured folks at HVCC who could care less if you pass or fail. I think they enjoy watching students fail and charging them for a re-take!!!
I have him for Biology at Hudson Valley Community College and he's a really great teacher.

Really humorous and charming professor. Very smart too on top of that! His Ethics in Bio class was so engaging that I actually looked forward to attend it. Never wanted to miss a single class. Does have a lot of presentations though.  Never presented so much in once class before.
He cares about teaching; very clear & well-prepared.  Nice guy.

Worst professor I experienced at RPI. Does not understand that teaching is about students, not himself. Seems to lack knowledge and general decency. (Relies on Demetrious for any credibility or intelligence)
his intelligence is as bad as his sense of fashion....
No Comments
No Comments
young professional who really knows his stuff. very helpful, clear and concise.

Great professor. I have now taken her for 3 classes specifically because she teaches them. She leads an open discussion in the class and manages to maintain kindness while questioning your inner logic. She is a great PDII professor, but if you can, take her for other classes. They are filled with other engaged students and her style works better.

Took her class during the fall of 2023. Such an amazing PDII prof. She cares about your education and is very engaging in class. Not too much reading and there is one paper and presentation that makes up most of the grade. She comes off extremely strong which I liked but I know some of my peers did not.

Hirsa is one of the few professors that care about your education. She makes the classroom a fun and engaging environment. She does make you think a little harder than surface level but it is worth it.

Hirsa was nice but her PD2 is definitely the hardest one. The grading of the papers, done by the worst TA I've had, was very unfair. Weekly discussion board assignments get old very quickly and aren't helpful, just busy work. However, the in-class discussions in this class were amazing and honestly very valuable.

This lady deserves a better class than PDII offers her. I love her style of teaching, involving everyone in discussion during class. She's incredibly fair and lenient on grading. Put in decent amount of work and you'll get a good grade. She likes to probe what you know so be prepared to explain yourself. Overall an awesome class.

Great professor that prioritizes communication and the success of his students. Most of the course material is very easy to understand, but please note that the class is very group and presentation heavy - just like in the real world. Overall, I had a fantastic experience with this Professor, and would highly recommend you take MGMT 1100 with him!

Prof O wants you to do well and is reasonable. It is important to participate in his class. Homework is usually assigned readings which you discuss in class. There are PS Challenges to work on with your assigned group every week. Quizzes are m.c. (25-30 q's) but you need to thoroughly review the notes. He also has a few extra credit opportunities.

Prof. O is the type of professor where you could really learn life long lessons from a conversation outside of class. His classes were lecture heavy, information heavy, and quizzes were difficult. However, if you participate in class, contribute to group work (P.S. Challenges), he will see that and look out for you. Highly recommend this guy

Prof O. is very organized and have a clear agenda with how he runs each class. Quizzes are multiple choice, but they are still tough so pay attention in class and do the assigned readings. He does not grade participation, but it is a participation heavy class. Be prepared to work with a group for activities and a final project.

Hes a great professor who is always accessible to answer any questions. Wants his students to do their best so if you do the work, you should do pretty well in the class. Quizzes were pretty tough but overall I would recommend the class.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Very supportive and encouraging. He would challenge you but you would grow a lot faster than you would with any other professor.
Everyone should take this class from Prof Wright!
A lot of work but not hard. Best professor I had at RPI.  If you put in the work and show effort you will get an A. Take Frank Wright and you will learn a lot but be prepared to work for it.
This course demands a lot of focus and time. The team you join in the beginning of the semester can make or break you. I would take this course again.
Terrific Professor.
Very caring professor.  Lot of homework but, isn't difficult at all.  Highly recommend.

Inventor Studio 2 was supposed to be my capstone course. What I got was a poorly organized, low effort, catastrophe that neither taught me new material nor offered me any meaningful chance for growth. Don't expect any of the typical online etiquette you normally get either. By far the most infuriating and disappointing experience I had at RPI.

I don't think any of my assignments were actually read or graded. I just got 95's on everything. IS2 with PD3 has a lot of work. It's not hard work but there is a ton of it. I hated the class because we were not graded on effort.

Inventor's Studio is much better than IED, Ghosh is the man! The minimum grade you can get as long as you complete all the work is a B+. Almost everyone in my semester got an A. He's very experienced with innovation & product design and will give you lots of feedback on considerations you might have missed to help with your projects.

I loved Inventor's Studio 1 with Dr. Ghosh. This is a way better alternative than taking IED by far. The class is very open and creative, motivating you to innovate your own invention and experimenting with it. Lots of group projects and participation in class activities. Easy A if you submit all of your work, & no final exam, just a final project!
Introduction to Chemical Engineering is basically a free credit. Show up, listen to the speaker, fill out questions, and you pass. Dr. Plawsky is nice, but he doesn't actually teach in this class.

Good guy, not a good teacher. He basically teaches out of his textbook which is mediocre at best. I would normally be fine with reading but there are mistakes and examples lack clear explanations.  While Plawsky does seem interested in teaching,  the way he teaches the material makes things harder than they should be. Consider using Learn ChemE.

Had Plawsky for Transport Phenomena 1. Breezes over the material expecting everyone to know it already. Homework and exams were hard, sometimes unfairly so. He uses his textbook for the class which is just as confusing as he is because he teaches verbatim out of it. Hardest class I've taken at RPI by far.
Had for Introduction to Chemical Engineering. All you do is show up and you pass. Class is passno credit. There was a guest lecturer every class.
Nice guy - great teacher.
Awesome guy. Smart, interesting, honest and fair.  You can tell this guy really likes and respects students - and cares about instilling the basics of engineering to all in his classes.

Good lecturer, but her tests don't match her lectures. She skips over lots of foundation information but tests you on it. I would suggest getting the chemistry for idiots book and read the text book even though she doesn't talk about it at all. She teaches basic concepts but asks the hardest questions and exceptions so look those up too.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She cannot decide how to write tests consistently. Some are super easy and then some are unnecessarily hard that even she couldn't pass them. Hated every second of her class, her lectures were good though you were doing well then bam 40 on the test. She isn't very helpful, gives no study resources, doesn't even follow the book so can't turn to that
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She is very good. She keeps the class interesting and brings the material to our level. Her tests align very well with her teaching style. She does ask that you understand the material and don't just memorize it, so some in class "quiz" like things are difficult, but they are doable.

She taught the lab portion of Chem 1 and was probably the best prof out of all of them. Straightforward and to the point, caring and respected - just a good person and professor all around. Her lectures were always easy to understand and covered more challenging topics. Beware quizzes at the beginning of class, you do NOT want to be late.

Great professor. Got a poor grade because of my own negligence in the beginning of the semester. It's an extremely challenging subject; expect to study a lot, expect to do homework, do not fall behind. A few lectures were confusing, had to refer to the book for clarification. Very helpful during office hours. I would take another class with her

He has huge accent which makes his lecture unclear and pointless. He never explained the details about how to solve the problem. The most used words by him are 'this' and 'that'. He never gives any clear and complete notes to students. He always assumed students can easily follow him and make the homework and exam too long and too hard.

Prof Lu is a harsh grader that expects perfection without specifying what perfection is. His accent makes him difficult to understand. He relates stories that are not really related to the subject. He doesn't take the course evaluations seriously.
Professor Lu is very nice and caring.

Prof. Lu was one of the most caring and helpful professors I've ever had. He starts every class by asking good morning and knows everyone's name and face. We cover a lot of complex material in a short period of time, but even so he strives to make sure that everyone gets the material.

Can be a little hard to understand at times, but is always clear and concise with advice. He is also very involved with student projects and as long as you put in the work, you get do well on projects.
Terrible avoid at any cost

His quiz are stupid and nonsense
Learn nothing from his class

Very awful professor send notification in the middle of night tell student there will be quiz in the next day without tell ahead of time.
You need to expected that listen to his nonsense lecture for one hour in the early morning and the attendance is require.

Decent Professor for this course. Several things stood out to me, such as how lecture heavy the course is and how exams make up around 75% of the course grade. This Professor, however, does not upload Problem Set answers, refuses to upload back tests, usually holds you for 1.5 hours or more, and does not upload written notes. Would not recommend.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Prof Chadd goes over slides in lecture and has few iclicker questions which are doable if you pay attention. The problems explained on slides are different than the ones on the hw. Gives out about five hw assignments over the semester but allows limited number of submissions per hw. Three exams and no final. Class before tests are for exam review

John is a great guy who cares a lot about his students and understands that they have a lot going on. If you have issues, he will make it work with you as long as you are straightforward and show up to class. He's very knowledgeable about the subjects he teaches and encourages student input in both class discussions and how the class is run.
Great Professor, very passionate about the subject and genuinely cares about students well being and success in and out of the classroom

I had him for Critical Thinking, overall the class was fairly easy, however with the weight of the quizzes one bad one could really hurt your final grade. If you show up and somewhat pay attention you'll do fine. If you actually try to understand what he's teaching you can learn a lot.

Nice guy, but very frustrating. Feedback on assignments takes an inordinate amount of time, and he places too much emphasis on group projects. Hour-long weekly plenary lectures are complete wastes of time and lack meaningful content. My advice: choose a different HAAS Inquiry class -- this one is worthless.
Ok

Great Prof. His lectures were clear and if something didn't click you could always rely on his office hours to be helpful. He has plenty of office hours during the semester and even adds some extended office hours before exams. Helpful during in class assignments and has no issue giving people more time to copy notes or go back to a previous slide.
He's really kind, and wants students to succeed! Dr. Lee is so nice!

Probably my favorite professor at RPI. I've taken 3 courses with him so far. He is always accessible outside of class and extremely helpful in office hours. He explains material clearly during lectures, but does rush a bit sometimes. Grading for HW and exams is strict, but he almost always gives partial credit if enough work is shown.
Professor Lee is a great teacher! He is a very positive professor and very helpful. I went to his office hours before the final exam and it was a very chill environment, he was very helpful.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: He's absolutely the best teacher ever. If I could take classes with him forever I would, I took biomechanics with him last semester and switched around my whole schedule to have him from programming this semester and is an absolute king. He's fair, honest, and always accessible outside of class, cares about his students and wants them to do well.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Prof. Ullal clearly cares about the subject and his students. Most questions on exams came from homework assignments. All assignments & grading were fair, and it shouldn't be difficult to achieve a good grade in his class.
Excellent professor to study with
Lab attendance is mandatory which are about a third of the lectures. Great professor who is passionate about the material and teaching.

One of the best profs I've had. Super thorough, great explanations, engaging lecturer. He could identify people by name within two weeks (in a 40+ student lecture). The course content sucks, but Ullal makes it bearable. Absolutely take MatSci with him if you can, especially since I've heard the other profs aren't as good.
Great at explaining things and making sure we had a deep understanding of the content. Very knowledgable too.

I absolutely loved his class, and it actually caused me to switch my major to Mat Sci. He was a super caring professor and very involved in the department and in the Materials Advantage professional society for students in my major. Extremely understanding of personal circumstances. If you want to do well in this class, he will help you get there.

As a CSE, I took this course with Prof. Huang as an elective: It's equation hell with a professor who speedruns lectures in a quiet, boring voice, and she refuses to post lecture notes online or use any sort of electronics in her class to help her TAs grade. Go to rpistudygroup for old notes, they are similar; and actually read the textbook.

I feel sleepier during her lectures than I do going to bed at night. Besides that, she's not much work and her tests are fair. All you need to do well is have every equation from lecture on your crib sheet, problems are just plugging in values. She's not great at teaching the concepts, just how to solve the problems, so I didn't actually learn much

For Microelectronics Technology, Dr. Huang tends to read from the powerpoint slides a lot, so the material gets pretty boring. But she is available after hours and is willing to go the extra mile for you. I like that she makes it a point to put all her notes, homeworks, class assignments, backwork, etc. online. She is a fair grader.
rating_tags: SO MANY PAPERS--Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY

comment: No Comments

Uses powerpoint lectures.  Everything online, which is nice.  Tends to teach details without giving the big picture, but that's just the nature of the class.  Slight accent but not difficult to understand.  Kinda sexy.

MMM contains interesting content and DTC is passionate about the content and student's learning. Content is detailed, therefore participation is important to understand where you might be missing something. 6000 level don't let the oral final deter you, if you participate in class it is basically practice for the final. Very nice guy one-on-one!

Very intelligent and has commanding knowledge of the material, but boy is this class hard. Completely different than other mechanics courses, heavy focus on complicated symbolic math that is unlike any other course I've taken at RPI. The material is pretty interesting if you can wrap your head around it, but get ready to work. Few hws but very hard

I have learned nothing from Corr's lectures. He is an interactive teacher but thinks we all know what is going on when we absolutely don't. Is rude to students when they answer his questions in class and talks down to students. Not very nice man. Would not take MMM with him either. 0 out of 10 would not recommend.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Tests are tough

comment: The evaluation includes an oral test.
Biomechanics 2 is incredibly tough, but interesting information. Dr. Corr grades mercilessly though. The jumping simulation competition at the end is pretty fun. Take at your own risk!
Always very prepared for Class and ready to answer questions. Great to talk to and especially helpful in office hours/ discussions outside of class.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Assigns lots of homework but grades very slowly. Currently we have 3 ungraded homeworks and the next was assigned. Going to class is basically useless he does not explain content too well. Figure out how to do the homework based on textbook and youtube videos and use the homeworks to study for the tests. Very tough grader, no leniency on tests.

He tries his best to be helpful. Going to office hours really helps. Financial computation is very tricky, and is very work intensive. Sometimes I don't understand what he is talking about. He always gives the solutions to the homework promptly, and guides us well for the exams. He makes sure all students have solutions to the class given problems.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: He is very helpful, provides a lot of material. The correct solutions to homeworks are always provided which helps for the exam.  Sometimes has a hard time getting his point across. Financial computation is a hard course, but I had no issues with the professor.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Very good lectures, but class is hard.

Be prepared to learn all the material on your own.  Jude knows his stuff but doesn't understand a learning curve.  Has no concrete requirements but still has expectations?  Used the previous professors notes verbatim and had high expectations on homework when the old professor was lenient.  Worked really hard in this class and still didn't get an A
Jude is awesome, easy to get along with and will help you every step of the way.
jude is young and therefore knows alot about computers also an excellent teacher compared to his so called co-teachers and collegues. deserves his tenure from rpi, vacations, and a million dollars
Nice guy, helps you out if you need it.  Very easy class, just memorize the study guides.  Start the projects early!
hes is a fun dude

Prof Campbell is amazing for Studio B! She cares so much about harm reduction and her students. Her lectures are in-depth but understandable and she's flexible with deadlines and participation. And she would occasionally bring snacks to class!
Excellent class and excellent professor. Fair grading, and solid discussions.
Excellent professor, I've taken History of Drugs and Bioethics with her,both classes were great.
Her class is hard, but she's a great teacher-really knows her stuff. I agree with the person who said her style reminds them of a high school teacher, but it's nice in my opinion nonetheless.

Professor Campbell is amazing.  She is a legal historian and specializes in drug history.  She teaches sort of like your high school history teacher may have taught, but it's nice.  She loves when people share their opinions, and the class is interesting.

Communications with Reina was genuinely so interesting. As far as HASS classes go, this was the most engaging one I have taken and she was really lax when it came to the material. Her class really made me glad I took the media pathway, especially with engaging assignments and really interesting lectures if you like this sort of thing.
One of the best COMM and Writing professor. She is trying to keep the class active and she has good explanations and examples of the course material.
Good at explaining and encourages participation.
Easy to understand.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: Weina is the best professor I have ever met, she is caring and makes the class atmosphere perfect. Definitely take her class if you want to enjoy university.

She is knowledgeable in architectural theory and open to any ideas. Half of the class is like a seminar and discussion. She cares about everyone's opinions. I am not so active in her class, but she always encourages me to speak out.

I have Jillian as my IDS professor. She is very wise and knowledgeable. She takes time to understand your idea and project. She gives advice at your design point. She is also approachable out of class time and always gives really detailed markup for your drawings.

Jillian is for sure incredibly knowledgeable in this area of study. She has a lot of experience in the professional field and this knowledge translates well to helping her students in developing their projects to a more realistic resolution. Jillian also cares a lot about the well being and mental health of her students, which is I respect a lot.

I think Prof. Crandall is great!! She knows what she does and her lectures had such an amazing impact on me every class. They were so interesting!! I would take another class with her without any doubt. There is a LOT to do, but the knowledge acquired makes it worth it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Group projects

comment: Gives a large amount of work with short amounts of time to complete. Not very respectful of students personal issues. Wants us to use techniques we don't know. Tells different students different things about the same assignment.

Professor C-K is a sweetheart, more than willing to accommodate students experience difficulties as severe as housing insecurity or just mental health recovery days. With a good depth of material and a hearty sense of humor, Brandon makes all classes enjoyable.

This is not your typical professor, Brandon is a younger, passionate, funny and realistic guy. He doesn't believe in our culture's grading system, he believes to teach through group bonding, participation and self discussion. He is as chill as they come. He participates extensively in climate change protests, sustainability efforts and being chill

Very eager to hear students' thoughts and opinions. Never shoots down an idea, even if it is bad.  With Environment and Politics, you have to write essays, which is never fun. Lectures can be kind of boring, and he takes attendance. We watched quite a few movies though, too. Easy A if you get the right TA. I didn't.
A little vague sometimes in what he expects from his students, but extremely willing to work with you on a case by case basis.
Provided very little grade feedback during the class (Only two assignments)

I've never been around anyone who hates marine mammals as much as her. Lectures are boring, but she is a very easy grader (my class pretty much convinced her not to have a final). Just read the book and get an A.

I took Intro to Saving the Whales (AKA Cultural Anthropolgy) in my sophomore year and it was definitely the biggest circus of a class I've ever experienced. She'd bag on coming to class at least once a week, leaving us with a movie to watch (which we didn't). She gave joke assignments and let us practice the final exam before we took it. Easy A.
She rambles constantly and doesn't follow the syllabus. The class had less to do with law and more to do with whales. Bored me to tears. Highly unrecommended.

This professor made the class essentially useless. She really liked ranting about the whaling protests, that's for sure. But beyond that, I got absolutely nothing out of the class - heck, half of the assignments in the syllabus weren't ever covered.

Dr. Drazan is an amazing IED prof. Sure, he's harder on his students than most IED profs are but the skills he teaches in IED are more valuable than anything written on the syllabus. I've gotten much more out of IED than I would've if I had any other prof. It's a ton of work, but if I had to do it over again, I'd be sure to take it with Drazan.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Class starts very easy as a review of Physics 1 all through the first test. Second test was also mostly easy if you knew how to solve problems symbolically. Gave extra credit on exams for proving that you got together with a group to study. Third exam is challenging material, but completely doable as exam questions are drawn FROM HOMEWORK.

I had him for Engineering Dynamics and I dont think the class average was ever above a 70, the standard deviation for the first two exams ranged from 15-18. He does an awful job explaining how he came up with a solution during lecture. If a student isnt doing well in his class, he just says this is basic kinematics and says you should know it.

Worst IED professor at RPI Expects way too much for presentations and memos and will just give you an 80 regardless of the effort spent You are graded on his personal opinion of you rather than your performance Prepare to cater to all of his personal interests if you want to deviate from the 80% box

Extremely unclear lectures made us never learn anything in his class... but that's fine. The disordered organization and ambiguous syllabus made many people cry. For example, he said in syllabus that piazza participation matters but did not specify how to get full credit in this section of grade. And he himself seldom showed up online...

Good discussion online in Piazza is more important than doing well in exams and homework! What's worse, the criteria for this part is not claimed at the beginning of class, no one knows!!!!!! It is so unfair!

Doesn't state clear at the beginning of class about the participation grading criteria. Give most people very low scores at this part. Almost decide the letter grade with piazza participation which is meaningless.
One of the worst teachers I have ever had. Unable to convey information clearly or in an interesting manner. Very easy class though.

Overall this class is not too difficult. Graded by 4 individual coding projects using R throughout the semester. If you have a decent understanding of statistics/regression and prior coding experience, this class will not be too hard. Prof Dunn's lectures are kind of dry and I did not find them very helpful, but is a fairly nice guy.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Expects you to be a genius in statistics, doesn't offer much help other than "if you have questions now is the time to ask". Hard to have questions if you have NO idea whats going on
Not a good teacher. In fact he is a bad teacher. Terrible.

Class is difficult to begin with, he doesn't help. There are in-class assignments every class. He expects you to know basically everything from MAU so hopefully you had a good professor. Overall, I don't recommend him as a professor. No one in my class knew what was going on.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Koratkar is very knowledgeable and professional.  You'll only use about 30 minutes of the lab block.  5 lab reports are your only grades.

This lab class could have benefitted significantly from a lab manual. Koratkar knows what he is doing but expects you to already be as learned in the subject as he is. You literally show up and do the lab and then have to answer 7 report questions with nothing but your computer and lots of these questions have no clear answer. No office hrs either.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: professional, smart, very logical, relatively good teacher, "knows what to do"

Doesn't make class any longer than it needs to be.  You will only go for an hour of the 3 hour block.  Lab reports always ask questions that aren't explained in class, but he is available and willing to give help.  Doesn't give a lot of partial credit, either you get the answer or you don't.

Honestly by far one of my favorite professors at RPI, he is someone who truly loves both teachings, as well as the content that he teaches, and that shines through in all of his classes, making it a much more enjoyable learning experience

"I will give you guys the best lecture you've ever had!" No textbooks, no quizzes, just notes and a course paper at the end. Yingrui does have a nice insight into so-called empirical science, but it could be hard to understand his idea considering his disorganized lecture, contagious laughter, and tendency to value his own work above yours.

I am in Gauge Theory of Higher Cognition and he started off by saying what we are graded on: Notes. Just notes. Nothing else. He does not teach from a textbook, everything is his own research or work and some stuff that came from others in the field. A very very sweet man. Accent can be difficult at times but you get used to it. Would recommend.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Yingrui teaches several nearly identical courses, both in subject matter and student requirements.  The latter are quite breezy: a couple term papers and hardly an exam in sight.  If you don't mind the professor's accent, contagious laughter, or tendency to value his own work above yours, you can still learn a lot.
One of the worst professors I've taken. Extremely unclear assignments and tough grader.

Actually, I think Gina is a very responsible professor although very strict. She is very helpful and resourceful, and she concerns students. Her marketing classes are awesome. I really enjoyed her class.

She is arrogant and does not listen to an opinion that is not 100% in line with hers.  Grades hard, and belittles students for sharing their opinions.  She thinks she knows everything because she has a PhD, when in fact she has no real world experience.
No Comments
He doesn't respond to student's emails. That's all I have to say.

Psychoacoustics is a fascinating class. Jonas knows a great deal about a lot of interesting things. If you listen to his lectures, you won't be sorry. He is also very responsive to students' questions and interests.

This class was a very good intro to psychoacoustics. The student who wrote the other assessment fails to point out that the professor actually bought all the textbooks so students would not need to. Auditory physiology has not changed in millennia, so saying text is obsolete is fairly ignorant. Great prof. Never heard of him stealing ideas.

Obsolete textbook, repetitive slides. Helpful in class and homework assignments. Inconsistent as advisor. Poor publication record for tenured prof. Protect your IP's. Choose your thesis topic wisely, he will approve it and then make you change it last minute and publish himself. If you are as good at academic shmoozing, you'll do fine

Not a good professor. Carries on in classes about meaningless information and does not spend enough time on teaching the material. Very slow on all quantitative work and extremely hard to understand. Asking questions in this class is a hopeless idea. Goodluck.

Prof Huang is super clear (sometimes can be slow) explaining quant stuff, easily understood.  A funny, nice guy! I tried the course last year. To me, Professor Huang teaches FAR better than a lady professor who taught this course last year. He's sooo approachable & helpful. I called his cell phone several times to ask questions. Great Professor!!

I was nervous initially given that I don't like maths much. However, the professor makes me very interested in this subject! He is absolutely an expert in what he teaches. Many lively examples and excel. He is probably the best professor I've had at RPI so far.  I enjoyed the group work in class. I like the way he teaches.

Absolutely terrible professor. Very unclear in his explanations and makes you feel incredibly awkward when asking questions in class. It's also very hard to understand him with his accent, and help is not given. I do not recommend this professor at all.

Bad, bad, bad. Goes off topic way too much. Asks for your opinion and dismisses it without even considering it. His tangents about Buffy just serve to bore people. He knows what hes talking about, there's no doubt about that. But it would've been nice if he gave constructive criticism instead of being outright condescending. Don't recommend at all.

Not a good teacher at all. While he is actually knowledgable in the subject, he goes way too off topic in class. His tangents of Buffy are in no way an exageration, he says something about it every class. Its easy as long as you're willing to write a lot. He also tends not to listen to anyone's opinion but his own. All in all I dont recommend him.

Great guy, I don't know what the other reviewer was talking about he is very knowledgeable on the subject and he creates engaging conversations in the classroom. I would certainly take a class with him again and would recommend his classes.

Terribly snarky. He does not have much knowledge of the subject. He constantly talks about what he's teaching in other classes and buffy the vampire slayer. The class only meets once a week which is nice but it's still time consuming. He's actually a professor at SUNY Oneonta so he's an easy grader but terrible to have to listen to.

Pleasant and easy-going professor. She likes to incorporate current events into class discussions. Lenient on due dates. Class participation is part of your grade so if you do so, I can't possibly see how one would do poorly. Tried to take her Eng 102 class but it was closed. I would recommend.
Shes very all over the place very nice but the word air head may be used
No Comments

She expects you to do the reading(occasional pop quizzes).  Two papers and two presentations over course of semester.  Class sits in circle during class to facilitate discussion.  Some don't like her because she's a bit silly at times, but she's a good professor and she's done a lot of different things.  I would recommend her.

All I have to say is nice guy but as a teacher, terrible. I learned more from my tutors than from him. He doesn't care if you understand, he's moving on to the next topic. He needs to retire honestly.

By far the worst professor I had freshman year. Dr. Teresco talked down to us like we were infants. Lectures were incredibly slowly paced, and featured very little information that was relevant to either the tests or labs. Luckily, he won't be back next year, as from what I understand he was not re-hired.

Computer Organization. You learn everything about how computers work, from "there is current going through this wire" to coding in c in painstaking detail. He made us code in mips and ssh into unix shells and all of that annoying junk. He imparts knowledge well, but he delves too deep into the monotonous material, and you stop paying attention.
So much time is spent going over homework in class that you hardly learn anything new in class which makes the homeworks difficult.
He simply reads through slides during lectures, which makes the lectures super boring.  His exams are all stupid memorization.

One of the worst the professors I have ever met. His tests are stupid memorization staff. You will get 90 points in the exam if you just remember the slides without understanding anything. Select the other professor Tacy in fall semester if you can. That section is easier to get an A.

Tests are by the bok compeltely! He requires very detailed answers and TAs tend to make mistakes. Just write as much as possible on the exams. I got an A- in the class because you needed a 95 on the final for an A and the final was RIDICULOUS! 20 pages of long answer questions worth 2-4pts.

Grading system is based off of deviation from the average so the majority of the class receives a C. He basically reads off of the slides during class and follows the book very closely. The information isn't very hard but small mistakes on exams are graded harshly. Hes nice if you talk to him.

I could not possibly think of a worse professor. When I went to his office hours, I explained that I was having difficulty with the material and asked if there was any way I could improve my studying and learning, such as a textbook or videos. He basically said no, you're on your own. WILL BE FILING COMPLAINT!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Nice, intelligent, accessible guy, but that's as far as the compliments go. He makes the topics way more complicated than they need to be. He's trying to reinvent Dynamics, & even introduces coding in MATLAB into the course, for 3 projects. His tests are definitely harder than other sections, and he doesn't think the book teaches it right.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: He makes even the easiest thing complicated. Completely have no idea why he has to use such complex ways to solve those easy questions. Literally he managed to confuse me about what I was already familiar with before taking his class. He may be a passionate and dedicating man but he is definitely the right person for teaching. Test too hard BTW.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: Professor Laflin was not the optimal professor for Engineering Dynamics. First half of class was physics based but second half is all circular motion and his notation for doing problems was beyond confusing. His notation was awful and did not follow the textbook at all making it next to useless. Would not recommend for future students.
The project was very interesting and we learned a lot about iteration and design
Project was interesting learned a lot about UX
Learned a ton about design. Reading was a lot but really good class.

More work than a communication intensive class!!! Attendance is required and he spends at least 10 minutes at the start of class (8 AM) calling out names of ~100 students... If you are late (come in after your name is called), he lowers your attendance grade (even if he is still calling out names of other students and you come in late...)
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Fascinating and lovely person.  Biopunk was an engaging class for those interested in visual art, biology, biohacking, etc.  Very clear about requirements and super reasonable and accommodating overall

Biopunk is one of the best courses I have taken at RPI. You are looking at science through the female/queer eye, and looking at the often forgotten awesome scientific discoveries these individuals have made. Lots of reading, but I thoroughly enjoyed each one. Decent amount of work, but Dr. High is very understanding and canhelp out if you're stuck.

Kathy is the best professor I've ever had at RPI. Her labs were fun, the guest speakers were all amazing, and the field trips were spectacular! She plans a lot of reading and writing in the syllabus, but understands and respects the limits of the students and is willing to be more lenient.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Digital Filmmaking was my favorite class this semester! Prof. High is knowledgable, gives great suggestions for improving your work, and is willing to work with you to set appointments outside of office hours if needed. The class is a solid choice for those interested in film, or need a HASS requirement filled with something fun. Would recommend!

each class is basically a lecture for whatever topic is being covered, hw's every week or so, 2 take home exams (should do well if you go to class and look at ppts), 2 short presentations on papers relating to class, one short written report on second paper. not a hard class just have to do the work

Everything will be done in a small group, which is kind of annoying. Otherwise prof is a really nice and understanding guy who does care about his students. Attendance isn't mandatory, two take home exams that are pretty difficult if you don't go to class, but doable if you can teach yourself. One homework a week typically.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: I loved going to class, even though it was pretty late at night. sometimes lectures can be hard, but that is true for almost any 3 hour class. HW was easy and relevant. class work was focused. my favorite were the 2 simulations. this class really introduced me to supply chain, which i now love

He has a strong accent and makes odd pauses in the wrong place of a sentence which makes it difficult to pay attention and understand. He has a monotonic voice and it's easy to zone out especially since it's not the most exciting topic. Homework is due on LMS every week, a short 1-2 page term paper with a 5 minute presentation with a group of 4

Be prepared for the project, its workload is heavy. 

Professor Xu definitely knows his stuff, his lecture is very straightforward, so does the homework. 
Easy to follow and understand. 
And start the project earlier, you will get a A.

This class is simply just hard. Be prepared to use outside material constantly. Grading is 50% completion for homework's, but you need it. Only one midterm and one final project. Midterm is very challenging and final project will take a while but quite doable.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Worst class ever taken. His lectures are not helpful. Exam and homework are difficult. Yes, you might be able to get an A if you completely know the stuff. However, if you are an average student, be prepared to get a C. And you can easily fail the class :).

Prof. Xu definitely knows his stuff, but his english is sometimes difficult to understand. Surprisingly you can still learn if you pay attention, as he tries his best explain all his calculations and the intuition behind the subject matter. Homework is sporadically given, exams seem to be clear cut. No official t-book, so you better come to class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: He was a great lecturer, and knew how to keep most of us engaged in the topic of instruction. He never meddled on 1 topic for too long, and we were able to get past the content that the course usually gets through. He is accessible outside of class, but 1 on 1, I preferred Dr. Snover.

What can be said about a man such as Cioffi? He truly revolutionized the world of organic chemistry. I wish he taught orgo 2 because I can never get enough of him. He's so nice and really knows what he's talking about. Please take his class even if you aren't a chemistry or biology major.

Cioffi is a very engaging lecturer, explains topics well and explains connections to previous material. Exams are fair, very similar to hw and crib sheets are allowed. Grade gets boosted by all the homeworks and quizzes, as long as you do them.

One of the best lecturers I have had so far at RPI. His lectures are clear and he doesn't repeat unneccesary information a lot of the time. He also tries to lighten the content up with jokes sometimes, which I appreciate. He is also very accessible via email and office hours.
The course was not organized. Overall, it was a very bad experience.

Do not take this class with Amiri if you can help it. Lectures go way too fast and have very few examples. Be prepared to learn from the slides and textbook. I only passed this class because I had already taken linear algebra.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: needs to learn how to teach before teaching important courses

Professor Mohammad goes too fast during his lectures, and when he asks students if they know what he's talking about, no one says yes, and he still continues. The homeworks are way too lengthy and are more complicated than his lectures. His lectures cover mostly proofs, and he rarely gave any in-depth examples.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: This is probably the easiest cheme class you'll take at rpi. Baysal's lectures are fairly difficult to focus on but that was likely a me problem. The homework is easy and the best way to understand the concepts. He takes forever to grade the exams but he's a really fair grader. Also make good crib sheets, they help a lot.

He's very accommodating and knows transport well, the issue is he essentially teaches directly out of the textbook. By the end of the year, he started just reading off a pdf version of the textbook. The nice thing is he gives online tests and an optional final. It's hard to get deeper understanding of the material.

Depends entirely on textbook (just scrolls through it during lecture). The exam questions always were completely different than anything covered during class, and he will literally tell you to "go through it yourself" during lecture. One of the questions on our final exam was from one of these "don't feel like teaching it myself" sections.

Very knowledgeable professor. The Aspen program is fun to use and very logical. Get ready to work in groups, on almost everything. Lecture is boring but covers everything you need to ace the class. Great preparation for CRD. Not all aspects of the program that is distributed by RPI work properly. Nothing is graded until the semester ends.

Really nice guy, knows his stuff when it comes to Aspen Plus.  I learned to use the program well enough, which was the goal.  He's not very good at giving guidelines for assignments though.  We didn't get the syllabus until halfway through the course.
Very ineffective professor who ends up being forced to give large curves, did not learn much, don't recommend. VERY stressful course
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Lai is one of the worst professors. The grades are built off of 2 tests and the average score of 10 homework assignments. Each lecture is unorganized and lecture notes are just variables and symbols which are confusing and vague. Often he skips steps because he is rushing through the content creating more confusion and sounds like a rambling child.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Great lecture! Not very easy exam. But still get A.

Professor Lai is very clear in his teaching. He gives students plenty of opportunities during his lectures to ask clarifying questions, but this is often unnecessary as he reiterates important points.  His HW problems sometimes use his own notation, so go to lecture. My only complaint is his heavy weighting on 2 exams; 30% midterm and 40% final.

I have experience with writing music, so his class was not very challenging for me, but I still found myself putting in a lot of effort and thinking outside the box. The low minimum criteria for what an acceptable submission or "demo" was meant that the workload was basically as much as I wanted it to be, and he gave amazing feedback to everyone.

I loved everything I learned in ARTS2700. The class is incredibly time consuming but very rewarding and graded generously. Would absolutely recommend this professor. He's a good lecturer, and he's a very interesting person too! I just hope I can get into ARTS4700 before I graduate. Spots for his classes fill up fast so get them while you can!
