Multiple in class assignments and projects in the course were great for learning the material. Great interesting class and she is always available during office hours. I strongly recommend to take classes with her.

A fine lecturer, trying to make class interesting when she could. The only issue was that it seemed like she didn't know what she was talking about. She has industry experience but not enough experience with the topics to be able to teach the class in a way that students get a lot out of it. Give her a few years though and I'm sure she'll be fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Had her for Managing IT Resources, she has very strong political views and contantly pushes her politics onto students. She also is very strict on participation and tracks everytime a student raises their hand and speaks. Her grading schema states that if a student fails the participation grade then they fail the enitre class, which is very harsh.
Great, personable professor with a kind but strict teaching style. You will learn a lot in this class and enjoy every minute of it. 10/10, would take again!
Nice lectures, somewhat hard homeworks, fair tests
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Great professor.  Very approachable and knowledgeable about the subject matter.  Homeworks can be slightly challenging, but no more than is necessary to practice the material.

I had Dr. Radlick as my Lab professor.  She tries to keep the labs interesting by having interesting photos for ppt presentations.  She'll answer most of the questions you have, but she relies on her TAs to answer them for you. Overall, she's not so bad.
Radlick is amazing and incredibly clear. She cares about your performance as long as she sees you're putting effort forth in the class.

I am graduating from RPI now and looking back, she was my favorite professor in CS. The class is clear and exact, she's very helpful, and she's nice and a bit funny. The class is very interactive, you can ask questions and she always has a great understanding of what you're confused about and can clarify it perfectly.
Excellent teacher, even though the material is fairly limited. For whatever reason the TAs are always incompetent graders for this class, maybe her answer keys aren't too good.

His lecture consists of doing the example problems in the textbook.  Not helpful at all.  We can read that ourselves.  He also let us know that we could pick up our graded exams/homework when we got to our final.  He ignores e-mails and just isn't willing to help you understand the material at all.
Puts book on slides then reads slides.

I thought I was going to hate this class, but Annie was very friendly and actually made the material reasonably interesting.  I studied 40 min for each quiz and aced them both (you can probably get away with less).  Would recommend her for PD3.

Prof. Virkus took the whole class with a grain of salt, which was a refreshing change from how seriously most professors took PD1. Took boring & obvious material and made it entertaining. Quizzes were easy & almost verbatim from the slides.

Excellent professor. Very interested in the topics she teaches and put the material in interesting and easy to grasp terms. The classwork involves two major tests and a couple of projects, but she is very helpful with those.
Awesome professor. Had her for human factors in design and I definitely learned a lot. It was a great class. Taking social psychology now with her and this is also an awesome class.

Bad with technology. Has the most incredible monotone I've ever heard. Doesn't allow computers in class. Lectures consist of reading off the textbook's PowerPoint. My grade went up as my attendance went down (may not work for you though).
kind of boring, but informative if you can manage to stay awake

Koffas is the best professor I've had at RPI. He is clear and understandable and really cares about making sure his students understand the material. If he sees a topic is causing a lot of people trouble, he'll spend extra time on it even if that means not covering everything in the syllabus. Very nice person too. Homeworks can be long.

Professor Koffas is one of the best professors I've come across at RPI. He knows how to make sure the class understands the material and gives adequate time to learn and apply the concepts. The course is extremely well taught. Koffas 100% knows his stuff and is clear and precise in explaining it to his students. his writing is legible.

Kinchy is a passionate professor who enjoys what she teaches and enjoys discussing it with students. When she assigns articles to read, make sure you do, or you'll be left sitting there awkwardly w/o anything to say. She usually doesn't call on students who aren't raising their hands, but she wants participation. Very supportive of student's ideas.

Professor Kinchy is a good teacher, but the course she taught, Social Problems, sucked. She believes in assigning readings constantly, but she is really nice and will help you in or outside of the classroom. She is young and inspiring, and I really like her style.
He takes student research seriously, so I learned to be a theorist instead of someone who just reads theories.
TA Josh is awesome! He really loves teaching, and it shows. He always has good power points (short and to the point), and he knows a lot about the topics. He also looks/sounds like a super hero.

Took the immersive AI class over summer arch. She is a great professor to have; so kind, understanding and lenient. Lectures are immerse and dynamic (quiz games). If you have any issues or questions, talk to her and she'll understand. Assignments are not difficult. Studio 2 lab puts you in scenes and scenarios that you'd encounter in China.

Zhou Laoshi is a great Chinese teacher. She is a native speaker and her teaching is clear. She assigns lots of homework, but can lenient with due dates. She has also been very encouraging to me. One warning: semester-long projects.

This class was very laid-back and enjoyable. Professor Howard gave great lectures that often involve stories from his own life or popular cultures (like Harry Potter) and incorporated the materials with our lives as college students. We had a lot of readings, but no quizzes, and grades were based on papers, attendance, and a group project.

Professor Howard is very approachable and he tries to explain things as best he can and to really be sure people understand the material. Participation isn't a huge part of the grade, but it can tip the scales so be sure to attend lecture and participate when you can.

Prof Hiland is my favorite professor at this school. I took Intro to Comm Theory and Speech Communication with him.  He is first of all very knowledgeable on the subjects but is also really open to discussing and debating with students. He makes sure that his students are actually learning, and every assignment is useful. 100% recommend.

He insists we call him "AL," and he's the funniest dude at RPI. His lectures are good for Public Speaking, and he will actually help you become a better speaker if you put in the effort. He grades based on your capabilities, so he will grade fairly with everyone. Only downside is that there are pop quizzes based on a textbook, but are always easy.

Awesome professor, really super interesting too. He really cares about the students and the subject material. He's not too serious but won't stand for nonsense, and is great to talk to. Favorite professor in uni so far.
Awesome guy. Super accessible and will make sure he helps you out. Super chill and great to work with.
He is Just mean idk man

I feel like I got the short end of the stick taking one of his classes during his first semester teaching. He has already noticeably improved with making homework and tests more doable. He's also a very hard grader and doesn't give hardly any feedback. You'll learn plenty but still be worried about passing.

The textbook he uses for stats is really good, I did not pay attention much in lecture but still knew everything based on the textbook alone, however, he summarizes the textbook and lectures very well. He basically gives you 50% of the grade for free as long as you show up to every class and do the HW. Exams are kinda hard but huge curves given
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: The professor ensures that the students understand the material before leaving the classroom. He is fair with grading.. Exams can be tough. Going to office hours helps a lot. 10/10 recommend.

Class was ridiculously easy and Prof. Jain is an awesome guy. I think he knows the class is kinda a joke so it is really laid back, both midterm and final are take at home and there was maybe 3 homework assignments all semester plus one 6 page paper at the end. Also helps he is a very reputable and experienced person in the field of marketing.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He is a really great guy. He definitely cares a lot about his students. He answers his emails pretty frequently. You need to go to class because attendance is mandatory and for his exams he gives the a lot of the answers to the questions in class. He provides a lot of real world examples. I never once said when am I ever going to need this.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Munasinghe is the best professor I've had at RPI; He's caring and ensures you feel respected. He provides excellent professional opportunities through conferences and publications.

I took Prof. Thilanka Munasinghe's Data Science course in fall, 2021. He conducts valuable guest lectures facilitated by renowned professionals and authors. (NASA/Google etc) He is an ethical lecturer who teach students with dignity and empathy, and he receives respect in return from the students. He creates a friendly learning environment.

I think they changed the instructor and that's a good thing because she doesn't seem to be an expert in that area. Apart from that she's a very nice person, but not often available (outside of class).
The main grade from this class comes from 2 essays, a midterm essay and a final essay, which are both very easy. Professor Ruzanka is very knowledgeable in her field, and her class was very fun.

Super chill professor. Seems to actually care about students which is rare for the bio department. Grading criteria could be more clear but he's fair. Pay attention in lectures, do all the assignments (even non-graded ones), and talk to him if you need help. Made programming easy. Might be hard without a previous stats class but use crash course.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He is a gem. Personable, kind, and respectful to all students. His lectures and powerpoints are clear and concise. He cares that students understand the material and will admit if he makes a mistake. If the majority of students get something wrong he will throw out a question. Great professor and a genuinely nice guy. Textbook is not mandatory.
Terrific instructor and even better Airman. Proud to have been graced by his presence and to have walked in his footprints almost a decade later. Semper Supra Sir!

Highly inspirational, unlocked the Airman in everyone.
You can't spell "Air and Space Studies" without "Captain Joshua J. Lavin"

Prof Borja is a cool guy who is very interested in physics and it's applications. The in-class lab work is very simple to follow, and the lectures are reading off of slides. My issue with the class is that he does not prepare the class very much for the exams, which are a majority of the grade. Other professors cover more back exam Qs.

As a new teacher, Dr. Borja is an overall super chill and sweet dude and I had a solid time in Physics. Alas it was 8:00am but he made the best of it and I respect it. It felt like having a new high school teacher who you just gotta like.

Professor Borja is very enthusiastic about physics, making his lecture blocks very easy to sit through, even at 8AM.  Gave good preparation for tests. The only issue, which I assume is not his fault, is that the lecture slides are made by a different professor. If he crafted his own lectures, I think he could go from a 4 to a 5. (Taken Fall '22)
Edwin is tough when it comes to his critiques but doesnt truly assign a lot of homework and gives us some weeks to redo projects we've already done. Not bad teacher but sometimes a little stale
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Liu takes sadistic pleasure in assuring students feel as though they did terrible on their projects. The projects, he does not even need to assign, but chooses to do so, what more, making these mandatory for his students. He is unclear with his lectures and provides no guides for his students. Did not say a single positive word all year.
The best professor in rip, I like genshin.
Genshin start!!!

Bad lecture slides / teaching and too many added topics without proper guidance. I learned more from TA's and exams were nothing like any of the sample ones provided and very bad communication overall. I wouldn't recommend taking any class with them if this lack of quality is consistent...
His lectures are rarely understandable due to his strong accent, sometimes he's also mumbling so it's hard to hear.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Accessible outside class

comment: The professor in short talks in circles. It becomes difficult to follow along when he keeps repeating the same thing but each time it becomes more complicated. Asking questions is also difficult as he would often answer you back in a vague way. The professor is also extremely biased, he grades based on his liking.

Scott struggles to give clear directions on a consistent basis, which leads to great frustration and confusion from his students. When this is brought to his attention, he often becomes irritated. He's also prone to long, off topic rants in class which take up valuable time. He also is indifferent to students who have an illness or personal matter.
He's really good at guiding you to the correct solution to a problem that you might not be able to solve on your own

Gustavo is a highly dedicated professor and will give selflessly of his personal time to ensure his students are given the right direction to pursue design direction.  I appreciate his hard work and dedication to the studio.
Best Band Teacher on Campus!
Great musician, director, and overall person.  I looked forward to Jazz Ensemble as the highlight of my week.

Reads straight from the slides. Clearly not knowledgeable about the class. She masks her lack of knowledge by picking out "key words" on test that you don't include so that not everyone gets an A. Homework varies, I hope you're good at reading textbooks, because they're a much better teacher then she is. Can't believe professors like her exist.
Had her for DSES Supply Chain. Not a bad teacher but can be snappy if you ask a question the wrong way after class. Explains EVERYTHING step by step though.

I don't completely agree with the other comment below but I understand what they're trying to say, I think Tyco means well but is definitely scatterbrained and also has favorites in the lab and really only spends time around them. Sometimes its hard to get ahold of him for help but Sprage stays around lab too to help. Hes just OK, nothing special.

not really a good TA. some people like him bc he tries to be adorable and charming. honestly he tries way too hard to be friendly with students and doesn't understand boudaries. sometimes kind of creepy. sneaks up behind you when you're working with chemicals. nice guy but kind of a big dork who doesn't like people who aren't dorky with him.

Dr. Wan is the worst proff I've ever had in 4 semesters at RPI. He uses a filler word, 'right, so' that distracts from the lecture. His lectures are not engaging and it's extremely hard to understand him with his accent. If you're planning on taking intro Biomechanics, CHOOSE A DIFFERENT PROFESSOR.

I am in his current Biomechanics section and it is the class I dread going to most every Monday and Thursday. He is not at all engaging and I hear the same filler words at least 100 times per class. Definitely not a professor I suggest taking it is awful.
Clear understanding of the subject but expects that students should know things beforehand.

Generally a nice guy and good prof, but can be a bit tough. I didn't agree with a lot of his policies. Had 4 hwks, each 10% of our grade, and just 2 tests for the rest. Made students go see the TA to see their graded test, which made it difficult to argue unfair grading. Doesn't like to deal with silly complaints so ignores all student criticism.

Professor Hampson used to be a professional hockey player. And working in the industry area for 20 years. And he has just gone back to school, and he kept making mistakes in class, but he was always well preapred for every class, and tries his best. I think he would be better in future.

I am sitting in IED right now, it is our last class.  Mr. Hampson is extremely helpful and has a strong background in both engineering and liberal arts.  he is very knowledgeable and very helpful, oh so helpful.  it was his first time teaching IED and really cared about teaching.  He is very optimistic and will give you a second chance if you suck

She's very helpful outside the class lectures in her office hours.  Material can be tough, but her examples are thorough and clear. Tests and homework are very fair and cover material from lectures and text. Learned a LOT from this course.

Prof Genc lectures are clear. She provides numerous examples and easily explains any questions. Her tests refect her homework and are very fair. To boot, she has a great sense of humor and is very approachable.
Best TA I've ever had, lectures with professor can leave you confused, he explains very well, and is very willing to help.
Matt was amazing. He was an awesome teacher and made everyone want to go to class. Exams with him are great.

Amazing professor. Class will certainly be interesting. If, not you're free to use your laptop, read a book, or get up and leave (really). If you tell him what grade you want, he will tell you exactly what you need to do to get that grade, and will help you get there. Lectures were very thought-provoking and unique compared to traditional classes.
Had him for Heroes of the Hudson Valley. He was very nice, very interesting, and took an interest in his students. I highly recommend him.

Great professor. Unit 1 started off weird with counterpoint and tons of rules/regulations which I found challenging to enjoy. After that though, I really started liking the course and I began to appreciate the skills that Christopher was instilling in us. Can't wait for ARTS4380!! Very approachable and loves participation
Easy class but you won't learn as much things as expected for a 2000 level class
History of Hip Hop was great, F-L is truly an amazing man.

He's a really nice guy, which is why it's hard dislike him. He's got the standard foreign-professor issues: Hard to understand, sometimes doesn't understand your questions and if you ask him for help, he'll solve the problem without explaining what he did.  The TA for the class was great, which made it bearable.

Prof. Lian is very hard to understand, though he understands you and your questions quite well. The entire class really all depends on your TA who will be grading reports and is there when performing the experiments. Expect to lose a lot of points on the first couple lab reports until you figure out exactly what is needed.
She is a very cool professor, the class is project based which is what I like, not too much work compared to STEM courses.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Accessible outside class

comment: Raquel is an amazing professor and she's great at introducing design. Classes are weekly discussions/lectures with 3 main projects. Projects are graded fairly and she's open to help after class. Feedback is always helpful and it was a great class.
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Youmans is one of the most understanding and kind professors I have ever had the pleasure of meeting. If you have a choice between two professors to take a class with the other professor's skills and ratings are irrelevant. Take it with Professor Youmans and you will be happy you did.
Prof Youmans was amazing for PD3! She understands the material well and teaches it in a fun manner.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: The class mostly consists of critiques on both projects and "Formal Focuses" where you read a chapter of the textbook and take + edit a photo based on the concepts of that chapter. If you participate in the critiques and can explain why you made design decisions, you will likely get a good grade. He is not a very harsh grader on projects.

Benj is an amazing professor who cares about all of his students equally. He always tries his best to make the class entertaining and engaging, making learning art for a stem-centric institution insightful and eye-opening. His grading policy is extremely fair and he is the most understanding professor at RPI. Benj is the GOAT.

I had Prof Veksler for PAICS.  He taught the material clearly, always sought feedback on our understanding of and our interest in the topics, was very reasonable for deadlines, and was always available for meetings.  I'd recommend him to anyone interested in cognitive science.

Had him for Computational Modeling of Linguistic Semantics. The course was basically one lecture followed by independent work, weekly meetings, and a final presentation. If you like that style, you'll like the class. He's a nice guy and is approachable. If you prefer having classes, this isn't for you.
He doesn't know how to teach.
A very casual professor.  Makes even 8:30 AM classes interesting!

Speaks too softly; I'm not sure anybody past the front row actually caught everything he said. Not too happy with late homework, but lets the TA deal with it. The lecture notes rarely helped me on the homework, and the homework didn't help very much in preparing for exams. Seemed to have a hard time understanding students' questions.

amazing fundementals of flight teacher, always interesting in the students and the course material. tests were quite hard, but well prepared me for what i need to know now. very clear professor as far as accent and explanations go. i would suggest this to all people taking fund flight

The Rensselaer Orchestra has become the premier classical ensemble on campus due to his leadership. As a musician, you are expected to put in 100% effort in rehearsal or Nick will notice. He wants to make the music as perfect as possible because he really cares. Easy "A" if you show up and put in effort and are a strong player. A great experience.

Nick is a great, fun, understanding choir teacher. He will have you become an expert at sight reading since we sing through every piece with solfege before we dive into the task of pronouncing the words (how many English songs there are seem to depend on the theme of the semester). You will also get better at rhythm, vowel forming, and breathing.
He speaks directly and informatively. He expects a great deal from his students but not without good cause, and he always allows ample time to complete assignments that might seem overwhelming.
Teaches the practical aspects of design as well as the importance of creativity and ingenuity.

She gives too much info that we don't need and not enough info that we do. The information is usually very hard to understand and she makes no effort in trying to explain it in a way that everyone can understand. She will also often say "you don't need to know this part, it will not be on the test" however, that exact thing will be on the exam.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Love Dr. Christian! Biochem lab with her is great, and she has put in lots of effort into transitioning it to online while school is closed. She's smart and runs intense/detailed labs but is so caring and friendly. Nicest lab professor I've met. Lab has typical lab-y assignments and work but it's very doable and can even be fun.

I would definitely recommend taking human rights in history with Professor Sohasky. It consists of super interesting lectures and the ability to focus on a topic in history that interests you. Id take this class again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Sohasky's classes are just short of incredible. She is an excellent discussion moderator and incredibly knowledgeable about the topics that she covers. If you get a chance to talk to her about her research, take it. Classes tend to be lecture- or book + discussion-based.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: The best and most memorable professor I have ever had.

Professor Hahn was possibly the best professor I've had at RPI. She genuinely cares about her students, and truly strives to make a difference in the world. Overall, her class was an easy but eye-opening experience.
Great guy, definitely looking to take another class with him
Good prof wouldn't take again though.

Professor Varsamis effectively teaches Intro to CEE. His combination of peer and guest presentations gave a good overview of the field. I also enjoyed the poster and presentation we did in class. The professor is a little vague with guidelines and grading, so don't rely on the syllabus for help with assignments. I wish the class wasn't at 6 pm.
Prof. Varsamis is great! He makes sure you understand the material and is approachable outside of class to make sure you do so.
Whalen is the GOAT. He is very caring, though I wish he would focus more on providing sections specific feedback.
be prepared to sit on your phone for 90% of the rehearsal if you play brass and barely get feedback even though your section doesn't sound good the one time you have the melody

Awesome professor, make really funny jokes, lots of fun opportunities outside of class. Just make sure that you actively participate in class and show up. Just make sure that you aren't glued to your phone in class, ESPECIALLY during a concert (instant F), but you shouldn't have to really worry about that.
Rich was awesome. Wish he were still here.
Soft spoken, very difficult exams.  Cares about students, approachable, fair.  Post-doc, very young.  Relatively easy to understand if you sit close to the front.

Class was solely based on three in-class exams and the final. Tests were usually pretty straightforward and Dr. Herbert did a good job outlining beforehand what to know, but a poor grade on one solidified your grade. He was extremely helpful and caring outside of class and made it clear he wanted his students to succeed. Go to his office hours!
Professor Vastola tries to be nice. But he cannot hide his meanness.
Very helpful, nice to students

Great professor; major help during office hours; always asks if people understand the material before moving forward; exams reflect material covered; he has an accent but it wasn't hard to understand. Highly recommended for IEA.
Prof Wozny is very good at teaching, explains things well.
Best teacher here.

No notes allowed during class, so you have to pay attention. However the tests are not based on memorization, no multiple choice just 6 open response questions. The questions will be like "design an experiment that tests X and provide the conditions for Y and Z."He makes class interesting, asks questions often, and genuinely wants people to learn.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: For each lecture topic he provides a bunch of study questions which you are expected to complete on your own as you go, then the test questions come directly from there. Almost everybody who takes this class gets an A/A-; I got a B because I only put in enough effort to do alright. Also Prof Gross will love you if you participate in his class.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Jensen is a wonderful and kindhearted professor who shows a genuine care for his students. His lectures are engaging, and his blatant passion for biology motivated me to be interested in it as well. He also provides great extra material for practice/review. If you can take him for intro to bio, you definitely should!!!

Super educated. Lectures were a bit boring but overall not bad. Exams were lengthy and application-based, but offered plenty of easy extra credit HW to make up for it (up to 10% points added to overall grade).

Very good lecturer and doesn't include information that isn't going to be helpful. Tests are 90% of your grade and the other 10% is made up by pop quizzes, but as long as you pay attention in class, they are very straight forward. He's funny and I always look forward to his class.

My Air Vehicle Design capstone took up less of my time. There are a minimum of 25 (35 total) "reading guide" assignments, each 2 pages (and each 2% of your grade). He assigns novels due between classes. He gives lousy feedback as if he doesn't even read any of your NINE essays. You will have to rent/buy 15 novels and 4 movies. >1 reading per class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Good professor with decent lectures. The project given are simple as you can just follow the examples you get taught in class. The exams are easy as long as you pay attention and take notes.

Professor Hasan is a little disorganized, but overall a good professor. He is very knowledgeable about accounting and wants students to succeed. He provides the resources to make this happen. Sometimes lectures can move slowly, and he will backtrack on himself, but if you show up to class and pay attention it's nearly impossible to fail.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Very nice professor. She was very lenient with late submissions, graded closely with the syllabus, and is clearly passionate about what she teaches. If you want an enjoyable, easy class, she's a good professor to have. She is fairly strict with her attendance policy. Every unexcused absence past a threshold is a whole letter grade reduction.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Designing Musical Games is a course very flexible and adaptable to one's abilities and major, as long as you're willing to put effort into the three projects spaced across the semester. He only teaches 1 small class a semester; one-to-one communication is very accessible in class and through Discord. Some might find his grading to be slow at times.

Fortunate to be his first class of students for the Advanced Quantitative Methods course in Fall. Very practical approach to OR, not much Math but very much driven by real world industry problems.  Very knowledgeable in OR & Supply Chain and I highly recommend his class for all students looking to understand the applications of OR.

As long as you keep up with the reading and pay attention/take notes in class you'll be fine. There's also a group project that as long as you put in decent effort you'll have no problem getting a B on it.

For Environment and Society, we have a midterm and a final where you write short essays on 5 questions from lectures. It's pretty straight forward and I got a 100. The rest of the grade comes from one participation credit where you just share something you saw in the news and then a few easy homeworks you can do in  groups. Class always ends early.

TMike is awesome. Not only will he help you find your way, he has a genuine interest in both the subject matter and the students. He has taught many studios and is very educated, and has developed, an at times, guarded sympathy and will actually let you get some sleep

He has a very heavy accent. Teaching is always behind what homework is scheduled. Lecture is boring and he spends too much time on easy things then doesn't get to the harder, more in-depth parts. Reading is expected, although not mandatory.

Dr. Hedden is a lecturing professor at RPI so he spends his time with students-not research. He is very accessible by email, and great to talk to in person. He is a real straight shooter and a great professor to ask advice from. I have taken CPDC with him but he teaches a number of classes now and seems very knowledgable across all ChemE

Same level of work gets A with other TA's, gets F with her. No explanation, just gives significantly lower grades for same level of work. Rare feedback with occasional explanation. No useful office hours. AVOID!

This was kind of a double whammy. MAU is a difficult class, and Prof. Kang isn't the best at communicating the material. His lecturing style was somewhat monotone, and I found myself struggling to pay attention. Class attendance went from 35 to 12 students by the end of the semester. I'd say: take the class with a different professor if you can.

Has assistant post notes to dropbox(usually a week late) and is unreachable outside of class. U can reach his assistant but her response is "contact the professor" when he does not respond at all to emails nor addresses the concerns brought up to his assistant in class. Cancels class frequently (6 wks behind), tests r on material covered for 5 min
Make sure to do your homework and practice the concepts learned in lecture. Awesome professor.

Lectures do not align well with homework assignments and practice problems. Aware of student struggles but does not provide accessible office hours for students (cancelled office hours several times). Tells students to drop the class because he did not provide the proper teaching of the subject. Inconsiderate to those with limited coding background

Studio C was a super easy class. Did he teach me anything? No, Brian expects you to learn everything needed for your project and only go to him when you have questions. But he grades on effort and attendance so all his classes are easy A's. Make sure you're able to keep yourself on track though!

HR Resources is a rough class. Dr. Golden is a tough grader, so do not expect an easy A. Final project is long- get ahead. There are two 'quizzes' that are not inherently difficult, but you need to be sure you read EVERY single little thing as the questions will be hyper specific. Dr. Golden is a really nice guy, but he doesn't take edu. lightly.

Super sweet guy, very understanding of the fact that he teaches Literature at a stem school. Contributing during in class conversations makes the class much more interesting and he is overall a pretty good professor.

She is a very enthusiastic professor and it's clear that she genuinely cares about her students and their learning. My only complaint is that she sometimes gives students extra assignments that aren't on the syllabus, which can make it hard to plan ahead. If you're able to stay on top of the coursework and the group work, the class is pretty easy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: very boring teacher.  Does these weird pauses that make it very hard to pay attention.  Not the hardest class but they like to test on the things that they don't teach.
Brought a lot of his real world experience in highway engineering to the classroom. Shows a passion for teaching and seeing his students succeed.

Petela is very laid-back and nonchalant. Although he didn't orchestrate the curriculum with DC1 this semester, he was still pretty helpful. The class itself is not very hard, just have work done at pin-ups and polish it by midterm/finals. Very nice.

Professor Moran is a very insightful professor. He can be rude and slightly confusing at times, but knows a lot about what he is teaching and is a fantastic professor if you pay attention to his lectures and read the material. If you don't read or go to class, you won't do well on the assignments. You have to CARE to do well.

Lectures can be short some days. Sometimes assumes people know more than they do, but always willing to clarify. Very slow to grade, probably because he goes through your stuff line by line regardless of if it works. First HWs took longer than later ones.  1 Quiz, 8 HW, 3 Projects.

This is a class where you learn how to use Microsoft Access and Excel. Both are fairly easy to use. You will meet (or not go to class LOL) twice a week. Homework will usually be due at midnight of the days you meet. The professor is very hard to understand and is very wishy washy about his material. I went to class a few times and got an A.

Professor Sanderson covered much in the Pattern Recognition course, but little was learned. He is jumping from one topic to another. It is not a pleasant experience. I would not take this course again.

D'Allaird is a great educator in terms of real world application. Too many teachers seem to dwell on the course subject without actually addressing how it could impact your future occupation. D'Allaird offers a nice mix of course content with actual uses in the field based on his experiences.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Would take again

comment: She says A, she thinks B, and she does C. Frustrating!

I can't believe no one has rated this guy. I currently have him as my TA for differential equations and he covers many things that my actual professor never bothers clarifying. He makes the recitations worthwhile, I wish he WAS the professor.

Material of MAU seems semi interesting, however this guy killed any interest I had in the class within the first few weeks. Extremely bland lectures. No partial credit on open ended questions on tests, which count for 20% of your grade each. Would not recommend taking.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--TEST HEAVY

comment: horrible
Steve is a great lecturer and I learned a lot during his classes.
Unlike most condesending professors at RPI, she clearly reviews all lecture materials before each class. She always checked my labs before I turned them in. Very responsible and caring professor.
Professor Brown is a knowledgeable teacher and a very nice person. He is extremely helpful and accommodating. If you have a chance to take a class with him, go for it.
Very interactive and insightful. Guest speakers, social media elements, in vogue topics are all covered. Very assertive and encouraging

The professor clearly knew about what he was teaching and was really amazing with articulating his thoughts throughout the classroom. The class is communication intensive so conversations basically made your grade and made the essays you wrote engaging. The material of the class is also eye opening to ideas surrounding technology and interaction.

Very good lecturer but not always the most interesting. Buy the notes binder & talk to TA. Tests are most of the grade but he is very fair about regrades (gives time to discuss in class). Will not accept guesses, but will give partial credit as deserved. Test difficulty varies but feels fair. Material is very clear-cut, no need for outside reading.

Get ready for a lack of feedback if you take IED with him. Compared to other sections, his averages are always lower and you won't know how to fix papers to make them better with the way he gives feedback. There is a line between setting strong, but reachable expectations for you students and setting unreasonable expectations-he crosses it.

My favorite professor at RPI thus far, you learn a lot from him and can stay after class to talk to him. Class was very interesting and we would start each class discussing current business news which I found pretty cool.

Understands the material very well, lectures are easy enough to understand. Ample time in class to do and ask about the in class assignments, often had time at the end to also ask questions about the homework too. Very kind, gave me a three day extension on one of the homeworks when I asked for only a bit more time to finish running some cases.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Online Savvy

comment: Professor Wagner is by far the best professor I've had at RPI. She grades based on effort and growth for big projects, which is so refreshing to see. She's super accommodating if you can't turn something in on time or can't make it to class. She keeps me engaged the entire class, I would take a class with her again!
This TA is the BEST!!!! If u have him as Chinese tutor, do not hesitate on going to his sessions. He is so insightful on his feedbacks on ur studying of Chinese, best TA EVER!!!!

Simpe intro class on nanotech, only requires one mini review essay, no homework or exam.
Enjoy the lecture!

DO NOT EVER TAKE HIM! exams take about 55% and the questions are extremely hard especially the multiple choice. lectures are so long, at lease 100 slides for 1 chapter. assignments only takes about 20% but you need to contribute tons of work every time writing it. Do not miss anything, otherwise be ready to argue with him because he is so MEAN
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: It was fun to be in his lectures. He's theory oriented in lecture which can get hard at times. Very hard class! That said, Professor Tumuklu was generous in his final grades. Exams were tough and heavy, but not unfair. Overall I was happy to be in his class, but be prepared to work for it.

Professor Tumuklu is dedicated to his students' success and is easily accessible for help. His lecture delivery could use s. While it's only his second year teaching, he is actively seeking ways to engage his students. He's clearly passionate, and I'm confident he'll continue to grow into an excellent instructor.

I have mixed feelings about him. Fluids is pretty tough, but I went to many office hours for hw and it really helped me understand what was going on during lecture and learn about him as a person, and he is actually quite nice and funny. He is probably the most self-aware prof too when it comes to understanding the limits of his students.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: As the others mention, he is extremely knowledgeable about fluid mechanics but not the best teacher. He is a funny/nice guy, he always seemed very stressed out and sad that people weren't paying attention in lecture, but he taught in a way that was very conceptual and often made things way more difficult to understand than they needed to be

Prof Tumuklu is very knowledgeable in fluid mechanics but he's a bad teacher. After we requested more examples, he said he would do them but kept deriving equations instead. Homeworks are hard and barely related to the lectures/textbook examples.

Professor Marrero's lab were very interesting. He was always available to answer questions wether in office hours or by email. Overall he made the material easy to understand and seemed to care a lot for the success of the labs.
Yes it is what
Tim is a really nice guy who knows reactor physics, both in general and specific to the RCF. The labs are fun and well-thought out. Fair assignments and exams with easy grading.
Dr. Garde is an excellent teacher, advisor, and lecturer.  He welcomes questions always, challenges students, and explains clearly and keeps students engaged and interested.

Literature search in biology gave SUPER useful databases and resources for bio researchers. She's informative, funny in a not-trying-to-be-funny way, and loves helping students. class is only 50 minutes (of internet surfing) but the knowledge is timelessly useful.

You're not going to learn manufacturing processes by doing mindless calculations, and this professor understands that. While he does teach you the equations you need, he's more interested in presenting you with problems that you would encounter in a manufacturing environment. I learned a lot in this class and never felt overwhelmed by the material.

Boskin is a great professor. He is a practitioner that works with factories to implement ERP systems. Lectures are boring, but his exams are easy. Interesting part of lecture is when he would talk about his experiences. He also brought us to a factory in Watervliet to display the class material.  He rarely teaches undergrad, so take him if he does.

Taught this grad course with Prof. Garde. You could tell Coppens knew his stuff but he didnt explain things quite as well as you wanted. He wrote one of the tests and half of the take home final. The test was fair but the part of the final he wrote was pretty brutal. Usually put a lot of effort into helping out outside of class though.

Dr. G's biggest drawback is his accent. It takes a lot of getting used to. Other than that, his class is pretty simple- pay attention in lecture, do the homework, and the tests will be simple (but they will take the full two hours). And the final is optional.
He throws every concept at you and does not explain. If you are in diffy Q you will be fine, but if you didn't pass the AP exam than good luck.
Brilliant man. His course and theories are invaluable to mankind.
Brilliant and friendly instructor.
Dr Christian is great, I learned a lot in his capstone course. He does a great job of sharing his experience in industry. Very approachable, great sense of humor.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Passionate professor who genuinely cares about student success. The course is well-organized and easy to follow, with straightforward online quizzes and a manageable final. You'll need to stay engaged, but it's not overwhelming. Great opportunities are available for those interested in exploring the material further.

Scott is awesome! He gives good feedback and is extremely patient and helpful to his students. His positive encouraging attitude always made me leave his class happy. He genuinely cares about his work as a teacher, and wants you to learn. He grades very easy. Do the work, get the grade... and if you don't do the work, he'll help you catch up.

This professor is okay. She is pretty chill and likes to foster discussion in class. You're graded by only a few things though and it was often unclear what was expected in order to get a good grade. Grades also took too long to get released. She was reasonable though, and was willing to work out misunderstandings and changed grades when necessary.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects--Caring

comment: Med Chem is a great class! In class he just goes through the PPT, so it's not really necessary to go. There's two tests and a paper. He provides study questions as non-mandatory hw, and the tests are very similar to theses Qs. He also provides examples of the paper which is about the development and pharmacology of a drug of your choice.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Teaches both CIVL 4070 and CIVL 4080, great class notes and fair grading.

Fabian might be the worse instructor I've ever had. He seemingly has a vendetta against all students, as very few meet his exceptionally high standards. He graded harshly, provided very little feedback, and didn't post answers, so if you got a question wrong, you're just out of luck. He's also very rude to students and doesn't give any respect.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: She was really sweet. I really enjoyed her!

Sometimes seems like she doesn't know what she's talking about when lecturing. Someone asks a question and she replies with "it's just like that" or "that's just how it works". There are 2 exams for this class and she did not give exam 1 back for us to review until after exam 2. Also uses Piazza instead of LMS so you don't get notis
Very kind person, super helpful in labs.

Dr. Sanchez is an amazing professor. He would regularly spend hours after class with us to teach us about random physics things we were interested in, be it particle theory, Electromagnetism, or dark matter. He really cares about both physics and his students, and goes beyond the extra mile for anyone he can.

caring, motivating and respectable professor and I enjoyed his inorganic chemistry lectures! I encourage every chemistry student to attend his class to soak in knowledge in an inspiring and encouraging manner.
Very good professors. Great attitude in lectures, makes the course easy to understand.
Tracy was the professional development teacher for IED and she was AMAZING. She makes learning about leadership and group development fun and she cares deeply about our learning goals.

The way his class is structured makes the work very straightforward, but it can get tedious. If you stay on top of your classwork, however, it is possible not to have any homework. He is great at helping students troubleshoot issues, and in my experience, he always responds quickly to emails and grades assignments reasonably quickly.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Great professor Understanding Fun Easy grader Participation in her classes in very important

Professor Gaetano is a very sweet lady who is fairly openminded. However, ARTS 1020 combines photography, animation, web design, and graphic design in nutshell course that runs at a fast pace. She gives good projects but in order to give the projects you are going to have to learn how use the software on your own.

There's a simulation project to hand in at the end of the semester, but as long as you do it on time, you're good. You can suck on the final because it's mad hard but there is a huge curve.  Just get try to get above a C on exams and do well on homeworks!
AWFUL IN EVERY WAY!

Dr. Hutchinson is a  cool guy!! Right after his Ph.D. degree he started teaching physics. We are among his first batch of physics students. He is joining another university for the next a year where he will be the curriculum maker for the physics department. He lectures are clear cut and always there for students in the classroom.

Prof. Hensel is a super nice guy and the course is pretty easy. Teaches you quality stuff about business law and uses current events to help explain. The midterm and final are straight forward and not that difficult.
Very "interesting" guy. Did have a sense of humor. Thought he did a decent job covering the materiel. Ridiculous curve on the tests
Horrible lecturer, terrible teacher and even worse at explaining formulas, plugs and chugs on excel then expects you to do it by hand on exam. Stick to doing research purely Hesna.

Lectures aren't mandatory but are good to go to because the lecture slides are bad and hard to study from. Some think he's hard to understand, but you'll get used to it. Always would ask for feedback on his teaching, he cares about student's success. Overall good teacher, very respected and has great knowledge of medical imaging.

He focuses on real-world problems and solutions related to highway engineering (not so much theoretical garbage). Look for cleverly placed puns and jokes within the tests and lectures for a good laugh. Tests are tough but completely fair and the class project was AWESOME! Very approachable (don't be intimidated by his good looks).
Super helpful. Easy to understand. Great review classes before exams

I consider Larry more of a friend and peer than anything else. In the class I was in, he was one-on-one for every step of the way. He will help anyone with any problem, as long as they pay attention and respect him for his time and energy. Outside of classes, you will find him in the MILL or the Forge. I recommend both as a pastime. Heart of Gold.
Super caring prof, easygoing. Very well designed course.
Strict teaching style is what the other students disagree with.  If they could get past this they would actually get a damn good education.

Great lectures and discussions! No math at all, just understanding of ideas and concepts. Tests were 25%x2, reports (short summary and discussion of a paper) are 10%x2, 6 HWs is 15%, 9 in-class exercises are 15%, (these two are both completion based). Overall very chill and extremely interesting class, I just wish the handwritten notes were posted.

Dr. Roggio is a very sweet person, and she does care a lot about her students. If you are bad with excel, I suggest not taking this course. It is super easy, almost everything is online aside from the final project, however you still need some hard skills to succeed in the class.

You do not need any external study time until tests. ALL HW and TEST material are topics in classes that have examples. Put in effort and you can easily get a good grade. He also understands students' lives are tough and is accommodating. 10/10 prof. Took the course because he was teaching it. Is also the reason I didn't transfer.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: She isn't a bad professor but if there is another option I would recommend taking a different professor if you have the option (I've heard others are easier and grade more liently). The class was graded by four assignments, two of which required group work. Easy class, just wished she graded nicer. She is clearly passionate about ethics
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He and the TA's never seem to see eye to eye. He cares about just trying your best but the TA's were much stricter about literally everything. He never grades anything on time, which is frustrating. His lectures are all over the place, but he's a very caring man, and can pick out people who are trying and putting in effort and makes sure you're OK.
rating_tags: So many papers--Respected--Graded by few things

comment: I had Bucky for his first semester teaching. This is a communication-intensive course, and it is no less than what that demands: reading and writing. Bucky's approach to teaching and grading is hilarious and constructive, but some feel it is offensive and targeted. You'll have no problem getting an A if you know what this class asks of you.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Accessible outside class

comment: Made me retake my final the next semester. Can be difficult just have to pay attention 24/7

My first grade I got back was in late October and my grade was okay 2.8/3. The next grade was give back on December 1st after all my assignments were submitted she then says I'm doing it wrong and there's no chance to go back and fix my assignments, they then offer extra credit to redo the assignment and fix things… and I get 0 points for that

Grading was that of an English class rather than based upon understanding of concepts. Assignments were not graded in a timely manner and students were told that they should "be keeping track of [their] own grade." The lecture given felt as through they did not serve a purpose as assignments did not line up with lecture content whatsoever.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Prof Zheng was extremely helpful in office hours. I'd always go in with a bunch of questions and she'd explain them all so clearly. She explains labs well and I highly recommend her office hours! She made Physics 2 at RPI manageable.

Prof Zaki is delightful to have as a professor. He is always clear about his expectations and is so humble for a guy of his caliber. A passionate lecturer who often talks about his time doing research in Texas. So accessible outside of class, but I don't know how I feel about his college in the math department...

Prof. Zaki is one of the best professors I've ever had. Lots of people complain that the class is too difficult but they just won't put in the work. I've never had a professor who clearly puts so much effort into his lectures. As he says “mediocrity is not a virtue” and this is reflected in his course. Take this course if it's the last thing you do

Prof. Zaki is an incredible man. Inspirational. As you can see, I nearly failed his class. But I would do it a thousand times over. The life advice I've gotten from Abrar, as he likes to be called, cannot be measured by a single letter. One time, in the middle of class, Abrar went on a tangent about a life-changing experience in Zimbabwe.
an absolute g
